Job Description:
A little about Abiomed:
Abiomed is a fast-paced medical device company with a portfolio of percutaneous heart pumps that impact the lives of patients around the world. We have a strong Coop program that challenges students in multiple areas in Engineering with a focus on providing mentoring and learning opportunities through a growing curriculum.

Job Description:
The candidate will support the AIC Software and Impella Connect Firmware teams, closely working with a Software Engineer, DevOps. Typical responsibilities include:

Working in a service group
Help to administer and maintain engineering tools.
Help to manage 30 Linux and Windows servers.
Understand and solve engineering needs.
Provide input into process development and improvement.
Basic Qualification:
Senior or Grad student pursuing a degree in computer science, software engineering or computer engineering.
Strong design and analytical skills required.
Experience with Linux/Unix Administration with an ability to code shell and python or golang.
Experience in working with Ubuntu, CentOS, Windows 2016 & 2012 servers.
Experience with virtual machines and containers is a plus.
Work experience in Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, and Release Management. Skills to configure and manage a Jenkins server and set up and run builds.
Ability to install and configure tools / packages.
Knowledge in network protocols.
Experience with C and C++ programming languages is a plus.
Knowledge in LDAP, Active Directory and Rest API is a plus.
Demonstrated communication skills, both written and verbal.
Self-motivated and execute tasks in a timely manner without direct supervision.

Job Description:

This is a 6 month Co-op, with the option of starting early to extend the Co-op length. A student can work up to 8 months at this Co-op if they start during the Summer 1 semester.

The SQA Engineering Co-op will perform one or more of the following tasks while working on Acacia's world class optical communication products.  The Co-op will be assigned relevant work assignments to challenge them according to their current level of experience and capability.  Acacia is well known for developing ground-breaking products in short time intervals.  To support new product development at an exciting pace the SQA team is challenged to architect, develop and maintain test automation software using scalable and maintainable methods. If you have a passion for test automation, working on complex systems and for delivering high quality best-in-class technology, then this position is calling your name.
The Co-op may find themselves working in the following areas:
Contribute to design and development of test plans, test facilities and test automation software (C++, C#, Python or LabVIEW)
Execute manual and automated tests on new Acacia product software releases under supervision of senior SQA team members
Work closely with senior SQA team members to resolve issues by analyzing Acacia product under test while using various measurement instruments and automated debug software
Document detailed test results; analyze test results data for trends and anomalies
The Co-op will learn to produce high quality code that is robust and maintainable.
Minimum Qualifications, Experience, Skills, Education and Certifications:
Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electronic or Electrical Engineering
Knowledge of Python?
Knowledge of C# or C++
Knowledge of LabVIEW
3.0 minimum GPA
Good interpersonal and organizational skills
 
 
Highly Desired Skills:
Passion about engineering
Enjoys working with hardware AND software
Enjoys working in lab environments
Likes to be challenged to understand system and figure out ways to break it
Previous internship experience
Local candidates preferred

Job Description:
This is a 6 month Co-op, with the option of starting early to extend the Co-op length. A student can work up to 8 months at this Co-op if they start during the Summer 1 semester.
The Software Engineer intern/co-op will perform one or more of the following tasks while working on Acacia's world class optical communication products.  The Software Engineering co-op will be assigned relevant work assignments to challenge them according to their current level of experience and capability.  The Software Engineering co-op may find themselves working in the following areas:
Collaborate with other team members to drive product quality thru enhancing the regression tests and test environment;
Development and maintenance of in-house tools to increase the team's productivity;
Graphical User Interface software development. 
Troubleshooting software bugs within Acacia's real-time embedded firmware
Hands on experience with state of the art fiber optic telecommunication systems in a laboratory environment
Data acquisition and trend analysis
The Software Engineer intern/co-op will learn to produce high quality code that is robust and maintainable.

Minimum Qualifications, Experience, Skills, Education and Certifications:
Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electronic or Electrical Engineering
Knowledge of Python?
Knowledge of C# or C++
3.3 minimum GPA
Good interpersonal and organizational skills 
 
Highly Desired Skills:
Passion about engineering
Enjoys working w/ HW, optics
Enjoys working in lab environments
Likes to be challenged to understand system and figure out ways to break it
Previous internship experience
Local candidates preferred

About Us:
 
The AIC (academicinternshipcouncil.org) brings over 30 years of experience to program management and placement operations in the United States and internationally. Our global team places students across every industry sector. All of our programs are customized and, in addition to the internship component, may include academic coursework, cultural exploration activities, professional development workshops, program management & safety, housing, visa processing and other logistical support. The AIC offers strong employer networks and an enthusiastic and well-trained staff in the cities where we operate
 
Multiple positions available in the following industries:
Business
Finance
Social Innovation
Supply Chain Management
Marketing
Public Relations
Computer Science/Information Technology
Engineering
Industrial Engineering
Electrical & Electronic Engineering
Civil Engineering
Film & TV Production
Public Health
Public Sector
Municipal Government
NGO's
Science
Sustainability
Environmentalism
Food Justice
Urban Planning


Program Fees
Toronto six month placement without housing $2,225 USD per student
Toronto six month placement with housing $10,775 USD per student

Application Process
The AIC will place each participant in an internship that corresponds to that student's course of study, to ensure the quality and academic relevance of the placement. To determine the appropriate opportunity, the student receives an individual assessment meeting with a member of the AIC team to clarify the student's skills, interests and professional goals.
 
The AIC then draws upon our extensive employer network to find the right match. If a match does not exist in our database, our team will conduct vigorous outreach to locate a proper placement. The companies and organizations that make up the list of approved internships in our database are carefully and regularly monitored by site visits and student assessment.
 
Additional Information
Remuneration varies. Most positions will be unpaid.
Agency has been vetted for Toronto, but other locations are available including: Berlin, Boston, Cape Town, Hong Kong, London, Mumbai, New York City, Santiago, San Francisco and the Bay Area
Program Services
Included in the comprehensive internship program are the following services:
Co-op Placements - personalized process including individual pre-placement meetings, industry specific resume review, interview coaching, customized employer outreach, as well as informational interviews, coaching and troubleshooting throughout the placement process.
Professional Development Support - skills-based workshops and professional networking activities.
Housing - furnished student housing for the duration of the program convenient to public transportation and including kitchen facilities, access to laundry, and WiFi.
Recruitment Assistance and Orientation Activities - program recruitment templates, recruitment webinar, pre-departure orientation, as well as on-site group orientation to the city, housing, and internship culture.
Program Management, and Emergency Support - on-site teams provide 24-hour support in case of emergencies.
Academic Component - mid-term review and final evaluation, as well as close collaboration with Northeastern University to ensure completion of any objectives outlined to grant academic credit.
Internship Visa Services - guidance on the visa process plus SWAP/IEC visa processing and fees.
Cross-Cultural Activities - program components such as discussion groups and small group collaborative activities as well as range of events to integrate students into the city and local workforce.

Accion Systems is the in-space propulsion company.  We're pioneering scalable electric propulsion technology that will completely transform what satellites and other spacecraft can do in Earth orbits -- and beyond!

We're seeking a software/computer engineering co-op to join our team.  We have lots of hardware to build and little time to build it.  You will be interfacing with electrical and software engineers.  Your list of tasks will involve writing low-level embedded C code, designing and running tests in vacuum chambers, and data analysis for our products.  This co-op will involve working with hardware in a hands-on experience in the lab. 
 
We're looking for someone who's programmed as part of a team and has been exposed to different coding styles, and who is methodical and thoughtful.  Working knowledge of packet-based communication, UARTs, PWM, as well as some basic circuit analysis will be helpful.

Learn more about us: http://www.accion-systems.com
Learn more about how we have fun: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=neM9Zsf83Vw

(We're also looking for mechanical and electrical engineering co-ops -- see our other postings and tell your friends!)

To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicants must be U.S. citizens, lawful permanent residents of the U.S., or protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3).
 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other protected factor.

Why Accion?

Space is cool! 
              New startup companies working on space technology have reinvigorated excitement for outer space.  You can join one of Boston's few space companies working on technology that will be launched into orbit. Our team is comprised of highly motivated employees who are leading experts in the space industry, revolutionizing in-space propulsion.
Startup Environment
              Working at a startup means you get to contribute to the company's big picture goals.  Every employee at Accion works on critical projects from start to finish that directly impact our company's progress.
Perks
Breakfast every Monday, Lunch every Wednesday, Monthly Birthday Lunches, New Employee Lunches (Basically, you'll be fed!)
Kitchen is always fully stocked with snacks and drinks (FREE COFFEE)
Regular social hour, team building events and industry networking events, social groups (Women of Accion, R&D Journaling, Book Club, Foodie Group, Bike Club)
Open office setup with plenty of breakout spaces to fly solo
State of the art lab facility
Free parking and shuttle to Sullivan and South Station
On site gym, cafeteria, café, lounge, rooftop garden, harbor walk, softball field, cornhole, ping pong table
Steps away from historic Charlestown and trendy Assembly Row
Five-minute walk to the Orange Line
We're looking for self-motivated people to join our team who will hit the ground running and have the confidence to manage their own projects. Your success is our success.

ABOUT US:
Abiomed is an innovative medical device company focused on recovering hearts and saving lives.   We have a single guiding mission:  "Patients First."   With corporate headquarters in Danvers, Massachusetts, offices in Aachen & Berlin, Germany and Tokyo, Japan, Abiomed's 1,000+ employees form one of the fastest growing medical technology companies in the world.  Abiomed attracts and retains exceptional talent with our collaborative culture, passion for our work, and a strong commitment to employee professional development. 
 
POSITION SUMMARY
The Software Engineer (SE) Co-op will be mentored & coached with Abiomed's Cloud Architect. The SE will be part of ensuring Abiomed's cloud software success. They will be involved in the entire lifecycle of software development (e.g., DevOps automation testing, cloud development).  At the end of the co-op the student will have gained valuable skills for future personal/career development.
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design/Implement Automation tests for Cloud project 
Design/Implement Unit Tests for Cloud project
Support Developer Operations (e.g., Build, Release operations)
Work with the software architect and UX designer to implement feedback from the VOC
 
REQUIREMENTS
Student pursuing a degree in computer science, software engineering or computer engineering
Strong design, testing and analytical skills required (e.g. engineering and statistical analysis)
Proficient in Python and C#.
Demonstrated communication skills, both written and verbal
Self-motivated. Execute tasks in a timely manner without direct supervision

Co-Op Software Engineer
Addgene is seeking a Co-Op Software Engineer to join our Development team. This is
an opportunity to learn and work from soup to nuts on a complex Python/Django web
environment that supports both our public platform and our internal lab and inventory
management systems.
Addgene is a non-profit organization dedicated to accelerating research and discovery in
the biomedical sciences by improving access to cutting-edge materials and information.
Addgene was recognized by the Boston Globe and the Boston Business Journal as one
of the best small places to work in Boston. We support team building activities outside of
work, including volunteer projects, social gatherings, and sporting events. This is a
terrific opportunity become part of a young, growing non-profit and to contribute to an
important resource for the scientific community. If you're ready to work for a mission that
makes a difference, Addgene is the place for you.
Learn more about us at www.addgene.org/careers
Job Description
As a member of the Development Team, you will:
- Report to the Team Lead for Software Engineering and receive mentoring from
all team members.
- Work collaboratively with stakeholders in our Science teams to understand their
requirements and provide estimates.
- Work collaboratively with the rest of the Development team to design, implement,
test and deploy new features and solutions to issues.
- Review other team member's code, and have your code reviewed.
- Keep up to date with new technologies and best practices and seek out
opportunities to integrate them into our code base and processes.
Job Qualifications
Candidates should be enthusiastic, self-motivated, organized individuals who want to be
a part of Addgene's mission. Specific qualifications include:
- Some experience developing web applications, preferably using Python and
Django
- Some experience with common software engineering practices, including source
control (we use Github), testing (we use Python unit tests, Selenium and TeamCity),
code reviews (we use Github Pull Requests) and deployment (we use
Jenkins)
- Some experience with some of the usual range of web-related technologies such
as: HTML, CSS, jQuery, Bootstrap, Apache, MySQL, Linux

Co-op Data Engineer
Addgene is seeking a Co-op Software Engineer to join our Data Team, an interdisciplinary group of scientists and software engineers whose mission is to ensure broad access to Addgene's wealth of data. This is an opportunity to work on building Addgene's Data Environment in support of internal data analytics and external data sharing.

Addgene is a non-profit organization dedicated to accelerating research and discovery in the biomedical sciences by improving access to cutting-edge materials and information. Addgene was recognized by the Boston Globe and the Boston Business Journal as one of the best small places to work in Boston. We support team-building activities both within and outside of the workplace, including volunteer projects, social gatherings, trivia, board game nights, and athletic events. This is a terrific opportunity to become part of a young, growing non-profit and to contribute to an important resource for the scientific community. If you're ready to work for a mission-driven organization that makes a difference, Addgene is the place for you.

Learn more about us at www.addgene.org/careers
Job Description
As a member of the Data Team, you will:
Work collaboratively with stakeholders from different teams at Addgene to understand their data requirements and provide time estimations.
Fulfill requests for datasets or data summaries by working closely with other Data Team members.
In close collaboration with the Data Team, design, implement and test Addgene's data environment components, such as data extraction tools, data pipelines, and data access APIs. 
Review other team member's code, and have your code reviewed.
Keep up-to-date with new technologies and best practices, and seek out opportunities to integrate them into our code and processes.
Job Qualifications
Candidates should be enthusiastic, self-motivated, organized individuals who want to be a part of Addgene's mission. Specific qualifications include:
Some experience writing data manipulation code using Python. Familiarity with common libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Biopython, Scikit-learn is a plus.
Some experience with common software engineering practices, including source control (we use Github), testing (we use Python unit test), code reviews (we use Github Pull Requests)
Some experience with the usual range of server technologies such as MySQL, BigQuery, Linux

DEPARTMENT:         Software
 
REPORTS TO:          AI/ML Software Engineer
 
Activ Surgical is a fast growing, venture-backed company focused on transforming robot-assisted surgery.  Continuing on the work of National Children's Health System in Washington DC, Activ Surgical is developing novel vision, sensing, and movement solutions for streamlining collaborative robot-physician workflows.  At the core of the technology is a combination of the latest in machine vision hardware, custom algorithms, and intuitive UI.

PURPOSE
The Vision Intern/Co-op will assist in the development of depth and 3D reconstruction algorithms in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.
 
GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Work within a multidisciplinary software product development team
Design, prototype, implement, and validate 3D vision algorithms
Establish performance metrics for 3D hardware and software technologies
Automate established hardware testing/calibration routines
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS
Required
Strong background in mathematics and linear algebra
Background in signal or image processing
Self-starter, not afraid to ask for help
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Preferred
Background in Computer Vision
Experience with depth imaging (stereo imaging, light field imaging, structured light imaging, time of flight, etc.)
Hands-on experience with depth sensing hardware
Experience with 3D scene reconstruction (ICP, SfM, etc.)
Experience with 3D volume segmentation
Familiarity with OpenCV, PCL, Open3D, or MATLAB Image Processing or Computer Vision toolboxes
Comfortable working with MATLAB or Python
EDUCATION
Undergraduate or graduate student in a related field
Hands-on experience valued highly

About Airfox
Airfox's mission is to provide emerging markets with access to capital and financial services. Through an Android app launched in Brazil in February of this year, unbanked and underbanked consumers are able to make money transactions using their smartphone. Airfox has offices in Boston and São Paulo.

Airfox is looking for a UI/UX designer with a rock-solid visual design sense to join our rapidly growing team in Boston. The focus of this position will be primarily UI Design. Working alongside UX and the rest of the product team, you'll lead the creation of an elegant UI, from compelling visuals to system-level design elements. You'll also feel comfortable developing, managing, and continuously improving on visual design libraries. You'll be a crucial member of the team as you work to present complex financial products in a clear, trustworthy, and relevant way for our audience of underbanked users in Brazil.

REQUIREMENTS
Skilled in a mix of design tools and able to learn new ones (we used Figma and Illustrator)
Ability to articulate rationale for UI decisions and champion the voice of the user in design conversations
Comfortable in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with constantly changing priorities
Extremely organized and detail-oriented. No email is lost or deadline is missed
A team superstar, working seamlessly with others and diffusing heated situations
Empathy, cultural sensitivity, and the ability to work respectfully and effectively with diverse populations
Fintech experience and/or experience with comprehensive UI redesigns is very nice to have
BENEFITS
Competitive hourly pay - negotiable
Flexible work schedule and ability to occasionally work from home
Opportunity to be a part of a growing design team with a focus on personal growth
Casual work attire
Location in Downtown Boston

We are a fintech startup that just closed a huge deal with a retail giant in Brazil. It's an exciting time to be at Airfox! As in any startup, all of our employees work on a variety of tasks, gaining experience in many different areas of the business. Our team embraces diversity and we have fun working together!  We believe in growing our people (especially interns), and make a point to constantly give feedback and promoting learning.  

About Airfox
Airfox's mission is to provide emerging markets with access to capital and financial services. Through an Android app launched in Brazil in February of this year, unbanked and underbanked consumers are able to make money transactions using their smartphone. Airfox has offices in Boston and São Paulo.

Description
Our marketing co-op will assist in communicating the company's vision to a variety of audiences. As a co-op, you will work closely with various team members and departments, ranging from product managers to engineers. Your daily activities may include the following: :
Perform competitor, industry, or product research and present it to the team
Assist the business development team in researching and contacting vendors
Write marketing copy
Develop and execute multi-channel social media campaigns (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.)
Design or edit marketing materials (digital and print)
Create and/or run reports

Requirements
An ideal candidate would be:
Extremely organized and detail-oriented. No email is lost or deadline is missed.
A self-starter, needing little to no guidance to own a new project
Comfortable in a fast-paced environment with constantly changing priorities
Able to create great documentation and other supporting materials  
Able to communicate clearly and effectively to others
A team player, working seamlessly with others even in tough situations
A fast learner, quickly picking up procedures and tools without any oversight

What to look forward to
Hourly pay - negotiable
Convenient location - one block from South Station
Great company culture with open door leadership and focus on personal growth

Overview
The Co-op program at Akamai provides current college students the opportunity to work full time for a period of 4 to 6 months within their field of study. Students who accept a Co-op position are given the opportunity to dive deep into projects and responsibilities and gain valuable hands-on work experience. Students must be enrolled in a degree program with the intent to return to that program at the conclusion of their Co-op. The typical Co-op cycles run from January to June or July to December.
 
In addition to your day-to-day responsibilities, program participants will be invited to a variety of formal and informal trainings, interact frequently with company leadership, and attend social events. 

The Technical Writer Co-op will focus on developing technical documentation to support a variety of key projects that could include but is not limited to new hire onboarding, organizational communication, and information access. The Technical Writer Co-op will focus on learning authoring tools, process and procedures for the Networks department. 

As a Technical Writer for the Networks department, your responsibilities may include:
* Assess documentation needs based on product goals, usage, and reader needs.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Product Management, Service and Support, Operations, and Quality Assurance) to plan projects, anticipate documentation needs, solve problems, scope deliverables, determine delivery mechanisms, and communicate progress.
* Produce high-quality documentation that is clear, organized, and appropriate for the target audience.
* Maintain, improve, and augment existing documentation.

Qualifications
Required Skills 
* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's in English, Technical Communications, Journalism, or Business writing and returning to the program after completion of the Co-op.
* Available to work 40 hours per week during the Co-op cycle.

Desired Skills
* Demonstrated excellence in writing and editing skills
* Demonstrated understanding of the technical documentation development cycle.
* Demonstrated experience with modern user assistance principles and best practices, user research methodologies, Web 2.0 and Mobile industry standards and trends.
* Demonstrated knowledge of content delivery networks and an understanding of network protocols and the Internet.
* Comfortable working across departments within the Engineering organization.
* Enjoy delving into new technologies in a highly engineering-centric culture.

About Akamai 
As the global leader in Content Delivery Network (CDN) services, Akamai makes the Internet fast, reliable and secure for its customers. The company's advanced web performance, mobile performance, cloud security and media delivery solutions are revolutionizing how businesses optimize consumer, enterprise and entertainment experiences for any device, anywhere. To learn how Akamai solutions and its team of Internet experts are helping businesses move faster forward, please visit www.akamai.com or blogs.akamai.com, and follow @Akamai on Twitter.

Co-op Job Title: AkaTec Support Engineer in Digital Media
Job Description:
Overview
We are seeking a highly motivated, independent software engineering student looking to expand their knowledge and professional experience in a dynamic support engineering role while engaging with some of our highest level cases. As an AkaTec Support Engineer Co-op, you will join our Akamai Technical Support team of engineers which works with our digital media and web customers to resolve and troubleshoot a variety of issues. By the end of this co-op, our goal is that you will be as experienced in this role as many of our TSE employees.
 
As an AkaTec Support Engineer co-op, your job responsibilities may include:
*Working with our experienced Technical Support engineers to learn the proprietary product suite and assist customers with top tier engineering support cases
*Finding root causes of denial of services and slowdowns in traffic
*Participate in the technical training program for our Global Support Engineers, which includes enhancing in-depth command-line experience, text processing, and networking basics. Training takes 2-3 months after which you will take on your own support cases.
*Work with TSE's and local Management on initiatives, research, documentation and other duties to directly support the business as needed.
 
Qualifications
Required Skills
*Currently pursuing a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Networks Engineering, or a related field and returning to the program after completion of the co-op.
*Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills
 
Desired Skills
*Basic understanding of DNS, HTTP, SSL, caching, and other internet protocols
*Well-rounded knowledge of command-line tools, features, and uses
*General knowledge of networks and distributed systems, and how they apply to the internet today
*Experience with working in a technical group environment to collaboratively reach a common support goal
 
About Akamai
As the global leader in Content Delivery Network (CDN) services, Akamai makes the Internet fast, reliable and secure for its customers. The company's advanced web performance, mobile performance, cloud security, and media delivery solutions are revolutionizing how businesses optimize consumer, enterprise and entertainment experiences for any device, anywhere. To learn how Akamai solutions and its team of Internet experts are helping businesses move faster forward, please visit www.akamai.com or blogs.akamai.com, and follow @Akamai on Twitter.

In addition to your day-to-day responsibilities, program participants will be invited to a variety of formal and informal trainings, interact frequently with company leadership, and attend social events.

We are seeking a highly motivated, independent software engineering student looking to expand their knowledge and professional experience in a dynamic support engineering role while engaging with some of our highest level cases. As an AkaTec Support Engineer Co-op, you will join our Akamai Technical Support team of engineers which works with our digital media and web customers to resolve and troubleshoot a variety of issues. By the end of this co-op, our goal is that you will be as experienced in this role as many of our TSE employees.
 
As an AkaTec Support Engineer co-op, your job responsibilities may include:
*Working with our experienced Technical Support engineers to learn the proprietary product suite and assist customers with top tier engineering support cases
*Finding root causes of denial of services and slowdowns in traffic
*Participate in the technical training program for our Global Support Engineers, which includes enhancing in-depth command-line experience, text processing, and networking basics. Training takes 2-3 months after which you will take on your own support cases.
*Work with TSE's and local Management on initiatives, research, documentation and other duties to directly support the business as needed.
 
Qualifications
Required Skills
*Currently pursuing a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Networks Engineering, or a related field and returning to the program after completion of the co-op.
*Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills
 
Desired Skills
*Basic understanding of DNS, HTTP, SSL, caching, and other internet protocols
*Well-rounded knowledge of command-line tools, features, and uses
*General knowledge of networks and distributed systems, and how they apply to the internet today
*Experience with working in a technical group environment to collaboratively reach a common support goal
 
About Akamai
As the global leader in Content Delivery Network (CDN) services, Akamai makes the Internet fast, reliable and secure for its customers. The company's advanced web performance, mobile performance, cloud security, and media delivery solutions are revolutionizing how businesses optimize consumer, enterprise and entertainment experiences for any device, anywhere. To learn how Akamai solutions and its team of Internet experts are helping businesses move faster forward, please visit www.akamai.com or blogs.akamai.com, and follow @Akamai on Twitter.
 
About the Co-op Program
The Co-op program at Akamai provides current college students the opportunity to work full time for a period of 4 to 6 months within their field of study. Students who accept a Co-op position are given the opportunity to dive deep into projects and responsibilities and gain valuable hands-on work experience. Students must be enrolled in a degree program with the intent to return to that program at the conclusion of their Co-op. The typical Co-op cycles run from January to June or July to December.  
In addition to your day-to-day responsibilities, program participants will be invited to a variety of formal and informal trainings, interact frequently with company leadership, and attend social events.

Join us and be part of the team that's building the definitive social network for small business (SMB) owners world-wide. As a group SMBs are responsible for 50% of our GDP and 65% of new jobs. They're the lifeblood of our neighborhoods and help give each of them their unique character.

We're shifting the power back to them - giving them the ability to more easily work together and win together. Since launching in 2014, we now have over 4 million members in over 30,000 communities nationwide and are profitable. Our team has founded numerous successful companies from zero to IPO.

You'll be joining our dev team as a CO-OP Software Engineer. You'll be working closely with product management, design, and engineering to craft great experiences for our users. You'll be contributing to our main application throughout the stack from Javascript to Ruby 2.4 + Rails 5 all the way down to x86 assembly (just kidding on that last one). We use Postgres, Redis, Dynamo, Redshift, and Memcached for storage and we deploy code with AWS. We're looking for someone who wants to work at a startup and be an integral part of our dev team. We won't just leave you in a corner to code all day; you'll be participating in design discussions and arguing (with data!) why we should or shouldn't implement a feature.

Your first day at Alignable:

You'll hop on the T and arrive at our office by North Station between 9:00 and 10:00am. We'll give your new Macbook Pro and help you configure your dev environment. In your first few hours, you'll have your dev environment set up with your favorite editor (which is VIM, naturally) and our CTO and his awesome beard will give you an overview of the product. Around 12, we'll break for lunch.

After lunch, you'll get started on your first JIRA ticket - a production bug chosen specifically to help familiarize you with the codebase. You put on your headphones and start cranking. After several minutes / hours, you have a solution. Your solution includes a unit test that replicates the bug. You push your branch to Github and create a pull request. Within a few minutes, our continuous integration software runs the test suite against your code and one of your insanely awesome fellow engineers will code review your solution. Once your code is reviewed with no outstanding issues and all tests pass, you can merge to master and push your code to production. 

As your co-op progresses, you'll be tasked with larger features with more responsibility. Several months into your co-op, the features you'll be implementing will make you indistinguishable from a full-time junior engineer.

You might want to work here if you: 
- have experience with or willingness to learn Ruby/Javascript
- want to be treated like a regular team member, not as an intern
- like the constructive feedback provided by code reviews
- enjoy the security provided by a comprehensive test suite
- appreciate the delicate balance between writing "good" code and shipping
- understand the performance implications of different algorithms and data-structures
- grok Git and can explain: "Git gets easier once you understand branches are homeomorphic endofunctors mapping submanifolds of a Hilbert space"

Winter/Spring Associate Co-op Program? Client Service Team
What should the start of your career look like? Do you look for an introduction to the world of business and exposure to a wide variety of industries? A role offering autonomy and measurable personal impact? A clear path towards leading your own team and managing blue-chip client relationships in two years' time? Running your own multimillion-dollar book of business in five years? 

If this resonates with you, read on.

AlphaSights is the world's knowledge partner, comprised of ambitious professionals committed to accelerating progress for our clients and our people alike. From the moment you join us as a Winter/Spring Associate, you'll have significant autonomy and personal responsibility. You'll receive training and professional development opportunities to help you excel in your role. Hard work, drive, and a commitment to delivering results will put you on a path to becoming a Manager in around two years from joining us, and a Vice President in around five. 

All along, you'll be working in the company of like-minded, driven colleagues from across the globe: we work as one global team that's dedicated to growing our business, improving ourselves, supporting one another, and celebrating wins together. Our alumni go on to join some of the world's most prestigious companies or pursue further study at top graduate schools.

About AlphaSights
AlphaSights provides global investment and business professionals with on-demand access to business expertise across all industries and geographies. Through AlphaSights, decision makers from investment management, private equity, management consulting, and corporates connect with a dynamic network of industry experts that provide qualitative and quantitative market insights, industry expertise, and execution support. Leveraging cutting-edge technology and our global team of 700+ professionals in nine offices on three continents, we support our clients 24/7 around the globe. AlphaSights regularly ranks as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world. Learn more at alphasights.com.

The Role
As a Winter/Spring Co-Op, you'll act as the connection point between our clients and industry experts. Your role is to understand clients' knowledge gaps and identify experts with the knowledge that can address them. You'll need to think quickly yet critically, conduct high-level research on companies and industries, and identify the world's best experts with the right experience and insights to address our clients' questions. You'll spend considerable time on phone and email reaching out to people and assessing whether they possess the knowledge our clients seek, and you'll connect qualified experts to our clients. 

Working on several client requests at once, you'll quickly develop effective project, client, communication, and time management skills. This is a fast-paced, commercial role with a clear focus on results and revenue generation, and Associates who succeed at AlphaSights often embark on successful careers in commercial and operational leadership.  
 
Find out more about the AlphaSights career path here.

To learn more about AlphaSights' Co-Op Program, watch the following video: https://bit.ly/2C1vQqf

What We Look For
AlphaSights welcomes candidates with different backgrounds and experiences. Here are some qualities that many of our successful applicants possess:
Strong academic credentials gained from any undergraduate major 
Innate curiosity and excitement about the world of business, ideally evidenced through choice of undergraduate degree, past internships, etc.
High levels of extracurricular involvement and leadership
A client-first mindset, which means a relentless commitment to work on clients' behalf and surpass their expectations
The drive and resilience to deliver excellent service amidst tight timelines and changing circumstances
Growth mindset: the ability to develop in your role over time and view setbacks as learning opportunities
What You Can Expect 
A fast-paced environment with measurable deliverables and a focus on results
The opportunity to gain transferable skills, including results-oriented research, sales, negotiation, commercial acumen, professional communication, and project and time management
A team-oriented, strongly supportive culture emphasizing transparency, continuous feedback, professional development, and celebrating wins
A professional development team that works to ensure that you're supported and on a clear career trajectory both within our firm and beyond
Opportunity to receive a full-time employment offer to return post-graduation
Subsidized lunch program, monthly team events, free breakfast & snacks
Requirements
Rising Undergraduate Junior (Class of 2021)
Strong academic credentials and noteworthy extracurricular leadership
Fluency in English is essential. Fluency in a relevant foreign language is a plus
AlphaSights is an equal opportunity employer.

How to Apply: 
Applicants must submit their resume through both NUcareers AND the external AlphaSights site to be considered.

To apply to our New York office: https://bit.ly/2MsGDAz
To apply to our San Francisco office: https://bit.ly/2TBwGBr

Please note that unfortunately we are unable to sponsor visas for this position.
Note: This is a paid Co-Op program.

OVERVIEW OF ROLE:
 
The Financial Systems Technical Co-Op work placement role would join the AMC staff who carry out Oracle functional changes, administration and support for the day to day use of US Domestic Oracle based AMC Financial Systems.
 
A successful applicant will be taught Oracle Financial System concepts and screens during their placement, and with appropriate supervision and guidance:
 
Carry out basic administrative tasks such as adding and removing users
Review and assign user issues to appropriate Servicedesk queues
Basic investigation and online research into issues
Carry out system testing across various Oracle modules
Assist with quarterly compliance activities such as SOX
Prepare project documentation
Attend project meetings
Assist with developing Test scripts, strategies for application testing.
Assist with building and documenting as-is process flows
Assist the accounting team during application product rollout
 
No Oracle or financial experience is required, as on the job training will be provided. Monthly mentoring sessions will be provided too.
 
The ideal candidate will be keen to learn, diligent, organised, a self starter and able to work positively with others.
 
 
KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
Learn about Oracle systems and AMC financial and Accounting processes
Carry out basic Oracle administrative tasks
Attend and participate in projects
Assist with compliance and audit activities
 
 
KEY RELATIONSHIPS:
 
Business users, particularly Finance and Accounting
Financial Systems staff
 
 
TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS AND WORK EXPERIENCE:
 
Basic familiarity with Microsoft Office tools
Financial or IT knowledge is of benefit, but is not essential
Working in an office environment is of benefit, but is not essential
 
 
PERSONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
 
Proactive, with an enthusiasm for learning
Organised, with high ownership and an ability to work following instructions
Good positive attitude
Able to interact professionally with others

  
RELATIONSHIPS
 
Reports to:       Director of Financial Systems, IT
 
Manages:          n/a

Amperity is an early stage technology company, venture-backed by the early investors of Amazon, Facebook, LinkedIn, Spotify, Concur, FlipKart and many more. Our team of successful, repeat entrepreneurs is focused on building a company composed of top-tier talent and a suite of disruptive products that drive tremendous value for our customers and the consumers they serve.  Importantly, we've already had a Northeastern intern whom we've hired for next year, and if you're anything like them, we'll do great together!

Interesting Problems
- Ingesting and cleaning large amounts of data daily and blending it with real-time events
- Automatically stitching data together across disparate systems by training machine-learning models to build a probabilistic knowledge graph
- Taking research algorithms and productionizing them for high-scale usage
- Allowing users to perform complex, real-time queries across an aggregated view of their data
- Publishing query result data to a diverse set of systems for client usage

About You
- You are excited about using or learning to use functional languages in a production environment
- Experience or interest in working with large scale data oriented systems
- Strong software skills in a JVM-based language
- Interest in or experience with Clojure or another functional language
- Strong desire to learn and investigate new technologies
- Open minded, inclusive, and motivated to make good decisions

Technologies We Use
- Open Source tools such as Accumulo, Spark, and Kafka
- A web stack based on ClojureScript and the React family of tools
- Cloud-first automation including Apache Aurora and SaltStack
- Random forests, logistic regression, and probabilistic databases
- Emacs AND vi!

Post Production Intern
 
Description:
IFC Films, a subsidiary of AMC Networks and the film distribution company behind movies such as THE DEATH OF STALIN, BOYHOOD, WILDLIFE, THE BABADOOK, FRANCES HA, and BLUE IS THE WARMEST COLOR, is looking for a post-production intern. Candidates may be currently enrolled in a college degree program or recent graduates looking to further their experience in the area of independent film post-production.
 
Responsibilities:
-Reviewing film materials for technical issues (including, but not limited to audio and video related problems)
-Revising English subtitled dialogue lists for foreign language titles
-Creating dialogue transcripts
-Graphic manipulation of feature art
-Maintaining incoming and outgoing inventory
-Assisting with asset deliveries to home video, cable or digital partners
-Scheduling messenger and FedEx packages and coordinating with post lab and other vendors
-Keeping track of and coordinating asset storage
-Organizing physical DVD inventory and assisting with replicating process
-Sending out digital screener links
 
 
Qualifications:

Please note that this is not a video editing internship, however we both welcome and typically prefer candidates with editing experience as your editor's eye will be greatly beneficial for the projects you will be working on. Adobe Photoshop experience is preferred.  You need to be well-organized, attentive to detail, and willing to take on daily administrative work.

Anheuser-Busch Brewery Co-ops

Forget coffee runs and lunch orders. As an intern at Anheuser-Busch, you'll be working on the same projects that full-time employees work on. We're talking about the kind of work that empowers you and challenges you on a daily basis. Your manager and team will be there to help you along the way, but by the end of the summer you'll have gained a whole new set of skills that employers like us look for in a full-time employee.

Manufacturing/Engineering Co-op 
We offer semester-long co-op experiences. You'll have the opportunity to work in one of our breweries and learn the fascinating processes behind the brewing, operations, logistics, and utilities departments. We also have opportunities in our corporate engineering/brewery support functions at our headquarters in St. Louis where you'll learn about process improvement, raw materials, quality and maintenance.

So, get out of your comfort zone and get into the fast-paced, data-driven, and ever-evolving beverage industry with America's Leading Brewer!

Who we are looking for:
We are hiring a Full Stack Software Engineering Co-Op for the Summer of 2019 to contribute to our rapid product development pace.  We work collaboratively to set the technical direction for our SaaS products, developing easy-to-use solutions for our customers.  Our engineers find a deep satisfaction in building things that customers actually need.  We focus on delivering value to customers and understand that this often means delivering code that isn't perfect, but meets customer needs.  

This is an ideal opportunity for someone who has a passion for building leading edge software and is driven to help build a successful SaaS product used by thousands of happy businesses. We foster an environment that empowers small teams to collaboratively set the technical direction of our solutions.

Responsibilities:
* Develop scalable, robust, and simple web-based solutions to solve complex business problems
* Formulate, implement, and evaluate algorithms and database queries to support SaaS scalability and stability.
* Implement new features and optimize existing ones to drive maximum performance
* Use test-driven development, code reviews and continuous integration to deliver high quality software, and rapidly fix bugs as they come up.
* Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from other engineering team members, QA, and product owners, and our APM customers
* Leveraging agile practices, encourage collaboration, prioritization, and urgency to develop at a rapid pace
* Research, share, and recommend new technologies and trends

You know you're the right fit if?
* You've heard of Ruby and Rails, and have some experience working with a language like Ruby, Java, or Python. You may even know enough about Javascript to have opinions about how frequently "the new hot thing" changes.
* You love learning about new technologies, but understand the value of continuing to use something old if it still does everything you need it to do.
* You care about the long-term maintainability of the codebase and will learn to advocate for refactoring and clean-ups where appropriate.
* You care about work life balance and want your company to care about it to; you'll put in the extra hour when needed but won't let it become a habit.

Additional Skills and Knowledge:
* Currnetly pursuing BS, MS, or Ph.D in Computer Science or related technical discipline
* Hands-on work/internship experience developing web-based applications, preferably in a SaaS environment
* Creativity, ability to solve complex problems without a roadmap

Nice to Have:
* Experience working across all levels of the development stack
* Experience with some areas of our tech like Ruby on Rails, React, Redux, AWS, SOA
* Familiarity with Agile software development processes: Scrum or Kanban
* Familiarity with Test-Driven-Development

If you are interested in creating exceptional SaaS products, and contributing to a successful company, apply today!

Overview

Good presentation skills
Passionate about building extraordinary products

Creative, collaborative, and product focused

Currently pursuing a PhD, Masters, or Bachelors degree in Machine Learning, Human Computer Interaction, Natural Language Processing, Robotics, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or related areas.

Summary
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, extraordinary ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple's University Recruiting team is looking for a highly motivated, engineering students with a strong background in Back-End Engineering, Core OS, and Web Development to join its team of highly skilled software engineers.

Our software engineers are the brains behind some of the industry's biggest breakthroughs. OS X, Siri, Apple Maps, and iCloud ? not to mention the system-level software for iPhone and Apple TV ? all started here. These teams are on the front line of our constant charge toward innovation. We are actively seeking enthusiastic interns who can work full-time for a minimum of 12-weeks either for our Fall 2019, Winter 2020, Spring 2020, or Summer 2020 sessions.

Key Qualifications
Strong object-oriented design skills, coupled with a deep knowledge of data structures and algorithms
Proficiency in one or more of the following developer skills: Java, C/C++, PHP, Python, Ruby, Unix, MySQL, Clojure, Scala, Java Script, CSS, HTML5
Experience in advanced Big Data methodologies such as Data Modeling, Validation, Processing, Hadoop, MapReduce, Mongo, Pig
Experience with web frameworks such as AngularJS, NodeJS, SproutCore
Demonstrable experience in application development in Objective-C for OS X or iOS a plus
Client-Server protocol & API design Skills
Able to craft multi-functional requirements and translate them into practical engineering tasks
A fundamental knowledge of embedded processors, with in-depth knowledge of real time operating system concepts.
Excellent debugging and critical thinking skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in a fast paced, team-based environment
Strong verbal and written communication skills and social skills

Description
Backend Development - You are responsible for making the features that our users love (like Siri) work by presenting data to the user-facing applications. Backend development opportunities are available for students in the following areas:

Siri, iCloud, Apple Maps, Core OS, OS X, Frameworks and Applications, Interactive Media Group, Audio/Video Software Integration and Localization, Advanced Computation, iLife, iWorks, Aperture, Pro Apps, iTunes, Security, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and Platform Infrastructure Engineering (PIE)

Core OS - You want to be at the heart of Apple's Software organization. The Core OS team is responsible for the design and development of core technologies that are deployed across all Apple product areas including the iPhone, iPad, Watch, MacBook, iMac, Apple TV, and audio accessories. (Yes, that's pretty much everything.)
Specifically, the opportunity in CoreOS is in the sensor technology area. By integrating motion, optical, and other advanced sensing hardware to Apple's products, we are now able to create innovative features that are truly adaptive to the user and environment.

Web Development - You will help build web-based tools and applications to enhance our products and do more for our customers. Our developers are responsible for shaping the direction of our products by considering the architecture, performance, testing, design, and implementation. And of course we look for engineers that use our products.

Engineers here work on both UI level and lower-level implementation details. The successful intern candidate will be amenable to working in a dynamic, collaborative environment. The person filling this position must be a hands-on, enthusiastic, self-motivated developer with strong initiative and desire to succeed in a challenging environment. You will have a real passion for extraordinary user experiences and an eye for details. Those applying for the Web Development intern position should include a link to a web portfolio.

We are looking for an extraordinary engineering student to join the development of iPad products with in-region iPad Product Design team. You will realize the design and bring the exciting products to the markets worldwide. You will work closely with cross-functional teams in Engineering, Production, Reliability and CM partners. You will highly involve in design validation, fixture design, data analysis, failure analysis and measurement technology with a rigorous engineering approach in a new product development. You have the opportunity to plan and execute complex engineering studies and improve the design and production. The products you are working on will delight millions of people in the world.

Education
Graduate / college student in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering, or equivalent.

Additional Requirements
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Detail orientated, proactive thinking, and capable of handling multi assignments under high pressure.
Exceptional written and oral English communication skills.
Good team player and great interpersonal skills.

Company Overview

We are a Boston-based investment manager that provides global and international equity investment strategies and fund products to institutional investors such as pension plans, endowments, foundations, and registered/unregistered commingled investment funds. We are a registered investment adviser with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), and a registered commodity trading advisor and commodity pool operator with the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC).  Our firm manages over $90 billion for over 175 client relationships in North America, Europe and Australasia.

The Role

This position has dual responsibilities as a System Operation Engineer and Desktop Support.  As a System Operation Engineer, the individual will monitor the production systems and is the first line response to any issues that occur.  As a Desktop Support person, you will be a point of contact for all technical needs that develop. This will include regular desktop assistance, as well as any network applications, production applications, LAN/WAN, telecommunications, hardware or phone issues that arise. 
 
The ideal candidate must be able to work independently to identify, research and resolve any issues that occur in the production environment.  Good interpersonal skills are necessary in order to interact productively with the internal business user community, as well as the development teams.  This individual will also be responsible for coordinating, reviewing and managing all installations of new code and software into the production environment. 
 
In this role, the successful candidate will analyze and resolve routine to moderately complex problems which may include desktop and network applications, production applications, LAN/WAN, telecommunications and hardware. The ability to perform installations and maintenance of software and will assists users with issues including, connectivity, printing, and e-mail will be required.

Principle Duties and Responsibilities

- Interact closely with business users for intra-day support and with development teams for additional support on complex issues.
- Answer help desk calls and resolve a variety of computer hardware, software application or local area networking questions/problems of moderate complexity.
- Perform installation and maintenance of software and hardware.
- Assist users with issues such as VPN connectivity, printing and e-mail.

Qualifications  
 
- The ideal candidate will have a strong academic record in the undergraduate program; Computer Science, Engineering or related undergraduate degree track is a requirement.
- Proficiency with Microsoft Office is a necessity.
- Excellent organizational, analytical and problem solving skills.
- Experience in Windows environment.
- Ability to very quickly learn and understand the workings of and inter-relationships between software components.
Some experience as a Desktop Support Specialist is a preferred plus.

Job Description:
This is what it means to be an Intern at Ashoka: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fWDCtlCQkCw
 
In 1981, Ashoka changed the framework of the social sector, by introducing the idea that there is nothing more powerful than a bold, new idea in the hands of an exceptional entrepreneur. We have built a fellowship of leading social entrepreneurs: people who catalyze an irreversible social change through an innovative idea and encourage others to do the same. Our network of Fellows is now over 3000 innovators strong and spans 85 countries. In addition, the field and profession of Social Entrepreneurship has grown into a global force.
We're setting out to change the frame again. This time, we want everyone to understand how to succeed and be a force for good in a rapidly changing world. If you are an entrepreneurial student with a desire to be a part of this historic movement, we want you to join our team.
 
Ashoka Fellows are the core of our community, and their insights show us how the world is moving and what is needed next. Examples of Ashoka Fellows include:
  *   Mohammed Yunus (Nobel Peace Prize Winner 2007)
  *   Kailash Sayarthi (Nobel Peace Prize Winner 2015)
  *   Katherine Lucey (Founder of Solar Sister)
  *   Wendy Kopp (Founder of Teach for America)
  *   Jimmy Wales (Founder of Wikipedia)
  *   Casey Fenton (Founder of CouchSurfing)
 
Ashoka is hiring for two Co-op Positions.  Please indicate which position you are applying for
 
Global Venture and Fellowship Co-op Position You will work on the Global Venture and Fellowship team and report to the Director of Fellowship. You will learn about social entrepreneurship, project management, network engagement, partnership development, nonprofit administration, and corporate social responsibility.
Assist in global communication with our over 30 country offices
Research and help develop engagement strategy for potential partners for Ashoka Programming, including corporations, foundations, and campaign opportunities
Edit and publish analysis of Ashoka Fellows
Update our internal database on Salesforce
Write surveys, stories, and reports to engage internal and external audiences
 
Ashoka Changemakers & Bootcamp Product Co-op Position You work on the Ashoka Changemakers team and report to the Associate Director of Ashoka Changemakers. You will gain valuable exposure to the world of nonprofit development, organizational design and program management.
Candidates should be driven, well-organized, and detail-oriented who are interested in designing a team that models best in class talent and operations while finding fun opportunities to innovate every day.
Primary support opportunities are system design and implementation, professional development strategy, outreach to candidates & partners, and assistance with international program design.
Analyze role plans across team and recommend resources for professional growth
Screen entries for Bootcamps and assist with planning and delivering Bootcamps for social innovators
Support overall program development, conducting internal interviews and creating/editing key trainings
Ensure tools and systems are in place to effectively implement programs (e.g. Slack, TeamWork, Google Drive)
 
Requirements:
  *   Proficient with MS Office and Google Office Suite
  *   Graphic design skills highly desired
 
Ideal Qualities:
  *   Changemaking track record (i.e. experience in creating an idea, building team, and affecting change in his/her community)
  *   A demonstrated interest in social entrepreneurship
  *   Ability to easily adapt to a constantly changing environment and meet deadlines
  *   Ability to work collaboratively within and across teams
  *   A self-starter with a strong work ethic, positive outlook, and professionalism
  *   Strong oral and written communication skills
  *   Attention to detail and ability to manage competing priorities
  *   Major or minor in Social Entrepreneurship (not required but encouraged)

Want to join an high-energy team that is reimagining the eCommerce solution for one of the largest footwear brands in the world? In this role, you'll have the chance to work with Salesforce Commerce Cloud (formerly Demandware), AWS, develop mobile API's, Mulesoft and more, to build applications touching tens of millions of users.

We are looking for Software Engineering Co-ops to work on the development of key functionality and infrastructure across the entire ASICS eCommerce platform. This could mean building new features on the storefront or building the communication between systems that are used to provide a never-down storefront experience to millions of runners world wide. You will work in an integrated Scrum team with other Software Engineers, QA engineers, a Designer and Product Manager. 

And lastly, while we are a fast moving company, many of us are not fast (or even moderately fast) runners. The idea of helping make the world a healthier place is the most rewarding piece for us.

Potential Projects You Could Work On:
-Launching new versions of ASICS.com across the globe
-Build new shopping features for runners and fitness enthusiasts
-Unlock the ability to sell products to new parts of the world
-Creating a new world-class eCommerce solution
-Build a mobile-first storefront

What you'll do:
-Hands-on backend development of Java/Mulesoft based application with teammates and a mentor to ask any questions you may have
-Hands-on front end development SalesForce Commerce Cloud (Demandware) storefront

What you bring to the table:
   - Currently enrolled in a BS program in Computer Science or equivalent
   - Experience with a couple of the following: Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, SQL, Agile/Scrum
 

Location: 1 Winthrop Square, Boston, MA 02110
We've got a great location in Downtown Boston right by Downtown Crossing, Park Street, South Station, and State Street T Stops. Food choices galore! 

One Other Perk of the Job?? 50% of ASICS gear. Best in class sneakers, athletic apparel, and training gear .. or just for building up a huge sneaker collection.

[1]

Preference given to students with Mobile experience.

Want to join a team of passionate engineers who are excited to work at the intersection of fitness and mobile technology? Come join our team, a Boston-based mobile company with more than 55M users worldwide. A little bit about our app, Runkeeper transforms your phone into a personal trainer, helping you track your activities, set your goals, and stay motivated to go that extra mile. 

We are looking for Software Engineering Co-ops to work on the development of key functionality and infrastructure across the entire Runkeeper system in areas such as fitness tracking, coaching, social features, analytics and device integration. You will work in an integrated Scrum team with other full time Mobile Engineers, QA Engineers, a Designer, and Product Manager.

And lastly, while we are a fast moving company, many of us are not fast (or even moderately fast) runners. The idea of helping make the world a healthier place is the most rewarding piece for us. 

Potential Projects You Could Work On:
-Improve the overall tracking experience for the Runkeeper App
-Working on a stellar personalized training plan experience for our users
-Helping to build a platform for different potential media partnerships
-Updating our software in order to seamlessly integrate with the latest iPhone and Android operating systems as well as latest wearables (i.e. Pebble, Apple Watch, Android Wear)

What you'll do:
-Hands-on development for iOS and Android with teammates and a mentor to answer any questions you may have

Co-op Job Title: Ashoka Mexico - Venture & Fellowship Program Intern
Job Description:
This is what it means to be an Intern at Ashoka: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fWDCtlCQkCw

Organization description:
Following its vision of Everyone A Changemaker, Ashoka supports the movement of social entrepreneurship through different social groups, i.e. social entrepreneurs, youth, universities, companies and social organizations. Ashoka constantly works to achieve its vision of a world that responds quickly and effectively to social challenges.

Ashoka Venture and Fellowship encompasses the search for and selection of social entrepreneurs who have the potential of becoming Ashoka Fellows. These Fellows have always been at the core of our mission and together, will be the engine that drives systemic social change forward.

Now you can join us in one of our most interesting and important endeavors -- finding and selecting the amazing innovators who could become Ashoka Fellows and help us supporting them through our Fellowship program.

As our Venture & Fellowship intern you will:
Search for potential Ashoka Fellows through research, contact with nominators, presence at events, etc.
Help interview and evaluate potential candidates according to Ashoka's selection criteria (New Idea, Creativity in Problem Solving, Entrepreneurial Quality, Social Impact of Ideas, Ethical Fiber). 
Revise received applications and write profiles for Ashoka?s panelists outlining how the candidate meets the criteria as well as their strategies. 
Organize workshops and problem-solving sessions for Ashoka Fellows
Monitor and analyze our Fellow´s impact through evaluation questionnaires
Help organize networking events like the induction for the newly elected Fellows
Help organize bootcamps for candidates who do not quite yet meet Ashoka's criteria, but could be fellows with more development


 
 
 
Benefits
Learn about every aspect of Ashoka Venture and Fellowship program, as well as Ashoka's other departments in Mexico and Central America
Work with some of the brightest social entrepreneurs of Latin America
Collaborate with a young, enthusiastic, and international team of interns, volunteers, and employees
Be part of a team where your work and opinion matters
We believe in giving our interns freedom to: create, lead, and make mistakes.
Improve your Spanish
Enjoy the office's location in one of Mexico City's most historic, lively, and artsy neighborhoods
Become part of Ashoka's global network, operating in over 90 countries with nearly 500 employees in 40 regional offices all around the world.
 Required Skills and Experience
Self-motivated, entrepreneurial ability
Ability to work independently
Ability to work in an unstructured, collaborative, creative office environment
Desire to cause systemic change
Proficiency in both English and Spanish
Profound qualitative analysis skills
Organizational skills
Great attention to detail

Job Description:
This is a video of what it means to be an Intern at Ashoka: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fWDCtlCQkCw

About the Organization
 
35 years ago, Ashoka changed the framework of the social sector, by introducing the idea that there is nothing more powerful than a bold, new idea in the hands of an exceptional entrepreneur. We have built a fellowship of leading social entrepreneurs - people who catalyze an irreversible social change through an innovative idea and encourage others to do the same. Our network of Fellows is now over 3000 innovators strong and spans 85 countries. In addition, the field and profession of Social Entrepreneurship has grown into a global force.
We're setting out to change the frame again. This time, we want everyone to understand how to succeed and be a force for good in a rapidly changing world. If you are an entrepreneur with a desire to be a part of this historic movement, we want you to join our team. 

Ashoka Fellows are the core of our community, and their insights show us how the world is moving and what is needed next. Examples of Ashoka Fellows include:
?    Mohammed Yunus (Nobel Peace Prize Winner 2007)
?    Kailash Sayarthi (Nobel Peace Prize Winner 2015)
?    Katherine Lucey (Founder of Solar Sister)
?    Wendy Kopp (Founder of Teach for America)
?    Jimmy Wales (Founder of Wikipedia)
?    Casey Fenton (Founder of CouchSurfing)
 

Ashoka Indonesia:
You will be working on the Indonesian team and engaging closely with Indonesia social entrepreneurs and Ashoka programmes launching in January 2017. This is a great opportunity to learn more about project management, social entrepreneurship, nonprofit administration, report writing, and corporate social responsibility.
 
Responsibilities:
·        Planning events for visiting Partners and Ashoka Fellows in Indonesia
·         Assisting with the GlobalizerX Indonesia accelerator programme which will help Indonesia social entrepreneurs scale their impact.
·         Planning the final GlobalizerX Event in Jakarta with Social entrepreneurs and Ashoka partners.  
·        Assisting in communication in Indonesia.  
·        Compiling data on Ashoka Fellows in Indonesia and writing impact reports on progress so far
?        Helping with the launch of new projects to support social entrepreneurs in Indonesia.
 
Requirements:
?         Minoring in Social Entrepreneurship (not required but highly encouraged)
?         Proficient with MS Office, especially MS Excel
?        (Bonus but not required) Graphic Design skills
?         Knowledge of Indonesian language would be an added value.
 
Ideal Qualities:
?         Entrepreneurial thinker and changemaker
?         A demonstrated interest in social entrepreneurship
?         Able to easily adapt to a constantly changing schedule
?         Enthusiasm for team management and team building
?         Ability to consistently meet deadlines
?         A proactive work ethic and professional demeanor
?         Strong oral and written communication skills
?         Attention to detail and ability to manage many ongoing projects
?         Positivity!!


Emily Ming                                                                                         Ashoka Indonesia co-op
Personal reflection                                                                              Summer/Fall 2018
 
Working at Ashoka Indonesia
My experience at Ashoka Indonesia was really great!  While I was there, I worked mainly on a GlobalizerX program, in which five Ashoka Indonesia social entrepreneurs (we call them Fellows) spent 5 months learning how to scale up their impact without scaling up their infrastructure.  I oversaw groups of consultants from A.T. Kearney, PwC and other companies who helped the social entrepreneurs with their strategies.  In addition, there was a three-day summit for the program in November that we started planning in August.  We developed everything from finding the venue, the agenda/content for each day and invitations for the public for one of our days.  I also helped coordinate the logistics for three other events throughout my 6 months and worked on strategizing Ashoka Indonesia's social media. I think the work will depend on what events/projects are coming up ? however, don't worry because the branch had a TON of ideas right before I left.
 
After a couple years of hiatus, the Ashoka Indonesia branch resolved to rebuild their presence in the country.  Therefore, in 2018, many new people were hired and more events were organized for 2018. When I joined, I was immediately given similar responsibilities as the other full-time staff.  Together, we identified challenges of putting the Ashoka name into the public sphere and rebranding ourselves.  My co-workers were definitely a highlight of my time there.
Some other events I helped coordinate and attended were: interviews for potential new Ashoka Indonesia Fellows; an event with A.T. Kearney where consultants helped Ashoka Indonesia Fellows find solutions to common problems they encountered (not necessarily just scaling up impact); a breakfast with senior-level businesspeople to introduce them to social entrepreneurship and Ashoka Indonesia, and form possible partnerships; and an Ashoka Global Partnership retreat in Indonesia where Ashoka staff from various worldwide branches from the partnership teams joined together to discuss strategies, develop collaborations and bond with each other.
 
What I learned from co-oping at Ashoka Indonesia 
This was my second co-op, and I definitely think I grew a lot, not just in a professional sense, but also just for myself. One of the best things to consider for this co-op is your ability to take initiative.  The work on my part was pretty project-based, so my manager did not tell me exactly what I needed to accomplish day-to-day.  This meant I had to create my own schedule and tasks to achieve my long-term goals.  The work is extremely rewarding, and you are constantly surrounded by inspiring and kind people (both my co-workers and the social entrepreneurs).If you are interested in social entrepreneurship, this co-op is excellent and provides great insight into the field.  However, I also think the skills you gain (time management, project management, leadership, professional communication, global communication) are highly transferrable.
 
Living in Indonesia
Living in Indonesia is nice.  I didn't make too many friends besides my co-workers, but I'm sure there are many expat events in Jakarta if you put yourself out there.  In addition, all my co-workers could speak English very well, so there was no need to really learn Indonesian fluently. Obviously, if you can, that's more advantageous because the average Indonesian doesn't speak English very well. I was the only co-op in Jakarta as far as I know, but there were some in Bali I think. I heard that Ashoka Indonesia may hire 2 co-ops, which would be awesome. During the weekends, I explored Jakarta (it's a HUGE city) and also was able to travel around Indonesia a little.
 
Living in Indonesia is SO cheap compared to the US.  I bought food for lunch every day and it was around $2-3 USD.  I was awarded some money from the Presidential Global Scholarship, which went a long way, so definitely apply for that.  For housing, I lived in Menteng, which is in central Jakarta.  There were a lot of food, convenience stores and public transportation stops nearby, so I could get anywhere in Jakarta pretty easily. If the Ashoka Indonesia office is still in East Jakarta, the commute will be a little long (about 1.25 hr), so it depends on your priorities!  Also Menteng is a little expensive (for Indonesian standards) because it is center city. I just stayed in an AirBnb for 6 months, but there are certainly much cheaper alternatives. Ask your co workers for help, they are so friendly and kind. 


Curretn work address in bandung
Wangsa Jelita
Jl. Kelapa Hibrida 4 Blok BD2 No.6, RT.7/RW.13, Pd. Klp., Kec. Duren Sawit, Kota Jakarta Timur, Daerah Khusus Ibukota Jakarta 13450

Job Description:
A little bit about us
ASICS Digital is a division of ASICS based in Boston, Massachusetts. Our goal is to build innovative digital technologies to better connect the ASICS brand to its consumers. We are responsible for the continued development of fitness solutions such as ASICS Runkeeper and ASICS Studio, global Ecommerce platforms, and other digital services that inspire people to move, get fit and stay healthy.

A little bit about our team
Our team strongly values curiosity, kindness, and honesty. We enjoy challenging ourselves with new problems and emerging technologies, we care about making products that help both our customers and other ASICS employees, and we trust each other to be honest about challenges so that we can overcome them as a team. On a typical day, you can find us working at our desks, solving problems in a conference room, joking around in the kitchen area, or going for impromptu coffee walks outside.

Do you have strong attention to detail? Relish a good challenge? Do you want the chance to think creatively about why and how software misbehaves?
