EXAMPLE CO-OP'S (see website for full list)
1. Internship: Optimize the electrostatic particle removal method on the EUV electrostatic wafer clamp
Introduction

This is an internship (co-op) assignment for a bachelor student in Electronics, Physics, or a related field, who has an affinity with the fields of electrostatics and material science

Job Mission

Contamination in ASML machines causes yield problems for our customers. ASML has developed a method to remove particle contamination from the EUV electrostatic wafer clamp. The concept has been proven, but has not yet been optimized.

Job Description

Optimize the electrostatic particle removal method for particle removal effectiveness and duration.

Your tasks will include:
? Getting acquainted with the current knowledge status and way of working at high tech experimental setups.
? Designing a plan to test the impact of selected parameters.
? Performing experiments in a cleanroom environment.
? Reporting and presenting your findings to the ASML electrostatics competence group.
? Assisting in further development by creating and/or testing additional optimization hypotheses.

Education

You are a bachelor student in Electronics, Electrical Engineering, Physics, or a related field and you have an affinity with the fields of electrostatics and material science. You are a critical thinker, and a focused and accurate experimenter.

This is an internship (graduation or apprentice) for 5 days a week with a duration of about 6 months.

Please keep in mind that we can only consider students (who are enrolled at a school during the whole internship period) for our internships and graduation assignments.


2. Internship: Design exploration of the low pressure gas pump
Introduction

This is an internship assignment for a master'sstudent in Mechanical Engineering or Applied Physics, graduating in a field that's compatiblewith fluid dynamics.

Job Mission

ASML is working hard to enable greener technology by enabling smaller and more energy efficient electronics. The latest generation of lithography machines use light in the extreme ultra violet range. Since light of this wavelength (13.5 nm) is absorbed by any optical medium, reflective optics in a vacuum are used. Any dust particle can potentially ruin the light patterns that are generated in the machines. Therefore, high velocity jets of low pressure gas are used to push contamination away from sensitive modules.

This requires relatively large flows (~100's of liters per minute) of clean hydrogen gas for particle and contamination suppression. This gas is currently burned off after it has passed through the system once, meaning that the lithography systems currently aren't very energy efficient. This assignment aims to find a way to at least partially recycle the hydrogen flow. For this we need systems to pump low pressure (~100 Pa) gas.

Job Description

There are scaling laws that can be used to estimate the efficiency of fans and pumps at lower pressure. However, it is unclear if they hold at these low pressures. Therefore we need someone to design, validate and use a test set up to determine the efficiency of various pumps and fans.

Deliverables
?Evaluate which pumping systems could match the requirements.
?Design a test setup to test the pumpingsystems in an existing vacuum vessel.
?Test and validate the setup.
?Determine if any of the pumping systems would suffice for our goals, and document your findings.

You'll be working in close collaboration with experienced architect(s) and designers to bring this project to a successful end.

Education

You are a master's student in Mechanical Engineering or Applied Physics, graduating in a field that's compatible with fluid dynamics. The study has both practical and theoretical aspects, where the focus will be is up to you.
We are looking for someone who asks questions and who is willing to pick up and incorporate new information quickly. We expect you to drive your own project and to prepare planning and test claims (under guidance by your supervisor).

This is an apprentice or graduation internship for 3-5 days a week with a minimum duration of 6 months. The start date can be discussed.

Please keep in mind that we can only consider students (who are enrolled at a school during the whole internship period) for our internships and graduation assignments.

Furthermore, this position requires access to U.S. controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such U.S. controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access U.S. controlled technology.

3. Internship: Quantify the precision of a GigE Time Synchronization method

Introduction

This is an apprentice or graduation internship for Bachelor students in Electronics who would like to dive in the problem of how to derive time information from different available (clock) signals at both the master and the slave and how to measure it by means of automation using Python and a very state-of-the-art oscilloscope.

Job Mission

In many industrial applications its required to have very precise time synchronization between different control nodes. The gigabit ethernet interface (GigE) between them allows to implement time-synchronization protocols like IEEE1588 which apply a two way time transfer method. Channel symmetry is key in such method as well as the local timestamp accuracy that determines the time moments used to come to time corrections at the slave.
Demanding applications require high precision synchronization in the order of nanoseconds. For optical implementations this has shown to be feasible. For electrical implementation using copper 1000BASE-T only very limited research is available. A concept has been studied and prototyped using development boards that potentially would allow to achieve very accurate timings over copper interfaces as well.
 

Job Description
Study in more depth a particular Gigabit Ethernet PHY;
Create a Python script that allows commanding an existing development kit having a gigE chip;
Extend the Python script to allow controlling and reading measurements of a high-end oscilloscope;
Create an automated test environment that allows to measure the timing of Master and Slave in subnanosecond resolution;
Execute multiple test with different cable length.
Document the measurement results and draw conclusions on the achievable precision.
 
Education

You are a HBO bachelor studying electrical engineering or a related discipline. You are eager to dive in the problem of how to derive time information from different available (clock) signals at both the master and the slave and how to measure it by means of automation using python and a very state-of-the-art oscilloscope.

Please keep in mind that we can only consider students (who are enrolled at a school during the whole internship period) for our internships and graduation assignments.

We build some of the most amazing machines that you will ever see, and the software to run them. Never satisfied, we measure our performance in units that begin with pico or nano.

We believe we can always do better. We believe the winning idea can come from anyone. We love what we do ? not because it's easy, but because it's hard.

Co-op Job Title: Lentiviral Vector Manufacturing Sciences & Technology Co-Op
Job Description:
*Pleae apply on https://boards.greenhouse.io/bluebirdcoopandintern*

Job Title:  Lentiviral Vector Manufacturing Sciences & Technology Co-Op
Company Description:
bluebird bio is a commercial-stage company committed to developing potentially transformative gene therapies for severe genetic diseases and T cell-based immunotherapies. The company's objective is to develop and bring to market the most advanced products based on the transformative potential of gene therapy to provide patients hope for a better life in the face of limited or no long-term safe and effective treatment options. Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, bluebird bio has operations in the U.S. and Europe.

Job Description:
This co-op position in Lentiviral Vector Manufacturing Sciences and Technology (LVV MS&T) is an opportunity to observe both upstream and downstream operations for the LVV production process.  The MS&T group at bluebird bio is responsible for process lifecycle management; which includes continuous process improvements and investigations of manufacturing site events.  This role is an ideal fit for candidates looking for an overview of the entire LVV production process and a perspective on how MS&T, process development, quality assurance, and manufacturing can work together to bring innovative new therapies to patients.      

Experiences include:
Executing experiments to support lentiviral vector commercial stage process improvement to support multiple programs
Exposure to technology transfers to commercial manufacturing sites
Design of experiments and data analysis for the optimization of downstream purification parameters for lentiviral vector process
Authoring technical documents that will be used to support MS&T activities
Preferred Qualifications:
Aseptic technique and adherent cell culture experience is preferred
Experience with sterile filtration, TFF, and AEX chromatography is preferred
Experience with design of experiments
Strong verbal and written skills; ability to provide focus and clarity; able to handle confidential information and material appropriately
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment where results are achieved through influence and the incorporation of multiple points of view
Independently motivated, detail oriented and good problem-solving ability
Excellent organizational skills, to multi-task in an extremely fast-paced environment with changing priorities

Company Overview:
BlueWave Solar is a B Corporation on a mission to revolutionize energy with simple, powerful solar solutions.
We have a rapidly growing team of experts intensely focused on increasing our solar loan footprint, refining our Solar Management Platform software, developing and managing community solar projects, and forging efficient capital partnerships that enable consumers to choose local, low-cost solar power. We are constantly innovating to keep pace with the evolving energy industry, and that spirit of innovation is what drives our company's dynamic culture. We are an energetic, driven and welcoming group of people that is looking for our "people person" to help us build the right team to support us in meeting our goals.
When you join the BlueWave community, you join a team doing all that we can to be transparent, sustainable and high-integrity. We don't just want to do business, we want to do good business. Because of our commitment to B Corp Certification we hold ourselves to high standards when it comes to our impact on the environment, our employees, our communities, and our customers.

Position Description:
BlueWave has an immediate opening for an Information Technology Co-op, reporting to the Managing Director of Information Technology.
The co-op will be an active member of a small and dynamic IT team whose mission is to support BlueWave's growth while making company operations efficient, secure and compliant. The IT Co-op will configure and provision company laptops, maintain laptop inventory, troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, and help administer our security and compliance programs. Depending on the skills and interests of the co-op, projects may include access controls testing, application implementations (e.g. Active Directory, Mimecast), and network monitoring, depending on the priorities and needs of our growing business.

We Seek: smart, motivated self-starters looking to gain experience in Information Technology, Security and Compliance.

Is this you?

Duties Responsibilities:
· Develop an intimate understanding of BlueWave business processes and technologies
· Provision company laptops and maintain laptop inventory
· Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues
· Administer Microsoft O365, Box.com, and our VOIP Phone System
· Conduct compliance controls testing in order to ensure employee adherence to BlueWave security policies
· Perform other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications/Skills/Education:
· Expected or completed degree in Business, Engineering, Information Systems or a related field
· Desire to learn cloud application administration, monitoring and troubleshooting
· Ability to work efficiently and independently with modest supervision
· Desire to learn information security policies and operations

This job is located in Everett, MA and accessible by public transportation.

Settlement Coordinator/Trading Support Undergraduate Trainee Program

For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Everyday our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart.

BNY Mellon is offering a 6 month placement.

The Undergraduate Program provides:
             Robust on boarding and skills training.
             Opportunity for exposure to a variety of lines of business across Investment Management, Investment Services and Business Partner Groups.
             Highly visible networking opportunities with other placement analysts, senior leaders and executives.
             Hands-on, self-paced opportunities to learn about different areas of the business and professional development.
             Commitment to conversion for permanent hires and onto our graduate and rotational Emerging Leaders Program for eligible candidates.
 
The incumbent performs assigned duties under the direction of an experienced staff member to acquire knowledge of methods, procedures, and standards required for performance of the departmental duties. He/She receives training and performs tasks in one of several departments to become familiar with the line of business and company policies and practices. He/She may be trained in functions and operations of related departments to facilitate subsequent transferability between departments and to provide greater experience opportunities. He/ She will need to be able to undertake a piece of project work or a number of smaller projects. The qualified individual should currently be enrolled in a 4-year degree program and must have a minimum QPA of 3.2 and need to complete this assignment as part of their degree qualification.

The duration of the role will usually be a minimum of 20 weeks and no more than a year. He/She will possess strong leadership, analytical, and problem solving skills. Strong communication and organizational skills is a must. He/She should be able to work in a team environment as well as work independently and be computer proficient.
 
JOB DESCRIPTION: Standish Mellon is looking for a mature, self-motivated individual who is interested in gaining exposure to many facets of an investment firm. This position allows the individual an opportunity to learn and work closely with many investment procedures. Duties include coordinating the settlement of all cash trades and working closely with trading, brokers, and custodial banks. Also assisting the trade processing department with confirmation, notification and settlement of all transactions. Includes assisting the fixed income trading desk with collecting and maintaining data for fixed income securities. Co-op will also coordinate and implement written correspondence with brokers and custodian banks.

COORDINATOR NOTES: BNY Mellon is the asset management arm for Mellon Bank. This position requires a good attention to detail, as you are processing trades in a very busy environment. BNY Mellon has a corporate-casual dress code.

Who we are
BookBub is one of the fastest-growing consumer tech startups in Boston (and we're profitable). Millions of readers use BookBub every day to find great books, and our service empowers thousands of leading publishers and authors to drive sales and find new fans. We're expanding our team to address the challenges and opportunities of the publishing industry while continuing to help readers find books and authors they'll love. Learn more about what to expect working at BookBub at bookbub.com/careers.

Our co-op program
You'll join us for a full-time, competitively paid co-op at our office in Kendall Square for about six months in the first half of 2020.
You'll work with a small team of engineers to implement real features used by our readers, authors, and publishers. You'll take on big challenges and collaborate across the company to ship complete, end-to-end solutions.

Our engineering philosophy
We organize into small cross-functional teams that are deeply focused on one product or initiative. Teams are empowered to make product and technology decisions and quickly build the best solutions for our readers, publishers, and authors. We lean heavily on automation, good test coverage, and continuous deployment to ensure we're constantly getting rapid feedback from our users, and follow the approach of starting small, shipping often, and deferring unnecessary complexity. We believe that we build better products when our teammates have a variety of perspectives and experiences, so we care a lot about creating a supportive and inclusive environment.

During your co-op, you will:
Receive one-on-one mentorship and training from experienced engineers who are dedicated to helping you grow quickly
Learn the tools we use, and deepen your understanding if you already know them: Rails, React.js, Clojure, Postgres, Redis, AWS, Docker, and more
Engage in many deep technical discussions with friendly and talented engineers
Ship code to production almost every day via our continuous deployment pipeline
Use automated tests and monitoring to ensure code works as expected and runs correctly in production
Work on high-scale systems used by millions of people
Complete your co-op with the skills and experience to be a professional software engineer at a top-tier tech company

What we're looking for:
You're pursuing an undergraduate degree in computer science or a related field, with anticipated graduation in 2021 or 2022
You're available to work in person at our office in Cambridge, MA for six months at the beginning of 2020 (typically January-June timeline)
You've had at least one previous coop or internship developing software with a team
You're comfortable working in at least one general-purpose programming language
You've had experience working in at least one general-purpose programming language
You enjoy collaborating with others on shared goals
You're an effective communicator, both in writing and in person
You're able to break complex problems into manageable pieces and efficiently assemble solutions

Your interview experience
Our goal is to create an environment where you can interview at your best. If we can provide any assistance or accommodations during your time with us, please let us know at accommodations@bookbub.com. All requests are treated as privately as possible and have no impact on candidate eligibility.

 
BookBub strives to be an inclusive workplace and we value learning from different perspectives. We seek to foster an environment filled with people from a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

At Boston Children's Hospital, success is measured in patients treated, parents comforted and teams taught. It's in discoveries made, processes perfected, and technology advanced. Join our acclaimed Heart Center and discover how your talents can change lives. Yours included.

Excellent user interface and graphics design skills

Boston Children's Hospital is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
 
 
1. application development teams: We develop desktop, web and mobile applications using Microsoft.Net technologies (primarily) and Java. Boston Microgreens is a modern urban agriculture startup based in South Boston. We provide high quality microgreens and specialty herbs to chefs and restaurants in the Greater Boston area. Founded by two Northeastern graduates, Microgreens combines traditional agricultural methods with modern growing technology to provide fresh ingredients to the best Chefs in Boston.
 
We are seeking a co-op with a background in electrical engineering, computer engineering and software design to develop and implement new technology in our growing operation. An engineer at Boston Microgreens will spend time in our indoor grow lab in South Boston developing hardware and software prototypes that maximize plant yields and optimize our workflow.
 
An ideal candidate is an energetic person who is comfortable working independently on research and prototyping tasks. It's ok if you don't have prior experience with agriculture -- we will spend at least 2 full crop cycles (about 1 month) showing you the ropes.
 
Tasks may include:
Contributing code to our in-house inventory software platform (Python, Django)
Exploring and implementing new sensors and automation technology
Conducting plant growth experiments and monitoring results
Managing inventory, from sowing seeds to supply and delivery runs
Constant ideation to refine operations and workflow
 
The position is deliberately open-ended, providing plenty of opportunities to shape the role around your interests and expertise in order to create the most rewarding experience possible. If things go well, a paid part-time position will be available to you post co-op.
 
A co-op with Boston Microgreens presents an opportunity to become part of a vibrant team of smart and passionate individuals and a unique local business.

The following position description is for a Robotics Software Engineer Co-op/Intern.  The duties of this role include but are not limited to; supporting senior staff in the development of robotics and supporting technologies, participating in development of algorithms for robot perception, localization, planning, and other elements of robotics, participating in Agile and Test Driven Development practices,  participating in code reviews, advising senior engineers on state of the art software languages and development tools (e.g. Google Go programming language, AngularJS, Javascript V8, Hadoop, MapReduce, etc.).  The candidate will be exposed to architecture, design, implementation, benchmarking, test, and fielding of various capabilities enabled by software related to robotics and autonomous systems.
A successful candidate is someone who is willing to work hard with a high attention to detail, takes tremendous pride in their work, and will take it upon themselves to go the extra mile when needed.  Senior engineers will challenge the successful candidate to think independently and to hone both their engineering and professional skills. This candidate should be able to see the ?big picture?, realizing that engineering is not simply developing a subcomponent but that there are interfaces within the system and with the real world that must be attended to.  No candidate will have all of the required experience, but the key is a strong desire to learn and willingness to push oneself! Be prepared to have fun, be challenged, and learn a lot in a startup-within-a-professional environment.
Required Skills and Experience:
Intermediate experience with one of the following programming languages, preferably through course work, personal projects, and previous work experience: C, C++, Python
Hands-on experience developing code (C, C++) for embedded platforms such as Beaglebone Black, Raspberry Pi, or similar other than Arduino (or in addition to Arduino)
Familiarity with Object Oriented Programming (OOP) and design patterns in a hands-on and/or classroom setting
Basic understanding of performance tradeoffs in algorithm implementation through coursework or previous work experience, including but not limited to tradeoffs between stack and heap memory in embedded environments, tail call optimization, algorithmic complexity analysis (i.e. Big O notation), to name a few
Familiarity with both backend and frontend web technologies, including JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular and Node) and others such as Django and RoR is desired, but not required
Excellent communication skills, or willingness to learn to be an effective communicator
 
Desirable Skills and Experience:
Familiarity with ROS through course work, clubs/groups, personal projects, or previous work experience
Familiarity with software engineering challenges and best practices for autonomous vehicles (land, sea, air, or space) desired but not required
Interest in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, demonstrated course work, projects, etc. is desired, but not required
Some experience with mobile app development, either for Apple iOS or Google Android. Interest in lieu of experience is also a plus
Working knowledge of modeling/simulation software such as Matlab/Simulink is desired, but not required
Must be a United States person due to governmental contractual obligations

Job Description:
Brammer Bio, LLC is a dynamic gene and cell therapy contract development and manufacturing organization that is looking for leaders to bring the highest quality processes, products and testing to our clients. Our staff members are committed to making a difference in our organization, for our client partners and the patients we serve. We seek individuals with proven competencies and strong character to help lead our organization now and into the future.
 
The Automation Engineering Co-op will report directly to the Automation Engineering Manager, and have activities coordinated by a member of the Automation Engineering team. The Automation Co-op will be part of a team responsible for supporting automation systems used in drug substance and drug product manufacturing, quality control laboratories, and associated support areas at Brammer Bio's Lexington, MA site. Job specific activities shall include quality, safety, and conduct-based training that is crucial to operations in a cGMP facility. Additional and more specialized training will be assigned as appropriate or needed. Some limited travel to Brammer Bio sites in Cambridge and Somerville, MA may be required, but the position is based in Lexington.
 
The Automation Engineering Co-op will support the organization with the following tasks depending on the project selected:
Provide Automation support on capital construction projects including: equipment specification/selection, design reviews, DCS integration into standalone PLC islands, automation troubleshooting, and supporting overall project objectives.
Provide DCS and/or PLC coding support for manufacturing/facility systems including but not limited to DeltaV, Allen Bradley, and Siemens.
Use data analytics to provide direct input into Automation Engineering's improvement initiatives.
Aid in the support of technical documentation review and revision for systems within an FDA/EMA regulated environment.
Present a project that will encompass system knowledge and/or significant innovation will be required at the end of the term.
Experience and Skills
Must be 18 years or older
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent
Completion of at least two years of study from an accredited college or university prior to the Co-op commencing
Basic to intermediate experience with MS Word, Excel, and Visio
 
Key skills/desired experience:
Degree concentration(s) in Automation/Computer/Electrical/Chemical Engineering, Life Sciences, or related discipline
General understanding of electrical standards and local requirements and control system hardware
Sophomore/Junior standing with graduation in either 2020 or 2021
Strong leadership, communication, and organization skills
Experience using databases, data queries, and data analysis
Experience with systems such as ESXi, Syncade, OSI PI, Infobatch, Labwatch, etc.
Ability to improve business operations and directly contribute to departmental goals
General understanding of biologics manufacturing process and unit operations (bioreactors, depth filtration, chromatography, ultrafiltration/diafiltration, tangential flow filtration, viral filtration, filling operations)
Comfortable working in a Clean Room environment

Valuation Services/Corporate Finance Advisory
Location: New York, NY

Position Summary:
BRG Corporate Finance, a business unit within Berkeley Research Group (BRG), has advised in some of the most complex corporate domestic and international matters. The group's broad experience and superior service, coupled with our personal, hands-on approach to client service, have benefited hundreds of clients from small businesses to Fortune 500 companies in a wide array of industries. BRG's core practice areas include:
* Valuation Services
* Restructuring and Bankruptcy Services
* Transaction Advisory Services
* Capital Markets Services
* Business Transformation Services
* Alternative Investment Advisory
* Bank Regulatory Services
* Litigation, Forensics, and Dispute Resolution Services

BRG is seeking 1 or 2 co-ops to join its Valuation Services Group, which provides valuation services in support of transaction opinions, alternative investments portfolio valuation, GP manager valuations, corporate financial reporting and strategic valuations. BRG's clients are leading hedge funds, private equity funds, boards of directors, special committees, pension funds, family offices, lenders, corporate attorneys, trustees, investors, and other fiduciaries.

Examples of the types of transactions for which BRG typically advises on include:
* Mergers & acquisitions
* Spin-offs
* Leveraged buyouts
* Management buyouts
* Dividend recapitalizations
* Refinancings
* Down-round financings
* Restructurings
* Buy-and-sell side
* Exchange offers
* Share repurchases
* Going private
* Fraudulent conveyance litigation

BRG provides independent portfolio valuation services for illiquid securities across the entire capital structure, including valuations for:
* Common and preferred equity (private equity)
* Direct lenders, BDCs, private debt providers
* Structured products (CLOs, CDOs, ABS, CMBS, RMBS, and structured notes)
* Options, warrants, synthetic securities, convertible securities, and hybrid securities
* Tangible assets (infrastructure, real estate, land, machinery)

The ideal candidate for the co-op position will have strong financial technical competencies, the ability to collaborate with a variety of industry specialists, and an interest in growing one's own leadership capabilities. The individual will work with experienced senior professionals focused on providing opinions of value to our clients for a variety of purposes including transaction support (including fairness and solvency opinions), GP/LP Investment reporting, expert testimony, etc.

Job Responsibilities
* Technical:
o Develop 3-statement financial models and perform valuation analyses (discounted cash flows, guideline public companies/transactions, cash flow modeling, etc.)
o Research, prepare, and present company, industry and economic analyses
o Analyze and vet financial statements and prospective financial information
o Command use of financial software such as Capital IQ and Bloomberg
o An aptitude for and desire for further develop a solid understanding of GAAP and related SEC reporting requirements for alternative investments investors and corporations

* Quality:
o Meet team deadlines and quality expectations
o Maintain productivity while managing competing client priorities
o Maintain an organized, methodical and professional demeanor

* Communication:
o Demonstrate strong report writing skills - producing quality work products
o Utilize strong verbal and written communication skills to communicate project status and results to your managers

* Teamwork and Leadership:
o Participate in a team environment and collaborate to share responsibilities towards attainment of team goals
o Actively seek out opportunities for practice development projects and personal leadership skill development

* Business Development:
o Take an active role in business development activities, such as building pitch books and maintain log of pipeline clients

Qualifications:
Applicants must be in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or other related field of study and have some prior internship or work experience in finance, accounting, business valuation, or a similar financial role. Candidates must be able to submit verification of his/her legal right to work in the U.S., without company sponsorship. BRG is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Berkeley Research Group (BRG) provides independent expert testimony, advisory services and data analytics to major law firms, Fortune 500 companies, government agencies and regulatory bodies around the world. BRG experts provide sophisticated economic, financial, and analytical advice across a wide range of disciplines including antitrust and competition policy, complex damages, finance, healthcare, intellectual property, restructuring, valuation, and workforce issues. In addition, the firm assists clients in major industry sectors with compliance, business process improvement and strategy consulting.

Us: a team on a mission to build tools that enable rapid analysis and exploration of massive genetic datasets (100s of TB and tripling yearly). We are dedicated to open science and all our work is open source. We currently develop in Scala, Spark, Python and C/C++ but will use any tools we need to get the job done.

You: a computer science or related discipline student. You have some facility with data structures and algorithms. You can write clear, correct code to solve non-trivial but well-defined problems.

Key to our success is growing a strong team with a diverse membership who enable and support the growth and success of one another. Self-improvement is a fundamental part of our culture; we want to grow great engineers.

The Vector Engineering laboratory within the Stanley Center for Psychiatric Research at the Broad Institute of Harvard and MIT aims to develop next-generation gene therapy vectors by engineering adeno-associated virus (AAV) capsids and recombinant genomes. We are looking for an exceptional and experienced biostatistician/bioinformatician to join our rapidly growing, multidisciplinary and data-driven research team. You will work at the cutting edge of data science to integrate, curate, and mine complex datasets to develop next-generation AAV vectors for use as gene therapy vectors. The lab routinely generates large, high-quality NGS datasets that require innovative data analysis solutions.
 
During your 6- or 8-month internship, you will drive the computational side of several collaborative projects aimed at using directed evolution, protein engineering and high-throughput screening to develop AAV capsids with new capabilities and to identify gene regulatory elements that enable scientists to probe and interrogate specific classes of neurons in the mammalian brain. This role requires extensive knowledge of statistics, algorithm design, data analysis and visualization; an understanding of molecular biology; and an ability to communicate effectively with wet-lab molecular biologists with whom you will be working closely to ensure the success of the projects. You will also benefit from being surrounded by a highly diverse collection of Broad's bench and computational scientists who are at the forefront of generating and applying genetic data for the understanding of psychiatric diseases and for the advancement of medicine.   

Your responsibilities include:
Develop, apply, document, and maintain computational tools, both for your projects and to support analysis by biologist colleagues without formal computational training
Follow relevant scientific literature to ensure the use of optimal methods and understand emerging practices across the field
Attend and present results at team meetings, plan projects and experiments, and communicate results to collaborators 
Contribute to progress reports, publications, and presentations at scientific conferences
Work with other Stanley Center and Broad Institute computational scientists and wet-lab biologists
 
Requirements 
Strong background in bioinformatics and statistics
Demonstrated programming and algorithm design skills; Python and data visualization skills are essential
Non-trivial data analytics experience 
Basic understanding of molecular biology
Experience working with next-generation sequencing data
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively across disciplines to facilitate productive collaborations with wet-lab scientists
Good team-playing skills: flexibility to lead projects, collaborate, and work as a team member in projects led by other scientists. 
 
Preferred but not required 
A relevant publication record 
Familiarity with Matlab and R
Experience with single-cell RNAseq
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform 
Familiarity with machine learning 
Experience managing and/or mentoring computational personnel

Through these live video tutorials, students can practice having live conversations with native speakers and learn how to master the IELTS and TOEFL.

We're looking for aspiring software engineers who are passionate about changing the way people learn languages. As a Cambly engineering intern, you'll be part of a small and fast-moving engineering team where you'll have a large impact on all parts of the Cambly platform. We've been growing rapidly among language learners around the world, so you'll get to learn what it's like to join a fast growing startup that's creating opportunities for our students and tutors alike.

A product-minded approach to engineering. You should be excited about working directly with our students and tutors to make sure they have an amazing experience.
Experience writing software in Java, Python, Swift, Objective C, or react.js either in school, side projects, or professionally.
A passion for learning. You fearlessly dive into new and unfamiliar technologies.
A global perspective. You should be excited about building an app in 10+ languages that integrates with the social networks and payment methods used by our students.
Currently enrolled in a Computer Science degree program with at least 2 years of study completed.
On a small and nimble team, every engineer should be able to learn new technologies quickly and jump in anywhere in our stack. You should have experience using or be excited about learning all the parts of Cambly: iOS, Android, React, JS, Python, Mongo

The Vector Engineering laboratory within the Stanley Center for Psychiatric Research at the Broad Institute of Harvard and MIT aims to develop next-generation gene therapy vectors by engineering adeno-associated virus (AAV) capsids and recombinant genomes. We are looking for an exceptional and experienced biostatistician/bioinformatician to join our rapidly growing, multidisciplinary and data-driven research team. You will work at the cutting edge of data science to integrate, curate, and mine complex datasets to develop next-generation AAV vectors for use as gene therapy vectors. The lab routinely generates large, high-quality NGS datasets that require innovative data analysis solutions.
 
You will drive the computational side of several collaborative projects aimed at using directed evolution, protein engineering and high-throughput screening to develop AAV capsids with new capabilities and to identify gene regulatory elements that enable scientists to probe and interrogate specific classes of neurons in the mammalian brain. This role requires extensive knowledge of statistics, algorithm design, data analysis and visualization; an understanding of molecular biology; and an ability to communicate effectively with wet-lab molecular biologists with whom you will be working closely to ensure the success of the projects. You will also benefit from being surrounded by a highly diverse collection of Broad's bench and computational scientists who are at the forefront of generating and applying genetic data for the advancement of medicine.   

Your responsibilities include:
Develop, apply, document, and maintain computational tools, both for your projects and to support analysis by biologist colleagues without formal computational training
Follow relevant scientific literature to ensure the use of optimal methods and understand emerging practices across the field
Attend and present results at team meetings, plan projects and experiments, and communicate results to collaborators 
Contribute to progress reports, publications, and presentations at scientific conferences
Work with other Stanley Center and Broad Institute computational scientists and wet-lab biologists
 
Requirements:
Strong background in bioinformatics and statistics
Demonstrated programming and algorithm design skills; Python and data visualization skills are essential
Non-trivial data analytics experience 
Basic understanding of molecular biology
Experience working with next-generation sequencing data
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively across disciplines to facilitate productive collaborations with wet-lab scientists
Good team-playing skills: flexibility to lead projects, collaborate, and work as a team member in projects led by other scientists.

A relevant publication record 
Familiarity with Matlab and R
Experience with single-cell RNAseq
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform 
Familiarity with machine learning

The vector engineering group at the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard is a technology development laboratory focused on engineering gene delivery vehicles (viral vectors). The group applies high-throughput selection and screening to engineer recombinant viruses that enable more efficient and selective gene transfer to defined cell types in the central nervous system. The ultimate goal of these efforts is to develop treatments for psychiatric disorders by supporting hypothesis testing in a variety of model systems.

During the 6 or 8 months period, you will be working within the vector engineering team and will be closely mentored by a computational scientist to analyze NGS data and apply machine learning techniques in cutting edge protein engineering projects geared towards groundbreaking gene therapy research. Your first project will be to build a pipeline capable of analyzing and comparing multiple NGS data sets to understand how specific sequence variants are enriched under a variety of selection conditions. The pipeline will also be scalable, meaning that data from new experiments can be added to the existing bank of data from previous experiments for combined analysis. This first project will be followed by other machine learning project(s) to infer patterns in those sequence variants. Prior experience with machine learning is desired but not required.

This is a great opportunity to collaborate with biostatisticians, mathematicians, and biologists at the Broad Institute of MIT & Harvard. Depending on your progress, you may have the opportunity to present your work at an annual Broad meeting in May and to the broader Broad Institute members and affiliates in December at the Broad annual Retreat and ultimately push your work into a publication.

Requirements:
Non-trivial algorithm development and coding experience (internships, previous co-op, publications, projects, etc)
Python
Basic statistics background

Preferred but not required:
Matlab or R 
Bioinformatics background and experience
Experience with NGS analysis and pipeline development
Machine learning background

About the Company
Cardinal Health is a $10 billion global healthcare products leader dedicated to innovation and long-term growth. Cardinal Health creates innovative medical solutions for better patient outcomes and delivers value through clinical leadership and excellence

General Overview and Summary of Position
The Logistics Planning Department is responsible for the daily operations of specific Cardinal Health-owned manufacturing plants and outside suppliers. Some of the major Key Performance Indicator's (KPI's) include Average Backorders, Fill Rates, and Total Inventory. We work closely with various other functional groups such as Marketing, Manufacturing, Sourcing, and Customer Service.

The Logistics Co-op provides essential support to the Logistics Planning team with report and database management.  This position also has end to end supply chain planning for a product family manufactured at one of our Cardinal Health sites, which will include collaboration with Marketing on sales forecasting and Manufacturing on supply recovery and inventory planning.

The candidate should be proficient with technology, demonstrate good time management and be detail oriented.  He or she should be a fast and resourceful learner, who shows initiative, exhibits strong communication, interpersonal skills, and can work both independently and as part of a team.

This is a great environment for any Co-op student interested in learning more about a global supply chain, as well as how a large global company runs on a day to day basis.  You will have the ability to visit manufacturing plants, meet with employees from various functional areas, and gain hands-on supply chain experience.

Required Skills
Experience with one or more prior co-ops, preferably related to Supply Chain
Follow up and time management skills
Strong analytical skills along with attention to detail
Passionate, inquisitive individuals with a drive to succeed
Ability to learn new concepts and systems on the fly
Preferred Skills
Prior experience with MS-Excel and Access, preferably with a course in database
Basic knowledge of SCM, preferably with 1-2 courses taken in SCM
Majors Preferred
Supply Chain Management (SCM), Management Information Systems (MIS) or Business Administration

Cardinal Health is  accessible by public transportation. If the Commuter Rail option is chosen, Co-ops can get off at the Mansfield Crossing station, and take a taxi to the Cardinal Health campus which should take approximately 5 minutes. By car, it is approximately 45 minutes from Boston.

Pay:

Company Description:
Camera IQ is a tech start-up enabling brands to create Augmented Reality Experiences to engage with their customers through social platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and Snapchat. We are a lean and agile team with a passion for what we do.
Job Description:
We're looking for a dedicated, hard working, technically minded product manager with an excellent customer facing presence, sharp critical thinking skills and a passion for learning to help us develop our Augmented Reality platform.

You will play a pivotal role partnering with our Senior Product Manager to investigate product needs and drive value as we continue to grow and scale our product.
Responsibilities:
1. Product Management / Exploration
We are always questioning our underlying assumptions and investigating new potential product ideas and features
In this role, the APM will be expected to take a potential new product feature through the entire product development lifecycle: ideation ? design ? prototype ? implement ? test
2. Business analytics
The APM will be the champion for both product and customer analytics
The questions that the APM must ask themselves and find answers to are ones such as: "which product features are being used the most / the least?", "how are users using the product / what are their product behaviors?", "what makes customers successful and how do we increase their chances of success?"
3. Participation in all agile ceremonies
Camera IQ is an agile, lean startup. As such, the APM will be expected to participate in and contribute to all agile ceremonies, such as:
Sprint Planning - where we prioritize and plan what product features we want to work on in the next couple weeks
Daily Stand ups - where, as a team, we discuss our progress from the previous day and what we plan to accomplish today
Grooming - where go through the upcoming priorities as a team and break down the work so that both the product team and the engineering team gets a better understanding of how we will accomplish them.
Retrospectives - where we discuss, as a team, what went well in the previous sprint, and what should be improved upon going forward

Pursuing a bachelor's degree in an engineering, business, or design related field

Excellent communication skills
Excellent organizational skills
Interest in tech / software development

An awesome friendly team environment :)

Casma Overview
Casma Therapeutics is harnessing the natural cellular process of autophagy to open vast new target areas for drug discovery and development that will profoundly impact the lives of patients. Autophagy is a conserved cellular process that contributes to overall organismal health. Inefficient autophagy flux or defects in lysosomal homeostasis are observed in numerous pathologies, e.g., neurodegeneration, metabolic disorders, inflammation, and muscle degeneration. Casma uses several approaches to intervene at strategic points throughout the autophagy-lysosome system to improve the cellular process of clearing out unwanted proteins, organelles and invading pathogens. By boosting autophagy, Casma expects to be able to arrest or reverse the progression of lysosomal storage disorders, muscle disorders, inflammatory disorders and neurodegeneration, among other indications. Casma was launched in 2018 by Third Rock Ventures and is based in Cambridge, Mass.

WHAT WE NEED
Casma is seeking a talented and highly motivated co-op to support the IT & Informatics team. Your work will support the entire company, implementing and maintaining the software and hardware required to drive our scientific mission. As a newly-founded and fast-growing startup, you will get to be a part of a dynamic environment as we are building the science and programs and have the opportunity to interact with the entire organization. We are looking for someone who will share our excitement about the technology and science, contribute to our culture, and honor our commitment to patients.
 
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Support the growing Casma user base with IT-related issues. With a small IT team, we support all users of technology and enable them to be as efficient as possible in their daily jobs.
Work directly on infrastructure projects including planning, execution, and maintenance. You should enjoy both the high level view as well as diving into the details, and be ready to get your hands dirty.
Participate in IT strategy and planning; bring your thoughts and ideas! We cover all aspects of IT including infrastructure, networking, desktop support, cybersecurity, cloud systems, informatics, data management, and system integration and automation.
Learn about building an enterprise-class technology environment. As a small company, you'll have the opportunity to be exposed to the many facets of technology for enterprise.
While the projects and duties will vary based on need, here are some examples of what we do:
Help end users with desktop computer issues
Build, maintain, and troubleshoot network and infrastructure, both on-premise and cloud
Prepare hardware and software for new implementations
Prioritize and plan new projects for hardware and software implementation based on company needs
Integrate third-party software systems to work seamlessly together
Have fun! If you love technology and helping people, this role should be a great fit.

QUALIFICATIONS YOU SHOULD POSSESS
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program with a major in Computer Science or related discipline
At least one year of directly-related work experience (two co-ops or equivalent). Must be knowledgeable in the use of various operating systems (Windows, Linux, and Macintosh) as well as application software products (Office 365, anti-virus, file shares, desktop and web-based software)
A love for technology; if at home you like to tinker with a Raspberry Pi or write your own scripts, then this role is for you
Basic understanding of networking, cybersecurity, and cloud systems (AWS)
Enjoys working with people and providing excellent customer service
Knowledge of a scripting language is a plus (Powershell, Python)
Experience with server and database applications is a plus
Interest in or familiarity with healthcare, biology, pharmaceutical, or biotech
Problem solver who takes initiative to drive projects to completion
Strong collaboration skills, perform well in a team
Clear and effective verbal and written communication skills
A demonstrated ability to think logically and critically
Ability to successfully participate in a highly-creative and enthusiastic start-up environment
Exemplify a patient-first mentality, courage, integrity, drive, and respect for all team members

Casma Company Values + Culture

SUMMARY OF POSITION:
This Controls Engineering Co-op will work on the design of Medtronic's next-generation minimally invasive surgery (MIS) robotic platform.
 
They will participate in the development and testing of control algorithms using Simulink.  S/he will assume a supporting project role, serving as a functional team member working within a group of electromechanical and software engineers. 
 
SPECIFIC JOB FUNCTIONS:
 
Develop test methods and control algorithms to perform system level characterization and calibration of complex electromechanical systems, including:

Kinematic and dynamics control of robotic systems.
Design and fabrication of test fixtures and integrated measurement systems for characterization of friction and mechanical properties of robotic systems.
Develop simulations and control algorithms of robotic systems
Characterize and calibrate drive components, mechanisms, and subassemblies.
Develop control code to implement gravity compensation, friction compensation, and dynamic compensation in the system.
In addition, participate in the design and evaluation of product level prototypes, including:
Participate in design reviews and evaluate mechanical components, assemblies and mechanism designs, including motor drives, linkages, and cable driven mechanisms.
Design and fabricate engineering prototypes, measurement systems, test fixtures, and other specialized equipment used for development.
Develop test protocols and perform preliminary verification testing.
Preferred Experience:
Basic knowledge of robotics, kinematics, and controls.
Hands-on experience debugging code used to control electromechanical systems.
Experience with motor control and interfacing / programming motor controllers.
Previous experience with Simulink and Matlab
Working knowledge of C and C++ programming languages.

About Catalant:
Catalant helps companies build an agile workforce, with technology and programs that enable them to access the talent they need, when they need it, wherever it is. Forward-looking executives partner with Catalant to transform the structure of how their companies' work gets done and the behaviors that drive or delay agile workforce transformation.

Over 20 percent of the Fortune 1000 use Catalant's best practices and platform to frictionlessly access and deploy internal and external talent, including over 50,000 independent consultants and 1,000 boutique firms in Catalant's expert marketplace. Anonymized data from leading companies train Catalant's AI-powered talent matching and recommendation engine, inform its program design and best practices, and surface counter-intuitive insights that get smarter over time.

Our investors include General Catalyst and Highland Capital, two of the top Venture Capital firms out there, as well as famed investor Mark Cuban. We're on a mission to build the absolute best team on the east coast, and are looking for talented, scrappy, fun, and competitive folks to redefine the way work gets done!

About our Software Engineering Co-ops:
We are pragmatic. Our team is responsible for creating and supporting a platform that enables our customers to engage the right people, inside or outside their company, at the right time. We try not to overbuild: we value shipped code over perfect code. Time to market is important, as is time to fix. We value excellence and teamwork. 

We're a python shop on the Flask framework. We use docker. We do continuous deployment. We work in 4-6 person scrum teams, writing new features and customized business logic for our clients. We limit meetings, so you're focused on the stuff that matters.

As a new co-op, you'll deploy your first production code on your second day in the office. If you get stuck on a problem, your team is right there to help you out and get you moving again. Our office has plenty of space to explore.  Feel like you need a change of perspective? Go work in our garden, or the cafe or the library. 

Current challenges you can help us with:

- How do we deliver customized solutions to our clients in a scalable way?
- How do we make it easier for our clients to find the right person for the job every time?
- What tools do businesses need to power the transition to an agile workforce?

What you'll get when you work with us:

- Feedback from our Chief Architect on improving your coding practices
- An agile team that is always looking to improve and to effectively meet the needs of the business
- The ability to have impact every day by creating value for our customers and stakeholders
- Free Friday lunches

Co-op Job Title: Clinical Trial Operations Data Science Co-Op
Job Description:
Role Summary 
The Data Science and Innovation (DSI) Department at Cerevel Therapeutics is focused on accelerating all stages of the discovery and development of CNS (central nervous system) therapeutics.  We are comprised of different technical and academic domains which collectively are aimed at disrupting traditional drug R&D paradigms through the novel collection, use, and re-use of proprietary and public data from all stages of drug discovery and development.    

The creative use of AI/ML, statistics, and visualization in pharma is a relatively new field, but the opportunities to have major and immediate impact in this multi-billion-dollar industry are sky-high.  We are seeking candidates with state-of-the-art skills in software and data science and a passion to get to the heart of problems to uncover insights that enable faster, more efficient clinical trials and deliver therapies to patients who need them.   The candidate will work hand-in-hand with our Clinical Operations Team to develop analyses that improve the efficiency of our clinical trials for our drugs addressing epilepsy and Parkinson's Disease.  This could involve estimating which trial sites will be most efficient or building dashboards that summarize factors contributing to trial success.  
The candidate would iteratively collaborate with experts to design and refine analyses and visualizations, with the goal of building a library of reusable and interactive tools that become a central part of the business workflow.  The candidate will identify and implement best practices to establish an efficient and reusable path towards systematically extracting value out of complex data.  In some cases, off-the-shelf SW/BI tools may suffice, but we frequently expect that substantial customization will be required, and hence the candidate must be able to easily work hands-on with data in a scientific programming language. 

Job Responsibilities 
The candidate will be embedded across the DSI and Clinical Operations organizations and will: 
Partner with experts to understand business-focused problems, capture their requirements, and translate those problems into a plan for data-driven challenges; 
Establish a computing environment and infrastructure for executing data analysis and visualization efforts 
Prototype visualizations and analyses and present to stakeholders to collect feedback and refine results until stakeholders give acceptance 
Store tools and results for easy re-use and modification 
Compose storyboards capturing successes that can be shared with other stakeholders 
Educational Requirements 
Senior-level or graduate student in Engineering, Computer Science, Computational Biology, Informatics, or Data Science 
Strong preference to past study or exposure to life sciences/health care data or problems 

Technical Job Requirements 
High proficiency in data science languages like R, Python, and SQL, with an ability to use state-of-the-art visualization and data science toolboxes (e.g., Pandas, sklearn, numpy, scipy, matplotlib, Angular, etc.) 
At least 2 demonstrated uses cases translating a business/science problem into a data science effort, including both visualizations and code 
High proficiency in basic statistics (e.g., t-tests) and basic machine learning (e.g., supervised classification, feature selection, cross-validation, etc.) 
Working familiarity with commercial business intelligence tools such as Spotfire, Tableau, etc. 
High proficiency in manipulating data from different sources, e.g., .csv files, MySql 
Excellent oral and written communication skills 
Desired Personal Attributes 
Strong team player with a positive, can-do attitude 
Customer-focused 
Works independently but knows when to ask for help 
Punctual and detail-oriented 
Relentless in finding the best way to solve a problem, but able to make practical decisions 
Learns enough about new fields to quickly become effective 
Job Details 
Term of Co-op is Jan ? June, 2020 
Pay will be competitive and commensurate with experience 
Cerevel is located next to Back Bay Station 
 
About Cerevel 
Cerevel Therapeutics is a new Boston-based biopharmaceutical company formed by Bain Capital and Pfizer that relentlessly finds paths through complexity to bring real progress and new treatment options to people living with neurological and neuropsychiatric disorders. 

Our portfolio of pre-commercial neuroscience assets targets a broad range of central nervous system (CNS) disorders including Parkinson's, Alzheimer's, epilepsy, schizophrenia and addiction. 

Headquartered in the Greater Boston area, we are bold thinkers, deep experts, resilient pathfinders, and transparent partners who push the boundaries of scientific understanding to unlock breakthrough CNS therapies that have real impact on people's lives.

Who We Are

Certain Lending is a Series-A, financial technology startup located in the heart of San Francisco's financial district. Founded in September 2017, we connect real estate investors to competitive financing options and ensure timely access to mortgage capital through an online experience, high-touch client engagement, and institutional-grade advice.

A client may enter their project details into our responsive online platform and we will return a digital comparison of financing offers from bank and non-bank lenders on their behalf, including potentially one from our firm. After clients choose an offer of their liking, we work on their behalf to ensure their transaction closes on time at the desired terms. For loans we directly finance, we then work to sell these mortgages to hedge funds and other firms to hold to maturity. We facilitate projects ranging from a single family residence fix and flip project to the acquisition, renovation, or construction of a hotel or office space. 

Your Co-op Experience

We are seeking a highly motivated, autonomous and accountable individual who is driven to take on real responsibility within a production application. Once you are up to speed with our architecture, you will take the lead on a front-end, back-end, or dev-ops project of your own design.

Like 3 prior co-ops, you will receive direct mentorship from one of our lead engineers, who will be there to help you figure out how to design, debug, and deploy each project you build in your co-op and help you tailor your experience with us to fit your interests and long-term career goals.

You will meet regularly with our co-founders and have the opportunity to learn about what founding and running a successful startup is like firsthand. Engaging questions and ideas are always appreciated. 

We will further provide opportunities for you to participate in industry events in real estate and technology, fly to meet active real estate investors in our markets, and be active in San Francisco's tech scene through participating in hackathons, conferences, helping to host meet-ups, etc.

Your Potential Projects

On a given day you could be implementing both the front and backends of new user workflows including:

Creating rules engines for encoding lender underwriting practices
Providing proof of income and liquidity, through integrating with 3rd party services like Plaid.
Improving the automation of underwriting through integrations with 3rd-party API calls for public record and MLS real estate data, FICO credit scores, and identity verification services.
Building document, CSV, and other integrations to hedge funds and other partners' platforms to automate the import/export data necessary to sell originated mortgages  
Developing matching algorithms between investor projects and lender eligibility criteria
Identifying and leveraging public records to pre-populate property and investor information
Developing automated E2E testing tools to cover serverless, backend, and frontend components
Compensation and Benefits
$27 - $42/hr. indexed to experience
Full benefits: Comprehensive health insurance, gym membership reimbursement, pre-tax commuter benefits, 401(k) eligibility
Housing: We offer a housing stipend to offset the cost of living near our downtown office. We will work with you to find a reasonable housing option, to include introducing you to short term furnished housing options and providing feedback on neighborhoods and commutes.
Transportation: We will cover your flight to/from the Bay Area at the beginning and end of the co-op.
Meals: We provide daily lunch and all the beverages and snacks you'd expect in a Bay Area startup
Tech / Workstation
TL;DR whatever you need to be happy and productive
Multiple 4k monitors
MacBook Pro with any desired accessories
Standing desk (if desired)
Ergonomic chairs
Modern office space near all possible forms of public transportation (BART, Muni, bus, bike, electric scooters, etc.)
Who You Are
Actively pursuing a degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or similar fields with at least one prior software engineering co-op
Experience in JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript and a web application framework like Express, Django, or Flask.
History of personal coding projects, or past experience on production web applications
Experience with distributed storage (AWS S3), serverless computing (AWS Lambda functions, Step Functions) and database systems (MongoDB/Postgres)
Have an interest in the real estate industry 
Bonus points if
You've had a prior co-op at a relevant company, or have a background in real estate 
You've had prior experience with our current stack, particularly, Vue, Express, and Postgres. (You should also check out our current stack: https://stackshare.io/certain-lending). 
You've previously worked on a production web application, or your personal coding projects are hosted live and you can explain the reasoning behind your architecture. 
You've contributed to an open source project. 
You have a burning desire to thrive in SF and will take advantage of the countless industry meetups, conferences, and other events that this co-op will enable.
Our Co-op Interview Process
Our intention is to accept NU Careers applications until the last Friday of September (09/27), continue conducting phone calls with candidates until October 4th, then fly to the Boston campus for an info session and in-person interviews sometime during the week of 10/7-10/11. We will keep all interested parties informed if this schedule changes during this process.

Full benefits: Comprehensive health insurance, gym membership reimbursement, pre-tax commuter benefits, 401(k) eligibility
Housing: We offer a housing stipend to offset the cost of living near our downtown office. We will work with you to find a reasonable housing option, to include introducing you to short term furnished housing options and providing feedback on neighborhoods and commutes.
Transportation: We will cover your flight to/from the Bay Area at the beginning and end of the co-op.
Meals: We provide daily lunch and all the beverages and snacks you'd expect in a Bay Area startup
Tech / Workstation
TL;DR whatever you need to be happy and productive
Multiple 4k monitors
MacBook Pro with any desired accessories
Standing desk (if desired)
Ergonomic chairs
Modern office space near all possible forms of public transportation (BART, Muni, bus, bike, electric scooters, etc.)
Who You Are
Actively pursuing a degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or similar fields with at least one prior software engineering co-op
Experience in JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript and a web application framework like Express, Django, or Flask.
History of personal coding projects, or past experience on production web applications
Experience with distributed storage (AWS S3), serverless computing (AWS Lambda functions, Step Functions) and database systems (MongoDB/Postgres)
Have an interest in the real estate industry 
Bonus points if
You've had a prior co-op at a relevant company, or have a background in real estate 
You've had prior experience with our current stack, particularly, Vue, Express, and Postgres. (You should also check out our current stack: https://stackshare.io/certain-lending). 
You've previously worked on a production web application, or your personal coding projects are hosted live and you can explain the reasoning behind your architecture. 
You've contributed to an open source project. 
You have a burning desire to thrive in SF and will take advantage of the countless industry meetups, conferences, and other events that this co-op will enable.
Our Co-op Interview Process
Our intention is to accept NU Careers applications until the last Friday of September (09/27), continue conducting phone calls with candidates until October 4th, then fly to the Boston campus for an info session and in-person interviews sometime during the week of 10/7-10/11. We will keep all interested parties informed if this schedule changes during this process.

Circle is a global crypto finance company, built on blockchain technology, powered by crypto assets, and dedicated to helping people and institutions create and share value globally.  With our suite of products, we enable our customers to invest in and trade crypto assets.

Our passion is building tools that allow Circle to help our customers, ensure that we have insight into how the platform is running and anything else that we may think of. As a Tools co-op at Circle, you'll assist in building features from concept to deployment. You will spend the majority of your time writing React as well as a bit of PHP. You may also have opportunities to work with AngularJS and Node.JS. We're looking for highly motivated individuals who seek a fun, collaborative, iterative and fast-paced environment.
What you will work on 
Contribute ideas for our tools, architecture, and implementation
Collaborate with other teams to help craft elegant solutions to problems
Develop features on both the frontend (React) and backend (Node.JS) of our internal tools for our Customer Experience (CX), Risk Operations (Risk Ops), and Compliance teams 
Ensure code is well tested through unit and integration tests
Leverage new technologies in innovative ways
Automate manual tasks to greatly improve the efficiency of our CX, Risk Ops, and Compliance teams
What you'll bring to Circle
Experience building single page web applications using JavaScript frameworks
Passion for writing beautiful, functional and well-tested code
Curiosity and a creative mindset when it comes to problem-solving
Strong communication skills as you will be working with the Tools Product Manager and stakeholders in CX, Risk Ops, and Compliance on a daily basis
A collaborative attitude and willingness to work closely with engineers and stakeholders
Circle was founded in 2013 by internet entrepreneurs Jeremy Allaire and Sean Neville. We're backed by $250 million from investors including Jim Breyer (Facebook), Goldman Sachs, IDG Capital (Baidu, Tencent), General Catalyst (AirBnB, Snapchat), Accel Partners, and Bitmain, with offices in Boston, New York, San Francisco, Dublin, London and Hong Kong. 

Circle Invest empowers consumers to buy and sell crypto assets. Circle Trade is one of the world's top market makers for major crypto coins and offers OTC trading services for institutions and high net worth individuals. Additionally, in the last couple of years Circle acquired Poloniex and as well as SeedInvest, both of which enable us to expand our offerings even further. Poloniex is one of the world's leading token marketplaces. SeedInvest is the largest equity crowdfunding platform in the United States, as well as a licensed broker-dealer.
Check us out at circle.com and download Circle Invest and Poloniex for iOS and Android today.

As a Risk Engineer at Circle, you're part of the team creating the rules engine framework and productizing machine learning models to build a world-class real-time automated risk evaluation system. We work across Data Science, Product, Platform and Compliance to manage risk exposure while delivering the best possible experience to our customers.

What you'll work on
You will be a part of a small productive team in an agile environment, gaining real-world experience building and deploying secure, production-scale services for consumer facing products. You will contribute to creating new, efficient ways to write pre-optimization algorithms for loading data science models that predict future decisions. You will: 
Develop a rules engine framework that allows Risk Analysts and compliance to monitor and control transactions en masse in real time
Work closely with DevOps to define and deploy new features new services on AWS
Integrate with third party vendors in a resilient fail-safe environment to enhance or supplement decision making
Calculate or pre-calculate risk features in a concurrently and in near-real time
Design, develop, peer review and test a wide range of components including REST APIs, statistical modeling methods, machine learning algorithms, message queues and asynchronous processes, SQL and NoSQL data models
Work closely with our Data Science, Product and Platform teams to manage risk exposure and perform fraud analysis and prevention while delivering the best possible customer experience
What you'll bring to Circle
Clear communication skills
Broad and diverse background (the broader the better)
Interest in financial software and cryptocurrencies
Nice to have
Linux Shell scripting experience
Exposure to Machine learning algorithms
Familiarity with Javascript, Scala or Python

The Co-op will help build and enhance Circle's software to manage, store, and send crypto assets. Management of crypto assets is an essential component of Circle's mission to deliver trustworthy trading services to customers. 
You will 
Be a key member of a small, productive team that uses agile methodologies to build, deploy and operate secure, reliable business-critical services used by Circle's operations
Work closely with individual cryptocurrency protocols to build tools that manage crypto assets
Design, develop, and test a wide range of full-stack features and systems composed of SQL data models, REST APIs, and cryptographic methods
Integrate various internal systems and APIs
Ensure code is well tested
Utilize AWS cloud platforms and patterns most appropriate for the job, including technologies like ECS and Docker
Contribute ideas to improve our product and processes
Required qualifications 
Coursework in Data Structures and Algorithms and Software Engineering
Experience with Java programming and Object Oriented programming principles
Experience with SQL
Clear communication skills
Bonus points 
Understanding of the common architectures of major cryptocurrencies
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks and libraries like React, Angular, etc.
Experience with AWS services such as S3

As a Data Scientist Co-op, you work on meeting Circle's goal of becoming the premier platform for tokenizing, investing in and trading of crypto assets. As a part of your job you will design and implement machine learning algorithms that significantly impact results and decision making for risk, compliance, marketing and trading functions at Circle.
What you'll work on
* Create text-based classification algorithms to help improve customer experience across a range of products offered by Circle.
* Create machine-learned predictive models that guide our fraud prevention and compliance
* Become an expert on data sources and flows at Circle, including Bitcoin blockchain analysis
* Collaborate with Engineering and Tech Ops teams to optimize and simplify the deployment and upgrade process for the models your team builds
* Evangelize the power of analytics to improve our business and operations
What you'll bring to Circle
* Coursework in Statistics, Machine Learning, Database programming, Data Structures and Algorithms and Software Engineering
* Expertise with a scripting language (e.g. Python)
* Knowledge of SQL
* Ability to understand business problems and break down into structured analytics projects. (edited)
