The role of Circle's Security team is to protect both the assets and the privacy of our customers as well as the resilience of our own business.  Circle's business operates in the cloud and relies on a variety of third party solutions, working in concert, to serve our customers.

As a co-op on our Security team you will assess the risks associated with our vendors to: 
Help ensure that vendors operate within Circle's risk tolerance
Help ensure that Circle integrates with its vendors security
Help drive improvements by vendors that reduce risk for Circle

You will learn about the business side of information security and see how associated disciplines like Vendor Risk Management, Issues Management, Incident Management, and Business Continuity Management come together to support the comprehensive risk management of the organization. 

We are looking for a Business / Computer Science (or similar) candidate who is:
Attracted to the business side of information security and risk management
Interested in learning how modern businesses leverage outsourcing to drive value
Interested in financial technology, including cryptocurrency
Savvy with computers and technology
Meticulous and detail focused
Able to work with technical and non-technical teams
Willing to ask questions in order to understand business requirements

What you will do at Circle:
Be part of a talented infosec team working to secure Circle and our customers' assets
Work with Circle's vendors to understand and reduce the risk associated with their services
Collaborate with technical and non-technical people across multiple teams within Circle
Gain real-world experience with measurable results
Develop reports used to support risk decision making by senior management
Come to understand the business context for key aspects of the security and risk management programs

Co-op Faculty Note:  Please note that in addition to applying through NUCareers, you will also need to apply directly to the Cisco website.  Read entire description below for directions.  Please also note that this position is based in Research Triangle Park, NC area (Raleigh-Durham, NC) with Richardson TX as a potential secondary location.  And finally, please note that the deadline to apply for this position is October 3, 2019.  Cisco will be on campus on October 4-5 conducting interviews so if you are interested, please be sure to apply before the deadline.


Team Description
As a Technical Consulting Engineer Co-Op supporting our Customer Experience Centers, you'll work on leading-edge technology with a keen focus on enabling Cisco's global customers to achieve successful business outcomes. Customer Experience supports the full customer life-cycle. You will join a cohort of engineers to build your technical expertise, learn Cisco specific technologies and make a direct, positive, impact on our customers. You will collaborate with and learn from industry-leading engineers in the areas of network infrastructure, collaboration, security, mobility, and cloud. At Cisco, we value your ideas and perspective. We encourage you to innovate and push boundaries. 

What You'll Do
The Technical Consulting Engineer Co-Op is broken down into two phases of 3 months each. 

In the first phase, you'll get hands-on experience with next-generation technology in Cisco's Advanced Labs. You'll collaborate with our Support Services engineers to recreate customer networks in the lab, using these recreates to tackle our customers' most trying technical problems.

Duties include:
Build networks consisting of an array of Cisco equipment every day
Monitor and track network recreate requests
Support the lab infrastructure
Collaborate with peers and mentor new co-ops
Receive on-the-job training and build your skills as you earn industry-leading certifications (expected to receive CCNA by the end of the co-op term)
In the second phase, you will work directly with Cisco's customers to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues they're experiencing with their Cisco products and services.

Duties include:
Ensure our customers are able to fully utilize Cisco services by solving technical issues and preventing costly down time.
Craft technical documents to build Cisco's intellectual property and technical knowledge base
Engage with wide, diverse customer base to help users get the most from their technology
Automate the process of finding and fixing common problems in Cisco's products
Minimum Requirements
You are actively pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a technical field, such as Networking, Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical/Computer Engineering or a similar field
You have the ability to work full-time hours in our Research Triangle Park, North Carolina location for 6 months.
You are fluent in English (verbal and written)
You have a minimum GPA: 3.0
You have a real passion for networking, IT, or computer science; knowledge of adjacent technologies
You have strong analytical and technical problem-solving skills
You possess the ability to multi-task, work in a dynamic team environment, and work independently
Cisco or industry certifications a plus
Application Instructions: 
IN ORDER TO INTERVIEW WITH CISCO YOU MUST APPLY THROUGH THE CISCO CAREERS SITE. Please use the Email address listed on your Resume for all of your Online Applications.  Click the link below to apply through the Cisco Careers site. 
 
If you already have a Cisco account, you still need to submit an application to the specific position for which you wish to be considered.
 
Apply to the Technical Consulting Engineer (Co-Op) position here: Click Here
 
You will receive an auto-reply email once you have completed all of the above steps.

We Are Cisco
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here's how we do it.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we're "old" (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we're also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do ? you can't put us in a box! But "Digital Transformation" is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) 

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair? Don't care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That's cool.

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.  Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

CodaMetrix is a well-capitalized and early stage company focused on solving some of the more interesting problems in the healthcare administrative and clinical space. The company was formed by the Massachusetts General Physicians Organization to help commercialize and build upon internally developed, and highly utilized AI-based applications.

CodaMetrix is led by proven entrepreneurs, technology and healthcare veterans, whose vision is to create a highly desirable atmosphere for technical talent to flourish and develop innovative, significant, reliable, and broadly utilized solutions.

Job Description

We are seeking a motivated junior engineer to join our DevOps team as an IT Operation Engineer, working with a diverse set of teams to provide IT services and resources such as computers, software and network connectivity. We are building a highly automated IT infrastructure including self-service onboarding, asset management, software installation and policy enforcement. As a member of the  DevOps team you will have opportunities to work on projects such as automating the creation and maintenance of cloud resources, building tools, and configuring integrations to help streamline and improve our software development processes.

Responsibilities
Configure, distribute and manage IT resources using common tools and services to help streamline the process.
Identify areas for improvement in the tools and services provided by the DevOps/IT Ops team.
Assist with DevOps projects such as the following: 
Implementing and managing continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) systems and methodologies.
Build and maintain tools to automate operational processes.
Assist with creation of automation scripts and declarative templates for provisioning cloud resources, rolling out tools and new features.
Monitoring systems, responding to alerts and providing support as needed.
Work with all teams to achieve business objectives.
This position may have occasional time required off-hours or on-call
Minimum Qualifications  
Expertise in provisioning and administering Windows, MacOs and Linux systems.
Development experience in Python, Java, Node.js or similar. Scripting experience with Bash or PowerShell, ideally both.
Understanding of agile and other development processes and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with management and peers.
Passionate about technology, automation and security, and eager to learn.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Automated IT asset management (MDM, SCCM, Intune, Zendesk, ManageEngine, VMWare Airwatch).
Support Desk and User Support experience.
Background in CI/CD automation or use of configuration management tools such as Ansible, Chef or Puppet.

Our company, as well as our products, are made better because we embrace diverse skills, perspectives, and ideas.

At CNC Software, Inc., our mission is to create software and services that solve the world's manufacturing challenges. Our software, Mastercam, developed and supported by our talented team, is the most widely used CAM software in the world. Headquartered in Tolland, CT, we are a culture that embraces remote work, with twenty percent of our team working from their home office in United States as well as in offices in Switzerland and China. As the industry leader, we strive to innovate, and we partner with our resellers and customers to make the impossible, well, possible.
 
As a privately held, family-owned business, our culture is shaped by our concern and care for each other and our community. Our work environment reflects this care, with exceptional benefits and services you would expect of an industry leader [on-site fitness center, walking paths, employee gardens, bicycle shop, kitchen facilities] which are supported by geothermal heating/cooling and solar arrays which power the majority of our utility consumption. As a Top Workplace, [#1 Mid-size Company 2018 http://www.courant.com/business/top-workplaces/hartford], our focus has always been on creating a workplace that embodies the family-friendly values we hold, and which, well, doesn't feel like "work", but more like a place that you want to be. If you have a passion for your work, an inquisitive nature, and a pride in exceeding the expectations others have set for you ? then CNC may just be the place you have been looking for.

Position Overview:
We are looking for a programming co-op to join our Software Engineering department. Our department builds a large-scale, commercial CAD/CAM application used extensively throughout the manufacturing industry.
 
As a member of our Software Engineering department, you'll use modern techniques to solve complex software development challenges. Our Software Engineering department works in a wide range of areas, including toolpath generation, graphics, user experience development, CAD development, and more.  Depending on your interests and skill set, you could find yourself modernizing some of our legacy code using the latest C++ standard, implementing new user interfaces in C#, WPF and XAML, streamline and optimizing our build and deployment tools, or creating new algorithms to drive CNC machine tools.
 
To succeed in this role, you will need to understand software engineering best practices, including design patterns and the SOLID and DRY principles. You have a drive to constantly improve your software development skills, and will have a passion for clean, well-written code. In addition, you'll be a proactive self-starter who can communicate well with both technical and non-technical coworkers.
 
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Write software to fix defects and add features to complex commercial CAD/CAM software.
Write unit tests to test functionality and improve test coverage.
Improve and modify tools and processes used to build and test our products.
Document code, tools, and processes to ensure consistency and improve reusability of tools and code.
 Minimum Requirements & Qualifications:
1+ years of experience developing software.
A solid understanding of object-oriented development.
Familiar with standard software development practices such as source control, peer reviews, and unit testing.
Ability to work independently, as well as within a team, to support the overall strategy and departmental goals.
Solid organizational skills, attention to detail and the ability to use sound judgement as needed.
Dedicated individual who takes a pro-active approach to learning.
Ability to clearly communicate with both technical and non-technical co-workers.

Founded in 2006 and headquartered in Needham MA, ClearEdge Partners is a fast-growing consulting firm with a great work environment.  Our goal is to ensure that our clients receive the best value on their technology spending and we hire employees who enjoy critical thinking, relish wearing multiple hats and are looking to be involved in work that will develop valuable skills for the future.

Since 2014, our co-ops have played a pivotal role in shaping and growing our organization, and we have been fortunate enough to hire several of them in full-time positions upon graduation.  Past Co-ops have given us this feedback:

-It exceeded my expectations
-Liked the balance of collaborative and independent work
-The environment was really great
-Learned lots of good excel skills as well as time management and how to work in a professional environment

DATA ANALYST CO-OP

The Data Analyst Co-op makes key contributions to the client deliverables of our Analytics team:

-Conduct online research using various search engines to yield information on technology companies and vendor pricing
-Develop in-depth databases to assist with organization and insight retrieval of our rapidly growing knowledgebase
-Participate in client delivery calls and provide insight on supplier trends and findings
-Use Excel and Microsoft office suite to prepare reports and client deliveries
-Assist in ad-hoc projects
-Work in a casual, fun, collaborative, and fast-paced atmosphere
 
Interviews are onsite at our office in Needham Crossing with peers and management in our Analytics group.  Our office is accessible through public transportation and we provide a free shuttle from the station to our employees and Co-ops.

BRIEF JOB DESCRIPTION (essential functions of the job):
 
Under general direction, the Junior Engineering Aide will assist in all areas of the Traffic Signals and ITS Unit, including communication troubleshooting, monitoring traffic flow and making adjustments to traffic signal timing from the traffic management center, identify malfunctioning traffic signals and make repair calls, prepare CAD drawings and respond to requests for engineering services. operation of the Traffic Management Center, collecting traffic data and preparing traffic signal warrant studies, reports, and work orders.  The junior engineering aide will also perform research on transportation issues, and assist with computer simulation of traffic flow, and developing engineering plans for traffic signal installations.
 
MINIMUM ENTRANCE QUALIFICATIONS
Working knowledge of AutoCAD, Microsoft Excel and Word; ability to make mathematical calculations accurately; verbal and written communications skills, ability to understand and follow written and oral instructions. Some knowledge of electrical circuits and computer systems preferred.
 
CERTIFICATE REQUIREMENT:
Possession of a current and valid Massachusetts Motor Vehicle Operator's License required.
 
BOSTON RESIDENCY REQUIRED
 
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER
ALL APPLICANTS MEETING MINIMUM ENTRANCE
REQUIREMENTS WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS VACANCY

Founded in 2006 and headquartered in Needham MA, ClearEdge Partners is a fast-growing consulting firm with a great work environment.  Our goal is to ensure that our clients receive the best value on their technology spending and we hire employees who enjoy critical thinking, relish wearing multiple hats and are looking to be involved in work that will develop valuable skills for the future.

Co-op from January - June 2020

The Company: Cognex Corporation

Cognex is the global leader in the exciting and growing field of machine vision.  With over $800 million of cash in the bank and no debt, we are a financially strong international company with a culture that maintains the fast paced, creative environment of a startup.  Our employees, proudly called "Cognoids," take their work seriously, but don't take themselves seriously.   Our Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast culture recognizes our employees for their innovation, perseverance and hard work in a fun, rewarding, and quirky environment. 

The Role:

Seeking a highly motivated Software Engineer Co-Op to work as a member of the Vision Software software product development team.  This individual will be part of a team to develop application software for the machine vision industry.  You'll be exposed to the latest Microsoft software technologies as well as the latest embedded processor technologies developing under Linux in creating the most advanced software and hardware that only machine vision can solve.   The job involves software development, design, and implementation on a wide variety of platforms.

Essential Functions:
Be part of a core Scrum team of software developers designing the next generation machine vision software and hardware.
Write software in a variety of programming languages including C, C++, or C#.
Learn the Microsoft software development integrated development environment and the embedded integrated software development environments.
Be involved in the analysis and performance of machine vision algorithms and system performance on a wide variety of hardware platforms and processors.
Help develop system level unit tests to exercises sub-systems in a multi-threaded architecture.
Analyze and resolve important critical sub-systems to improve overall system quality and performance of the software.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Experience with a debugger (Microsoft Visual Studio, Eclipse)
Knowledge of a structured programming languages C, C++, or C#
Knowledge of Microsoft .NET technology helpful
Knowledge of Linux tools and the development environment helpful
Some experience with object oriented design and programming useful
Experience with Perl, JavaScript or other scripting toolkits are helpful
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
Highly motivated and eager learner of new technology
Familiarity with the PC-platform architecture and embedded hardware design useful
Proficient as a problem solver, and able to analyze and debug software specific problems

Minimum education and work experience required:
Must be enrolled, and in good standing, in a bachelor's degree program or graduate degree program at a top tier college or university, working toward a degree in computer science, or engineering with a GPA of 3.0/4.0 or better
1-2 years' experience programming in C, C++, or C#
Must have reliable transportation to Natick, MA global headquarters

Massachusetts Attorney General's Office
 
Application Development Co-op
Executive Bureau/Information Technology Division
 
 
Office Overview
Come work for Attorney General Maura Healey and make a difference!  Are you looking for more than just a great learning experience?  At the Attorney General's Office, you will be part of "The People's Law Firm".  Whether working directly with our residents, or supporting our talented and dedicated staff, your work here will contribute to a higher mission of serving the public and making a difference in the lives of others. 
 
The Attorney General's Office is the largest public sector legal office in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Attorney General Maura Healey is the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth. Her office serves as an advocate and resource for the Commonwealth, its residents, and businesses in many areas, including protecting consumers, combating fraud and corruption, protecting civil rights, and promoting meaningful economic stability. The Attorney General's Office is organized into six bureaus. The divisions and teams within each bureau have distinct missions and work closely together to ensure the Attorney General's Office provides the highest level of public protection. We invite you to explore the work of our office at www.mass.gov/ago

 
Work Culture
The Attorney General's Office is a professional, collaborative work environment.  Our dedicated employees work together with a shared commitment to serving the interests of the Commonwealth.  Students have shared these comments about the Office:
"A kind and welcoming atmosphere."
"The positive energy was very infectious, and it made me strive to work harder as well."
"The most professional yet fun office I've yet to work in."
The Office supports and appreciates the diverse perspectives and backgrounds of our employees and strives to provide a welcoming and inclusive workplace environment for all.  We offer a variety of co-op positions, and our co-op students are an integral part of the Office.
 
Position Description
This position supports the overall operations of the Information Technology Division, with a focus on helping with the development and implementation of a new software application system for our users. Provide administrative support for various functions within the division and gain exposure to the inner workings of a busy government office.  Duties may include but are not limited to: 
 
User testing, documentation, scheduling tests;
Synthesizing user feedback and drawing out insights;
Taking meeting notes;
Taking testing notes;
Special projects as needed.
 
This is a great position for someone with an interest in being part of a team performing all aspects of the application development lifecycle and implementation using agile project management.
 
Desired Qualifications
Organized team player who is willing to learn and able to adapt quickly to the complex world of a large public law firm. Able to do assigned tasks in a conscientious way and excel at them. Interested in being an integral part of a large-scale project that has many moving parts and the ability to prioritize tasks accordingly.  Strong interpersonal and organizational skills, attention to detail, and a sincere interest in public service.  Ability to work with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality. We are looking for a tech savvy team player with a can-do attitude and an interest in learning.  Direct IT experience is not required, but a willingness to learn is essential.  
 
Learning and Professional Take-Aways
Students develop professional skills during their co-op experience while building self-confidence.  You can expect to leave this co-op with:
An understanding of how the Business Applications Team supports the chief lawyer and law enforcement officer of the Commonwealth;
Learn how an agile team builds business applications using a secure cloud platform;
Understand how a public agency leverages technology to serve its constituents;
Application development experience, including?
Requirements gathering and analysis;
Design, testing, and implementation;
Training, deployment, support, and enhancements.
 
Location and Amenities
Location and convenience! We are centrally located at One Ashburton Place on Beacon Hill; close to the State House, Boston Common, and Faneuil Hall.  We are easily accessible by public transportation, and accessible to the many cultural and social activities offered in the city.  Enjoy the convenience of Metro Café, a cafeteria offering a wide variety of affordable food options, located on-site at One Ashburton Place.
 
Pay and Work Hours
This position is full-time and pays $14/hour.  This is a non-benefitted position with paid earned sick time.  The expected work hours are 9:00 to 5:00 with a half hour lunch (37.5 hours per week).
 
  
The Attorney General's Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As the representative of the Commonwealth and its residents, the Attorney General's Office strives to ensure that those working in our office reflect the diversity of the communities we serve.  The Office encourages applicants from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to apply for positions.

About MassDOT and HR
In the past two decades, MassDOT/the MBTA has undergone a metamorphosis, moving from data-poor to data-rich, upgrading systems, and becoming a more innovative and cutting-edge organization. The Human Resource department has been a key leader in innovation at MassDOT and the MBTA, challenging the status quo and reimagining the workplace for the several thousand employees that it supports on a daily basis. HR is a critical hub of communication, training, knowledge and resource sharing, and career development across MassDOT's five Divisions--Rail & Transit, The Registry of Motor Vehicles, Highway, Aeronautics, and the MBTA?and its shared service departments. 
As a team member at HR, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the agency at its most fundamental level: its workforce.
Position Summary
The Game Designer will report to the Manager of HR Business Process Improvement and be responsible for the support of new and ongoing process improvement initiatives, through simulation, algorithm, and game design.
The role will be project-based and will include the following products in addition to other design outcomes that may be identified during the first weeks of the internship:
 
-Research and identification of how game play, simulations, and scenario modeling can be applied to process improvement, training, or change management practices in state government and human resources
-Creation of a proposal to create a game, simulation, or scenario modeling application to improve a specific organizational process
-Design, prototyping, and implementation of a game, simulation, or scenario modeling application and final presentation to senior leadership
 
Within the above-mentioned focus, the position affords a great deal of creative freedom ?this is a great opportunity to build your portfolio and showcase your skills in a new environment!
 
The Game Designer will be responsible for exploring human resources functions and organizational process that could benefit from game play or simulation. During the Co Op, the Game Designer will have an opportunity to build and application or experience from the ground up to help us think differently about decision making processes, HR data and information, or the employee experience. This person needs to be self-driven, very detail-oriented, independent, pro-active, organized, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. This person will work collaboratively with researchers, analysts, designers, developers, and leadership across the agency to develop a proposal and product throughout the course of the Co Op.
 
Application instructions:
Please attach a copy of your resume and a cover letter stating your interest in the position and your goals for the internship within the context of working at MassDOT. Please include in either your resume or cover letter a link to your online portfolio or github OR attach work samples.
 
Job Responsibilities
Identify processes, training, and decisions that could benefit from game play or simulation and create proposals for gamification that clearly outline value for stakeholders, as well as data and system needs
Create and document algorithms for decision making and scenario planning
Write and test code or collaborate with developers to prototype algorithms or game experiences
Research and investigate a variety of gaming and simulation methods and communicate relevant options and their trade-offs to stakeholders and leadership
Create, organize, and maintain datasets as needed. Keep ongoing and accurate records of project data. Collaborate across teams to ensure systems for communication and documentation are up to date and accurate at all times.
Participate in observational field work as needed
Document, assess, and design the user experience and create UI/UX strategies
Assist in the development and facilitation of workshops, user testing, focus groups, and other ideation or prototyping sessions to test and refine your ideas with stakeholders and subject matter experts
Participate in team meetings, staff meetings, organization events and other duties as necessary.
A successful candidate will have:
Some experience with a variety of computer languages or the ability to develop applications.
Strong attention to detail and ability to troubleshoot and iterate on details until a challenge is resolved.
Systemic perspective and approach to problem-solving.
Solution-oriented attitude, with excellent time management and organizational skills.
Ability to work effectively in a small and collaborative team environment.
Ability to identify, articulate, and investigate research questions relevant to a project or big-picture topic
Experience and strength in analytical thinking including identification of trends and patterns in qualitative or quantitative data and deduction and reasoning skills.
Exposure to agile and design thinking methodologies a plus.
Experience or interest in HR, organizational design, urban planning, or transportation a plus.
Takeaways
At the end of the 6-month co-op, the Game Designer will have been exposed to a broad variety of projects and programs run by HR and other departments throughout MassDOT. They will have gained experience managing a variety of tasks on a large, multi-faceted project, communicating with diverse groups of stakeholders, and interacting with personnel at many levels of government. They will have had the opportunity to explore the department and the organization, to contribute to a wide variety of efforts, and to transform internal processes. Through this internship, the Game Designer will have exposed the organization to a greater level of gamification, simulation, and scenario-based modelling and the value found therein.
In addition, depending on the person's interests and skills, HR and other staff in the organization will assist in matching the student with appropriate projects and mentors.

General Statement of Duties and Responsibilities:
The Process Improvement Assistant will report to the Manager of HR Business Process Improvement and be responsible for the support of new and ongoing process evaluations and improvement initiatives.

The responsibilities in this position are extremely varied, with many different topics and types of activities/tasks. Therefore, this person needs to be able to manage multiple projects with concurrent timelines and be very detail oriented, independent, pro-active, and organized. It is also critical for this person to be able to communicate effectively both verbally and through written and graphic media (for example, presentations or reports).
 
The Process Improvement Assistant must have the ability to gather, organize, and present information from a variety of sources including interviews, workshops, and observations.
 
Data analysis skills are preferred; this position is a good opportunity to apply and improve data analysis and information management skills.
 
DETAILED STATEMENT OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Gain familiarity with a broad range of projects and programs at HR in various stages of progress; get a thorough understanding of the goals, the activities to be undertaken, project timelines, and the steps needed to move through the project stages.
Gain familiarity with projects and programs across departments, related to or impacting HR initiatives.
Document and analyze procedures and standards and identify areas for improvement
Research and investigate a variety of management and procedural methods and communicate relevant options and their trade-offs to stakeholders.
Develop, communicate, and manage work-flow processes for projects to provide cohesion among HR staff and internal and external partners. Develop guidelines/procedures for tracking progress on each project. Manage the programmatic processes as defined for each project, including program timelines, deliverables and accountability for all participants and staff involved.
Create, organize, and maintain datasets as needed. Keep ongoing and accurate records of project data. Collaborate across teams to ensure systems for communication and documentation are up to date and accurate at all times.
Work with HR staff to design performance metrics to evaluate projects, standard operating procedures, and service level agreements
Assist in the development of workshops, focus groups, and other engagement/ideation sessions related to process reengineering, trainings, and awareness.
Participate in team meetings, staff meetings, organization events and other duties as necessary.
TAKEAWAYS:
At the end of the 6-month co-op, the Process Improvement Assistant will have been exposed to a broad variety of projects and programs run by HR and other departments throughout MBTA and MassDOT. They will have gained experience managing tasks in multiple concurrent projects, institutionalizing project management processes, communicating with diverse groups of stakeholders, and interacting with personnel at many levels of government. They will have had the opportunity to explore the department and the organization, to contribute to a wide variety of efforts, and to transform internal processes.

In addition, depending on the person's interests and skills, HR and other staff in the organization will assist in matching the student with appropriate projects and mentors.

Prior co-ops have come from extremely diverse academic backgrounds majoring in Economics, Operations Research, Performing Arts, Data Science and/or Entrepreneurship; Yet each co-op was internally motivated to grow and learn quickly, present ideas with succinctness and clarity, and worked well with others.

A successful candidate must have either:
Strong knowledge of at least one coding language.
Familiarity with the MEAN web stack, Tableau and some JavaScript base framework like Angular2, Git, SQL or No-SQL, R or Python/Pandas, and Linux/bash is a plus.
Increasing emphasis on Tableau and in particular workflow via Tableau Prep and Tableau Server.
Combine business acumen with technical wherewithal. 
Understanding of business concepts including business process design, supply chain, strategic sourcing, and/or contract negotiations.
Enthusiasm to learn and share new technology, good writing ability, and an analytical approach to problem solving are a must.
Description:
The procurement & logistics data analyst co-op will work alongside the data analytics team under direction from the Data Manager. The co-op will be responsible for assisting management in the collection, analysis, and presentation of data (both via online and in print) that will identify opportunities for improvement and cost savings in procurements and material flow. Additionally, the co-op will assist in process mapping, business procedure updating, and inventory policy development. Additional duties will include assisting staff with research, and all other tasks as deemed appropriate.
 
January-July 2020:
Responsibilities include WebDev for internal use--project codename is PLIT (Procurement & Logistics Internal Tools). Collecting, wrangling, analyzing, interpreting and summarizing data regarding procurement & logistics at the MBTA. Supply Chain and Warehouse knowledge may be timely. You will work on a variety of projects involving research, analysis, and presentation skills; Learn about the interworking of state/federal government and transportation policies. Classes that would help: CS1100, DS 4100, basic WebDev, or something similar. Knowledge of statistics is a plus, as is an understanding of economics/business.

Snippet from two former co-ops:
"Working at the MBTA has been a fantastic introduction into the public sector, and has allowed me to work on problems that have a direct impact on the T. This position has exposed me to data in various forms (records in a database, data frames, spreadsheets, etc.), and has given me a new-found appreciation for the amount of data we encounter daily that is not so apparent. I have done something different almost every week here which has pushed me a little bit outside of my comfort zone, but as a consequence, it has also exposed me to many different types of work that I thought I would never try."
 
"I spent 80% of my time learning to wrangle, present, interpret, and analyze data using both Excel and R, with the opportunity to learn Python. Having come from a non-technical background, I'm very satisfied with how much I was able to learn in the short timeframe. The co-op lead was incredibly helpful and clearly passionate about teaching the co-ops both specific technical skills and broader philosophical questions in data analytics."

Months later, follow-up email update from said co-op:
".... I recently have had some exciting updates to my life, and wanted to keep you in the loop! I started as a Data Quality Specialist at a small utility analytics company...it's similiar to the work I was doing at the MBTA....Just thought I'd let you know since the expereince you exposed me to at the MBTA were ultimately what led me to this job."

Digital Assistant, Archives

Organizational Description:

This position is with the Office of the Massachusetts Secretary of State, Archives Division, located at the Massachusetts Archives. The Massachusetts Archives houses approximately 30,000 cubic feet of records documenting Massachusetts' government from the colonial period forward.  Increasing, our collections are born-digital or are digitized to increase public access to the information. These records require a high level of management and description to ensure their continued accessibility over time.

Job Description:

This is an important, behind the scenes role at the Massachusetts Archives. The Digital Assistant will support the Digital Archives staff with projects related to securing, preserving, managing, and making accessible electronic records at the Archives. The assistant will help with extensive data entry of metadata describing records, and will have the opportunity to work with a variety of archival materials specific to our State's heritage. Examples include oral histories of Massachusetts public figures, genealogical records from Massachusetts families, and records documenting state administration, such as photos and videos from former gubernatorial terms. Over the six-month semester, students will learn about: digital preservation of electronic records in various formats, including audiovisual materials; standard archival practices for describing digital information, methods for providing access to electronic materials, and how to use an archivist's vocabulary, among other things.
 
We are seeking a Co-op who is:
Detail-oriented;
Willing to ask questions and seek clarification when needed;
Familiar with basic office software programs such as Excel and Word;
Willing to learn new and emerging technologies related to digital preservation;
Strong verbal and written communication skills a plus
Working as an intern at the Archives means having opportunities to ask questions and delve into the history stored here. I worked with pretty much every office in the building and got a huge breadth of experiences, from more hands-on activities like doing box intake for the SRC to more detail-heavy work like creating an inventory of 12,000 documents. This position requires a lot of independence, a strong attention to details, and a willingness to learn and adapt quickly. The people you work with are extremely intelligent, kind, and helpful. Between learning how to use multiple database systems, preserving decaying documents, and exploring the vaults, 6 months flew past. I would recommend this position to second-cycle students who are interested in government and history, are particularly keen on the details, and have drive to finish long-term projects.
            -Lauren Renfro, Digital Assistant (Archives) January-July 2017
 
Citizenship Requirements: Citizen/perm. res.

The Massachusetts Archives is located at 220 Morrissey Blvd, Boston
Transportation:.   Via MBTA: Take the Red line to JFK/UMass station. The free shuttle bus (route #2) will bring you to the Archives bldg.
 
Via Car: Take RtI-93 to exit 14 or 15 marked UMass/JFK/Morrissey Blvd.Follow signs to UMass and JFK Library.  Our building is across from the JFK Library and looks like a fort.
 
Hours Worked/Compensation: 37.5; 8:30 am ? 4:30 pm with ½ hour for lunch
Division: Secretary of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts

Job Description:
Invent Yourself. Reshape the World. For more than 350 years, Saint-Gobain has been enhancing the well-being of people everywhere, whether it's by addressing climate change, delivering true sustainable construction, participating in medical breakthroughs, or advancing aerospace technology. Focusing on the intersection of people, innovation, and purpose, Saint-Gobain helps to address the needs of today and the challenges of tomorrow. If this aligns with your passions and your vision of the future, then come join one of our research teams and let's reshape the world together.

As a Co-Op at Saint-Gobain you will be directly involved in R&D projects within one of our material platforms: abrasives, ceramics, construction products, high performance polymers and technical textiles. You will work alongside our world-class researchers contributing to solutions in key development programs.

You will have the opportunity to build a lasting professional network, attend lunch & learn trainings, and interact directly with our company executives. All of this allows you to gain the necessary skills and knowledge to become a future leader in the industry.

REQUIREMENTS:
Currently enrolled as a student in a BS, MS or PhD program in Materials Science, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Polymer Science, Polymer Engineering, Ceramics, Design or Data Science.
Have a creative problem-solving mindset with a hands-on approach
Ability to analyze data and write reports in a clear way
Possess strong interpersonal and organizational skills
Work safely and effectively with a diverse R&D team actively supporting a culture of safety
Previous research/intern experience is a plus.

Position Purpose & Objective / Focus
The Business Analytics Department has enterprise-wide scope, authority, and responsibilities.  The ideal candidate will exhibit strong analytical skill and an eager and ready-to-learn attitude that will serve and supplement our existing team. This individual will be vital in assisting the team with harnessing data to optimize business results.  The co-op will perform analysis of claims, underwriting and financial data and take part in projects that provide intelligence to all business functions.   He/she will help to identify and fix data quality issues. This role provides the opportunity to learn advanced analytics skills, data quality assurance, and project management skills.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Respond to requests for data to assist the Coverys enterprise in its mission to grow the business and improve decision-making through actionable business intelligence.
Collaborate with cross departmental teams to help define metrics, guidelines, and strategies for effective use of algorithms and data.
Work in project management role for projects with members from multiple departments and offices.
Partner with Advance Analyst to identify, design, and build appropriate datasets for complex experiments.
Support the creation of data mining and analytics architectures, coding standards, statistical reporting, data analysis methodologies and statistical techniques
Coordinate data resource requirements between analytics teams and IT teams
Work with Data Visualization Specialist in developing and creating informative visualizations that intuitively display large amounts of data and/or complex relationships.
Assist with the application of quality assurance best practices across the organization.
 
Education, Requirements & Competencies
Must be a current student working towards a degree in a quantitative major with an interest in telling a story with data.  
Must have experience working with large sets of data to draw trends and actionable information from data.
Self-starter who shows solid initiative and ability to work independently with little direction while exercising good judgment and attention to detail
Project management skills or experience is a plus.
Knowledge of analytic methodologies
Must have a sophisticated level of knowledge of MS Office, particularly Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word, as well a variety of graphics and visualization tools/packages.
Proficiency within the following toolsets: Tableau, Altyerx, R, DataRobot, UiPath, SQL, or PowerPivot.
Strong communication skills, both spoken and written
Interest in the insurance industry is a plus.

At Datadog, we're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams.  We operate at high scale trillions of data points per day providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.

We are looking for great students to join us for an internship to help us collect, aggregate, visualize and analyze extremely high-scale metrics, logs, and application data. 

The Opportunity
We're looking for talented developers to join our teams and start making an impact from day one. You'll join one of Datadog's software teams and work alongside other engineers to help solve challenging problems. Whether you are writing a new integration, building data pipelines, or working with the open-source community, our interns are key contributors to our product.

Your Skills and Qualifications
You are in the process of receiving a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline
You have solid experience with a couple of programming languages
You can take complex ideas and distill them into simple, working code
You're curious and want to learn more
You have strong computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, software design, to name a few)
You've coded something real. Include in your application a link to one of your apps, websites, or open-source libraries
Eligibility
We offer 3 internship terms (Winter, Summer, and Fall). Winter and Fall intern applicants must be available for 4 - 6 months.
North American applicants will only be considered for positions in New York/Boston
Bonus Points
You are fluent in Python, Go, Ruby, Java or Javascript
You have some specialized skills, like data visualization or distributed systems engineering
You've used Datadog or have written your own monitoring tools before

Cygnal Therapeutics is pioneering a new field, Exoneural Biology - the neural regulation of cancer, immunity, and regeneration.  Cygnal is developing drugs to manipulate Exoneural Biology for the treatment of cancer, immunological diseases, and regenerative processes. Our science is powered by a comprehensive, cutting-edge neurotechnology platform that lets us explore new frontiers of biology.

Cygnal was founded by Flagship Pioneering in the VentureLabs innovation foundry, and is located in the heart of Cambridge, MA. Our team is comprised of experienced biotech scientists and entrepreneurs passionate about new discoveries and making a difference for patients.

Cygnal Therapeutics is a dynamic start-up biotechnology company. We are seeking exceptional, creative, fearless young scientists to join our team. The co-op students will work closely with our scientists to develop cutting-edge technologies and discover new biological insights at the intersection of immunology, cancer biology, regeneration, and neuroscience.

Qualified candidates should have at least one prior co-op experience in industry or in an academic lab and a strong track record of academic success in a relevant field (biochemistry, biology, neuroscience, chemistry, bio-engineering). The best candidates will also demonstrate initiative, a drive to succeed, and a willingness to tackle unchartered research questions.

Data Ductus is a network consulting firm specializing in advanced service orchestration, cloud infrastructure development, and network automation. We are software engineers with passion to solve technically challenging problems in small, scalable, and agile teams, using a variety of tools and languages.
 
From system design to software development to project delivery, we have expertise in End-to-End (E2E) services in mixed physical and virtualized networks. We build these networks and orchestrate their services in mixed Network Function Virtualization and Software Defined Network (NFV/SDN) environments.
 
As a member of our team, you will work directly on real customer projects writing service code or tests for automating service orchestration, cloud infrastructure development, and network automation based-projects in Java, Python, or Bash on Macs/Linux using the latest automation frameworks such as Camunda, Cisco NSO, Docker, and Ansible.  With the senior members of our team, you will learn best practices for software development using such tools as BitBucket, Jira, Trello, and Jenkins, and you will work with both junior and senior engineers on our local team and virtually with our Data Ductus team members from around the world.   
 
Our Boston Design Center is actually located in Maynard, MA, in the 180 year old mill that has been the home to cutting edge technologies throughout the generations.  While it is not quite Davis, Kendall, or the Seaport, it is bustling with restaurants, bike trails, and coffee shops. 
 
Are you a rising computer science junior or senior who finds yourself more interested in the networking classes than the web design classes or the projects where you built web servers rather than building the web applications themselves? If so, we'd like to talk to you about spending a semester with us working on the cutting edge of networking applications.

Job Purpose:
Cynosure's internship program provides students the opportunity to participate in engineering of laser and RF systems.  The co-op will work closely with software engineers and with cross functional team of engineers and technicians including Mechanical, Electrical and Optical. Specific tasks include: Design, implement, test, collect and analyze data, and document production systems, prototypes, and test fixtures.
 
Duties: 
Contribute to the architecture and implementation of a distributed control system with Windows as the primary user facing platform technology.
Participate in design and code reviews.
Develop and test algorithms, scripts, and procedures in production of new and existing products.
Prepare, execute and evaluate design verification protocols for new or modified products ensuring that the design specifications are met.
Utilize Microsoft Visual Studio and Team Foundation Server (TFS) to create and maintain source code, bug reports and requirements.

Co-op Job Title: Undergraduate Software Engineering Co-op (Front-End or Back-end)
Job Description:
Coordinator Note: Log into myNEU to print a copy of your unofficial academic transcript. 

Please apply using the following link: https://app.jobvite.com/j?aj=oBMMafw3&s=NUCareers_page_(Spring_2020)

We are seeking motivated undergraduate students for a 6-month co-op opportunity (January-June 2020) to work as part of our i-Ready engineering team. Be proud of the impact you will have on over 7 million students across the country building educational software for the fastest-growing company in the EdTech industry and one of Boston Globe's Top Places to Work 2014-2018.
How to apply:
 
Apply using the above link with your resume, transcript, and a doc with a couple sentences about why you like us, and why we would like you! We are unable to consider your application if these items are not provided.
 
Our CO-OP philosophy:
We think that as a co-op, you should have the opportunity to accomplish meaningful work while growing as an engineer. You will be placed on (and become an integral part of) a team comprised of people from many different groups including designers, project managers, etc, and you will also be part of a larger community including your peers of other co-ops & interns. As a CA co-op, you don't work for us, we work with you to make sure you're gaining the experience and skills you want. You'll start off with smaller assignments to understand our tools and processes and ramp-up to more complicated, larger assignments as you learn and apply. You'll be exposed to many different aspects of engineering all the while completing work that moves your team(s) forward.
 
"A successful term at CA will result in co-ops eventually doing the same work as their experienced teammates and learning applicable technical and business skills aligned as much as possible to their personal goals." - Director of Engineering, CA
 
What to expect: 
Develop features that directly benefit our K-12 students and teachers
Ensure code quality through testing (unit, integration, and end-to-end) and reviewing other team members' code
Work closely with team members in product and design
Take ownership of designing and implementing solutions to enhance our product
You would be a good fit if you...
Have experience in any of the tech we use (take a peek below - we don't expect you to know all of it)
Want to make a positive social impact
Have a knack for solving complex problems in efficient and creative ways
Enjoy working on a collaborative team
but you simply must...
Be an undergraduate student with completion of at least one year in an engineering discipline, computer science, or mathematics
Have a 3.2 GPA or higher
Be able to work 40 hours a week for the 6-month duration of the co-op January - June 2020
Some tech we use:
Javascript (ES6)
React/Redux
Java
Spring/Hibernate
SQL
AWS
Git

Perks:
Subsidized onsite lunch
Shuttles from/to Alewife, Allston, Kenmore, Back Bay
Game Room & Gym Facilities on Site
Free Parking on Site
 
About Curriculum Associates: 
Curriculum Associates is a rapidly growing educational technology and publishing company committed to making classrooms better places for teachers and students. Located near Boston, we are an innovative, collaborative, and mission-driven company that has been recognized as a Boston Globe Top Workplace, Boston Business Journal Best Place to Work, and Software & Information Industry Association CODiE award winner. 
 
We believe that-with the right materials and support-all children have the ability to succeed, and this idea inspires our engineering, product development, and service teams every day. Our award-winning products include both traditional published material and EdTech products such as our cloud-based i-Ready®. Our programs provide flexible resources for teachers and administrators, as well as meaningful assessments and data-driven, differentiated instruction for millions of students.

Day Zero Diagnostics is a bacterial genomics startup in Boston that is seeking to recruit a highly motivated data scientist to join our team. At Day Zero Diagnostics we are modernizing the way infectious diseases are diagnosed and treated by developing a rapid diagnostic that sequences the genomes of pathogenic bacteria, and then uses machine learning methods to identify the cause of the clinical infection.

As an Associate Data Scientist, you will work with a senior machine learning research scientist to develop, implement, and optimize state-of-the-art prediction models from bacterial genomics data. 

Candidates will gain experience in a multidisciplinary and fast-paced startup environment, and will have ample opportunities to acquire new skills, work closely with an accomplished team, and communicate results through patents, conference presentations, and peer-reviewed publications while working in a supportive and energetic environment. We value intellectual curiosity and a strong work ethic, and look for candidates who are both excited to contribute their expertise and eager to broaden their skillset to new areas.

Responsibilities
Under the direction of a senior machine learning research scientist, the applicant independently carries out various tasks, including:
Develop and implement algorithms that speed up data processing and machine learning model research.
Build statistical and analytical tools to research and support machine learning models.
Develop, implement, and test machine learning models for predicting phenotypic traits from genomic sequences.
Maintain organized, tested code and corresponding documentation.
Present data within and outside of the company at meetings and symposia.
Write, edit, and submit manuscripts/abstracts/grants detailing the results of the project.
Work closely within the group and with outside collaborators.
Maintain close communications with the team regarding progress.

Requirements
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, or equiv.
Fluency in high performance computing (e.g., parallel computing, memory management, OpenMP, CUDA)
Fluency in Python, Linux; Familiarity with PyTorch, SQL, C/C++, and git
Familiarity with neural network models (CNN, RNN, etc.) and machine learning best practices
Familiarity with NGS data analysis, particularly ONT MinION data, helpful
Highly motivated and independent, with the ability to work in a dynamic team environment
Strong oral and written communications skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

Co-op Job Title: Undergraduate Co-Op, System Integration Team Drive Evaluation
Job Description:
System Integration Team Drive Evaluation, Undergraduate Co-Op
Hopkinton, MA
At Dell Technologies, we are committed to bringing innovation to people everywhere and organizations of all shapes and sizes so they can transform and thrive in the digital economy.
 
As the Systems Integration Co-Op with Dell Technologies, your primary responsibility will be to work on integrating NVMe, SAS, Serial-ATA hard disk drives and Solid State Drives (SSD) into Dell Technologies storage products.  You will assist in automated test design, test emulation, test execution, error analysis and debug, and performance testing in DELL-EMC's Storage/Server Subsystems and products.
We are looking for individuals who are comfortable taking accountability and are able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our rapidly evolving business. The ideal intern is customer focused, results driven, innovative, works well on a team, and acts with integrity.
You will also be responsible for the following:
Plan and complete testing required for pre-qualification, qualification, and regression testing on new disk drive, SSD products and other technologies.
Communicate effectively with personnel and personnel from various drive suppliers.
Design and implement scripts/applications to help with test automation and emulation, error checking, firmware building, and maintaining standardization.
Work with engineering personnel and outside suppliers to debug disk drive/SSD firmware and system related issues found during testing or in the field.
Design and implement new ideas that may be more effective and efficient to the Drive Storage Media Engineering (DSME) Evaluation team test strategy.
What you can learn:
Strong knowledge of NVMe, SAS, Serial-ATA, disk and Solid State drives
Knowledge in Dell Technologies products including VMWare.
Knowledge in Linux/UNIX and Windows based operating systems, performance test methodology and test script development for testing of disk and solid state drives inside Dell Technologies products.
Working on new technological advances and products that will impact the future of Dell Technologies and the global information technology market.
You are our candidate if:
Working toward Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Knowledge of UNIX/NT/2000/XP operating systems preferred.
Knowledge of C, C++, Perl, and/or Python program

Associate Bioinformatician Position

Day Zero Diagnostics is a bacterial genomics startup in Boston that is seeking to recruit a highly motivated bioinformatician to join our team. At Day Zero Diagnostics we are modernizing the way infectious diseases are diagnosed and treated by developing a rapid diagnostic that sequences the genomes of pathogenic bacteria, and then uses machine learning methods to identify the cause of the clinical infection. As a bioinformatician, you will work with a senior computational biologist to implement NGS data pipelines and microbial genomic data analysis tools. These tools will be used both to aid internal R&D projects, and to provide lab-based services for customer-facing projects. Candidates will gain experience in a multidisciplinary and fast-paced startup environment, and will have ample opportunities to acquire new skills, work closely with an accomplished team, and communicate results through patents, conference presentations, and peer-reviewed publications while working in a supportive and energetic environment. We value intellectual curiosity and a strong work ethic, and look for candidates who are both excited to contribute their expertise and eager to broaden their skillset to new areas.

Responsibilities
Under the direction of a senior computational biologist, the applicant independently carries out bioinformatics and software engineering tasks, including:
Implementing analytical tools and reports on hospital outbreaks of bacterial infections
Maintaining pipelines for NGS data, including Illumina and MinION sequencing data
Execute genomic-based lab services for clinical samples
Maintain organized, tested code and corresponding documentation
Present data within and outside of the company at meetings and symposia
Write, edit, and submit manuscripts/abstracts/grants detailing the results of the project
Work closely within the group and with outside collaborators
Maintain close communications with the team regarding progress

Requirements
Bachelor's or Masters Degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or equiv.
Relevant experience in bioinformatics with a strong preference for microbial genomics experience
Fluency in Python, and Linux; familiarity with SQL and git helpful
Familiarity with NGS data and standard bioinformatics tools (alignment, variant calling, assembly)
Familiarity with ONT MinION data helpful Highly motivated and independent, with the ability to work in a dynamic team environment Strong oral and written communications skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

Co-op Job Title: Co-Op Analyst, Digital Product Management - Technology
Job Description:
Co-Op Analyst, Digital Product Management - Technology
 
Digitas is a highly-creative digital marketing agency where brilliant minds come together to bring bold, award-winning ideas to life.
 
Paving the way for these amazing projects is our Technology capability, dedicated to transforming the digital marketing landscape. The Technology capability collaborates with other capabilities within Digitas such as Strategy, Creative, Data Science and Media, as well as client business and technology representatives, to bring cutting edge digital products and campaigns to life. We also have strategic partnerships with many of the world's leading marketing and advertising technology vendors that helps us leverage the best platforms and tools for our clients.
 
What you'll do:  
 
The Digital Product Manager role provides requirement gathering and specification documentation, as well as technology strategy services (e.g. technology assessments and vendor evaluations) to support complex digital projects being defined, designed and developed by Digitas. These projects range from marketing communication (websites, ad campaigns, email marketing, etc?) to data engineering to emerging technology. Client digital tasks are increasing in scope and complexity and the need for effective tech leadership and digital product management skills has never been greater to deliver on those needs.
 
As a Co-Op Analyst on our Digital Product Management team, you will assist in managing a product roadmap for a set of features from inception through implementation. You will document requirements, help establish key performance metrics, and assist in driving execution on a range of digital projects within our client portfolio. You'll collaborate with our internal teams on the design, development and testing of world-class digital initiatives.
 
This Co-Op opportunity with our Technology team in Boston is a 26 week assignment, starting January 2020.
 
What we're looking for:
 
If you describe yourself as someone who:
Has a natural curiosity for technology and is always learning
Is innovative and has a detail-oriented approach to problem-solving
Is intrigued with how brands use technology to engage with consumers
Is fascinated by creativity and "what if?" thinking
Is not afraid to ask questions and offer suggestions
Then your day to day could look like this:
Partnering with creative teams to identify digital solutions to business problems
Developing user stories and epics to describe how a technology solution would function
Proactively identifying and resolving technical issues
Partnering with Technical Leads and Quality Assurance to ensure high quality and timely development and delivery
This is the foundation which can lead to opportunities focused in:
Enterprise Platforms: Content management, commerce and CRM solutions for global companies
Product Management, Quality Assurance & Technical Project Leadership
Experiential Technology: augmented reality, bots, IoT and more
Data Engineering: machine learning, AI, big data
Endless coaching, mentoring and training opportunities in a collaborative environment
Got what it takes? We'd love to hear from you.
 

Our Boston office ? Where you'll work!
 
The Boston office is located Downtown - walking distance from all commuting options (train, subway, boat, even airplanes!). We have free snacks, (healthy and not so healthy J) an onsite café with barista, a smoothie bar and bagel Fridays! The office is modern and open with lots of natural light and plenty of communal working areas to foster community and collaboration. If you're a multitasker, walking desks are available if you'd like to get your steps in while working on projects for some of the biggest brands in the world!  We have outdoor space featuring views of Boston Harbor, (Great for Instagram!) and our neighborhood has many convenient lunchtime and after work options.
 
Diversity & Inclusion at Digitas
 
At Digitas, we believe diversity of all kinds and inclusion at all opportunities are integral to our success. Hiring, retaining and developing diverse talent and inclusive minded individuals, all while developing and nurturing an inclusive culture is our focus and a strategic priority. By investing in these efforts and our talent, we believe we will drive deeper client relationships and ultimately more innovative work.
 
Through our many Business Resource Groups (BRGs), Digitas strives to establish an open space for employees of diverse backgrounds and experiences. We work to inspire, include, and project the voices and experiences of our employees. We hope to cultivate a culture of open dialogue and maintain a lasting conversation of ideas, opinions, and issues as it pertains to diversity that therein affect our workplace.
 
About Digitas
 
Digitas is The Connected Marketing Agency, committed to helping brands better connect with people through Truth. Connection. Wonder. With diverse expertise in data, strategy, creative, media, and tech, we work across capabilities and continents to make better connections and achieve ambitious outcomes through ideas that excite, provoke and inspire. Curious and fully transparent, we are always examining real human behavior to create authentic connections?between brands and consumers, clients and partners, and ideas and outcomes. Digitas has 3,500 employees across 21 countries and 34 offices, with an extended network via Publicis Media of over 23,500 employees present in more than 100 countries worldwide. To connect with Digitas or learn more, visit www.digitas.com

Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory Intern
Do you thrive in times of disruption? Have a passion for turning challenges and opportunities into long-term competitive advantages?  As a Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory intern, you'll have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience working alongside leading professionals across diverse industries while building your professional skills in a variety of project experiences.  Our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice helps organizations effectively navigate business risks and opportunities?from strategic, reputation, and financial risks to operational, cyber, and regulatory risks?to gain competitive advantage. We apply our experience in ongoing business operations and corporate lifecycle events to help clients become stronger and more resilient. Our market-leading team's help clients embrace complexity to accelerate performance, disrupt through innovation, and lead in their industries.
 
Work you'll do
As an intern, you will have the opportunity to work on multiple projects leveraging your business or technology related degree to help our clients more confidently make decisions to drive performance.  You will help our clients embrace change, grow their business, accelerate performance, and navigate periods of crisis or controversy and emerge resilient. 
 
The type of work you focus on will be influenced by your office placement and business needs.  Your recruiter will be able to provide more information about our offices.  Projects may be aligned to the following areas and include:
 
Internal Audit & Assurance:  Helping clients advance transparency, relevance, and the quality of information disclosed to the markets and investors so that they can meet regulatory and attestation requirements.  Inspecting accounting systems and controls for improvement opportunities, leveraging our methodologies to help clients improve their information technology controls or technology risk management programs, and/or participate in the development or execution of internal audit strategic plans

Regulatory & Operational Risk:  Supporting clients with their most pressing regulatory and operational challenges.  Helping them to identify, remediate, monitor, exploit, and manage enterprise risks and create value through implementing a compliant, resilient enterprise

Forensic:  Assisting with compiling, analyzing, and documenting facts for matters under investigation or in litigation and helping clients manage and respond to internal and external investigations, regulatory concerns, litigation, and other business controversy

Risk Intelligence:  Helping clients to embrace their most strategic risks, providing a platform of advisory services that enable senior executives to plan for, spot, assess, manage, and respond to brand and reputational, financial, catastrophic risks and unforeseen threats that could undermine their competitive position and jeopardize their critical assets, reputation or financial standing
 
Regardless of project type, your work will require: 
Proficiency in verbal and written communication skills essential to interacting with clients and teams
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects/assignments/responsibilities in a fast-paced environment
Problem solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to quickly and concisely research and collect data from unique places
Ability to synthesize data and convey information in a meaningful way

The team
Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory helps organizations navigate a variety of risks to lead in the marketplace and disrupt through innovation. The insights of our professionals, combined with our specialized products and services, help clients learn how to embrace complexity and leverage their position of strength to accelerate performance.

Learn more about our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice at Deloitte.
 
Qualifications
Required:
Undergraduate or Master's degrees in the following majors will be considered: 
       o Accounting or related degree.  A concentration in management information systems, business analytics or other business technology related areas is a plus
       o Technology related degree such as Management Information Systems, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Data Analytics, Engineering, Information Science/Management and Math
       o Other majors will be considered with a concentration in accounting or a related area
A strong understanding of Windows-based applications including proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Travel (domestic and possibly international) up to 75% may be required, depending on role and location 
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
 
Preferred:
Strong academic track record (minimum GPA of 3.2)
CPA exam eligibility for Accounting majors 
Relevant work experience or work experience in a professional environment (e.g., internships, summer positions, school jobs)
How you'll grow
Through your variety of experiences at Deloitte, you will have the opportunity to develop the analytical, communication, and leadership skills that can help you achieve your full potential, no matter what career path you eventually choose. Working with client service teams on real business problems, our internship program is designed to help you develop the technical skills as well as critical professional behaviors, standards, and mindsets to make the most of your internship. You'll work with Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory professionals, gain first-hand exposure to the day-to-day responsibilities and challenges and develop insights while working on client engagements. Along the way, you will have access to mentoring, counseling, and training opportunities to help foster and accelerate your development of new skills and capabilities.  Interns will be invited to participate in a Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory Internship Conference hosted during the summer at Deloitte University. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.
  
Deloitte's culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives.  Learn more about Life at Deloitte.
 
Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.  We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.  Learn more about Deloitte's impact on the world.
 
Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you're applying to. We also suggest that you brush up on your interviewing skills and practice discussing your experience and job history with a family member, friend, or mentor. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

How to Apply
1. When applying through NUcareers, you will need to submit your resume and unofficial transcripts. Please submit your resume and unofficial transcripts on both the campus career center as well as on the Deloitte career site. You may use the following naming convention when naming your documents First, Last, type of document, date (e.g. John Doe Resume_09_15_15).
2. Deloitte website: In addition to applying through NUcareers, you are also required to apply through the Deloitte website for legal purposes. Below are the steps to apply for this position: Go to https://jobs2.deloitte.com 
Enter the keyword "S20BOCEI21JANKD-RFA" to search for the job posting. 
Complete profile.
Once you've completed your candidate profile on our website you will be prompted to complete an online application several days after. Please complete that upon receipt as well.
3. Deloitte Feedback Form: Lastly, please complete the following to submit your Location and Function preference: https://deloittesurvey.deloitte.com/Community/se/3FC11B2620D27152
