E Ink offers candidates unique opportunities to shape the future.  E Ink technology has enabled the creation of a new $10+ billion ebook market in less than 10 years.  Our technology is being adopted in many new applications that would surprise even a loyal follower.  Today you can find E Ink enabled products in applications such as electronic shelf labels in stores, smartphones, wearable devices and digital signage, to name a few.  E Ink's unique technology is currently being adopted in such novel applications as luggage tags for travel, smartcards for financial institutions, architectural design and even smart packaging for pharmaceuticals.  In many instances E Ink is enabling products that would not be possible otherwise.  Our customers are leading innovators themselves, often developing new products for completely new applications.   Customers include Amazon, Sony, Rimowa, Displaydata, Abbott Diabetes Care, Global Display Systems and the Palladio Group.
E Ink has a rich history.  Starting as a spinoff from the MIT Media Lab, it has become the leading innovator and manufacturer of electronic paper displays (EPD) and technologies in the world.  It has business and R&D offices in Massachusetts, California and Hsinchu, Taiwan.  E Ink team members around the world take pride not only in what has been accomplished but in the potential of what is possible in the future.  This is a unique opportunity to join a team of the brightest minds in the business and shape that future.

JOB SUMMARY
 
We are looking to bring on 2 Software Engineering Co-ops starting in January 2020.  This will be a full-time position (40 hours per week) reporting in to our brand new corporate headquarters in Marlborough, MA. Some reasons to be excited for our new location include state-of-the-art fitness center with six individual showers/dressing stations, free parking, subsidized cafeteria, coffee stations, team social outings and it's conveniently located right off 495!
 
The expectations of Doble Co-ops are simply to learn, grow, and have fun in many areas of Engineering coupled to delivering the next generation of software products that are helping to transform the utility industry, its business practices, and overall efficiency.
 
Specifically, Doble Co-ops will have the opportunity to be a part of teams that help shape how software products are defined, designed, implemented, qualified, and delivered. Doble is committed to working with its Co-ops to find the right fit for their skill set as well as personal aspirations.
 
The duration of this position will be approximately 6 months, January to July 2020, full-time (40 hours per week) Monday-Friday.
 
**PLEASE NOTE: We will be moved in to our brand new corporate headquarters in Marlborough, MA. There is no public transportation local to this office, so it is required that qualified candidates are able to make travel arrangements to get to/from work.
 
 
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
 
The essential qualities of what will make a Doble Co-Op successful are their desire to grow, aptitude to learn, and ability to apply.
This Co-op will be joining our Software Embedded team and working alongside our Engineers. We are seeking a Co-op with an interest in Computer and Electrical Engineering.
Students with an interest in other areas, such as Data Science, DevOps, and Software Test Automation may have the opportunity to explore and be a part of those areas as well.
The Co-ops develop in an Agile environment; we have 3 week sprints and demos so you get feedback on your contributions.
Get the opportunity to work alongside other Embedded engineers but also collaborate with Hardware and FPGA developers. 
Co-ops will leverage their Linux skills to grow embedded debugging skills and learn how to program and test real time environments.
You will be developing engineering test and validation using tools such as Jenkins.
Applicable Skill Sets:
Course work in embedded systems, computer architecture or electrical theory.
Familiarity with C, C++
Python or other scripting experience
Development for the Linux Operating system
Lab or working experience with embedded system and processors.
Knowledge of FPGA, CPLD or DSP implementations is desirable.
 
QUALIFICATIONS
EDUCATION: Must be pursuing a degree(s) in Computer Engineering and/or Electrical Engineering.
 
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:
Motivated self-starter with an aptitude for learning new skills and environments quickly while multi-tasking
Ability to spot problematic areas, analyze solutions, propose resolutions and direct their implementation is essential
Candidates should have a technical background
Strong written and oral communication skills
Proven ability to work independently as well as within a team environment
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
While performing the duties of this job the employee is often required to stand, sit, use computers, read, write, type, use fax machines, use copy machines, file paperwork, use telephones, and utilize written and oral communication to interact with clients, co-workers and customers. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions of this job. Must be capable of lifting 30 pounds.

Come build the future of conversations & commerce

At Drift, we create conversations that make our customers successful. We want engineers who are ready to tackle some of the most meaningful problems in the industry?from building adaptive AI for bot-supported conversations, to designing next generation chat experiences, to bridging the gap between old and new ways to buy. We want you to join us as we change the global buying experience. 

Our interns/co-ops are full-time engineers. They have full deploy access and push code into production from day one. Everyone gets to work on tough technical challenges, like building an automation routing audit log, building 2-way data integrations, or making easy-to-understand error messages for our Sales and calendaring tools!

You will:
Steer the success of our product in our broad culture of autonomy. You have the authority and responsibility to make things happen!
Become fluent in a wide range of systems, processes and technologies. Your team will own problems from end-to-end.
Create new relationships across the organization in sales, customer success, marketing
Uphold our Drift Leadership Principles and be the teammate you want to work with.
You may be fit for this role if you:
Enjoy working on the frontend, backend, or anywhere it takes to solve problems and delight customers
Have some programming experience (either in class, in your personal time, or at a job). We work mostly in JavaScript/React and Java. However, languages can be learned: we care much more about your general engineering skill than knowledge of a particular language or framework
Take pride in creating results quickly by breaking projects down. We execute on small pieces to generate visible results
Enjoy working with a diverse group of people with different expertise
Can put yourself in the shoes of our customers to unite design & code and craft fantastic experiences
Uphold quality standards in engineering, security, and design
You might work on:
Creating Infrastructure that processes billions of messages a minute to extract buyer intent and priority for conversations
Developing complex machine learning models to help website visitors get connected with the right person as fast as possible
Building tools to trace and visualize any message ever sent so customers can zero in on giving the best buying experience
Turn our customer success team and salespeople into data superheroes with data ops automation and slack commands
Who you'll work with:
Whether you're an intern or a principal, you will get to work on hard problems together. We want you to bring out your unique experience and specialities!
Tommy Hu, Tech Lead, joined June 2017. Tommy leads the Drift Assistant team, and has done a ton of work in the Drift widget and sales tools extension.
Carolina Lopez-Treviño, Tech Lead, joined August 2017. Carolina built several email features, and is a champion for the email infrastructure.
Maggie Crowley, Director, Product Management, joined Dec. 2017. Maggie & her team own our bot features and built the interaction flow we use today. 
 
What's it like to work at Drift?
We help companies build better pipeline faster by connecting them now with the people who want to buy now. Drift is changing the way businesses buy from businesses by building software tools that make conversational commerce accessible to anyone. We want the world to revolve around the customer, and we lead by example. 

Drift hires people who want to make a difference in the lives of others. In product, we have engineers, PMs, and designers with broad sets of skills (from a variety of backgrounds) who are ready to tackle some of the most meaningful problems in the industry?from building adaptive AI for bot-supported conversations, to designing next generation chat experiences, to bridging the gap between old and new ways to buy?through this work, we're changing the global buying experience.

We look at Drift as a constantly-adapting learning experience; for all of us, we believe we're at the forefront of an enormous opportunity. We support one other in our curiosity and creation?which we pursue through small, frequent releases to see what works for our customers. We are enormously reflective as a team and knowledge-sharing across disciplines powers our day-to-day work.
Product teams at Drift are small by design. We want you to feel like you're part of a successful garage band. These teams are supported by centralized groups that build tooling and train on topics like UX, security, compliance, and leadership so we can get better as we grow larger. 

We want to work in a company of positive, hardworking people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well. The kind of people who are committed to going out of their way to succeed in their work, and to help other Drifters improve over the long term (by helping them get better at what they do).

We celebrate wins as a company. Whether it's sales bonuses, trips for team MVPs, or the most "high-fives", we celebrate one another as much as possible. We also have a culture of transparency that we carry on with extraordinary alignment, executive reports, and automated stats for everyone.

In both our products and our people, we aim to share the pains and successes of our customers. We are building a company that is abnormally successful. To do that, we need to both embrace tradition, and seek success that goes far beyond "the way we've always done things".

Founded in 1997 based on research started at the MIT Media Lab, E Ink Corporation is the leading supplier of electronic paper display (EPD) technologies.  Products made with E Ink's revolutionary electronic ink possess a paper-like high contrast appearance, ultra-low power consumption and a thin, light form.  E Ink's technology is ideal for many consumer and industrial applications spanning handheld devices, watches, clocks and public information and promotional signs.  Future technology developments will enable many new applications through ultra-thin, lightweight, rugged, flexible, full color displays.

E Ink has commercialized many different forms of "Electronic Paper" solutions over the past ten years. Most recently, Sony, Lexar, Motorola and others have all won prestigious awards for their use of E Ink's technology in their devices. Customers value E Ink's technology for its brightness, high contrast, and low power - attributes that are similar to that of paper. E Ink is currently mass manufacturing high-resolution displays for several electronic books, including the Amazon Kindle & Sony Reader, as well as for signage, watches and other portable devices. For more information about E Ink, please visit our web site at www.eink.com

Elektrofi, Inc. is seeking an Associate Process Engineer to support the Process Development Team
 
Company
Elektrofi is a growing biotechnology company developing a platform formulation technology. Elektrofi's mission is to redefine the standard of delivery for life-saving biotherapeutics to improve the patient experience. The company was founded by an interdisciplinary MIT-based team and is headquartered in Boston, MA.
 
Position summary
Elektrofi is looking for an Associate Process Engineer to support the development of processes and equipment for the production of biologically active microparticles.  This individual will join an early-stage, multidisciplinary team of scientists and engineers and contribute to a variety of process development activities in a highly collaborative environment.
 
Day to day activities and opportunities
Planning, execution, and documentation of process development experiments, with a focus on the production and physiochemical characterization of microparticle formulations
Analysis and presentation of process and product characterization data, including drafting of memos and reports
Testing and troubleshooting of novel process equipment
Development and maintenance of equipment operating procedures
 
Key qualifications
Strong candidates should possess:
B.S. in Mechanical, Chemical, Biomedical, Materials, or Pharmaceutical Engineering, or a related engineering discipline
Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A desire to gain hands on laboratory experience with instruments and techniques for physicochemical analysis of biologic drug products
A detail-oriented approach to experimentation
The ability to work independently and efficiently in a fast-paced R&D environment
Additional relevant skills and attributes include:
Familiarity with computer programming languages and standard office software (MS Office)
Working knowledge of basic methods of data analysis
Good attention to detail and the ability to thoroughly document experimental work
 
This is an entry-level position; exceptional candidates will have demonstrated the above qualifications through their academic achievements and relevant internships, volunteer work, or personal projects.
 
Responsibilities
The successful candidate(s) will:
Apply engineering principles and problem-solving skills to plan, execute, and analyze mission-critical process development experiments
Effectively document and communicate ideas and results within an interdisciplinary team

Who We Are
Ellevation is a growth-stage education software company that is changing how educators work with English Language Learners, the fastest-growing student demographic in the country. We build web-based tools for educators to help enhance instruction, improve collaboration, and increase productivity. We partner with public school districts all across the country. In the past 12 months, we have more than doubled the size of our team and quadrupled the number of districts that we serve. We are well-capitalized, have an awesome and growing team, and are looking to add passionate, smart, fun and entrepreneurial folks to who are interested in building a high-impact company. This is where you come in?

Position Description 
We are looking for a Software Engineer to join Ellevation's core technology team for the spring/summer as a Co-op. They will play a key role in helping to build dynamic web applications and services, implement complex data and API integrations, and be part of the conception-to-design-to-implementation product development process.

As a member of our small engineering team, you will contribute to our software development ecosystem. Just as importantly, we are looking for someone who wants to be in a startup, has tremendous communication skills, and is a motivated self-starter.

We value best-practice software engineering principles such as continuous integration, loose coupling, and SOA. As a small technology group, we seek individuals who are willing to be cross-functional and hands-on in multiple areas. You will be testing, releasing and supporting the code that you design and develop. This is a tremendous opportunity to help build the engineering foundation of the company.

Desired Skills & Experience
The ideal candidate has an understanding of core software development principles and the right attitude and interest to learn more. Candidates who have the following background and experience are encouraged to apply:

Technical skills:
Strong design & implementation skills.
Design patterns, OO concepts and applications, refactoring and Software as a Service (SaaS) development
Experience with relational databases

Bonus points for experience or expertise in any of the following areas:
Web application development using CSS, HTML and JavaScript frameworks such as jQuery or Aurelia.
Scripting languages such as Python or PowerShell
Microsoft & .NET tech stack -- C#, ASP.NET MVC, SQL Server

Other skills:
Comfortable getting in front of a whiteboard and discussing both high level architecture and as well as coding/algorithms.
Good analytical problem solver and a team player.
Eager to learn, willing to ask questions and learn "on the job."

Qualifications and Requirements:
BS in Computer Science or equivalent degree upon graduation.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
Commitment to the mission; desire to focus talents on helping improve outcomes for others.

Job Title: Embedded Systems Co-op, Product Development
Company name: EMPHYSYS, Inc.
Website: www.emphysys.com

Company Description:
EMPHYSYS is a small, multidisciplinary engineering firm located in Woburn, MA. We recruit highly talented engineers and scientists to develop the next generation of technologies and products across several industries including medical device, semiconductor, and industrial equipment. Our customers range from large, well-established companies to small start-ups who come to EMPHYSYS for rapid product development and innovative problem solving. At EMPHYSYS you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, and hands-on environment and gain exposure to an array of engineering technologies and challenges. The ?big company red tape? has been removed and you will be able to quickly design, build, and test your ideas and solutions with the guidance and support of a world-class engineering organization. Emphysys places high consideration on co-op experience when full time positions develop.   

The team is small (~25) and we all wear many hats and stay flexible. On any day you could find yourself developing a new embedded control system in C, conceptualizing new control architectures on a whiteboard, reviewing a new electrical schematic, testing and troubleshooting a newly built system, building a lab test setup for a prototype, or packing up a new product for shipping. Examples of current and past projects at EMPHYSYS include several advanced plasma sources and plasma power systems, electrosurgical devices and power supplies, RF power and control systems, large motion-control systems, high-vacuum products, critical liquid/gas delivery systems, active magnetic bearing control systems, and many more.

Job Description:
Under the guidance of world-class embedded systems engineers, and as part of a wider team, contribute to the development of new technologies and products. Tasks include:
Create embedded code for medical, semiconductor, and industrial systems.
Develop new systems in collaboration with mechanical and electrical engineers.
Troubleshoot electro-mechanical systems which rely on embedded control systems. Change
code and code parameters to achieve desired system performance.
Read, assess, and understand existing embedded codebase written in C/C++ and adapt to
changing system needs as necessary.
Operate and test complex electro-mechanical systems, understand control methods, interaction
of embedded control and hardware.
Assist in electrical system bring-up and debug with code support and control insight. Apply engineering curriculum subject matter as appropriate to solve problems.

Experience and interest in some or all of the following is desired:
Primary:
Real time embedded control systems in C/C++
Digital signal processing for signal conditioning/filtering including frequency domain analysis
Device drivers/register level device programming
Logic design in VHDL or Verilog
Able to read and understand hardware schematics and datasheets both digital and analog
Familiarity with one or more embedded design tools (examples: Keil, IAR, Eclipse)
Secondary:
Serial interface communication
Embedded Linux applications
Linux networking
Linux device drivers
RTOS (real time operating system) knowledge a plus

Tertiary:
Windows GUI applications and networking
Also required:
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to provide thorough attention to detail

Location:
EMPHYSYS is located in Woburn, MA.
 
Accessibility: Car Recommended but Accessible by Public Transportation - 10 minute walk (sidewalks) from the Mishawum stop on the Lowell line of the Commuter Rail. Carpooling with Arcam or Fikst may be a possibility.

EMD Serono's Bioinformatics group is looking for a Spring 2020 Coop student to work on several target discovery and biomarker development projects within the Immunology and Immuno-Oncology therapeutic areas.  The specific project plan will be developed with the student and our collaborators at the beginning of the co-op period.  Past projects have focused on large datasets of sorted-cell RNASeq from Lupus patients, single-cell RNASeq, text-mining, miRNA expression analysis and analysis of immuno-therapy effects on tumor models.
The student will be responsible for computational work and for summarizing and presenting their results in the biological/disease context to the team.  Computational work might include writing code to process or transform datasets, running analysis programs or pipelines (for example, processing raw sequencing data, network and pathway analyses of gene expression or proteomics data, etc), benchmarking new published algorithms and packages, designing novel analysis pipelines, etc. The student will learn how to address specific biological questions using different computational and statistical techniques as well as a gain better understanding of drug development for auto-immune diseases and immuno-oncology. The student will also be able to participate in group and departmental meetings and seminars to learn about computational work at a pharmaceutical company and about all stages of drug development.
An ideal candidate for this co-op opening would have a computer science, bioinformatics, or bioengineering background. The student should be familiar with R and ideally at least one other programming language (Python, Perl, Java). Experience working in a Linux environment and with a version control system (eg, Git or Subversion) would be a major advantage. Understanding of molecular biology and previous participation in research projects are highly desirable. Specific projects will depend on the current work in our group; we'll discuss the list of possibilities during the first week of the co-op period and jointly decide (student + supervisor) on a plan.

Location: Malaysia

Students interested in applying to COE global positions must set up an appointment through myNEU with Sally Conant (s.conant@northeastern.edu) or Sarah Daum (s.daum@northeastern.edu). Once you have met, your resume will be sent to global employers.

Stipend:  Energy Action Partners will purchase 1 round trip air ticket and provide housing (a value of about $7,000 USD over a 6 month period).
Types of Accommodations: Room in shared house
Distance from housing to job site: Co-located

On-Site Supervisor:          Ayu Abdullah
Co-op Location:                50 Jalan Aminuddin Baki,
                                         60000 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Design off-grid energy system.
The Game is played as a multi-user, networked, cooperative, simulation game deployed on tablets in field-based planning workshops with rural communities.
We are seeking a Software Engineer/ Developer with front-end, back-end or full-stack development experience who will collaborate with other team members to contribute to and support the ongoing development of new features and enhancements to the software.
The Game is deployed as a web application with a Python and MySQL back-end and AngularJS front-end.
The student will have daily, direct supervision from a program director regarding software requirements, but the student must have the programming experience to implement the requirements independently.
This is not a job to learn programming, but one to put your skills into practice for a fulfilling and rewarding application.
Additional Housing Information
 Energy Action Partners rents a single story residential building, which hosts their offices, meeting rooms, and two single rooms for staff. The office is located in a single story house of a residential neighborhood, with a single room available. This is a common set up for non-profits in KL. The Co-op will have their own room (with a locked door) located in the building, and access to a shared full bathroom, kitchen, and dining area.

Basic understanding of front-end technologies and platforms such as JavaScript (i.e. Angular 2, Node.js), HTML5, CSS3.
Proficient knowledge of back-end programming language, Python.

Exposure to web development framework MVC model (i.e. Tornado or Django).
Skills Gained
Enhance web application development skills with a practical application
Project management and coordination of development cycle among multiple developers
Exposure to challenges in the energy sector, particularly on extending electricity access using renewable energy minigrids
Using games as design and educational tools for complex socio-technical systems

Our priority is on developing tools and projects that have a strong social impact. Our emphasis on community development, social inclusion, and sustainability pervades all that we do. We are a small and dedicated staff working in a friendly environment that is not overly formal (e.g., causal dress). Work may require travel to remote villages for field-based works where all staff are expected to show respect and also be willing smile and accept when amenities are different from their typical experience. Staff are expected to work regular office hours (typically 9am-5p with some flexibility).

Learn to train and retrain systems using video data.
 
Requirements
Experience in NLP/ML or in developing natural language, machine vision, transfer learning, data labeling and classification, regression, information retrieval, and statistical modeling.
Familiarity with NLP/ML tools and packages like Tensorflow, Caffe, pyTorch, Weka, scikit-learn, and nltk.
Knowledge of SQL, Hadoop, Hive, Redshift, Spark or other big data tools is a plus.
Coding and software engineering skills in a mainstream programming language, such as Java, C#, C++, and Python.
Interest in prototyping ideas and solutions, performing critical analysis, and using creative approaches for solving complex problems.
 
Benefits
Our office environment is open, collaborative, fast-paced and high energy. Examity's urban office location provides access to local shopping and restaurants. Employees enjoy Examity's free snacks and drinks, one "work from home" day per week, and frequent group outings to sporting events and summer concerts.
 
Examity is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

In 2007, two software engineers and serial entrepreneurs founded ezCater. Today, ezCater is the only nationwide online marketplace for business catering in the United States a $23.9 billion market. Our 3.6M+ on-time ratings and reviews, our 60K+ caterers and restaurants, and our 5-star customer service make it superbly easy for business people to find and order great food for their meetings and events. We're backed by Insight Venture Partners, Iconiq Capital, and Wellington Management, were on a path to $2B in 2020, and well get there - even more surely if you come help us.

We're looking for highly skilled engineers-in-training to help execute our technology goals while riding this rocket ship of growth. At ezCater, technology is valued as a differentiator and also as a key component of our success.  We push ourselves every day to better the codebase, improve performance, and deliver an amazing customer experience. Check out this CBS Boston article for a glimpse into our culture.

What you'll do:
- Build industry leading web applications using Ruby on Rails, React, and GraphQL
- Improve performance at every chance you get (we believe speed itself is a feature)
- Help us delight customers with elegant features, written with high quality code

You have:
- Completed credits towards a Computer Science or equivalent degree
- A working knowledge of web application architecture and related technologies
- A strong appetite for learning (new frameworks, new languages, etc.)
- A disposition that is friendly, flexible, and pragmatic

What you'll get from us:
Importantly, you'll get sane working hours and a huge amount of flexibility around work/life balance. Have people in your life - of any age - who always, often, or sometimes need your help? We make room for that. Have a bad thing or a good thing happen to you? We make room for that, too.

Oh, and here's what else you'll get: a tremendous amount of responsibility and autonomy, wicked awesome co-workers, cupcakes (and many more goodies), and knowing that you helped get this rocket ship to the moon.

ezCater is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace humans of every background, appearance, race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, and disability status.  At the same time, we do not employ jerks, even brilliant ones.

Software Co-op Job Summary
Festo is currently seeking enthusiastic Computer Science / Computer Engineering majors who can start work in January 2020. The interns will provide support to design, engineering, prototyping and validation activities for all hardware product lines.
 
Duties and Responsibilities
Ability to work in team-based environment.
Self-motivating.
Knowledge of algorithms and data structures
Flexibility and comfort working in a quickly changing environment.
Integration with German colleagues to accomplish goals.
Proficiency in Visual Studio C#, and preferred text editor for C/C++ to accomplish goals.
Experience in Design of Experiment (DoE) to perfect development testing systems.
Designing and building User Interfaces, back-end (C#) and firmware software (C/C++)
Familiarity with source control systems for example SVN/Git
Finding and interfacing with 3rd party API's to add functionality to system
Supporting advanced R&D initiatives & prototyping efforts with team members of other disciplines.

Identifying emerging technologies to help define development opportunities.
Researching AI concepts to improve systems
Anticipating and correcting issues that may impact mass-production (DFx).
Supporting positive team interactions to accomplish program objectives.
Contributing to schedule & milestone commitments.
Providing cross-functional program integration support.
Familiarity with computer interface protocols for example Serial (RS232/RS485), I2C and SPI, and USB as well as Ethernet communications protocols such as TCP/IP, Modbus and HTTP to communicate between PC's/mobile devices and embedded systems
 
Requirements and Qualifications
Enrolled in Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or related field.
0-3 years of experience, consumer product development.
Strong analytical/problem solving skills and ability to use statistical tools and techniques
Solid object-oriented programming and design skills
Experience developing thread based design, development, and debug

The Fidelity Enterprise Services Advanced Technology for Investment Management Team contributes to the vitality and growth of the organization by transforming breakthrough technologies into practical capabilities for Fidelity's internal and external investment clients. The Team promotes companywide collaboration while delivering new Artificial Intelligence enabled portfolio level perspectives to investment managers and client service colleagues.
 
 
The Expertise We're Looking For
Undergraduate and graduate degrees in computer science or related field
Solid programming fundamentals, knowledge for computing algorithms, data structure and design patterns
Solid RDBMS concepts. Exposure to course works on subjects like distributed systems, file systems, data, NoSQL and SQL processing
Experience using latest web-based technologies - jQuery, HTML and CSS and exposure to one or more web-based visualization libraries

The Purpose of Your Role 
Fidelity is looking for a motivated software engineer intern to build robust and scalable applications, help improve our code services and system architecture, participate in brainstorming sessions and supply ideas to our technology and products.
We want the highest levels of technical talent and programming skills, as well as a keen desire to learn and apply advanced technologies in creating new digital investment experience.
It will be important for a candidate to be curious, creative, and agile in learning and applying software engineering concepts.
 
The Skills You Bring
Demonstrated interest or experience in applied software engineering, web application design and development, software analysis, database design, visualization, prototyping and experimentation
Demonstrated interest or experience in Unix/Linux environments, mobile application development, distributed and parallel systems, information retrieval, networking and/or developing large software systems
Experience in one or more of the following ? Java, Python, C, C++, C#, PHP, Object C, SWIFT, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, jQuery, SQL, MySQL
Experience in one of more software development tools ? Eclipse, Visual Studio Code, XCode or any other IDE
Experience in one of more visualization tools ? DevExpress, Infragistics, Plot.ly, agGrid,  High Charts or other JavaScript based Visualization libraries
Excellent academic performance with a passion to learn more about financial markets, products, and processes
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and have meticulous attention to detail and unquestioned integrity
 
The Value You Deliver
Work alongside full-time engineers on high-priority projects that drive the product innovations and enable business growth. Actively participate in design and architecture of new financial products.
Work across our entire software stack from building web/mobile applications, middle-tier APIs, data fusion engineering, BigData infrastructure
Design, develop and produce quality software features for our product application suite and support tools
Build quick prototypes using Angular, Java and/or AWS stack
Develop code that is functional, maintainable, efficient and elegant, following the appropriate design and software engineering patterns
Actively participate in team-wide code reviews and design discussions
Build and configure internal automation tools for continuous integration and continuous deployment
 
How Your Work Impacts the Organization
 
The Fidelity Enterprise Services Advanced Technology for Investment Management identifies projects to continually strengthen investment decision and portfolio construction insights and support personalized investment goals. The Team works within an innovation ecosystem that includes partners from investment, client relations, technology and centralized R&D units. Fidelity Enterprise Services Advanced Technology seeks cross-domain authorities with backgrounds that connect investment management, machine learning and technology implementation. We cultivate success through a rigorous, collaborative approach that builds, tests, and iterates as we learn and seek challenging processes and problems in investment management.
 
Application requires a Resume and a Cover Letter
 
Company Overview
 
At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want.
We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates.  For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.

IT Audit Analyst Co-op: Beginning January 2020
Looking for an exciting opportunity to gain knowledge across various facets of the financial services industry?  Then we have a great opportunity for you as a Co-Op within IT Audit beginning in January 2020.  The Information Technology Audit team is responsible for providing the specialized IT audit skills required to assess and evaluate controls over Fidelity's corporate-wide systems infrastructure environment and system development efforts in support of Fidelity's businesses
 
 
The Expertise We're Looking For
Working towards an information systems, information assurance, or business degree with a technology concentration
GPA of 3.0 or higher (overall and in major)
Bright, innovative, energetic, and eager to learn
Strong problem solving and analytical skills while having a positive attitude and being goal driven
Demonstrable leadership experience in school, extracurricular activities, and/or work settings
Team player who takes initiative and works constructively with others to achieve team goals
Ability to work on multiple tasks and manage priorities and workload
Strong presentation, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Knowledge in two or more of the following areas is preferred:
UNIX/Linux
Windows
Mainframe
Network technologies and firewalls
Databases (Oracle, DB2, SQL Server)
Programming_sanitized_ing Language (C, Java, ASP, Python, Perl, Ruby, Visual Basic, SQL)
Information Security Topics
Cloud Services Topics
Web Application Services (.Net, HTML, XML, JSON)
 
The Purpose of Your Role
Working with management within a business or function facilitating the identification and resolution of risk issues;
Interviewing key clients and documenting results;
Developing, executing, and documenting control evaluation procedures;
Understanding the basics of general internal audit practices, tools, techniques, concepts and trends in the technology and financial services industries;
Participating in cross-enterprise audits and developing an understanding of Fidelity businesses;
Organizing and analyzing audit data and summarizing audit findings for manager review;
Applying strategic and organizational concepts, principles, methods and techniques to solve issues and document results;
Using automated tools in the evaluation of applications (e.g. security, content, performance, etc.);
Drafting audit reports that provide a clear description of issues identified, related implications on the business or enterprise as a whole and recommendations to resolve the issues;
Building deep working relationships with audit teams and clients located throughout the US and abroad.
 
The Value You Deliver
The IT Audit Analyst Co-op works on an audit team evaluating risks and controls, executing audit reviews, communicating issues and findings to management, devising solutions for business improvements, and following-up on corrective actions.  The IT Audit group may perform audits of Fidelity's data centers, network, cloud and IT infrastructure, firewall and perimeter security, mobile security, disaster recovery, vendor management, change and configuration management, and incident handling. Audits may also include pre-implementation or post-implementation evaluation of new or current applications across Fidelity's core businesses. 
How Your Work Impacts the Organization
Our primary motivation is to drive positive change throughout the firm. Fidelity Corporate Audit provides independent and objective audit and advisory services that help Fidelity manage risk, improve customer service, and enhance business performance.
This mission is accomplished through:
Assessing the adequacy and effectiveness of controls, risk management, compliance and governance processes
Reporting on issues and solutions that improve Fidelity's control environment
Responding to change with a sense of urgency through continuous risk assessment and resource allocation
Providing audit advisory services on new and changing products and systems
Developing talented professionals for audit and leadership positions
 
What will you receive from us?
Ongoing training and personal development time to prepare you for long-term career growth and success
Ongoing coaching and feedback from your direct manager, including career development guidance
Access to cutting edge tools and technology
Opportunity to work in a team environment, with a culture of collaboration, partnership and sharing of ideas
Access to a variety of employee resource groups and volunteer opportunities within the local community
Networking opportunities with Fidelity leaders and colleagues across the organization and region
Onsite fitness and wellness centers as well as company subsidized healthy meal options at our onsite cafeterias

Innovation Incubator Co-op Program
 
Fidelity Investments is looking for motivated students to spend their next co-op with us. This 6 month experience will offer the opportunity to work with business leaders, participate in new innovation projects, and learn about Fidelity Center of Applied Technology ("FCAT"). FCAT is a centralized function whose mandate is to catalyze innovation across the firm. FCAT teams prototype and pilot new businesses and capabilities that continue to distinguish our brand as the best customer experience in the financial services industry. We are looking for individuals who are passionate for creating products and services that make lives better and are action-oriented, collaborative, and disciplined self-starters. Candidates must thrive in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment working with emerging technologies, with high-risks and uncertainty.
 
The Background We're Looking For
Working toward a Bachelor's Degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics or other related field
The Skills You Bring
You have the ability to design and develop complex applications.
You can rapidly develop software based on requirement documents, prototypes, or other verbal requirements.
You are able to work across peer groups to resolve and understand complex technical/design issues.
You can learn and adopt new concepts & diverse technologies quickly and implement them effectively in projects.
You are able to foster innovation through research and conducts studies of alternatives
You may have experience with the following:
web-based technologies like HTML, JavaScript & CSS, Jason
JavaScript frameworks like Angular, Bootstrap, jQuery, etc.
Java, PHP or .NET
Object Oriented familiarity
software design patterns such as MVC
Native Applications / Mobile Web development for devices like phones & tablets (a plus)
relational database & server side development (a plus)
The Purpose of Your Role
As a key role on our incubator team, you will leverage multiple methodologies during your Co-Op such as Lean Start Up, Design Thinking and Agile, to rapidly move ideas through the scan/try to proof of concept phase.  Some of the technologies that our teams focus on include Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, VR/AR, AI and data science technologies. We will explore how we can disrupt our current businesses, and provide new opportunities to create visionary products and services with these emerging technologies and human­centered design to create visionary products and services that improve people's financial lives. As the innovation engine for Fidelity Investments, you will be part of an exciting group that provides expertise to the rest of the firm on new tools and techniques, while also incubating potential new applications of emerging technology.
 
The Value You Deliver
The Fidelity Center of Applied Technology (FCAT) Co-op Program is designed to begin to build the technical and analytical skills needed for a successful career with Fidelity FCAT. Co-ops have the opportunity to add value to the organization and learn about Fidelity's businesses in an environment supported by state-of-the-art technology.

In this Co-Op role, you will be a Technology Risk Analyst and have the opportunity to work in a collaborative, competitive, fast paced and exciting environment. Flow Traders US, LLC - New York, NY
Risk & Middle Office Co-op (January- June 2020)
Compensation: $25/hour plus OT
Perks + Benefits: 6 days PTO, fully stocked kitchen with coffee and breakfast, daily catered lunches, company events, intramural sports, weekly massages, bi-weekly haircuts
 
 
Flow Traders US LLC, a leading international trading firm, is seeking to hire a Risk & Middle Office (RMO) Co-op for their New York office. The Risk and Middle Office Team at Flow Traders analyzes risk, creates reconciliations, and develops reporting. They continuously seek opportunities to improve our systems and methods, develop new ways to monitor and track data, and increase transparency by capturing and communicating the risks and performance of trading operations.



As an RMO Co-op, your learning opportunities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Risk Analysis (Market, Regulatory, Liquidity, Counterparty, Operational, etc.)
Position Reconciliation, Limit Setting, and Limit Management
Trade and Cost Reconciliation
PNL Reconciliation
Liaising with Trading, IT, and Compliance to solve problems and build solutions
Ad-hoc projects
 
Qualifications
Junior or Senior level candidates, preferred
Majors in Finance, Accounting, MIS, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, a plus
Interest in Risk Management, Trading, or Financial Operations
Knowledge of Excel, VBA, SQL, Python and/or C#, preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Detail oriented and eager to find and address the root cause of issues
Interest to develop or build scalable process improvements
A proactive and flexible personality
Able to work full-time in our New York Office in Midtown Manhattan
 
The Company
Flow Traders is a proprietary trading firm and one of the world's largest liquidity providers in Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs). We maintain a continuous market presence, trading in multiple asset classes around the world.  Headquartered in Amsterdam, with trading offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, London and New York, Flow Traders has grown to 400 employees over the past 10 years and strives to maintain a casual and family-like culture that rewards hard work and determination.
 
Flow Traders US LLC consists of 70 employees in the New York office. Its fast paced environment encourages collaboration and innovative ideas across all levels of the company.  With a small, start-up feel, employees enjoy daily catered lunches, casual dress, a modern-style lounge, intramural sports leagues, and frequent company outings as one big team.
 
For more information, visit our website at www.flowtraders.com or our page on Glassdoor.

Position: Trading Support Engineer Co-op (Jan - June 2020)
Compensation: $30-35 (based on experience), plus OT
Perks + Benefits: 6 days PTO, fully stocked kitchen with coffee and breakfast, daily catered lunches, company events, intramural sports, weekly massages, bi-weekly haircuts
 
Job Description
Flow Traders US is looking for a motivated individual with an interest in financial markets and an entrepreneurial mindset, who is able to manage multiple responsibilities and demands with a strong sense of urgency and customer focus. Successful candidates are adaptable problem solvers with a development mindset, are proficient with Python programming and are comfortable in a Linux/Unix environment.


In this challenging position of a Trading Support Engineer Co-op, you will provide hands-on support to our traders to safeguard the performance and stability of our proprietary trading systems as well as the related hardware. Additionally, you will participate in projects, advise on structural improvements and monitor trends within your area of expertise to capitalize on opportunities of new technologies. 
 
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Act as primary escalation point for traders
Troubleshoot and optimize our in-house trading software and third?party applications
Install, configure and maintain critical trading applications and general office applications
Develop interdepartmental automated applications
Incident management via ticketing system and documentation
 
Job requirements
Interested in trading and financial markets
Knowledge of Unix/Linux and Windows operating systems, plus relevant hardware knowledge
Affinity with scripting languages, with a high preference for Python (e.g. Python, Shell, Perl, batch)
Excellent communication skills

Goldman Sachs is a world leader in developing quantitative and technological solutions to complex business problems. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Manage, visualize and analyze massive sets of market and operational data used in our trading risk management and control functions
Correctly and efficiently route orders for billions of dollars of securities every day
Allow the ability to represent, transact in and risk manage all of the firm's OTC derivative positions
Distribute computations across tens of thousands of computers
Make use of functional programming paradigm and big data solutions to develop the firm's next generation modeling, pricing and risk management platform
Contribute to key open source initiatives? e.g. GSCollections, Project Panama
Build the firm's strategic mobile platform
 
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
We are interested in applicants who possess the following computer science skills:
Strong fundamentals in distributed system databases
Design and analysis of algorithms
Implementation of programming languages and run-time systems
Knowledge of finance, stochastic calculus and financial models would be an added advantage.
 
APPLICATION DETAILS
In order to be considered for this role, please submit an application to the 2020 Americas New York City Area Engineering Summer Analyst role through our careers website.
 
If you have any questions, please contact: gscampusengineering@ny.email.gs.com
 
ROLES
Software Engineering
Transform our business and work across all areas of the firm to design and implement high-quality, scalable and smart solutions. Leveraging both internal and open source services, we design and develop applications capable
of building, maintaining, and processing large & complex data sets.
Ensuring we have the most up-to-date and actionable information, we constantly strive to boost performance and exceed industry standards in order to meet our clients'
evolving needs. We look for ways to improve our operations and enhance our client offerings through internal and external platforms as we build and expand the capacity for data mining, anomaly detection, and business intelligence.
Financial Modelling
We look beyond the numbers and find the trends.
As a member of our team, you will extract meaningful information to engineer advice and solutions that have real-world implications for our clients and the firm.
This level of expert analysis involves large, at times global, data sets ? both structured and unstructured ? to build predictive models that are relevant to specific business centers and account for market variables.
These quantitative techniques then inform effective and accurate cross-asset trade and portfolio ideas for our clients.
In collaboration with your team and others across the firm, you will build and enhance advanced quantitative and analytical methods, utilizing software to design risk modeling systems and develop machine learning algorithms.
Specifically, your role will focus on providing APIs
to clients helping them generate alpha, risk calculations and business metrics. This valuable information will allow them to build and challenge risk models that identify and quantify market and liquidity risk and modeling vulnerabilities.
 
Infrastructure Engineering
Infrastructure Engineering is a multi-faceted role that allows you to explore data center design, networks, storage, cloud computing, big data, application messaging, databases, communications, market data and software languages.
Make things possible for our clients and the firm as you design and build our compute and data infrastructure. You will put your expertise to work in a variety of challenges, from identifying internal hardware needs, to implementing public and private cloud-based solutions to providing seamless, on-demand scaling of our applications.
We provide a robust testing platform that involves the best standards, solutions and tools to ensure uninterrupted operation of all of our lines of business. You will have the opportunity to use data mining techniques to identify and
react to problems in the firm's infrastructure and platforms. A role on this team allows you to use your experience to help us transform the future at Goldman Sachs.
Cyber Security
Protect our clients and the integrity of our firm around the world in both an advisory and engineering capacity
as you develop and propagate our security control strategy. Be on the front line of our operations every day, helping the firm to protect itself & its clients and manage risk.
Information security is a top priority and in this role, you will focus on analysis, penetration testing, cryptography and authentication.
This defense involves performing security operations
to detect, analyze and respond to threat intelligence and incidents quickly. We do this by leveraging data mining and machine learning techniques to identify malicious activity and cyber risks.
Working as a part of a larger team, you will help developers create secure applications, and advise the firm's network and systems engineers as they build infrastructure.
Together, we are helping to secure the future of the firm and our clients every day.

INTERPOL Washington, the United States National Central Bureau, serves as the designated representative to the International Criminal Police Organization (INTERPOL) on behalf of the Attorney General. INTERPOL Washington is the official U.S. point of contact in INTERPOL's worldwide, police-to-police communications and criminal intelligence network. A component of the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ), INTERPOL Washington is co-managed by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and DOJ.  This ensures a continuing commitment to the guidance and oversight of the organization and reinforces its role in effectively sharing and exchanging international criminal investigative and humanitarian assistance information. INTERPOL Washington operates 24/7/365 and supports more than 18,000 local, state, federal, and tribal law enforcement agencies in the United States as well as their foreign counterparts that seek assistance in criminal investigations that extend beyond their national borders.

An internship with INTERPOL Washington offers insight into the growing nexus of transnational crime as well as law enforcement in the United States and around the world. Interns may receive the following opportunities:

Exposure to a wide variety of law enforcement partners, including law enforcement Detailees onsite from agencies including the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), U.S. Marshals Service (USMS), and other federal, state and local law enforcement agencies
Knowledge of the criminal justice system and both its domestic and international scope, impact, and mechanisms
Awareness of issues affecting international criminal investigations
Ability to analyze and summarize complex criminal activities
Expansion of network for future job opportunities, including mentorship from active law enforcement officers and INTERPOL Washington personnel
Attendance of field trips to nearby law enforcement headquarters and training sites

At this time, INTERPOL Washington offers full-time, nonpaid internships for six-month cycles (January-June; July-December). INTERPOL Washington will not provide housing.

Interns will be assigned to one of INTERPOL Washington's divisions:

Alien/Fugitive Division
Drug Division
Violent Crimes Division
Counterterrorism Division
Economic Crimes Division
Human Trafficking and Child Protection Division
Office of the Chief Information Officer
Computer science or related majors only
Compliance
High organizational skills and great attention to detail preferred
Public and Congressional Affairs
Writing skills, digital media, and/or congressional background preferred

Requirements for Consideration:

Must be a U.S. Citizen
Must reside in the United States for three of the last five years
Must maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA
Third- and Fourth-year college student preferred

OVERVIEW:

INTERPOL's Washington D.C. Internship Program is an unpaid opportunity open to undergraduates, graduates, and post-doctorate students across the country. Interns are granted a unique role in promoting global police cooperation and combating international crime from our office in Washington, DC. The program allows students to work hand-in-hand with liaison officers from a myriad of agencies including the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), Alcohol Tobacco and Firearms (ATF), the United States Marshals Service (USMS) , Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) , Customs and Border Patrol (CBP) , the Environmental Protection Agency  (EPA), the United States Secret Service (USSS), the Department of State Diplomatic Security Service (DOS-DSS), and the Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA) as well as representatives from state and local law enforcement entities. This environment provides exposure to the missions and roles of US law enforcement agencies as well as the police communities of 189 foreign countries.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Interns can expect to assist with a variety of administrative and organizational matters; in addition, students will support analysts and liaison officers in processing cases. Casework is divided among 8 operational divisions including the Fugitive Division, Human Trafficking and Child Protection Division, Violent Crimes Division, Counter Terrorism Division, Drug Division, and Economic Crimes Division. Each division houses programs and projects aimed at investigating, analyzing, and preventing particular global crime trends.

CANDIDACY & APPLICATION PROCESS:

We are seeking dedicated individuals with a range of experiences, a passion for justice, and a strong willingness to learn. Please read the additional details provided below.  If you are interested in a career in law enforcement or international affairs you are encouraged to apply. 

HOURS & SALARY:

INTERPOL Washington encourages a 40 hour per week schedule for all interns; minimum number of hours per week is 32 hours.
UNPAID Internship

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Strong communication skills and a positive attitude are essential.  Ideal candidates will be motivated, enthusiastic team players. 
Applicant must be in good standing at an accredited university.  Interest in criminal justice, international affairs, languages, political science, information technology or psychology are preferred but not required. 
Applicants will be required to pass a background check in order to receive an interim clearance. This process takes approximately 3 months time.

TRANSPORTATION:

INTERPOL Washington is conveniently located just one block from NOMA Station on the Red Line of Washington?s MetroRail System in Northeast Washington, D.C.

INTERPOL Washington, the United States National Central Bureau, serves as the designated representative to the International Criminal Police Organization (INTERPOL) on behalf of the Attorney General. INTERPOL Washington is the official U.S. point of contact in INTERPOL's worldwide, police-to-police communications and criminal intelligence network. A component of the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ), INTERPOL Washington is co-managed by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and DOJ.  This ensures a continuing commitment to the guidance and oversight of the organization and reinforces its role in effectively sharing and exchanging international criminal investigative and humanitarian assistance information.
INTERPOL Washington operates 24/7/365 and supports more than 18,000 local, state, federal, and tribal law enforcement agencies in the United States as well as their foreign counterparts that seek assistance in criminal investigations that extend beyond their national borders.
 
An internship with INTERPOL Washington offers insight into the growing nexus of transnational crime as well as law enforcement worldwide and the data required to meet the associated needs. Interns may receive the following opportunities:
 
·         Exposure to a wide variety of law enforcement partners ? Federal, State, and International ? and the breadth of law enforcement technology needs
·         Knowledge of the criminal justice system and both its domestic and international scope, impact, and mechanisms
·         Awareness of issues affecting international criminal investigations and the role of technology as a critical component
·         Ability to translate user requirements in a dynamic environment into actionable steps
·         Expansion of network for future job opportunities, including mentorship from active law enforcement officers and INTERPOL Washington personnel
·         Attendance of field trips to nearby law enforcement headquarters and training sites, plus vendors and DC based IT events.
 
Depending on the Intern's skills, task could include:
Help Desk Response
Network Administration
Requirements gathering and analysis for a replacement project
Data Analysis, Database Administration for SQL, Data system design
Project Analyst for projects
Documentation that could include updating schematics, creating and delivering reports, project management/SDLC requirements
Reporting for OMB required functions
Procurement to include solicitation and evaluation of proposals
Special projects in the future that could be part of an Intern's portfolio:
Design and Development of custom SharePoint applications
Testing of custom applications
Contributing to the implementation of new tools and applications

Financial and Impact Analysis Co-Op
Grameen America, Inc. (GAI) is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping women who have no access to financial institutions build small businesses to create better lives for themselves and their families. We offer microloans, training and support to fight poverty in the United States, starting with the poorest women in each community we serve. Started in 2008 in Jackson Heights, New York, GAI has served over 120,000 low income women and disbursed over $1.2 billion dollars. Currently, we operate through 21 branches in 14 cities across the United States and have an ambitious plan to serve more clients in the next three years.

GAI is interested in hiring a financial and impact analysis co-op position in New York City. Reporting to the Sr. Managers of Financial Planning and Analysis and the CFO, they will support financial analysis and treasury operations across the organization, as well as assist in organizational impact evaluation. The position offers significant potential for personal growth and exposure to a leading domestic social enterprise as we embark on the next exciting phase of our development in the United States.

Responsibilities Include:
Provide strategic support to Sr. Managers of Financial Planning and Anlaysis for organizational growth and efficiency
Modeling/analysis to monitor progress and growth of organization and individual branches
Budgeting analysis to monitor expenses of organization and individual branches
Maintain databases to ensure data quality and consumer metrics are accurate and distributable
Assist in developing processes for impact analysis based on real-time and historical data
Provide support to Treasury needs of entire branch network
Provide data analysis support for generating reports on a periodic basis
Clerical duties to help with accounting procedures as necessary
 
Qualifications
Junior or senior undergraduate in an area requiring integrative and analytical thinking (e.g. Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Knowledge of common approaches for research and strategic analysis
Experience working both individually and with a range of teams
International development and/or nonprofit exposure highly preferred
Passion for working in a social enterprise environment
Detail oriented
Strong time management and multi-tasking abilities
Self-motivated and autodidactic
 
Compensation is commensurate with experience ($15 - 20 / hr). If you are interested and meet the qualifications, please upload your resume to NUcareers (cover letters are also highly suggested).

Keywords: social enterprise, microfinance, microenterprise

Resumes will be reviewed the week of October 7. Please apply before that date for consideration.

Job description:
 
Looking for a student with strong object-oriented programming experience to work with the Mars Science Laboratory Engineering Operations Team. Tasks will involve developing software tools to aid in data analysis for the assessment of health and safety of the Curiosity rover. This will include improving existing tools, as well as creating new tools and capabilities for the operations team. Software tools include complex scripts for parsing and interpreting data in a Unix environment as well as visualization tools in web-based dashboards for trending analysis.

A strong candidate not only has strong programming abilities, but also a passion for space exploration and robotics and a desire to learn about the systems they are helping to analyze. System level understanding and context is crucial to making sure the software developed will truly support the end users and be maintainable.
 
Requirements:
Strong software abilities, preferably with experience in Python and/or Javascript, and familiarity with Object Oriented Programming concepts
Organized: organizes code in a robust, maintainable, easy to read way, sufficiently comments code, able to document user's guides and create training materials when necessary
Computer science or computer engineering major or minor
Passion for space exploration
Nice to have:
Familiarity with Bash and PERL
Comfortable in Unix environments
Front-end web development experience including data visualization.
Experience building database queries to retrieve data is also a plus, especially for Elastic search databases.
Experience working with data in formats such as JSON, XML and CSV tables.
Previous work experience preferred

GMO Panel - Wednesday, September 25, 2019 at 6:00 PM in Richards 458

Position Overview:
 
The Systematic Fixed Income Strategy group is looking for a talented and driven individual to join our quantitative strategy efforts.  The team is responsible for conducting research and establishing strategy across current Fixed Income capabilities and developing new strategies and products. Particular areas of focus are systematic credit capabilities in investment grade and high yield, and the development of an overarching framework across risk, performance, position and portfolio management systems to support strategy development and deployment and review.
 
The successful candidate will work on a number of projects related to the development of new systematic fixed income strategies. This would range from working closely with the quantitative team to develop backtests of new signals, create data and code infrastructure to working with various parts of the firm to develop connectivity and quantitative tools that help enhance and update strategy materials on a regular basis. He/she will develop critical insight in the development and management of fixed income strategies and gain exposure to multiple sectors of fixed income across emerging markets, corporate credit, and developed rates and currencies. This role offers insight into the investment product and strategy landscape in systematic fixed income more broadly. The individual will participate in research and project meetings and will be provided with opportunities to learn about and meet with other teams at GMO.
 
Responsibilities:
Assist in the creation of a data and code architecture to support systematic fixed income strategy testing and development
Create and enhance interactive tools for analysis and visualization of current fund and strategy positioning, performance and risk characteristics
Improve and extend connectivity on data and coding architecture and infrastructure within the fixed income and across other teams as appropriate.
Assist various members of the Fixed Income team with related quantitative projects.
 
Profile and Requirements:
Working on a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering or similar
Hands-on experience with programming in Matlab, or another language like R, Python, Java, C# or Julia
Programming proficiency in SQL
Basic understanding of statistics and econometric concepts
Interest in understanding the sources of returns for major asset classes, signal construction, portfolio theory and translation from model to markets.
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, set goals and meet deadlines
Ability to work effectively and efficiently with moderate supervision
Effective verbal and written communication skills
 
Department Profile
The Fixed Income team is responsible for managing portfolios and conducting research across all major sectors of fixed income and currencies.  The team values clarity of roles and decision-making while maintaining a culture of intellectual curiosity, debate, respectful disagreement, candor, and collegiality. 
 
Company Profile:
Founded in 1977, GMO is a private partnership committed to delivering superior investment performance and advice to our clients.  We offer strategies where we believe we are positioned to add the greatest value for our investors.  These include multi-asset class portfolios as well as dedicated equity, fixed income, and absolute return offerings, many of which employ the firm's proprietary 7-year asset class forecasting framework.  Our client base is comprised primarily of institutions, including corporate and public defined benefit and defined contribution retirement plans, endowments, foundations, and financial intermediaries.
 
GMO, whose sole business is investment management, employs approximately 500 people worldwide and is headquartered in Boston with offices in San Francisco, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, and Singapore. We manage roughly $70 billion in client assets using a combination of top-down and bottom-up approaches that blend traditional fundamental insights with innovative quantitative methods to identify undervalued asset classes and securities. Our valuation-based approach embeds several key factors, including: a long-term investment horizon, discipline, conviction, and a commitment to research. Our research emphasizes not only identifying and exploiting pricing dislocations but also understanding the long-term drivers of return in the markets in which we invest. We are known for our candor in sharing our views with clients and for our willingness to take bold, differentiated positions when opportunities warrant.
Organization: Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Co, LLC
Division: Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Co, LLC

Company Profile
Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Co. LLC (GMO) was founded in 1977 as an asset management firm.  GMO has over 2,000 clients in Pension Funds, Educational Endowments, Foundations, and International Organizations, totaling approximately $70 Billion dollars.  Today GMO has offices in Boston, San Francisco, London, Singapore, and Sydney.  GMO currently has 500 employees and is looking for an individual to be based in its Boston Office.


Company Mission Statement
To deliver superior investment performance and advice to our clients.
To provide a collegial and productive work environment that embodies an affirmative set of work and personal values.
To manage the firm in an effective and coordinated way that achieves a level of profitability sufficient to achieve the firm's mission.
To always put our clients' interests before our own, and to provide our clients the best service possible consistent with achieving their investment goals.
To develop a broad array of superior investment products.
To grow as fast as is consistent with our ability to perform in a superior way as an investment and professional organization.
To enjoy our work.

The individual will be a part of the Research & Investment Data team which is responsible for data intake, mapping and integrity across a wide range of data types, including, but not limited to securities, accounts, portfolios, indices and market data streams.  This person will be responsible for helping to ensure an exceptionally high quality of data, including establishing governance and metrics around the data while assisting in day-to-day troubleshooting of data quality issues.  The position will rely heavily on the candidate?s detailed nature as well as their analytical, organizational and communication skills.

Job Description:
Position Overview - Security Engineer Co-op

Reporting to the Manager of IT Networking & Security, this position is part of the IT Infrastructure group. The IT Security Co-op will assist the IT Security team in Security Incident Analysis and resolving any possible malcode infections on GMO's machines. This individual also assists the IT Security team in resolution codes coming from the company's Yearly Penetration and Vulnerability tests. The individual will also assist in the upgrade of company's security devices including Checkpoint, Tipping Point and Palo Alto firewalls along with assistance in day to day security operational tasks.

Requirements
Undergraduate or graduate degree in technology discipline or equivalent experience
Keep interest in learning new technologies.
Cisco, CheckPoint, and other related vendor certifications a plus.
Experience working with IP networking, networking protocols and understanding of security related technologies including encryption, IPsec, PKI, VPNs, firewalls, proxy services, DNS, electronic mail and access-lists
Experience with Checkpoint, Cisco, and Palo Alto firewall management and associated system managers
Experience with TippingPoint IPS and associated system managers, or other IDS/IPS products
Vulnerability Analysis and Penetration testings.
Experience analyzing Firewall and IPS logs, as well as Windows Event and Security logs
Experience working with enterprise log management software, RSA enVision a plus
Experience with data leakage prevention and eDiscovery technologies; Experience with Varonis DatAdvantage
Endpoint security experience (Windows, Linux, and mobile devices)
Familiarity with Active Directory
Excellent, proven troubleshooting skills
Experience working within the banking/finance/regulatory industry
Experience working with relevant operating system security (Windows, Linux, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communications and interpersonal skills
Must exhibit a team-oriented approach
Company Profile
Founded in 1977, GMO is a private partnership committed to delivering superior investment performance and advice to our clients.  We offer strategies where we believe we are positioned to add the greatest value for our investors.  These include multi-asset class portfolios as well as dedicated equity, fixed income, and absolute return offerings, many of which employ the firm's proprietary 7-year asset class forecasting framework.  Our client base is comprised primarily of institutions, including corporate and public defined benefit and defined contribution retirement plans, endowments, foundations, and financial intermediaries.

GMO, whose sole business is investment management, employs approximately 500 people worldwide and is headquartered in Boston with offices in San Francisco, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, and Singapore. We manage roughly $70 billion in client assets using a combination of top-down and bottom-up approaches that blend traditional fundamental insights with innovative quantitative methods to identify undervalued asset classes and securities. Our valuation-based approach embeds several key factors, including: a long-term investment horizon, discipline, conviction, and a commitment to research. Our research emphasizes not only identifying and exploiting pricing dislocations but also understanding the long-term drivers of return in the markets in which we invest. We are known for our candor in sharing our views with clients and for our willingness to take bold, differentiated positions when opportunities warrant.
Organization: Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Co, LLC
Division: Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Co, LLC

Job Description:
GMO Panel - Wednesday, September 25, 2019 at 6:00 PM in Richards 458

GMO is looking for ambitious problem solvers with talent for utilizing technology, analytical skills, and interest in finance to solve complex problems in the areas of Financial Analysis, Real-time Trading, Portfolio Management, Cloud Technologies, and Client Management.   We want you to work with us to design, prototype, develop, and grow technology solutions for in-house use.  We value individuals who have a passion for coding, an obsession for perfection, and can deliver practical, real-world solutions that make a difference.
 
Requirements:
- Working on Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, MIS or similar.
- Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
- Experience with frontend languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React or Angular a plus
 - Experience with backend languages such as C#, ASP.net, Entity Framework, SQL, Azure, PowerShell etc. a plus.
- Experience with QlikView, eReportal, Active Reports, SSRS, or similar a plus.
 

Department Profile
The GMO Information Technology team provides innovative technology solutions to GMO's clients, traders, portfolio managers, and quantitative analysts. We have built a culture of excellence where we can discuss interesting software problems and learn from each other. We hold frequent discussions where we share and learn various new technologies, coding practices, and problem remediation. We are a focused team of IT professionals working in agile manner to deliver timely and on-demand solutions using the latest cutting edge software and methodologies.  Some of the best developers in the industry work at GMO, including published authors of several technology books. 


Company Profile:
Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Co. LLC (GMO) was founded in 1977 as an asset management firm.  GMO has over 2,000 clients in Pension Funds, Educational Endowments, Foundations, and International Organizations, totaling approximately $70 Billion dollars.  Today GMO has offices in Boston, San Francisco, London, Singapore, and Sydney.  GMO currently has 500 employees and is looking for an individual to be based in its Boston Office.
