Job Description:
Background
Greentown Learn is a mission driven 501(c)(3) spun out of Greentown Labs- the largest cleantech incubator in the US - and located at the epicenter of the Boston area innovation ecosystem. Greentown Learn's mission is to help hardware startups move from prototype to product, faster and with greater impact and meaningful regional economic growth.

Manufacturing Initiative
The Greentown Manufacturing Initiative connects startups with manufacturers, engineers, and other firms essential to a hardware startups supply chain. The Initiative makes connections throughout Massachusetts to break down barriers and help establish working relationships.

In practice, the Initiative requires someone who is adept at both creating and managing relationships. This applies to both manufacturers from across Massachusetts and startups from across the Greater Boston area. Relationship management includes scheduling and hosting tours at Greentown Labs, scheduling and attending tours off-site of manufacturing facilities, scheduling and execution of workshops, lunches, speaking events, seminars and other events as they arise. Ability to synthesize survey data, create marketing materials, develop outreach materials for both manufacturers and startups and manage website content is very important.

The successful applicant will be someone who can prioritize quickly, is passionate about entrepreneurship and the startup culture,  is a team player but works well with little direction and oversight, anticipates needs, has a sense of humor and can take ownership of projects.

This position will report to the Program Manager of the Somerville office.

Job Expectations:
Assist with the maintenance of accurate records of interviews, events and program progress
Must be able to work independently and with a small team
Collect, analyze and summarize data, update and optimize salesforce database
Provide research support the Executive Director and Managers and stay up to date on current events and publications surrounding manufacturing and hardware startups
Act as a liaison between program stakeholders - startups, manufacturers, and investors
Assist in the preparation of project materials for submission to granting agencies, and others, including but not limited to: articles, reports, and presentations
Manage relationships in a professional and respectful manner
Prepare, maintain, and update marketing materials, blog posts, websites & social media
Be able to assist with event management & execution

Minimum qualifications/requirements:
Prior work/internship experience preferred  
Community leader; president of entrepreneurship or engineering clubs is a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Analytical mindset
Flexibility and ability to manage shifting priorities quickly
Team player
Detail oriented with experience managing events
Ability to work some evenings as needed
Familiarity with manufacturing processes is a plus
Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned as needed.
Salary: This is a full-time, non benefited position. This is a 4 month position with the possibility for extension.

Position Overview: Enterprise Data Management Business Analyst
This individual will work on an Enterprise Data Management team tasked with designing and developing critical Enterprise Data Management Workflows and Governance Models.
The individual will be a part of the Data Management team working within GMO's Operations Team. The Data Management team is responsible for securities, portfolios, code translations, and ensuring proper dataflow between firm wide systems and reports. The position interacts with GMO's various investment and operational groups, and offers the opportunity to enhance analytical, organizational, project management, and communication skills.
The ideal candidate will be pursuing a degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Finance, Math, or Economics.
Requirements
Required Skills:
Interest in or existing knowledge of financial industry.
Strong analytical and organizational skills.
Excellent oral and written communications skills.
Strong Microsoft Excel skills and adept at learning new applications.
Able to work effectively and efficiently with moderate supervision, including the prioritization of assigned tasks, setting goals and meeting deadlines.
Optional Skills:
SQL Programming, Python, R, Basic programming skills.
Interest in pursuing a career in Data Science.
Interpersonal skills:
Team player, positive attitude, proactive, professional and mature.
Position responsibilities
Analyze and document existing Data Flows. Help to design future flows.
Document existing Data into Data Dictionaries while also leveraging Data Flow Documentation to document Data Lineage.
Work with Data Management team where necessary to respond to customer requests/inquires to create Security Master and/or Portfolio Master Records.
Partner with IT to evaluate and implement Data Quality and Master Data Management toolsets.
Develop and execute testing strategies for the newly developed tools.  Identify and analyze issues if encountered.
Create and update detailed procedural documentation.
Design and maintain automated workflows to govern Enterprise Metadata.
Complete additional business analysis tasks assigned during the project.
Build data visualizations for end users to display metrics on metadata via reports and dashboards

The Enterprise Data Management team is a growing and integral part of GMO's Operations Team. The Enterprise Data Management team is responsible for securities, portfolios, code translations, and ensuring proper dataflow between firm wide systems and reports. Further, the team is going through an exciting period of transition into an Enterprise Data model that will focus on Data Governance and Data Quality. Job Description:
GreenSight Agronomics is a startup based in Boston developing a UAV(drone) service focused on helping golf course superintendents to efficiently manage their water & chemical usage by imaging their course with daily flyovers.

GreenSight is an innovative startup working on an extraordinary variety of technologies. We're looking for Co-ops (engineers-in-training) to help us develop UAV's, UAV systems (including software for processing data), and other robotic systems. Our prospective hires will help build and fly UAV's as welll as participate in the design and test of new systems such as super-high-performance UAV's, an auto-land-in-a-box system, cloud-based analysis software, and wheeled robots with integrated robotic arms.

We purposefully keep this job description broad, because we have a wide enough variety of work that we can hire students from a wide variety of majors. In the past we've hired Northeastern tudents studying mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer science, computer engineering, and business, both undergraduates and masters students.

Preferred skills:
Proficient with Google Docs & Sheets
Experience with building and/or flying small UAV's
Experience soldering and using basic test equipment
Image processing with COTS software or custom code
Programming in Linux/Ubuntu environment 
FAA Part 107 Remote Pilot Certification (Optional, but willing to study for and pass the test) 

If you love drones and robotics, please apply! Thanks!

Job Title: Incubator Resources Associate
Job Level: Full-Time (Hourly)

Job Summary:

You're a great fit for this role if you are an entrepreneurial engineer with a passion for the future of the planet!

Greentown Labs, a mission-driven social enterprise, proudly fosters a vibrant culture emphasizing teamwork, positivity, personal growth and passion. We seek employees who share our zeal for clean technology, sustainability, entrepreneurship, and wish to grow with a thriving organization. The mission of Greentown Labs is to enable cleantech and energy entrepreneurs to focus on their inventions that will solve the world's most pressing energy and environmental problems.

This position will report directly to both the Director of Operations and the Lab & Member Resources Manager and will play a key role in supporting day-to-day operations of over 90 different start-up companies and third-parties associated with the incubator. This position will help ensure smooth and seamless functioning of the "member resources" offered to member companies including machine shop equipment, 3d printers, an electronics lab, shared tools and much more. Supporting maintenance of equipment, documentation of use, systemizing access, and producing test parts will make up the majority of the day-to-day for the person filling this roll.

To a lesser extent, the associate will also support community-focused endeavors like facilitating meetups, garnering feedback and galvanizing users of shared equipment around the mission of enhancing our offerings to match the needs of our current and projected membership.

Primary Responsibilities of this Role: 
- Work with the Greentown team and Greentown members on strategies to make a supportive and one of a kind ecosystem and incubation space for clean tech
- Perform daily safety walk-throughs of Greentowns facility as well as equipment checklists, inspection, management, and maintenance 
- Support the safety training and safe use of all equipment.
- Provide support on community programming initiatives such as Lunch & Learns, Team Lunches, and monthly
- EnergyBar! networking events
- Assist with G.R.I.D. (Greentown's co-working intranet) upkeep & development
- Monitor and respond to our larger community Slack channels for troubleshooting and support.

Required Skills and Experience:
- Familiarity and comfort using a range of equipment including: 3D printers, laser cutting systems, CNC machine(s), mills, drill presses, saws, bending/breaking tools.
- Extracurricular activities demonstrating a strong interest in troubleshooting, hardware hacking, clean technology, energy & sustainability
- Ability to prioritize and juggle multiple tasks at once
- Capacity to predict and plan around potential operational failures
- Be able to lift 40 pounds of weight
- Excellent written communication and public speaking skills
- Can-do attitude & an eagerness to learn!
- Familiarity with web design and basic coding skills are a plus

Detailed Job Description:
- Develop more efficient systems to provide access to shared equipment while ensuring uses are doing so safely.
- Synthesize and manage company data spreadsheets and matrices
- Daily checklist execution of prototyping lab and machine shop
- Work with other members of the operations team to promote OSHA (Occupational Safety and Health Assoc.) compliance
- Assist with data entry using Google for Business tols
- Provide support on construction projects
- Lead tours through the facility when requested
- Develop relationships with a variety of 3rd parties to ensure steady supply flow to the facilities
- Update, maintain, and develop the Greentown Resources and Information Directory AKA G.R.I.D (intranet co-working software platform)
- Provide assistance to Operations & Community Manager with event planning logistics, set-up, execution, and take-down
- Work with senior team members when requested to provide hiring and interview support

Compensation: Starting at $17.00 / hr

Perks:
- Monthly MBTA pass
- Bike racks & showers on-site
- Work at The Coolest Startup Space in Boston!
- Lots of great food at weekly Greentown Labs events
- A fun community of quirky entrepreneurs
- Endless networking opportunities

Job Description:
Company Function
HarbourVest is an independent, global private markets asset manager with more than 35 years of experience and more than $40 billion in assets under management. The Firm's powerful global platform offers clients investment opportunities through primary fund investments, secondary investments, and direct co-investments in co-mingled funds or separately managed accounts. HarbourVest has more than 400 employees, including over 100 investment professionals, across Asia, Europe, and the Americas. This global team has committed more than $31 billion to newly-formed funds, completed over $15 billion in Secondary purchases, and invested $6 billion directly in operating companies. Partnering with HarbourVest, clients have access to customized solutions, longstanding relationships, actionable insights, and proven results.
 
Job Function
 
The junior business/technial analyst acts as an intermediary between the business community and the technical community working with IT project teams and business clients to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed.  The analyst will partner with developers to plan, test, and implement software changes to ensure that products conform to the desired quality standard. They will assist in the responsibility for testing software products, modifying applications or configuring solutions that are either built in-house, customized, or configured on the cloud.
 
Job Skills and Abilities
General IT domain knowledge in one or more of the following areas IT areas: Applications Development, Project Management, Business Process Management, Quality Assurance, Infrastructure, and Maintenance and Support
Confident in learning new skills and applying those skills to business and technical challenges
Ability to learn and conduct manual and automated testing
Familiarity with Agile software development methodologies
Excellent interpersonal communication skills, both written and verbal, including experience translating technical concepts and decisions to non-technical staff
Demonstrated analytical skills
Problem solving skills, ability to dissect complex situations
Strong affinity for data and attention to detail
Confident self-starter capable of taking initiative
Basic understanding of information technology and business concepts
Proficient with Microsoft office suite including Microsoft Word, Excel, etc.
Responsibilities
Work with business partner to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs
Clearly articulates and documents business requirements
Develops and documents step-by-step test cases based on the software requirements
Plans, tests, and implements all software changes resulting from work orders
Identifies, logs, and tracks defects
Prioritizes test scenarios and executes according to plan
Develops test scripts to automate manual repeatable time intensive tasks
Adheres to testing standards, procedures, and guidelines to ensure consistent testing procedures
Performs configuration updates for software based on requirements
Participates in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions
Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues
 
Allocation of Time
30% capturing and documenting business needs and shaping requirements through dialogue with business sponsors,
20% understanding end-user requirements,
30% performing and supporting testing,
20% performing application configuration.
        [1]

[1]

Reverse commute from Boston (40 mins), carpool may be available with second co-op student on location.

Harvard Apparatus has been hiring NU co-op students for almost 10 years.  We are committed to providing an educational experience for students that contains both hands on and design work.  Harvard Apparatus is a leading developer and manufacturer of scientific research instruments and devices used at pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, universities and government laboratories worldwide. As a member of the Holliston based engineering team, the coop will have exposure to many of the Harvard Bioscience brands and opportunities to work on a wide variety of products.  

Software Engineering Coop position:
·    Work in a small multi-disciplined engineering group.
·    Provide support in new product development applications.
·    Build and debug prototype systems.
·    Design and build test applications.

Requirements:
¨    2nd or 3rd coop pursuing a Software or CE Degree preferred.
¨    Experience and knowledge with various software development tools and languages.
¨    Work within a team and be capable of carrying out tasks with minimal supervision.
¨    Good verbal and written skills, and good working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs.
¨    Embedded software development experience is a plus.

Company Function
HarbourVest is an independent, global private markets asset manager with more than 35 years of experience and more than $40 billion in assets under management. The Firm's powerful global platform offers clients investment opportunities through primary fund investments, secondary investments, and direct co-investments in co-mingled funds or separately managed accounts. HarbourVest has more than 400 employees, including over 100 investment professionals, across Asia, Europe, and the Americas. This global team has committed more than $31 billion to newly-formed funds, completed over $15 billion in Secondary purchases, and invested $6 billion directly in operating companies. Partnering with HarbourVest, clients have access to customized solutions, longstanding relationships, actionable insights, and proven results.
  
Job Skills and Abilities
Performing hands-on IT security risk assessments of both new and existing in house and vendor-based systems.
Hands on experience with Machine learning, SIEM and/or SOAPA tools
Tenacious perseverance in investigating problems and processes, firm believer in established methodologies and best practices
Analysis of threat intelligence and other information sources and developing strategies to counter emerging cyber threats.
Ability to prepare and present research findings to VP of Global Infrastructure & Security
Identify security gaps and make recommendations for remediation
Understanding of controls frameworks such as NIST or ISO
Perform forensic research on breached targets

Responsibilities
Coordinate, track, and report on vulnerability remediation activities Contributing to the continuous improvement of risk assessment processes.
Run user reports necessary for maintaining accurate user information, such as inactive accounts, failed logins and ad-hoc reports by request.
Conduct ongoing review of incidents pertaining to user access, administrative activities and contextual use administrative privileges and in response to investigation
Works with engineering teams to define and refine information security and systems management policies and settings.
Provides analysis of potential risk to information security and recommends solutions

Happie Marketing Co-op

What Happie Does:
 
Happie is a venture-backed, ground-breaking recruitment marketing platform that helps companies identify, engage, and hire top talent at speed and scale. We have helped hundreds of companies like iRobot, DraftKings, and Rue Gilt Groupe hire amazing teams.
 
We have incredibly delighted, marquee customers that evangelize our offering, and we are ready to capitalize on that early success by telling the wider world about our product. This is where you come in.
 
We are a small team where you can work closely with multiple functions and leaders and truly see the impact of your work on a daily basis. As a Marketing Co-op, you'll be working alongside the CEO and a small, intense marketing team moving mountains in our space. You'll be treated as a full-fledged member of this team,with lots of responsibilities, projects, room to experiment, and skills to learn, as we push the ball forward massively towards our goals every single day.
 
Here's what one of our former intern, Sandy Chac, had to say about her summer 2019 marketing internship:
 
"My internship at Happie was incredibly fast-paced and filled with interesting projects. I learned far more than I thought I would and am now a much better marketer!"
 
This may be perfect for you if:
You are addicted to learning. This is an environment where you'll be asked to figure stuff out  and learn new things every day. 
You are creative. We prize creativity tremendously in marketing. You can put yours to good use here!
You have strong writing and social media skills.
You are a self-starter and can grab a project and run with it.
You are comfortable with the ambiguity, fluidity, and rapid pace of change in startup.
 
This may not be the right opportunity for you if:
You fear failure (marketing is all about testing lots of stuff and learning from what works - and what doesn't).
You have a thin skin. This is an intense environment of straightforward people who say it like it is.
You are not already pretty good at multi-tasking. There will be a lot coming at you and you'll need to be able to keep a lot of balls in the air.
You are not tech savvy. 
 
What You'll Do:
Email marketing. Yaay! Fun!
Craft and send compelling email marketing campaigns to potential customers.
Develop triggered email campaigns that support the customer journey as they move through research to buying stages.
Respond to inbound inquiries, segment them, and ensure that they get a delightful response from the right team member.
 
Events and Webinars
You'll create and support tons of events, both virtual and in-person. You;ll create content, promote them, drive attendance, and craft follow ups. Everything necessary to make them really sing!
?
Content content content.. And more content
You'll work with the Marketing team to build cohesive content and storytelling through many channels.
 
You'll help the team with other initiatives that come up during the internship.
You'll come up with innovative ideas, test them, find out which work and which don't, embrace and learn from your failures, and iterate until you hit a win.
Other interesting projects may include 
Product marketing: creating communications to alert customers to new features
Partner Program Development
Evangelism and Influencer Marketing
Social Media Content Creation
Blog post writing and editing (build your byline!!)

Business Analysis Internship (35h/week; Fenway)
Harvard Catalyst- The Harvard Clinical and Translational Science Center at Harvard Medical School is seeking fresh talent for a prestigious resume-enhancing opportunity. Join us this summer in conducting business analysis on our high profile informatics tools. Our mission is to enable world-class Harvard researchers to bring cutting-edge scientific discoveries to patient care!
 
As a member of our internship program, you will join one of our cross-functional project teams, composed of product owners, software developers, testers, project managers, and business analysts. You will also have ample opportunity to network with other professionals within Harvard Catalyst and attend events at other Harvard organizations. A mentor will be available to assist and guide you throughout the internship.
 
This internship is a chance to apply the research methods you learned in class and may be of particular interest to students who would like to work in an academic or healthcare-related domain. Our customers include faculty and fellows from Harvard Catalyst's 31 affiliate institutions.
 
This is a full-time position (35h/week). Compensation is $32 - $42/h, to be negotiated based on experience. Our office is conveniently located in Boston's historic and trendy Fenway area, ideal for MBTA commute.

Responsibilities

Working closely with a business analysis mentor as well as with a cross-functional team, you will be working in the following areas:
Perform application analysis for business needs, program vision, prioritization, and requirements.
Identify functional solutions to business problems. 
Scope and define solutions into detailed requirements.
Document and communicate business requirements effectively with team members
Assist in application testing and test planning
Perform non-project related business analysis and research tasks as needed

Enrolled in Northeastern University undergraduate or graduate program
Strong computer skills.  Proficiency in Microsoft suite, Balsamiq, JIRA, UI design software desired.
Good interpersonal communication (both written and verbal)
Good organizational and analytical skills
Adaptable and quick learner who enjoys tackling a large variety of problems
Optimistic, collaborative, and eager to learn
 
Additional Qualifications:
We are particularly interested in students who have completed or are currently enrolled in the following programs: Information Systems and Computer Science. Background in a health-related field is highly desirable.
Ideal candidates will have experience in analyzing complex problems and defining effective solutions. Knowledge of Agile methodologies and business analysis principles is highly desirable.  
 
For more information: https://open.med.harvard.edu/
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

Established in 2008, Harvard Catalyst

This is a paid position.
The INSPIRE Laboratory is seeking highly motivated students with experience in engineering, computer science, neuroscience, and/or physiology. The student will support a number of innovative research projects as part of a highly interdisciplinary and collaborative team.   
 
Key Responsibilities
 
Processing and analysis of sensor data generated from experiments in able-bodied persons as well as persons with neurologic pathologies (i.e., spinal cord injury).
Participate in data acquisition is completed during studies and meets established guidelines.
Assistance is provided to other lab team members to meet established objectives.
Independence with event logging maintenance to meet established guidelines.
Autonomy with data storing and back-up to meet established standards.
 
The INSPIRE lab is an interdisciplinary research environment composed of physiologists, clinicians, neuroscientists, computer scientists, and engineers. In addition, members of the team routinely interact and collaborate with other faculty at Harvard Medical School, MGH, and Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital.

QUALIFICATIONS:
* Skills in engineering, physiology, computer science, neuroscience, and/or related field. 
* Knowledge of data acquisition systems, high-rate data collection, signal processing, and sensor systems.  
* Willingness to assist with biological tissue testing, which will require the strict observance of biohazard safety procedures.  
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  

Positions will remain open until filled. Affirmative action/equally opportunity employer.
Organization: Harvard Medical School & Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital
Division: Harvard Medical School & Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital

Job Description:
Harvard Law School Information Technology Services
IT and Audiovisual Support Assistant

Summary

IT and Audiovisual Support Assistant Co-ops are a vital part of the Harvard Law School Service Desk support and Audio Visual team.  As an HLS ITS Co-op, you will provide endpoint support to our community of students, staff and faculty. This includes audiovisual support in event spaces as well as in-person and remote technical support. You will resolve customer requests by providing timely, quality customer support on first contact, and by following through on those you cannot resolve by collaborating with your colleagues at the Service Desk to determine and deliver a solution. The ideal candidate understands the importance of accountability, analytical problem solving, adaptability and active listening when working with customers to deliver personalized solutions.

After an initial six-week training program, our co-ops will rotate through six positions on a weekly basis. Each shift comes with its own set of tasks and learning experiences. The schedules of these shifts are as follows:
Media Services 1: 7:30 am to 3:30 pm Mon-Fri
Media Services 2: 7:30 am to 4:30 pm Sun; 11:30 am to 7:30 pm Tues-Thurs
Media Services 3: 2:30 pm to 10:30 pm Tues-Sat
Student Service Desk: 11:00 am to 7:00 pm Mon-Fri
Field Technician: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Mon-Fri
Business Operations: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Mon-Fri
Responsibilities
Work independently and within a team, maintaining organization of your tasks and tickets in the midst of shifting priorities and deadlines.
Perform audiovisual setups and break downs in classrooms and event spaces.
Setup and process video recordings for internal and external clientele.
Add, remove and update event requests in the room scheduling system.
Address walk-in customers at the service desks in a timely and professional manner.
Monitor incoming tickets and respond to customer requests in a timely manner.
Organize and inventory equipment, and assist with ordering supplies and materials.
Prepare and decommission computers and accessories.
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues.
Install or update software for students, faculty, and staff.
Add and update documentation on common issues or questions.
Assist with various projects as needed.
Qualifications
Basic familiarity with technology desirable.
Enthusiasm for customer Service experience preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Must be dependable, flexible, and comfortable in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
Proactive problem-solving skills and ability to work under stress and time pressure.
Strong aptitude to quickly learn and retain technical skills and institutional knowledge.
Transportation

We are located in the basement of Wasserstein Hall at 1585 Massachusetts Avenue in Cambridge, MA. The location is a quick walk from the Harvard Square or Porter Square MBTA stops and is also accessible via several MBTA bus routes, including the 1, 77, 96, 66, and 86.
 
There is also a shuttle option available to you:
The M2 LMA shuttle is free for Harvard employees and students with stops in Longwood, Fenway, and Back Bay: https://www.masco.org/lma-shuttles/m2-cambridge-hms

35 hrs / week. Coordinators: Jacqui Sweeney, Elinor Levine

Global Support Services- International Safety and Security-Security Assistant
 
Position Description:
The student will be assigned to the International Safety and Security unit, within Harvard's Global Support Services. ISS is responsible for critical pre-departure and in-country services, to include intelligence analysis, risk assessments, travel advice, consultations and emergency response in support of more than 8,000 University travelers in over 160 countries annually. In this role, the student will be assigned a variety of tasks supporting international safety and security efforts, having the unique opportunity to gain skills pertaining to international relations, research and analysis and customer service.
 
Responsibilities:
Performing research for and assisting with ongoing intelligence and research initiatives
Providing support for international program consultants
Perform country and regional specific research
Assist in maintaining and updating country risk ratings
Provide support developing and reviewing websites
Data entry for ongoing programs
Desired Skills:
Strong oral and written communication skills
Solid organizational skills with attention to detail
Ability to work as part of a team as well as alone
Proficiency in Microsoft Office particularly Excel and Outlook
Ability to perform research and synthesize vast quantities of information
Ability to work professionally within an organization of diverse people and projects
Preferred Qualifications:
Interest in safety and security or international relations
Previous office environment experience
The position hours are 9 AM - 5 PM with an unpaid hour lunch period and will have a pay rate of $15.00 per hour. The Global Support Services Office is located at 114 Mount Auburn Street, Cambridge, MA 02138.

We're Hiring!
Excellent Work Experience for Anyone Interested in Information Technology
Fast-Paced Environment; Lots of Learning!

The Technical Support Analyst, as part of an IT support services team within a thirty-­two person Information Technology Department, provides the technical expertise and assistance necessary to ensure the continuity of the information technology services for faculty, staff, students and research fellows at Harvard Kennedy School.

Specific Responsibilities:

Represent the Information Technology department as a customer-focused, results-oriented, and proactive partner to support the efficient and effective use of technology across the School.
Maintain outstanding and positive customer relations with customers to improve every aspect of the position.
Provide Tier 1 & Tier 2 technical support (desktop support, builds, troubleshooting, printing, network connectivity, etc.) to students, staff, faculty, and research fellows at HKS.
Provide telephone, email, walk-up, and remote support to customers.
Document and communicate all incidents, requests, questions and feedback via the ticket tracking system.
Communicate with customers on incident and request status throughout the entire lifecycle of the issue.
Escalate issues requiring resolution by other members or groups within Information Technology.
Provide updates to customers on the progress of their ticket as well as asking other team members for updates to keep the customer informed on the status of their ticket.
Collaborate as a team member on cross-functional issues and projects within Information Technology.
Contribute to the knowledgebase of the IT Department by creating documentation and case notes, which are technically sound and well written.
Participate in technical and procedural discussions and analyses to define new ideas and approaches for improving the delivery of IT support services.
Maintain the cleanliness and working order of all public computers aroud the campus.
Maintain paper and toner in public printers around campus.
Contribute to the image/reimage of computers, as well as ensuring all laptops are encrypted to protect data.
Deploy new computer purchases/leases and contribute to the removal of old equipment to be recycled or returned to leasing company.
Basic qualifications: (What the candidate must possess in order to be considered for the position)
Working towards completion of Bachelor's degree along with a concentration in management information systems, computer science, computer networking, or computer engineering.
Required Technical Experience, Skills, Knowledge and Abilities Gained through Experience or
Education:
1+ year of experience supporting Windows and Macs.
Demonstrated knowledge of Windows, Mac OS X, and Microsoft Office applications.
Experience with desktops, laptops, smartphones, and tablets.
Additional Qualifications:

Non-Technical Experience, Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
Exceptional customer service orientation.
Strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Ability to communicate technical topics to non-technical personnel.
Ability to work in a team-oriented collaborative environment.
Ability to exercise patience and professionalism in stressful situations.
Ability to be fully productive while working independently and with minimal supervision.
Ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks in a dynamic environment, as there are some times you will need to prioritize certain customers and/or issues to ensure proper workflow.
Ability to maintain and protect sensitive information.
Ability to lift and carry 50 pounds of computer equipment (with the support of your team and/or rollers, if needed).
Technical Experience, Skills, Knowledge and Abilities Gained through Experience or Education:
Experience with the following:
Network communication
Mac operating system
Windows operating system
Virus and malware protection, detection and removal on all platforms.
Computer images
Data backup technologies and services
PC and Mac hardware components and troubleshooting
Printer hardware components and troubleshooting
Usage of multiple types of peripherals and accessories
Wireless and wired networking
Tasks:

Service Center
Provide support to incoming email tickets from students, staff, and faculty members and triage the tickets to the correct team.
Provide face-to-face technical assistance with clients at the Walk-Up Window.
Provide phone technical assistance with clients, while using remote session, if needed.
Assist with any side projects that can improve the Service Center.
Field Support
Make office visits to faculty and staff to fulfill requests and troubleshoot
incidents. Will shadow with full-time staff at the beginning with the expectation the individual will move toward office visits independently.
Software installs/upgrades, hardware troubleshooting, network and local printer installation/troubleshooting.
Assist with hardware moves (laptops, desktops, monitors, printers) from one location to another.
Training
Review and/or determine steps to complete a process or procedure that is regularly performed by HKS IT customers. (For example, setting up two-step verification, connecting to Harvard Secure wireless, setting up HKS email on a device.)
Break down the procedure into actionable steps and relevant information.
Capture screen shots to illustrate the steps in the procedure.
Write a complete document following the documentation guidelines of HKS IT.
Benefits:
Compensation
$20.00 per hour; 35 hour work week
Work Atmosphere
Work with a Supportive Team of Technicians
You will have a very supportive group of technicians with a great amount of experience to help you out! We love it when you ask us questions and provide us with feedback on how we can do better. Every year, our former Co-ops always praise how helpful the Service Center team was during their entire Co-op experience at HKS IT.

Provide IT Support to Students, Staff, and Faculty Members of HKS
Every day feels like a unique day at HKS due to the multi-cultural customers you will work with during your time with us! Do you speak a second language? Great! Very good chance you will be speaking that language with a customer at HKS!

Excellent Co-op Training and Onboarding Program
Every year, we've improved our training process for our Co-ops. We do not want to make you feel you are being tossed into a burning kitchen! You will be trained properly by every member of our staff and allow you to learn at your own pace.

Weekly One-on-One Meetings with your Manager
We'll chat about how you are progressing or if you have any questions or concerns you want to bring up. Meetings help with one's development in their current position and for future opportunities.

Monthly Lunch with our Co-ops and IT Support Management
Once a month, HKS IT Support Management takes our Co-ops out to Lunch as a way to thank you for your time and hard work. This is also a great way for us to listen to your feedback so we become a better IT Department. We've received lots of great feedback from our former Co-ops, which has made us better with time!
Perks
Paid Sick Time
After 90 days of employment, Co-ops can begin using their accrued sick time.

Receive Career Coaching
We help our Co-ops with revising their resumes and help prepare them for their next job.

Advance your Learning and Gain Technical Certifications
Free access to ITProTV and Lynda.com resources that will help you to learn more through online video training courses on a number of relevant technical skills. If you feel that you're ready to take a test to get certified, HKS IT will pay for that exam!

Part-Time Opportunities
If you love working for us, you excelled at your job and you're eligible for part-time employment, we can offer you flexible part-time opportunities if you want to continue building work experience while attending school.

Harvard Shuttle Buses Available Nearby Wentworth / Northeastern Campuses
Do you live on campus? Great!
When you start working for us, you will be given a Harvard ID that allows you to hop in one of our available Harvard shuttle buses that roam around the Wentworth / Northeastern campuses to get to Harvard Kennedy School, absolutely free.
For more info, click here.

Work from Home (Coming Soon)
There is a specific all-day shift that we are looking toward giving our technicians (and Co-ops) the chance to work from home. We are still working on the kinks of this work-life balance perk!

Footprint Project
You are free to share ideas that could benefit the Service Center and we allow you to put that idea into action! We encourage our Co-ops to go "beyond the call-of-duty", which can add additional valuable experience into your resume.

Explore Other Parts of IT
We give our Co-ops the option to visit every part of IT and meet with each department manager to learn more. If interested, they can work and complete small tasks for that department, which adds more valuable experience into your resume.

Attend IT-Related Seminars
We encourage our Co-ops to check out Harvard's IT-Related Seminars. Let us know which ones you would like to attend and we'll add you into them.
Additional Unique Benefits
Do you like to exercise before coming to work?
HKS has an available Shower Room that you can use to wash off the sweat and get ready for the day!

Feeling stressed?
HKS has a Meditation Room you can sit, relax, and meditate your worries away.

Feeling hungry but don't feel like going outside?
HKS has a gorgeous indoors cafeteria where you can purchase food, snacks, beverages, whatever your stomach desires!

Want to sit somewhere else around campus to do your work?
HKS went through a recent campus renovation and there are now many wonderful locations to do your work! Grab your laptop and work wherever you feel comfortable.

Discounts, discounts, and more discounts!
Take advantage of discounts that Harvard offers for outings (sports games, concerts, aquarium, and much more) and even cellular plans if you need to renew your plan!

Coordinator: Elinor Levine

Application Deadline: October 8th 
On-site interviews the week of October 14th 

SUMMARY: 
Formed in 1974, Harvard Management Company ("HMC") manages Harvard University's endowment and related financial assets. Our singular mission is to help ensure Harvard University has the financial resources to maintain and expand its leadership in teaching, learning, and research for future generations. The endowment is managed by a highly experienced generalist investment team whose members each take ownership of the entire portfolio, regardless of asset class. HMC's operational structure brings a wide range of expertise to our portfolio management. These functions include risk management, legal, compliance, finance and accounting, human resources and administrative services as well as information technology to develop and implement the systems necessary to support our investment activities.
 
The Information Technology team is a dedicated group of seasoned professionals that work in close coordination with the business to deliver quality technical solutions.
 
The Co-op will work closely with the application development team as a full-stack developer in the design, testing and construction the core platform used to manage our investments. The candidate must have excellent programming, written communication and problem solving skills.
 
SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES:
Interact with key business users to build a proprietary, collaborative investing tool
Translate application storyboards and use cases into application functionality
Develop, integrate, test and implement application functionality with a focus on superior user experience
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to mitigate and address these issues
Assist IT team in resolving unexpected issues and concerns
Assist in maintaining code quality, unit testing and source control organization
Utilize mathematics and statistics while working on complex financial instruments
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
Excellent academic credentials, majoring in a technical discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Information Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering) at Northeastern University
Coursework in programming/software related classes
Previous co-op or internship experience related to application development a plus
Demonstrated interest in and understanding of the financial markets and or financial technology
Ability to work with a variety of co-workers in a team environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to handle multiple project assignments
 
SKILLS TO BE DEVELOPED DURING CO-OP:
Programming Skills-C#, .Net Framework, Unit Testing, Object Oriented Programming, UML
Relational Database Skills-T-SQL, ORM Technology, ER Diagrams, Data Modeling
Web Application Skills- Angular, .Net Core, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, REST, PrimeNg

Homesite is looking for a co-op to be a fully-integrated member of the State Management team. This position will engage with the Analytics, Underwriting, Catastrophe Management, IT, and Legal departments among others to develop and implement creative solutions to unique and challenging problems. The co-op will gain an understanding of actuarial concepts, business operations, and state regulatory requirements through the completion of state reviews, which involve assessing the performance of the state and recommending pricing and/or product adjustments. The co-op will also assist with various strategic initiatives and gain an understanding of how to navigate the interesting environment of insurance.

Position Overview

The mission of Home Base, A Red Sox Foundation and Massachusetts General Hospital Program, is to heal the "invisible wounds" of Veterans, Service Members and their families, including post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and traumatic brain injury (TBI), by connecting them to world class care. Home Base provides clinical care and support services, as well as community education, and innovative research. We provide clinical care to currently serving men and women (Active duty, National Guard, and Reserve), Veterans, and their families.
 
Home Base seeks to hire a data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) co-op for Jan-Jun 2020 who will support a variety of database management, ETL scripting, and data validation tasks that include but are not limited to: querying databases, restructuring data, performing manual ETL tasks, automating ETL tasks using tools and custom scripting, cleaning and validating data, documenting data systems, and constructing reports and/or dashboards. The qualified candidate will be highly detail-oriented and have a strong interest in and aptitude for data management and infrastructure. Some specific focus areas would be determined based on the candidate's skills and interests.
 
The successful candidate must be highly organized, motivated, and able to thrive in a fast-paced team environment and must enjoy the challenge of a dynamic environment with evolving needs. It is extremely important that the candidate possess the ability to carefully keep track of multiple work streams.

Principal Responsibilities
Utilizing, improving and constructing ETL tools
Running current SQL, Python, PHP, and/or Tableau Prep ETL scripts.
Improving and further integrating these scripts further into various data pipelines to achieve greater efficiency, reliability, and functionality.
Constructing new ETL tools as necessary/able, especially with respect to a couple major upcoming platform moves (to SQL Server and Salesforce)
Data Cleaning
Writing queries and scripts to identify data quality problems
Investigating the root cause of data quality problems
Working with appropriate team members to determine appropriate data remediation and process improvement plans
Writing queries and scripts as needed to repair data in bulk
Additional Responsibilities
Support data querying, processing, analysis and reporting for both regular and ad-hoc requests from clinical, executive, and external audiences
Create and maintain data documentation
Support special projects that requires additional resources, such as
Creating a tool to track staff productivity
Creating the data infrastructure to support new diagnostic equipment and tests
Skills and Competencies Required
Background
Graduate student or advanced undergraduate in Health Informatics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or a similar field
Familiarity with behavioral health clinical practice and/or research preferred
 
Technical
Procedural programming aptitude and experience with Python. PHP or other languages (e.g. C, C++, Java, JavaScript, Visual Basic, MATLAB) are a plus.
Knowledge of relational database platforms and concepts of database and data model design
Comfortable extracting data from and loading data into sources ranging from an Enterprise Data Warehouse to an Excel or text file, using built-in tools or custom-written ETL scripts
Knowledge of data aggregation and transformation processes (e.g. pivot, merge, union, hierarchical grouping, aggregation functions)
Above average SQL skills (e.g. familiar with subqueries, multiple joins, and grouping). Specifically, MySQL and/or SQL Server experience a plus.
Experience in web application design/programming/testing or Salesforce a plus.
 
Professional
Ability to interpret and follow-through on data requirements and with strong attention to detail
Strength in independently validating and debugging code and analyses, including consulting documentation, Stack Exchange, etc.
Demonstrates personal initiative and time management skills, as well as the ability to work effectively as part of a team
Ability to meet deadlines and multitask efficiently
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Interest in identifying process improvement opportunities is a plus.
Organization: Home Base Program, Massachusetts General Hospital

To be considered, please apply directly on the IBM Career Site: http://adtrk.tw/tp/rj6.oTplD_I.K

As a Hardware Developer at IBM, you'll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today's market.

Your Role and Responsibilities:

Work Locations Will Be: Houston, TX; Tucson, AZ; Rochester, MN; Hopewell Junction, NY
Position will be January-December 2020

IBM Systems has openings for Hardware Development Engineers to develop, test, and provide client support for the hardware, firmware, and semiconductors that comprise our industry leading IBM Systems products. We are a world class development team that pioneers innovations for the cutting
edge microprocessors and hardware used in IBM Systems including IBM Storage, IBM Power Systems and IBM Z mainframes. Development engineers participate in various aspects of the development and test process, such as:
System and microprocessor architecture
Microprocessor circuit design, logic design, and functional verification
Physical design and layout
Electronic Design Automation
Signal integrity and analysis
Microelectronics packaging
Materials analysis and characterization
Mechanical design and technology integration
Thermal design and testing
Voltage regulation and power delivery
Performance modeling
Processor and system test and validation
Firmware test and development
Supplier qualification and technology convergence
Client and field engineering support

Ideal candidates will possess enthusiasm for design, test, and communication skills. Candidates with at least three to six months of team based work experience with hardware products are preferred but NOT required.

Candidates chosen to become a part of our world class development teams will help advance IBM's leadership to develop the highest performing computers and game changing hardware solutions.

Come THINK with us!

Required Professional and Technical Expertise:
Fundamental education in hardware or firmware design or test
Strong communication skills
Passion to pursue career path in engineering

Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise:

Matriculation at in an accredited Bachelor's Degree program in the following areas: 
Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Physics, related majors

Being You @ IBM:

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

About IBM
Do Your Best Work Ever!
IBM's greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

International Telecommunications Communications company offering a wide array of emerging and mature solutions in areas of Mobile Roaming, IoT, and Voice/Data services
Opportunity to gain real world, hands on experience building solutions for operating, monitoring and managing carrier grade networks. You would gain exposure to both Commercial and Open Source OSS tools along with its application as solutions in one of the world's largest international telecommunications networks.
Wide array of Mobile voice and data technologies to learn and experience from a support, planning, and design perspective.
Possible exposure to career track in our Solutions Engineering, Systems Engineering, or Voice/Data Engineering teams
Partner with and get exposed with various groups within the company.  Product Management, Commercial Operations, or Sales
Culturally and professionally diverse group of mentors whom you can learn from, and build connections for future success in an environment that encourages individual initiative.
Culturally and geographically diverse customer base. Learn how to work in a truly international business environment. 
Job duties and responsibilities include: 
You will be involved in the evaluation and implementation support for new network architecture and designs for new products and services.
Collaborate with R&D, IS and external vendors for upgrades/changes to device hardware and software (Firmware/OS and application upgrades).
Support capacity management efforts and provide feedback for capacity concerns and recommend actions.
Manage and verify device configurations, and implement updates to standard configuration as needed.
You will be involved in the evaluation and implementation of automation frameworks for network devices as well as network monitoring applications.
You will be involved in the evaluation and possible implementation of frameworks/solutions for Network Data Management. 
Qualifications:
Pursuit of or holding a Bachelor/Graduate degree in IT, CS or EE related technical degree.
Strong understanding of IP networking concepts as it relates to switching and routing.
Strong understanding of Diameter, SS7 (ISUP & MAP, SIGTRAN), SMS, GTP and how these protocols apply to roaming scenarios.
Strong understanding of network monitoring models, protocols and tools.
Strong scripting skills in Linux environment with high interest/focus towards automating tasks.
Technical problem solving skills and good analytical skills.
Self-directed, motivated to learn, and not afraid to take initiative on new technology.
Experience working with a CLEC, ILED, LD, MNO or equivalent facilities a plus.

HubSpot is looking for students who are interested in solving complex problems and being part of one of the fastest growing, most ambitious engineering teams in the world. HubSpot engineering co-ops work with our engineers in small teams with minimal process and are given the freedom to do big things and own the software they create.

As an engineer you will get a MacBook Air and a GitHub Enterprise account on your first day.  Working closely with your team, you will start shipping production code right away. You'll see that our technology stack is diverse, and we are looking to fill roles for a variety of projects including:
- Middle tier APIs & web services in Java (DropWizard) 
- Dynamic web applications written in JavaScript (React, ECMAScript 6, Sass)
- Core data and infrastructure development with HBase, Elastic Search, ZooKeeper, Redis, MySQL, and Memcached.
- Running, monitoring, and deploying to thousands of servers in multiple data centers & the cloud (DevOps & SRE)

Curious if you're a good fit? Here are some of the skill sets that some of our teams look for:
- You should have web development experience (projects like mobile apps, web apps, or games beyond coursework is a plus) 
- You have an unmatched curiosity to learn and grow their skills with new challenges
- You demonstrate a strong understanding of HubSpot's business, products, and culture
- You possess great communication and collaboration skills
- You also have confidence taking on big initiatives and leading projects in a fast-paced environment
- You are a currently enrolled student in an undergraduate/graduate institution or program.
- You have full-time availability to work in Cambridge, MA between January to June 2020.

Research to be conducted in Diana Prata Lab:  https://dpratalab.wordpress.com/

The intern will work on an individual research project, supervised by Professor Arnab Jana and Professor Ronita Bardhan in the Centre for Urban Science and Engineering. Software Development Internship
Company Profile:
The company specialises in providing a technology platform for the distribution of search, contextual and domain matched internet text ads, more commonly known as ?sponsored links/ads?.
 
Search Feed Engine is the flagship software/come service ? a technology platform that allows us to control both the quality and volume of search queries being submitted from website publisher networks to advertisers.
 
The Search Feed Engine platform was developed in house by our technical development team, and we have commercialised this platform in the US market, with a vigorous and aggressive marketing strategy.
 
Training & Experience Provided:
The interns will receive training and exposure to the rationale and strategy that defines the development elements and system as a whole. This will lead to an understanding of online marketing strategy and business objectives of the systems being developed.

A centralised traffic and revenue reporting and tracking system integrated with 2, 3 4, & 5 below:
Arbitrage system that is integrated with Search Engine PPC bid management integrated with 1 & 3
A parked domains system ? similar to sedo.co.uk integrated with 1 and 2
A performance marketing system ? similar to cj.com but integrated with 1 and 5
A permission marketing system similar to emailcash.com.au but integrated with 4 and 1
The Intern will be exposed to senior developers on a daily basis and will learn how to work in a team, how to work individually, and will be exposed to all the systems used in the business at one level or another. All development is carried out in a customised framework designed by the Head of Development.
 
Requirements:

Personal Liability + Travel + Medical ($16 AUD per week)
Personal Liability Only ($7 AUD per week)

Refund

isee (www.isee.ai) is building self-driving vehicles with both enormous long term potential and meaningful near-term applications. The isee team consists of engineers, technologists, scientists from MIT, Harvard, and CMU, who have worked at leading organizations such as Google, Amazon, and DJI etc. isee is headquartered in Cambridge, MA with offices in Pittsburgh, PA and Dallas, TX.

This position is based at isee's primary office in Cambridge, MA. isee is located at The Engine, which provides space and advising to a number of startups. isee pairs each co-op with a mentor for 1:1 guidance on assigned projects. isee has a go-getter culture - individuals are encouraged to propose new ideas and be in charge of their own work. We are also a very fun office and there are always sweets (especially cakes) going around. The Engine provides complimentary snacks and organizes pizza lunches, cookouts, game nights, and various other activities with other startups that share the space.

Work with supplier and drive the implementation of development into production.

Excellent communication skills

Recommended

Experience with heavy truck

About iRhythm:

iRhythm is a leading digital healthcare company focused on the way cardiac arrhythmias are clinically diagnosed by combining our wearable biosensing technology with powerful cloud-based data analytics and machine- learning capabilities. Our goal is to be the leading provider of first-line ambulatory ECG monitoring for patients at risk for arrhythmias. iRhythm's continuous ambulatory monitoring has already put over 1 million patients and their doctors on a shorter path to what they both need ? answers.

About this internship:

Engineers at iRhythm work passionately to deliver innovative solutions that improve the quality of healthcare and the patient experience. As an Engineering Intern at iRhythm, you will contribute directly to near-term commercialization efforts for our next-generation wearable bio-sensors, collaborating alongside a small team of multi-disciplinary engineers experienced in bringing medical devices to market. You will be treated as a regular member of the engineering team, inclusive of the associated projects, deliverables and accountability.

About You

You appreciate producing quality software and understand the value of requirements based testing. You have a desire to gain a deep, practical understanding of how devices work and how they fail. You have strong debugging skills that help you systematically troubleshoot unfamiliar issues across hardware and software boundaries. You enjoy writing impactful software to automate repetitive tasks.

What You will be Doing

Working inside of our test framework to implement automated tests for our embedded system
Learning system level knowledge of how our firmware (embedded software) performs
Gaining familiarity with requirements, test cases and manual test methods
Improving your programming skill through code review and test development tasks
Working with other engineers to understand and correct bugs
Learning about medical device software development lifecycles
 
Desired Qualifications

Pursuing a degree or advanced degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent
Detail-oriented with excellent troubleshooting and critical thinking skills
Proficient in Python and familiarity with coding standards (PEP 8)
Familiarity with software debugging is beneficial
Experience with oscilloscopes and other test equipment
Familiarity with version control systems (git) and release methodologies
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively in a cross-functional environment
Care just as much about doing things right as getting things done
 
Perks

iRhythm is conveniently located in the SOMA district of San Francisco. Free shuttles are offered from CalTrain, BART, the Transbay Terminal and the Ferry Building to the office. You will never go hungry with regular company-sponsored lunches, a well-stocked snack kitchen and numerous restaurants within walking distance. iRhythm offers a competitive compensation package and you may be eligible for up to a $2,000 moving allowance!
 
How to Apply

If the position feels like a fit, we are excited to hear from you. When you apply, please include:
Your resume
A code sample (Python preferred, but we'll accept other languages too)
A cover letter: a short explanation of your background, relevant experience (links to past projects are always helpful) and what excites you about iRhythm.

Engineering at Klaviyo

Klaviyo is a Boston startup located right in the heart of downtown Boston.  We craft software helping thousands of e-commerce companies to have engaging relationships with hundreds of millions of consumers.  We love taking on tough engineering problems and look for full-stack engineers who specialize in certain areas but are passionate about building, owning & scaling features end to end from scratch and breaking through any obstacle or technical challenge in their way. We push each other to move out of our comfort zone, learn new technologies and work hard to ensure each day is better than the last.

What you'll be doing:
Wholly owning features that thousands of our customers rely on daily to reach 100,000,000+ of consumers to drive their business forward.
Working on crafting our highly scalable real-time data pipeline that processes billions of events weekly across data sets growing to petabyte scale.
Working on a deep analytics system that provides insight into hundreds of terabytes of data.
Be responsible for the mission, technical direction, and operations of projects that have an immediate impact.
Helping architect and design robust and high-performance data processing and storage systems leveraging new databases to serve different internal and external use cases. Contribute to open-source data processing technologies.
Contributing to the company as a subject matter expert in multiple areas, constantly pushing yourself to be a better engineer and to level up all of your peers within your team and within Klaviyo.
We'd love to hear from you if you:
Have experience building products that matter and pushing yourself and your team to be better engineers and build a product with passionate advocates
Enjoy working with new technologies ranging from the frontend to backend, and are particularly passionate and an expert in multiple stack areas. You show this by having strong and opinionated experience with various technologies and know-how to pick the right tool for any job
Love digging into performance and scalability issues to drive breakthrough solutions-- whether it's a slow loading UI or too many clicks in a workflow, a database query timing out, or a queue that just won't drain. You recognize all problems can be solved
Enjoy shipping code early & often in an agile fashion, pairing with product management to craft better software by soliciting feedback from thousands of end-users
Like working on small, autonomous agile teams. At Klaviyo, you will have ownership of features, but you'll collaborate with everyone to make sure we produce the right solution
Technologies we use
Python, Django, Celery
Kafka, Flink
MySQL, PostgreSQL, Cassandra, RabbitMQ, Redis
HTML, JavaScript, LESS, Backbone.js, React
Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, Aurora, etc.)
Terraform, Ansible, Packer, Fabric, ZooKeeper, Kubernetes and other infrastructure management and DevOps tools

Life at Klaviyo

Klaviyo is a team of people who are motivated by growth.

It's what we help our customers do: grow their businesses by making it possible and easy for them to use their data to power better marketing.

It's how we behave as individuals: we're all deeply passionate about learning.

It's how we manage our business: we have thousands of paying customers, we're profitable, and we're growing insanely fast.

And it's what our culture is all about. Working at Klaviyo means you'll work on things you never imagined you would; you'll grow in ways you didn't consider possible, and you'll do the best work of your career with people who are just as motivated and talented as you are.

Your curiosity has led you this far, so if this sounds like your ideal place to work, apply now!

No phone calls or agency submissions, please.

The KAUST Clean Combustion Research Center (CCRC) is seeking a candidate to aid in the development of a cyber-based infrastructure for combustion related data and modeling. The candidate will develop software tools and hardware infrastructure to drive technical advances including: set up cloud-based data storage, data-use software, data archiving, and data curation. The candidate will develop new software incorporating new uncertainty-analysis features, experimental templates, open-access formats, and open- source software for data mining and predictive simulation. The candidate will receive scientific guidance in developing the various aspects of the combustion cyber-infrastructure, but must have the appropriate skills, technical expertise, and prior experience to be successful.

40 hours/week

Website: https://ccrc.kaust.edu.sa/Pages/Home.aspx

Skills to be Gained by the End of Co-op:
Build a cloud-server database and tools of managing experimental and modeling combustion data.
Submit legacy data and develop new data submission software and forms
Develop software codes to integrate existing modeling and experimental tools
Develop new data models, in collaboration with the community, for transport properties, reaction classes, a broader range of experiments, computed quantum-chemistry results, k(T,P) data and calculations, and representations of their uncertainties.
Provide open-source tools for user and third-party development
Previous experience in developing user-friendly software tools based on simple and elegant codes
Programming in FORTRAN, C, C#, Python,Matlab, and other common languages
Ability to work in a team environment and to consider customer needs
Travel Advisory:
Please note, this co-op opportunity is located in a high-risk destination as defined by the university's Policy on International Travel

Northeastern Research Intern:

LifeYield is looking for a Research Intern for Spring 2020. This unique position will provide an opportunity to work as part of a multi-disciplinary software development team building complex optimization models and algorithms for investment industry clients. The successful candidate will help research and validate alternative algorithmic approaches, ready for inclusion in detailed software specifications and subsequently LifeYield's various products.

Responsibilities:
-Maintain a deep understanding of LifeYield's algorithmic engine.
-Research the applicability of various mathematical optimization, linear programming and other algorithmic techniques in the areas of investment management covered by LifeYield products.
-Design and prototype new algorithms based on LifeYield's product roadmap, helping to determine the most beneficial enhancements and the most appropriate implementation approaches.
-Convert/interpret algorithms and other requirements documents into software code.
-Participate in the development of software specifications and test cases to move prototyped features into production code, working closely with LifeYield's Product and Development teams.

Requirements:
-Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or other related discipline, combined with strong mathematical programming and algorithmic skills.
-Strong quantitative and statistical skills.
-Knowledge of and experience with Python.
-Able to work independently, and within a collaborative team environment.
-Excellent interpersonal skills, organized and detail-oriented.
-Familiarity with MATLAB a plus.

Responsibilities:
* Learn and apply project high-level and detailed business requirements
* Draft test artifacts, including Test Plans, Business Test Scenarios and Requirements Traceability Matrices
*Identification and creation of reusable test data, particularly for automated testing
*Develop quality assurance standards and track quality assurance activities
*Perform and document software tests and report problems into issue management system
*Candidate will be required to learn new product features and build tests for those features, automate existing tests, and write system-level tests of database functionality in the areas of performance


Qualifications:
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related technical discipline is   required.
* Cooperation/Teamwork - conveys a sense of teamwork, Self-motivated, detail-oriented
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Motivation and ability to learn is crucial and highly regarded 


Desired Experience/Knowledge:
* Experience with software testing and test plan design
* Experience developing and executing automated and manual test scripts for requirement validation, integration, regression,  performance and usability testing
* Experience with change management and defect tracking tools
* Working knowledge of the Database (preferably SQL Server). Should be able to write SQL scripts
* Strong programming background (Java Script, Python, VBScript, C++ or C#) and familiarity with HTML, CSS, XML, JSON is preferred
* Hands on experience with automation software testing tools (Such HP test tools/Selenium/Ranorex)
* Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills and possess team player attitude
* Ability to multitask and prioritize.

Agile Quality Engineering Co-Op

Lexington Solutions, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Boston Capital, is looking for a co-op student with a true, demonstrable passion for software quality and testing, both in and out of the office. We work in a collaborative, open space environment with a group of talented individuals who are all passionate about Agile and building quality software.

Liberating Technologies, Inc. (LTI) is a leading supplier of upper-limb prosthetic devices for adults and children.  LTI is a subsidiary of College Park Industries (CPI), which specializes in lower limb prosthetics. Located in Holliston, MA, LTI is a 20-employee team that is part of the 100-employee CPI company. The LTI engineering research division is currently focused on product development of novel prosthetic and orthotic technologies to increase mobility, advance control, and improve patient quality of life.
The LTI co-op opportunity will provide exposure to various technologies, and mentorship in skills, tools, and principles of research engineering.  The job would assist in various facets of multiple externally-funded research programs.

Current projects include:
+ Design and development of prosthetic terminal devices and active powered orthotics
+ Wireless control and sensor system for prostheses
+ Development of novel upper-limb terminal devices
+ Video game interface for prosthetic training of electromyography (EMG) control signals
+ Voice recognition control of prostheses
+ Design of novel prosthetic foot and knee prostheses
Mentorship Opportunities:
+ Research and development process
+ Electro-mechanical design and prototyping
+ 3D modeling and printing
+ Agile Scrum methodologies
+ GIT tools for revision control
-----
The Research Assistant Engineer role supports engineering projects by adapting and applying engineering techniques; conducting tests and inspections; and communicating data and concepts.

Functions of the position  include (but are not limited to):
+ Electro-mechanical design, assembly, and testing
+ Experimental data collection and analysis
+ Sensor testing and calibration
+ System root-cause analysis 
+ Prototype development

Qualifications: 
+ Knowledge of engineering design principles
+ Confidence in Matlab and/or MS Excel for data analysis and presentation
+ Experience in LabVIEW graphical interfaces and data acquisition
+ Adaptability, and a willingness to learn new skills
+ Able to work in a fast-paced and variable work environment

Additional Qualifications (preferred, but not necessary):
 + General tool competency, including the use of drills, mills, and other industrial/mechanical shop tools
 + Basic electrical skills, including the use of microcontrollers for prototyping circuits and interfacing sensors
 + Rapid prototyping / 3D printing experience
Optional Qualifications
+ Software/Firmware development (C/C++)
+ Android or iOS app development

We are accepting applications on a rolling basis.
