When you enter a cybersecurity at Liberty Mutual Insurance, you'll find the same dynamic environment and challenges as within other organizations. Yet you'll find something more: an opportunity to apply your analytic and technical skills to a company renowned for its integrity and dedication to developing industry-leading finance talent directly out of college. 
 
Our IT Audit department is responsible for auditing Liberty Mutual Group's internal control systems as well as supplementing the work of our external auditors, acting as independent consultants to operating managers, and investigating matters of dishonesty and fraud.  You will assist management by performing risk assessments and evaluating critical business processes.  As part of our team environment, you will complete audit steps using our customized IT audit approach and electronic work paper system.  Key responsibilities include interviewing personnel, performing testwork, analyzing results, and communicating audit issues. 
 
You will participate in a six month co-op program specializing in helping you to develop a broad knowledge base in cybersecurity and how it is used within the insurance industry. You will collaborate on project teams that conduct independent assessments of Liberty Mutual's information systems, IT infrastructure, and IT internal control environment through the execution of risk analysis, control evaluation, and innovative audit testing procedures and techniques.  This position will assist IT Internal Audit in developing next-gen cyber security and cloud security analysis, testing, and continuous monitoring processes to evaluate Liberty Mutual's cloud and cybersecurity control environments.Our goal is to provide you with a positive experience, filled with "real-world" projects that provide you with the opportunity to contribute through challenging work.
 
This co-op will also allow you to explore Liberty Mutual as a possible full time employer. During your co-op, you will receive all the tools you need to be successful ? this includes on-the-job training, a mentor from the team, meaningful work and management support. You will also participate in educational and social programs that will accelerate your development, as well as an online community of interns that will provide a collegial environment to help with your transition from school to work.
 
Responsibilities:
Assist in the auditing of new and existing information system applications and operating environments.
Participate on audit project teams to complete risk assessments and control evaluations for IT areas under review.
Use company and audit software to analyze data, set audit scopes and complete testwork.
Communicate audit findings in meetings and formal reports.
Assist in the interpretation and communication of information to management.
Qualifications:
Undergraduate working towards a bachelor's degree with a minimum of 3.3 cumulative GPA
Must have permanent work authorization in the United States
0-2 years of professional experience
Management Information Systems (MIS), Computer Science, or equivalent major
Strong interpersonal, communication, organizational and leadership skills
Attention to detail in a fast-paced work environment, and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent written and oral communication skills required.
Basic knowledge of IT cyber security principles and practices, strategies and methodologies
Exposure to developing cloud-hosted, security automation using JavaScript, or Python
Basic knowledge of network security engineering and administration concepts
Basic knowledge of Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery process and tools, testing frameworks and practices
Basic understanding of cloud networking concepts and various network security controls including firewalls, IDPS and proxy
Exposure to AWS, Azure and cloud orchestration tools
Overview:
 At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives.  We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.
 We're dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

In addition to applying in NUCareers, please also apply on the Liberty Mutual website at this link: lmi.co/undergraduate

LightRiver Software's industry-leading netFLEX® telecommunications management system simplifies and improves the operation of transport networks. It seamlessly integrates multiple technologies and multi-generational equipment from multiple vendors with real-time Fault, Configuration, Accounting, Performance and Security management. We are looking to add to our talented development team with individuals ready to take the challenge of the evolving telecommunications industry. As a team member you will be responsible for all aspects of adding new features to the system including design, coding, and testing. New features can include new communication protocols such as REST with JSON data structures to managing new Dense wavelength division multiplexing (DWDM) switches.
 
The Co-Op Software Developer will have responsibility for developing, testing, implementing, and maintaining software applications. 

Essential Functions 
The netFLEX application is a very scalable LINUX application written in C language which utilizes many LINUX features such as inter-process communications (IPC), network protocols, and databases (both relational and networking). The Cloud based GUI is presented in HTML5 and Javascript.
- Knowledge of LINUX/UNIX and C language would be a strong skill needed.
- Strong communications skills will be helpful to becoming a team member.
- All aspects of the Agile Software Development approach will be utilized as a team member
- Understanding of Apache, HTML, Javascript, and CGI would be helpful

Education and Experience
Bachelors of Science Degree in Computer Science or related degree, or in progress, preferred.
0-2 years of experience working developing software, preferred.
A strong background in LINUX / C development.
Knowledge of telecommunications, protocols, and databases is a plus.
Understanding of software testing procedures and methodologies.
Knowledge of Network Management
Ability to work independently and be self-directed.
Demonstrated communication skills needed for working with the development team and for customer facing assignments.
Strong attention to detail. 

Other Requirements
Satisfactory results of drug screen and background check

About LightRiver
LightRiver is the premier provider of next generation, multi-vendor, Factory Built Networks® and netFLEX®, vendor neutral, Optical Domain Control Software solutions. LightRiver is expert in Packet Optical, DWDM/ROADM, MPLS and Carrier Ethernet systems and designs, engineers, commissions, automates and supports next generation, software controlled, transport networks for mission-critical clients that require the highest capacity, reliability, resiliency and manageability that today's optical communications technology can deliver. LightRiver delivers unique value with turnkey hardware and software solutions, carrier-grade quality and unparalleled customer care in multi-technology networking.

Lola.com makes Agile Travel Management real by providing a super simple way to manage, book and report on business travel, saving employers and travelers time and money. Happy employee travel experiences within a policy can be set up in five minutes. Lola.com uses machine learning and 24/7 support to help travelers easily book trips, while empowering managers to create policies, view budgets and expenditures, and monitor their globetrotting team efficiently. Based in Boston, the company was founded in 2015 by Paul English, co-founder of the travel booking site KAYAK, and is led by CEO Mike Volpe, previously CMO at HubSpot. For more information, visit https://www.lola.com/ and connect on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

We're looking for a talented engineer to join our engineering team and help build a fast, scalable, reliable infrastructure to support our product. We welcome diversity and actively seek applicants who can bring a variety of backgrounds and perspectives to the team.
As an engineering co op at Lola, you'll collaborate with teams from across the company (from other engineers to our marketing and service groups). This work might include projects like integrating a third-party data partner, optimizing existing code to make it more performant, helping build out our BI tools, creating the APIs for new features, or developing new strategies for managing our Elasticsearch stack. We are looking for someone with an appetite for growth, and we offer the opportunity to learn directly from our architect, our CTO, and a highly skilled group of engineers.
Familiarity with frameworks like Flask or Django, GraphQL, the AWS ecosystem, and Redis would be a plus, but we also value the ability and desire to jump in and learn quickly, even without prior experience with a specific technology. You will join one of our product teams and contribute production code that makes our product better.  Check out our stack here.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, strong communication skills (across different audiences), and the desire and ability to self-start and time-manage in a fast-paced environment would set you up for success in this role.
As a team, we value curiosity, generosity, and passion. We believe that we're stronger as a team, and we seek out opportunities to learn from each other and to share what we know with the rest of the team. We also believe that focusing on the customer and developing a sense of empathy and compassion for our customers is key to the success of our product and our engineering organization. 
At Lola.com, we celebrate diversity and consider it key to our success as a team and a company. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment of mutual respect for all employees.

LineVision is an innovative Boston-based smart grid company with an advanced sensor and analytics solution that gives electric utilities more reliability, capacity, flexibility and resiliency on their transmission lines.
We are seeking a self-motivated, detail-oriented student to work with LineVision's transmission line telemetry data and public/third-party weather data to improve our core data delivery infrastructure and build value-added applications. This individual will primarily be working with Python and SQL.

Key responsibilities include:
Improving the infrastructure around the real-time delivery of our dynamic line rating data sets
Building data anomaly detection algorithms and reporting, helping ensure we're delivering quality data to our clients
Building and internal processes to calibrate data coming in from sensors in the field
Implement / improve analytical models reporting on transmission line health
This individual will report to LineVision's Director of Data Analytics and Operations and work from LineVision's Somerville office.

Requirements:
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science/Analytics, Information Systems, Math, Physics, etc.
Strong practical Python experience, SQL is a plus. Candidates will be required to take an at-home Python based technical assessment as part of the hiring process.
Experience working in a cloud infrastructure, AWS is a plus
Strong statistical and data analysis skills and experience working with large data numerical sets
An understanding of object-oriented design principles, relational databases, and distributed software design
Solid working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and Google G Suite
Disciplined testing, quality control and release management practices
Ability to work and think independently and manage a project to successful completion

Masa Israel is an agency that offers a fee-based comprehensive program including your co-op and housing along with a number of other services.   

About
MASA Israel Journey: The Gateway to Long-Term Israel Programs offers over 160 different gap year, academic, career development and volunteer opportunities in Israel. Programs range from 5-10 months and allow participants to engage with Israeli society and make an impact through interpersonal relationships, service in diverse communities and internships in Israeli organizations. All MASA programs include intensive Hebrew instruction, trips around Israel, encounters with Israeli peers and supplementary cultural programming and leadership development. MASA provides grants and scholarships toward the cost of the programs depending on the participant's age and the length of the program.

Program Fee: $7,350 (50% discount for students of Jewish descent)

Fee includes:
* Housing in Tel-Aviv or Jerusalem
* Logistical assistance with travel visa and insurance
* Mentorship from industry leaders
* Networking and social opportunities in one of
the world's hottest business (and beach) scenes
* Excursions in Tel Aviv, Jerusalem, and Haifa
* Hebrew language class

Application Process:
1. Submit Resume and Cover Letter on NUCareers through Co-op Coordinator Michelle Zaff
2. Michelle Zaff will send your application to MASA
3. MASA will connect with you directly

EMC Corporation is the world?s leading information infrastructure company, and spearheads technological innovation in the areas of storage, security, virtualization, management, recovery, computational infrastructure and Big Data.  The company is ranked as the sixth largest software company in the world, and the seventh largest IT company in terms of market value. In 2006, following several Israeli acquisitions, EMC established the EMC Development Center, which joined the existing Sales and Services Organization, in Petach Tikva. In 2011, this Center became the EMC Israel Center of Excellence (COE), headquartered in Herzliya, and managed by Dr. Orna Berry, Corporate Vice President, former chief Scientist of Israel. Several months later, the COE opened a strategic R&D branch in Be?er Sheva, and became the first multinational company in Israel with presence in the Negev, and in the past year opened yet another center in the northern city of Haifa. Over the last few years, the CoE has registered over 200 patents in Israel.

Job Description:
Students MUST possess EXCELLENT writing skills and an interest in technology!

Are you entrepreneurial, tech-savy, and a great communicator?  Have you always wanted to work at a fast-growing startup?  Are you excited to learn from successful entrepreneurs and world-class technical talent?  If you answered "yes" to all of these questions, you might be the next Product Management co-op at mabl!

mabl was founded in January of 2017 after the founders left Google (their previous startup, Stackdriver, had many connections to NEU and was ultimately acquired by Google in September of 2014). The company is focused on making software developers more productive by automating the process of testing software.  mabl's cloud-based product is built on cutting-edge machine learning technologies.  The company is backed by top-tier venture capitalists and the current team (60 people) works out of a beautiful office in the heart of Downtown Crossing.

Product Management co-ops play a critical role in evolving mabl's product based on customer needs and market opportunities. Responsibilities may include, but will not be limited to, the following:
- Serving as a "voice of the user" in product planning; capturing user feedback and sharing with Engineering
- Defining user stories and requirements for new features
- Working with designers and engineers to design new features
- Writing and publishing product updates and release notes
- Conducting market research (including competitive research)
- Writing and publishing end user documentation
- Providing user support
- Monitoring adoption/usage trends and developing appropriate plans to address any issues
- Working with engineering to triage and resolve product issues

This role requires strong technical aptitude, basic working knowledge of HTML and CSS, and a passion for building great products .

Lutron Electronics is a high growth, well-established leader in the lighting control industry. We use cutting edge technologies in innovative ways to improve the visual environment of residential and commercial buildings. New product development along with market creation and expansion continue to fuel our rapid growth. This is your opportunity to join us on the cusp of continued double-digit market growth per year.
 
As a Lutron Engineering Co-op, you will work in a hands-on environment alongside more senior electrical and computer engineers, mechanical engineers, manufacturing, quality engineers, and technicians. Involvement in the cross-functional team allows you to interact with many people from various departments. Using cutting-edge technology, co-ops apply engineering design to complex lighting and visual environment control systems. Our product development teams have responsibility for carrying the product from original design concepts through research and development to manufacturing finished products and systems.
 
Electrical Engineering co-ops use a variety of technologies including analog circuit design, RF communication, power electronics, and digital circuit design. 
 
We are always looking for opportunities to improve our products and implement new technologies as they apply to our business. If you have enjoyed your project-based classes, you will love the working environment at Lutron.
 
New areas of development at Lutron include radio frequency communication systems, energy management systems, "smart home" systems, compact DC motor/planetary gear assemblies, and miniaturized energy management control products.
 
We make every effort to give our co-ops real, impactful work. They are expected to learn to think and design like full time engineers and at the end of their term, they are given the opportunity to present their work to several senior members of our engineering team.  A co-op position at Lutron offers you a chance to experience the business world first-hand and to learn how Lutron works as a company. You will have the opportunity to meet various people within many departments and to learn about the exciting career possibilities Lutron has to offer. We consider co-ops very valuable in our search for outstanding future members of our team and pride ourselves in providing outstanding work experiences to students from universities around the world.

Previous co-ops in our Cambridge, MA office have:
Designed, fabricated and assembled lighting control PCBs
Troubleshot analog circuits and designed solutions to problems
Tested and validated new product circuits on the bench using various engineering equipment
Invented methods of calibration for advanced lighting systems
Designed and set-up automated bench test systems
 
Things you will learn (If you don't know them already)
Surface mount soldering skills
Advanced circuit debugging techniques
Using bench top equipment such as oscilloscope, waveform generator and power supply
Practical circuit design including layout implications, component selection and how to build a circuit that works under almost any conditions
 
Qualifications:
EE (hardware focused) majors with a 3.2 minimum GPA and at least 4 completed semesters. We seek talented, success-minded people with the desire and ability to make things happen. We look for engineers with not only great understanding of the theory but the desire and ability to turn the theory into a tangible product. Teamwork and hands-on engineering greet you every day on the job.

Job opening: Image reconstruction and data analytics
 
Job description and requirement:
We have multiple ongoing projects that require raw data manipulation, image handling, and image reconstruction for nuclear medicine and molecular imaging applications. This opening requires knowledge in mathematics and programming in MATLAB, and C++. Note that GPU programing, machine learning, and/or physics computer modeling is a huge plus. Experience in optics in general or laser optics in particular is extra.
 
Learning outcome: Students will gain knowledge about nuclear medicine imaging modalities and system design and will have chance to experiment with fundamental and high-end detector components of PET, and SPECT systems. They will also learn how to design an experiment or simulation, write manuscripts and research proposals.

Length of the project: Some of the projects span over multiple years which require simulations and modeling in different stages. Short-term and long-term contributions are possible. If the student contributes to the project, his/her name will be added to the research paper(s) even if his/her time in the lab is finished and the project keeps ongoing.

Mentoring: The PI and current lab members will be helping the student to accomplish his/her work. Lab meetings and one-to-one meeting between the PI and the student will be held. But the PI's door is always open for any questions or concerns.


Lab description:
In Sabet-lab for radiation physics and instrumentation, we focus on developing high-performance and advanced radiation imaging systems by rigorously studying and addressing fundamental limitations of today's imaging systems. One specific research area in our lab is fabrication of new category of radiation detectors using ultra short laser pulses for Positron Emission Tomography (PET), Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT), Computed Tomography (CT) applications, and intraoperative nuclear probes. We developed Laser-Induced Optical Barriers (LIOB) technique where a high-power pulsed laser is tightly focused inside the bulk of a radiation scintillator crystal, causing a local modification of the crystal structure. The modification is manifested by a change in refractive index (RI) of the material, where the modified region (called Optical Barrier) will have a RI lower than that of the unmodified crystal. Using the LIOB technique we place a pattern of optical barriers to manipulate scintillation light spread inside the radiation detector to achieve high spatial resolution radiation detector and hence improve the medical image quality.
 
Ongoing projects related to this job opening:
Developing light transport software for nuclear medical imaging applications
Image reconstruction for cardiac-specific SPECT system
Image reconstruction for brain-dedicated PET system
Image registration and reconstruction for intra-operative positron-gamma probe for surgical applications
These multidisciplinary projects span over medical and nuclear physics, engineering, mathematics, computer modeling, and material science.

Pay is dependent on your qualifications and job performance

MRI MODELING RESEARCH INTERNSHIP
 
Help solve today's problems in medical imaging and neuroscience by applying your technical knowledge!
 
The Magnetic Resonance Physics & Instrumentation Group of the Athinoula A. Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging, Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) is seeking a co-op student to join our laboratory for the Spring 2020 term. Our group consists of faculty, postdoctoral fellows, and graduate students from MGH/Harvard/MIT and we develop MRI techniques and technologies to non-invasively image the human brain and body in health and disease. You will work closely with a postdoctoral fellow on functional MRI for detecting brain activity by modeling the MRI signal from the microvasculature. Today, nearly every functional MRI study relies on imaging the hemodynamic response of blood vessels to changing brain activity. This project will help us as we seek to improve our understanding of the links between the MRI signals we measure and the underlying vascular physiology.
 
Depending on your interests and experience, your roles in this project could include modeling the MRI signals from blood and brain tissue, generating more accurate computational models of blood cells and the brain microvasculature, or modeling blood flow and oxygenation distributions throughout the vasculature.
 
You will join a world-renowned biomedical research laboratory and be trained on the fundamentals of MRI physics, computational modeling techniques, such as Monte Carlo computing, and neuroanatomy and physiology, depending on your specific interests. Desired qualifications: Comfortable with computer programming, ideally in MATLAB, C/C++, or Python. The ideal candidate will be pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, however, interested candidates with computer programming experience from other fields are welcome to apply. No previous experience with medical imaging required but an enthusiasm for research is desired.
 
FUNDING
 
Currently, this is an unpaid position, but we will assist in applying for grants and stipends offered by Northeastern University.
 
APPLICATION
 
Interested applicants should send a cover letter describing your work/research experience, your interests in this position, and future career goals, as well as a resume and contact information for two references.
Division: MGH/HST Athinoula A. Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging

Job Description:
The MIT BioMicro Center is a cutting-edge genomics core facility that provides MIT faculty members with integrated access to high-throughput data-intensive genomics, as well as large-scale bioinformatics and bioIT required to fully implement systems approaches to investigate a broad spectrum of biological problems.  The Center provides these services to researchers both inside and outside of the MIT community and is operated as a collaboration between the Departments of Biology and Biological Engineering at MIT, the Koch Institute for Integrated Cancer Research and the MIT Center for Environmental Health Sciences. The center supports next-generation sequencing technologies from Illumina, as well as third generation technologies from Pacific BioSciences and Oxford Nanopore as well as a broad spectrum of supporting methodologies and instrumentation.

The co-op will focus on improvements to the bioinformatics pipelines critical for the operation of the MIT BioMicro Center. These pipelines requires contiuous improvement to respond to changing technologies and provide a critical first step in the analysis of a broad variety of scientific questions from regenerative medicine to cancer research to ocean ecosystems. The co-op will be able to develop programming skills and are responsible for monitoring the pipeline runs to ensure successful data delivery to users. Additionally, the co-op will interact with a broad variety of research scientists and their tasks may extend further depending on the capabilities of the student.

Responsibilities and Duties:
Develop and improve bioinformatics pipelines for sequencing data processing
Monitor the pipeline production runs and ensure successful data delivery to users
Develop FAIR data management platform
 
Job Skills Required:
Strong coding skills in Python, Java and bash
Familiarity with Linux, database and web software development technologies such as HTML and JSON 
Demonstrate good understanding of software fundamentals including software design, development, testing and deployment 
Proficient interpersonal skills including professional correspondence
Ability to work effectively in a group environment and independently
Ability to learn scientific principles and concepts efficiently
Motivational attitude, flexibility, and versatility when working in a rapidly evolving environment
(CS-RSCH) (CS-DASCI)

Job Description:
MassINC is an independent think tank uniting non-partisan research, civic journalism and independent polling. We are committed to expanding and supporting Massachusetts' middle class.

MassINC was built around the conviction that better outcomes would be achieved if policy makers and opinion leaders were armed with credible data and analysis about key issues surrounding quality of life in Massachusetts. Unbiased, fact-based analysis have always been cornerstones of MassINC's work and have made us the organization of record for policy analysis and civic engagement.

The Program Assistant will assist in all areas of the organization with special projects as assigned. Projects the co-op is tasked with are very diverse and require a broad range of skills, including researching, writing, organizing and planning.

Projects may include: preparing for and staffing events, assisting in a major overhaul of our contact database, tracking and managing our growing compendium of media coverage, researching new prospects for funding opportunities and assisting with general clerical tasks. Some early morning and evening hours required.

In addition to special projects, co-ops are responsible for daily postings to CommonWealth magazine website, managing the MassINC contact database and donor database, and coordinating many various logistical projects for the office.

Co-ops will have the opportunity to network with Massachusetts policy stakeholders as well as develop independent projects with a policy focus of their choosing.
 
Qualifications Desired:
Strong interest in public policy and politics required. Must be able to juggle several projects at the same time and work independently on assigned projects. Must be able to work cohesively with a small team in an office setting. Some professional experience is preferred.
 
Skills:
Excellent computer skills, especially with MS Office programs.
 
Personal Qualities:
This individual must be motivated, organized, innovative, adaptable and outgoing. Position requires flexibility, some early morning and evening hours required. Because of this, this person must be reliable and prompt.

The Massachusetts Medical Society is at the forefront of health care -- leading the way as the state's professional membership association for physicians and publisher of the New England Journal of Medicine and Journal Watch.   
 
At the core of all we do is the dedication and commitment of our employees.  Consider joining an organization that is consistently recognized as a Top Place to Work.     
 
 
DIGITAL MARKETING OPERATIONS ASSISTANT INTERNSHIP

Entails working as a member of the Digital Marketing Operations team within the Audience Development department of the Massachusetts Medical Society's Publishing Division, which publishes the New England Journal of Medicine and NEJM Journal Watch newsletters. Individual will gain valuable experience in digital marketing operations and learn all aspects of audience development and digital marketing such as email marketing, onsite contextual messaging ad serving, ad campaign management, landing page optimization, web analytics and campaign reporting.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:
The person in this position will be responsible for providing ongoing support for a wide variety of digital marketing initiatives including ad campaign planning and scheduling, campaign set-up, testing and QA, email and banner ad campaign reporting, research and some administrative office responsibilities.
 
The candidate will work on some or all of the following tasks and projects:
 
Create digital marketing campaign reports
Assist with digital marketing campaign analytics and reporting for email promotions and digital marketing ads (contextual messaging and banner ads)
Manage and schedule promotions in e-newsletters and website properties
Traffic ads for digital marketing promotions
Create and manage promotion codes for digital marketing promotions
Review test emails, verify links, and validate that landing pages and online customer data flows are functioning properly
Perform QA and testing of landing pages and e-commerce pages
Maintain and enhance documentation of digital marketing operations reporting and processes
Research new digital marketing tactics and programs
Create payment requests for department expenditures and track these expenses in the corresponding product budget
Assist with other projects as needed
The candidate will have the opportunity to learn and become proficient in digital marketing and operations as well as email marketing and ad serving tools, Web Analytics software and e-commerce page functionality. The candidate will also learn to use databases and reporting tools to pull and synchronize divergent sources of data into reports in Microsoft Excel. Excel proficiency is required, but training will be provided as needed on all other systems.
 
LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES:
The candidate will have the opportunity to learn about a wide variety of digital marketing programs, strategies and tactics from a highly respected organization with strong brand recognition. The candidate will become an integral part of the Digital Marketing Operations team and will learn to work with new systems, juggle various priorities, manage multiple projects simultaneously and work with a variety of business stakeholders supported by Digital Marketing Operations, all of which will help the candidate develop their career path. The candidate will participate in marketing meetings with exposure to developing strategy, tactics and analysis for digital marketing campaigns. This is an excellent chance to be exposed to, participate in and build experience with all aspects of digital marketing in a collaborative, supportive and fun environment.
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
The candidate should possess excellent organizational skills, exceptional attention to detail, the ability to manage multiple projects, strong communication skills, an interest in and understanding of digital technology, a desire to learn or familiarity with web analytics, a strong problem-solving ability, and experience working with spreadsheets and databases. Knowledge of MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint are preferred.  An understanding of Business Intelligence and Web Analytics principles and terminology is a plus, but not mandatory.
 
WORK SCHEDULE
The work hours are Monday -- Friday, 8:30 - 4:30, however the student can arrange a flexible schedule. 


(CS-BGNR)

Want to take an idea from "hello world" to market launch?
Come work with the team responsible for innovation at the Match Group - the global dating company that owns and operates the biggest dating apps like Tinder, OkCupid, Match, Hinge, Plenty of Fish and Ship (a new dating app built and recently launched by the Plus1 Labs team).  For 25 years, we've made it our business to use technology to create some of the most popular ways for people flirt, date, and find love. Now, we're looking for someone just as passionate to join us in those endeavors.
Plus1 Labs is our internal innovation and R&D team working on launching cool new products and technologies to create the next big thing for the online dating world. We are looking for Software Engineering Interns to join our Co-op Program for a 6 month tour of duty.  The Plus1 team operates with the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup but with the full backing of the Match Group Corporation.

What will I be doing?
You will work with the Plus1 Labs team to take app concepts from ideation to launch. Cut your teeth on an array of new web apps, IOS/Android apps, support software, and the micro service architecture to hold everything together. You will leverage established frameworks and open-source technologies like Python, and Ruby on Rails, React, and Node.js. All the while, experienced team mentors will be there alongside you showing you the ropes. Past Interns worked on the initial conception, design and development of the new Ship app. Who knows, you may develop the next Tinder!

What's the team like?
We're a small, ferociously nimble team that iterates fast and ships often. Every team member creatively dialogs with many internal stakeholders to find, define, and build the most impactful products for our existing, new, and yet-to-be-discovered businesses.

What skills will I be using day one?
We work with so many technologies that it's impossible to be an expert in all of them. Here are a few that we'd love for you to have some experience with (you'll learn the others on the job):
Swift, Objective-C, and the SDK framework
React, Node.js, Express
Python, Flask
Ruby on Rails
PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Cassandra, Kafka
Public and/or private APIs (RESTful web services)
HTML5, CSS, JavaScript in a mobile web universe
Microsoft stack (C#, ASP.NET, T-SQL, Web API)
What do I need to land this role?
Experience in working in full-stack development
Interest in a driven agile environment
Strong background in object oriented development.
Ability to creatively solve problems and overcome unique challenges with little supervision or hand-holding
Currently enrolled at an accredited university pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science
Minimum of a 3.0 GPA or equivalent
Why Match?
Because we're not just Match. We're Tinder, Hinge, Plenty of Fish, OkCupid, and so many more!
Because opportunities like this don't come along often, and who knows ? you could create the next big thing in the world of dating!
Because our office culture is incomparable ? free drinks and snacks all day every day, happy hours, a game room, pool tables. So much room for activities!
To see more behind the scenes of working at Match, check out #LifeAtMatch on social media.
To be considered, please share GitHub, portfolio site, or sample projects in resume.

Co-op Job Title: CO-OP Student Security Services Department Leadership Enrichment And Development Program (Requisiton #25463)
Job Description:
Below is the link for students to apply for the MIT - LL co-op position in the Security Services Department. It looks like there are many co-op positions on their site for various Divisions and Groups,  so make sure it is the Co-op Student - Security Services Department - Leadership Enrichment and Development Program  which can be accessed via this link:      https://careers.ll.mit.edu/job/CO-OP-Student-MA/578463700/
CO-OP Student -Security Services Department - Leadership Enrichment And Development Program
The Security Services Department's overall mission is to ensure a safe and secure environment and protect all MIT Lincoln Laboratory facilities in which personnel perform research and development. To accomplish its mission, the Department develops and implements policies, plans, and actions to protect facilities against threats of vandalism, accidental destruction, and sabotage, and to safeguard personnel, classified and unclassified information systems, personally identifiable information, property, and other assets.

The six (6) month Leadership Enrichment And Development (LEAD) experience provides a real-world opportunity for cooperative educational program students to gain exposure to the National Industrial Security Program (NISP). Students learn requirements set forth by the Department of Defense (DoD) to access and protect sensitive and classified government information. Assignments are structured around a robust rotational schedule that allows the student to work alongside security professionals and become familiar with each of the functional areas of the Security Services Department: Physical Security, Information Security (supporting the Forensics Analysis Center (FAC)), Government Security, and Special Security.

The LEAD student participates in strategic security projects that focus on various topics: investigations, clearance processing and other personnel security actions, computer forensic examinations, cyber threat intelligence, database maintenance, and emergency preparedness/risk management and mitigation.
 Requirements:

Must be currently enrolled in an accredited bachelor's/master's degree program in Criminal Justice or similar field
Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications
Ability to interface with a variety of security professionals
Strong organizational, problem solving, and analytic skills
Demonstrated oral and written communication skills
Applicants are subject to a pre-employment investigation and must meet all eligibility requirements for access to classified information, including compartmented programs
U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a government DoD security clearance

 
Work hours: 8:30am-5:00pm
Location: MIT Lincoln Laboratory, 244 Wood Street, Lexington, MA

About MEDITECH
Medical Information Technology, Inc. (MEDITECH) has been a leading software vendor in the health care informatics industry for over 40 years. Our mission is to provide applications that enable physicians, nurses and other clinicians to orchestrate and deliver patient care in a safe, effective manner. Our software products also support the business activities of the organizations that employ these critical care providers. MEDITECH continues to take advantage of new, industry-standard tools and technologies, from tablet devices to browser-based functionality, to allow for clinical caregiver mobility and efficiency. As an extremely profitable and stable company, MEDITECH is well positioned for sustained success as we lead multiple industries ? health care, application software development and information technology ? that are constantly growing and evolving. We are building the future of health care, and there is no better place to build the foundation of your career!

Our Cooperative Education Position: Software Application Developer
As a member of MEDITECH's Product Development Division, your co-op will begin with a structured, intensive training program. Areas of concentration will be on application development and the underlying, advanced technology platform that supports it. We plan on establishing a team of around 6 co-op students from Northeastern University who will work together. From there, your learning and contributions will migrate to our quality control processes, focusing on functional design and development techniques utilized with our tools. Finally, small, self-contained programming projects will be established and assigned to the co-op team to measure their learning.

As a co-op student working at MEDITECH, you will be assigned a direct manager as well as a staff mentor to guide you through your journey. The program will have you working out of MEDITECH's office in Canton, Massachusetts and will enable you to establish many professional contacts with our staff, our customers and in the industry. Our management's open door policy will help you achieve the professional and technical experience necessary to succeed.

What to Expect at MEDITECH
At MEDITECH, we hold the distinction of being the oldest, private software company in the world. We work hard to fulfill our noble mission to help health care organizations deliver quality care. If you or a family member have ever fallen ill, you quickly realized how important our nation?s health care system is. But at MEDITECH we also play hard too. As a private company, we have established a wonderful family atmosphere not only experienced during the family summer picnic or staff holiday party, but throughout each and every work day. There are many amazing tangible benefits for full time staff members, from profit sharing and flexible work hours to telecommuting and educational assistance, if you choose to work with us after graduation. But before then, on top of your sick and vacation time allotment during your 6 month employment, there are many intangible benefits to working at MEDITECH.

Our beautiful Canton facility, complete with an atrium and auditorium, has a gym and running track, laundry service, ATM, a full service cafeteria with free soda and coffee, and ample parking around our facility which is right off the highway. With the PC or laptop you are supplied, staff take advantage of a wireless network, high speed Internet access and video conferencing. Our open workstation environment and dynamic, young culture of almost 1000 recent college graduates foster an atmosphere of teamwork, learning, friendship and more. Our internal classified ads help staff participate in sports after work, car pools, personal events, and enjoy employee discounts on computer hardware, mobile phones or other services.

For more information on MEDITECH, please visit our meditech.com web site.

The DevOps Software Engineer will work within the Medtronic R&D engineering team to develop and support the next generation robotic assisted surgical system right in downtown Boston's Seaport district. Medtronic is a leading medical device manufacturer, developing innovations in cardiac rhythm disease management, spinal and biologics, cardiovascular therapies, neuromodulation, diabetes, surgery, cardiac care, neuromodulation, and surgical technologies.

The role entails having a growing understanding of technical project management, development, IT, and cybersecurity. Python scripting

There are products that customers think are cool at the moment, and then there are products that customers cannot live without because they are so incredibly useful. At Matician, we are building the latter because these are the products worth spending our lives on. We want to build great products to solve real problems.

We believe that sensors and algorithms are finally good enough to reimagine home devices and apply Level 5 autonomy and mobility so that people can save time and energy bypassing repetitive and mundane tasks inside the home.

We're a small team with a singular focus on product that combines technologies such as vision, ML, structure-from-motion, and robotics. Our goal is to ship products that people love. 

You will:
Be Responsible for research and software engineering of these products
Collaborate with the HW, SW and Algorithms team to bring product vision to life.
Everything involved in applying an ML model to a production use case
Designing and coding up the neural network architecture, gathering and refining data, training and tuning the model
Deploying it at scale with high throughput and uptime
Analyzing the results in order to continuously update and improve accuracy and speed 

We are looking for someone who is:
An out-of-box thinker and doer, unafraid of solving really-hard-problems, and willing to do whatever it takes to ship extremely useful products. 
Curious, asks lots of questions, challenges conventional wisdoms, and doesn't shy from contrarian opinions/approaches.
Someone who prioritizes user needs, functionality, and usefulness
Detail-oriented and has pride in their work. 

Qualifications
Ability to solve problems and identify areas of improvement
Ability to write clean, reliable code that can be easily maintained
Experience with Python, Experience with Tensorflow, PyTorch or Numpy a plus 
Experience with working on computer vision, machine learning or NLP problems 
Ability to work in a fast-paced, autonomously driven, and demanding start-up atmosphere.

Physical Design Intern
About Mellanox
Mellanox Technologies was founded in 1999 and has headquarters in Sunnyvale, CA and Yokneam, Israel. We are a leading supplier of innovative end-to-end InfiniBand and Ethernet connectivity solutions and services for servers and storage. We offer market-leading solutions that include adapter cards, switches, cables and software to support InfiniBand and Ethernet networking technologies. Our products optimize data center performance and deliver industry-leading bandwidth and scalability. In addition, we serve a wide range of markets including high performance computing, enterprise, data centers, cloud computing, big data and Web 2.0. We are constantly reinventing ourselves to stay ahead of the market and bring game-changing products and services to the industry.  
 
This role is in Westborough, MA.  Our design center is focused on BlueField system on a chip (SOC) technology, and provides expertise in architecture, RTL design, verification, physical design, and software solutions for this product line.  The most integrated and efficient flash controller available on the market today, the BlueField dual-port 100Gb/s Ethernet and InfiniBand SoC combines the industry-leading ConnectX®-5 network controller, with a powerful 16 core Arm A72 CPU, DDR4 memory subsystems, and a PCIe switch with 32 PCIe Gen3/4 lanes. BlueField has demonstrated record-setting NVMe-oF performance of 7.5 million IOPS, with zero CPU utilization and under 3 microseconds of NVMe-oF latency.  
 
About Our Internship
As an eager engineer to kick start your career, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies which power the world's fastest networks. As an intern, you will gain hands-on experience implementing our latest compute fabric in silicon. You will collaborate closely with experts and senior engineers to drive the pre-silicon development from concept to tape-out. 
As an Intern you will learn about: 
Semiconductor physical design using cutting edge technologies 
The pre-silicon development Product Life Cycle 
Tools, Flows and Methodologies to achieve the highest quality designs 
Deeper understanding of computer architecture and on-die fabrics 
Develop and present plans to the technical staff 
Estimate complexity & effort of real-world tasks The Ideal Candidates should exhibit the following traits: 

Team player 
Self-motivated and inquisitive 
Ability to work independently 
Excellent work discipline 
Communication skills Minimum Qualifications: 

Preference given to candidates pursuing a Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field 
3+ months experience in TCL, Python, Perl programming or equivalent Preferred Qualifications: 

Good grasp of computer architecture principles 
Familiarity with semiconductor physical design or layout using EDA tools.
Hardware design via synthesis,  FPGAs and SystemVerilog a plus

Co-op Job Title: Engineering Co-op: R&D at an Energy Startup
Job Description:
Company

Mesodyne is an early stage startup company commercializing a miniature power source developed by its founders at MIT. The technology converts fuel into electricity for remote unmanned sites, wearable power, drones, and robots---serving industrial, scientific, and defense sectors. The company is co-located with several tech companies at 15 Ward St in Somerville, a 10-15 min walk from the Green Line Lechmere station.

Position

You will be working on improving the core components of the power source: the microcombustor and recuperator. Although you will work closely with the founders and other scientists and engineers, you will be expected to take ownership over your project. Specifically, you will:
- Develop new designs and fabrication processes for prototype systems, including high temperature mechanical components.
- Fabricate prototypes in-house and coordinate with job shops and vendors.
- Evaluate system and component performance by setting up instrumentation then collecting, analyzing, and presenting data.
- Rapidly iterate designs based on experimental results.

Qualifications

We are looking for a candidate with a balance of:
- Analytical skills---able to perform basic calculations (pressure drops, flow rates, etc.) and synthesize the results into a final design.
- Hands on aptitude---able to build physical prototypes using hand and machine tools as well as intuitively solve real-world problems as they arise.

Pursuing a degree in mechanical engineering, chemical engineering, or a related field with relevant experience. Most importantly, the candidate should be excited to learn new skills and grow with the company.

About Us:
We are The Selling App. The fast and easy way to sell or buy almost anything, from fashion to toys, sporting goods to electronics, jewelry to shoes. Launched in 2013, Mercari quickly became the #1 shopping app in Japan. Now we're on a global mission to build a future where people everywhere feel empowered to sell the things they don't use, a future where all useful things are used. And with a fast-growing user base in the U.S. of over 45 million downloads, we are on our way to doing just that.

Recent Engineering Achievements:
*We built a Brand Recommendation service and feature using collaborative filtering based on user interactions with brands on Mercari
*Launched a Search Query Recommendation service clustering search queries and suggesting search terms personalized to each user
*At a Go Bold Day (internal hackathon), we built an interface to google voice enabling a user to ask information about their listings

What You'll Be Doing:
* Coding in Go and Python
* Work with/on microservices running in Google Cloud
* Work with Product Managers and Designers for design and specification of our product.
* Collaborate with iOS and Android engineers to develop new features on our product.
* Collaborate with ML and Data Engineers to develop and bring to production new features on out product 

Requirements:
* Knowledge of data structures, computational and spatial complexity, and other computer science subjects
* Experience in working on a Team to push code into production
* Have a hunger for getting things done 

 (CS-DASCI)

SUMMARY OF POSITION:
This Software Intern will work within the Medtronic R&D engineering team to develop and support the Medtronic next-generation minimally invasive surgical robotic platform.

This Software Intern will participate in the development of the embedded software for the platform. This software ranges from device drivers and communication to state machines and device control.

In addition, the intern will work with cross-functional engineering teams to assist with the evaluation and integration of other technologies into the surgical robotic platform.
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Develops software for the next-generation surgical robotics platform:
Under the guidance of a software engineer, responsibilitiesinclude, the design, development, debug, test, integration, and documentation of embedded C/C++ software applications running in a real-time OS, Linux, and/or MS Windows environment. 
REQUIREMENTS:
Education:
Working towards a BS or MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields.
 
Experience:
Experience with an object-oriented language (e.g. C++, Java)
Experience developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code
Skills/Competencies:
Demonstrated willingness to learn and develop new skills and competencies
Good verbal and written communication skills
Fluency in English is required
ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS/SCOPE:
Reports to:  R&D Embedded Software Engineering Manager 
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Standard office setting, clean room, surgical lab, operating room, pilot lab, external research organizations, supplier visits, travel as required
Based in Boston, MA 
The applicant may travel domestically and internationally on a limited basis.
  
DISCLAIMER:
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification.  They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position.

Co-op Job Title: Engineering Co-op: Firmware and hardware development at an Energy startup
Job Description:
Company

Mesodyne is an early stage startup company commercializing a miniature power source developed by its founders at MIT. The technology converts fuel into electricity for remote unmanned sites, wearable power, drones, and robots---serving industrial, scientific, and defense sectors. The company is co-located with several tech companies at 15 Ward St in Somerville, a 10-15 min walk from the Green Line Lechmere station.

Position

You will be working on a control system for our miniature power source, involving both firmware and hardware development. Although you will work closely with the founders and other scientists and engineers, you will be expected to take ownership over your project. Specifically, you will:
- Write, test, and debug microcontroller C code. You will be both writing new code as well as modify existing code.
- Interface with sensors and actuators, including pressure, temperature, and flow sensors, and motors.
- Develop testing and debugging tools. For example, logging pressure data over USB for analysis.

Qualifications

We are looking for a candidate pursuing a degree in electrical engineering with:
- Proficiency in C programming. Familiarity with embedded programming techniques such as state machines and interrupt handlers is a plus.
- Experience with embedded systems (including Arduino). Familiarity with I2C, SPI, and RS232 is a plus.
- Previous electronics experience, including testing and debugging (oscilloscope, etc.), bench skills (soldering, etc.), and knowledge of basic analog and digital circuit design (op amps, logic gates, etc.).
Most importantly, the candidate should be excited to learn new skills and grow with the company.

Job Description:
Company

Mesodyne is an early stage startup company commercializing a miniature power source developed by its founders at MIT. The technology converts fuel into electricity for remote unmanned sites, wearable power, drones, and robots---serving industrial, scientific, and defense sectors. The company is co-located with several tech companies at 15 Ward St in Somerville, a 10-15 min walk from the Green Line Lechmere station.

Position

You will be integrating and packaging the power source prototype for different applications. Although you will work closely with the founders and other scientists and engineers, you will be expected to take ownership over your project.
Specifically, you will:
- Design, fabricate (either in-house or coordinating with a job shop), and test custom auxiliary systems such as fuel and air manifold.
- Specify, select, integrate, and evaluate off the shelf components such as pressure sensors and flow controllers.

- Experience with traditional machining (mill and lathe) as well as 3D printing and laser cutting.
- Ability to design for manufacturing and assembly. Previous experience working with complex systems.
Most importantly, the candidate should be excited to learn new skills and grow with the company.

Basic Purpose

The Co-op/Intern helps develop systems technology projects that address the business needs of the MFS Investment Operations division. They will learn how to elicit and gather business requirements, analyze data supporting business decisions and translate these into solutions. Principle Responsibilities
Performs analysis of business activities to determine business requirements.  Works with business users to understand requirements pertaining to industry, company, and customer needs.

Supports cross-departmental projects and follows the MFS Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), ensuring that all steps of the process have been followed accordingly.
Identify, analyze and interpret trends in large data sets.
Job Requirements

Analytical skills and demonstrated ability to make independent decisions.

The Digital Business Analyst Co-op position involves working directly with a small, dynamic team of web Business Analysts/Project Managers as they assist internal business partners in developing systems strategies to achieve MFS' business goals.  The position involves acting as an integral part of the team to create, enhance, and implement new and existing solutions by collaborating with software developers, subject matter experts and other IT team members.  The co-op will attend meetings, work directly with internal business groups, and assist Web Business Analysts with larger scale web projects.

Boston, MA (located near Davis Square Somerville)

Micro-Leads is a fast-paced medical device team creating a new wirelessly powered bioelectronic implantable device for treating chronic pain.  We are seeking a 2019 Spring-Summer Co-Op electrical engineering intern who has electronics hardware experience to work as a designer alongside our team of hardware engineers. 
 
Experience Level Required:  A junior or above.

Development of compact, multi-layer printed circuit board using modern CAD software (e.g. Altium Designer)

Candidates should not apply unless they are very "hands-on" in developing and debugging microelectronics circuits

Job Summary
The Enterprise Architecture Co-op position involves working closely with members of MFS' Enterprise Architecture team and technology management as they engage in the assessment and governance of technology change at MFS. At MFS and elsewhere, the discipline of Enterprise Architecture focuses on aligning technology capabilities and change with business needs and strategy across an enterprise. The role of the EA co-op is to coordinate the ongoing dialogue and interactions between technology and business areas to promote that alignment. The co-op will work directly with people from all technology and business areas to support Enterprise Architecture activities and processes.
Job Details
Exposure to the goals and strategies of the Enterprise Architecture program at MFS.
?Exposure to technology change proposed and in progress across MFS business areas and a unique/holistic view of the business through that change.
Exposure to MFS' business strategy and the processes and decision-making involved in the alignment of technology strategy and change with that business strategy.
Experience with a leader in the financial services industry in an environment that values and promotes a collaborative work environment characterized by mutual respect. 
Principal Responsibilities
Coordinate communication among technology and business participants in architecture review processes.
Coordinate activities of the Enterprise Architecture Review Board ("EARB"), the governing body for technology change and the activities of the EA team.
Coordinate and support the activities of the EA team in support of EARB.
Learn and use Sharepoint, the platform used to conduct EA and EARB business.
Effectively manage your own time and the participation of people bringing a variety of technology and business backgrounds to EA and EARB processes.
Work effectively with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint). Past experience with Microsoft Visio is desirable, but not required. (Most co-ops have learned it entirely on the job.)
Learn from and maintain documentation covering co-op responsibilities. 
Qualifications
Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in business or computer-related field preferred. Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Detailed Description
Independent for over 70 years, Milliman delivers market-leading services and solutions to clients worldwide. Today, we are helping companies take on some of the world's most critical and complex issues, including retirement funding and healthcare financing, risk management and regulatory compliance, data analytics and business transformation.
 
Through a team of professionals ranging from actuaries to clinicians, technology specialists to plan administrators, we offer unparalleled expertise in employee benefits, investment consulting, healthcare, life insurance and financial services, and property and casualty insurance.
Role
Interns will work as part of a collaborative team to analyze claims data, quantify the cost of insurance coverage, and model payment scenarios for both public and private sector clients. Prior experience in healthcare consulting is not required; our experienced staff will provide you with the tools and training necessary to complete a variety of interesting projects, which may include:
Pricing and analysis for Medicare prescription drug plans (Part D).
Providing medical and pharmacy benefit design strategy support for insurance carriers, state health exchanges, and employers.
Interns will expand their technical skill set with platforms such as Excel, VBA, and SAS. Individual responsibilities may vary based on business needs.
At Milliman, exposure drives development. Our interns are exposed to senior decision-makers and interact closely with clients. The unique organization of our firm encourages entrepreneurial spirit and allows interns to work independently and develop creative solutions. Interns gain experience in a dynamic, challenging environment where they hone their abilities to become future business leaders. We offer significant earnings potential through competitive base rates and enticing bonus incentives.
Qualifications
Required:
Preferred applicants are those who are working towards or have completed a degree in actuarial science, mathematics, finance, statistics, data science, economics, computer science, engineering, accounting, a related field, or an actuarial designation.
Desired:
Ability to work independently and in team environment
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational skills
Ability to work on multiple types of projects at one time
Self-motivated and inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
Excel, programming, and prior internship experience or work is a plus, but not a requirement for this position.
Time Commitment
This is a temporary seasonal position that may require a significant time commitment. Opportunities for overtime will be available, but not required. We are ideally looking to fill these positions with individuals willing to work extended full-time hours (40+ hours/week). The preferred start and end dates are January 13, 2020 through June 5, 2020 depending on business need, respectively, though there is some flexibility surrounding these dates.
 
Please upload your resume and cover letter in PDF format only.
Sponsorship/Location
Applicants must be presently authorized to work in the United States. Milliman will not sponsor applicants for this position for the following work visas/statuses: F-1 STEM OPT, H-1B, J-1, TN, O-1, L-1, or E-1/2.
 
This position will be based out of the Milliman office in Windsor, CT. Applicants must be willing to work onsite in the Milliman Windsor office.
Milliman is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Milliman is fully committed to the maximum utilization of all human resources and the goals of Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action. Coordinator Note: (CS-STRTUP), [1]

Organization: Microfinance Opportunities (MFO)
Co-op job title: Research Associate 
 
About MFO
Founded in 2002, MFO (microfinanceopportunities.org) is a global nonprofit organization committed to understanding the economic realities of low-income individuals and households in developing countries. MFO is a global leader in the development and use of the Financial Diaries methodology and has conducted 14 such studies across the globe, including the recently completed Garment Worker Diaries (www.workerdiaries.org).
Position description
The main focus of the work of the Research Associate will be supporting the implementation of the Scaled Garment Worker Diaries (GWD) study in Bangladesh, which will be scaling up from 200 to 1,300 garment workers between August 2018 and January 2019 and then collecting data from those 1,300 workers for a year. The Diaries methodology collects data on the economic transactions of respondents every week. MFO is partnering with a local research organization that will be in charge of collecting the data, but it is MFO's responsibility to: 1) ensure the data is of high quality by implementing a thorough data review and cleaning process; 2) shape the data and get it ready for analysis and posting on workerdiaries.org; and 3) analyze it. The Research Associate will have the lead responsibility for tasks 1 and 2, and will provide support for the completion of task 3.
Task 1 will involve consistent communication with the research team in Bangladesh, which is 10 hours ahead of the East Coast. This means that the Associate will have to hold conference calls either early in the morning or late in the evening consistently throughout the co-op placement. In addition to these tasks the Research Associate will manage the workerdiaries.org web site, prepare interactive visualizations of the Diaries data, short reports and blogs, and support MFO's efforts to disseminate the results of the GWD study to stakeholders.

In addition to the GWD study, the Research Associate will be responsible for supporting MFO's other projects as needed. MFO is a virtual organization with employees in Cambridge, MA, Washington, D.C., and Virginia and with associates across the globe. The Executive Director of MFO, Guy Stuart, is based in Cambridge and the Research Associate will work in the shared office space that Guy uses.

The ideal candidate for the placement will have the following skills and experience:
Proficiency in Python
Strong writing skills
Experience with data visualization
Design sensibility
Some knowledge of or course work in ethical supply chains is desirable
In addition, the ideal candidate will be:
Creative and flexible
Open to learning as well as giving constructive feedback
Comfortable working in a small team
Focused on social justice issues and concerns
Projected Learning outcomes and professional take-away(s)
By the end of the coop the student will have:
Had direct experience of managing a research project in a developing country, remotely
With a specific focus on the collection, processing, analysis, and visualization of Financial Diaries data
Been exposed to the literature on ethical supply chains
Reviewed the principles of adult learning, 8 steps of design, and the 4As learning sequence
With this new set of knowledge and skills the student will be better able to manage research projects and communicate their results to stakeholders. They will also have a specific expertise in the field of ethical supply chains.
Hours 
37.5 hours per week
45 Prospect Street, Cambridge, MA 02139
$15- 20 per hour depending on experience

About MKS: 

MKS Instruments, Inc. is a leading worldwide provider of process control solutions for advanced manufacturing processes such as semiconductor device manufacturing; thin-film manufacturing for flat panel displays, optical storage media, architectural glass and electro-optical products; and technology for medical imaging equipment.

Position Summary:


The primary role is to provide technical support in the analysis, design, and testing of advanced breakthrough technologies in the areas of remote plasma sources, reactive gas generators, flow and pressure measurement. The person must be able to work independently with limited supervision in a fast-paced, dynamic, highly technical environment and work on multiple concurrent cross-functional projects. A successful candidate must be highly self-motivated and have an excellent understanding of chemistry and applied physics, with an emphasis on RF plasma systems and vacuum technology. Exposure to fluid dynamics, applied electrodynamics, numerical analysis techniques, and laboratory experimental methods is highly desirable.

Position Details:

Ø Work with a senior scientist to characterize the performance and behavior of various plasma sources for a variety of manufacturing and industrial applications.

Ø Design and set up test-benches, perform experiments, collect and analyze data to achieve project objectives with an emphasis on plasma-materials interaction, product characterization and reliability tests.

Ø Identify and troubleshoot problems in prototypes.

Ø Interface with product engineering and cross-functional teams as required.

 

Requirements:

Ø Enrollment in Material Science, Physics, or Engineering.  BS in these areas is desired but not required.

Ø Familiarity with semiconductor processing and hands on skills in a clean room and R&D laboratory are desired.

Ø Significant experience with vacuum processing equipment, gas/liquid delivery systems, and RF plasmas.

Ø Basic understanding of plasma chemistry/physics, materials chemistry, materials processing, thin film and coating principles. Strong analytical capability is a must.

Ø Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ø Familiarity with Labview a plus.

NanoView Biosciences is seeking a software engineering co-op to assist with development of our recently launched ExoView Platform. The platform uses a custom microscope to automatically detect and characterize extracellular vesicles in biological samples. To achieve automation the microscope communicates with an embedded system,
mechanical stages, a high-speed camera, and specialized image processing software. Additionally, the platform incorporates a data viewing and analysis app that enables interactive browsing, plotting and reporting of data.

NanoView is looking for a highly motivated person that can work independently and collaborate as part of a team. A good candidate will be detail oriented, be able to document code and findings effectively, and be able to communicate software concepts to people of diverse backgrounds. NanoView will train employees on the technology being developed but we expect employees to be resourceful and build on that training.

Past co-op projects have included refinement of machine control, optimization of image processing algorithms, development of quality control workflows, and design and development of GUI and data plotting workflows.

Following or equivalent skill are necessary:
MATLAB
Basic understanding of optics and microscopy
DSP/Image Processing
Strong interest in working for a small biotech company

Position Overview

Nanotronics is looking for smart and passionate software development interns to join our agile engineering team in the development of the world's most technologically advanced nanoimaging solutions.
 
Software development interns will learn how to contribute to a complex production codebase in an agile environment by pair programming with experienced software engineers. Based on their interests and the current development roadmap, each intern will select and design a primary project for their tenure.
 
Areas for a primary project might include:
Image processing
AI analysis of images
Hardware control
GUI design
With growth and demonstrated performance in primary responsibilities, this position can offer additional explorations in machine learning and other fields related to the function of the core product. Our software team makes nanoimaging fast, accurate, and cost-efficient by combining optical microscopy with machine learning and artificial intelligence. The solutions we build push the envelope of what can be done, so we need team members who are highly intelligent, hard-working and creative.
 
Key Responsibilities
Participate in pair programming, stand ups, retros and project meetings
Design a primary programming project
Contribute to the core product code base: design, implement, test, and debug software applications used for microscopic image acquisition and processing
Create algorithms to solve challenging problems for production inspection systems
Learn and adhere to quality assurance procedures
Coordinate programming activities with R&D and other departments
Nice to Haves (Not Required)
Experience writing C++ code
Experience working with hardware and software
Ability to grasp high order concepts in physics, microscopy, hardware design, automation, and robotics
Experience with computer vision and machine learning
Experience with image processing
Experience working with an agile team
Experience in SQL
Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree (or pursuing) in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
Personal Attributes
Strong work ethic
Effective communicator
Flexible
Ability to work on own initiative as well as with a team
Detail-oriented
What is a Nanotron?
 
Nanotronics is a leading-edge microscopy and machine learning software company that delivers inspection and analysis solutions to sectors ranging from semiconductors,
microprocessors, LEDs, material science, pharmaceuticals, automotive and more. We are not simply a technology company but a science and technology company. We bring the
brightest minds in physics, optics, robotics, artificial intelligence, and software engineering together in our offices in New York, Ohio, and California to do things that have never been done before, and to take those solutions to the market.
