Co-op Job Title: (GLOBAL) Large-scale traffic signal control with Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning
Job Description:
Location: Italy

Students interested in applying to COE global positions must contact Sally Conant (s.conant@northeastern.edu). Once you have spoken with her about the position, your resume will be sent to global employers.

This position is unpaid but the Institute of Atmospheric Pollution Research provides Housing inside the research institute.

CNR IIA  (National Research Council, Institute on Atmospheric Pollution Research)

Position Description:
As a consequence of population growth and urbanization, the transportation demand is steadily rising in the metropolises worldwide. The extensive routine traffic volumes bring pressures to existing urban traffic infrastructure, resulting in everyday traffic congestions. Adaptive traffic signal control (ATSC) aims for reducing potential congestions in saturated road networks, by adjusting the signal timing according to real-time traffic dynamics.

Reinforcement learning (RL) is a promising data-driven approach for adaptive traffic signal control (ATSC) in complex urban traffic networks, and deep neural networks further enhance its learning power. However, centralized RL -that can be formulated under the "classical" framework of Markov decision process (MDP)- is infeasible for large-scale ATSC due to the extremely high dimension of the joint action space. Multi-agent RL (MARL) overcomes the scalability issue by distributing the global control to each local RL agent, but it introduces new challenges: now the environment becomes partially observable from the viewpoint of each local agent due to limited communication among agents.

The purpose of this task is to apply the most advanced techniques available in MARL to properly manage traffic controls in order to improve the traffic conditions in the city of Palermo.

The ideal candidate should have the following skills:
-A basic knowledge of software's to simulate urban mobility (SUMO)
-Good knowledge of Reinforcement Learning techniques
-Some experience with Recurrent Neural Networks (ex. Long-Short Term Memory Networks)
-Advanced coding abilities (C++, Python)
-Some experience with deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow and Thorch (Pythorch).

Organization:
The Institute of atmospheric Pollution Research of CNR conducts research and technology transfer in the field of air pollution in urban and industrial areas (both indoor and outdoor), Emerging Air Contaminants in Environmental Emissions and ambient air, pollutant cycles across different spatial scales including polar areas, Global and regional atmospheric modeling, Technological development and methods for Earth Observation, Geospatial information and environmental knowledge-sharing (GENS) and Transfer of Technical and Scientific Knowledge for the Production and Implementation of Air-Quality Legislation.

The research and technological development mainly concerns the following areas of investigation:
Biogeochemical cycle of pollutants in the Mediterranean area. Definition of the critical aspects of the biogeochemical cycling of pollutants in order to determine the risk thresholds (critical loadings) for the protection of ecosystems and human health;
Development of numerical models for the study of chemical and physical transformations of the pollutants in the Marine Boundary Layer and at atmosphere-ocean interface to vary of the major environmental parameters;
Development of monitoring techniques and analytical methods for the chemical and physical characterization of the major atmospheric pollutants;
Development of integrated environmental analysis (the DPSIR approach) for the development of strategies aimed at (a) the reduction and control of pollution on urban, regional and global level, (b) the management and control of critical aspects of pollutants cycles between atmosphere-ocean-land-vegetation; Study of the dynamics of contaminants in remote areas (ie, Arctic and Antarctica) and assessment of their influence on global changes;
Development of databases and their GIS interfaces regarding (a) the emission of pollutants into the atmosphere from industrial and natural sources, (b) socio-economic data, (c) quality data of river and sea water;
Characterization of industrial emissions and development of emission inventories at local, European and global levels.
Development and Management of National European and International Projects;
Management and Organization of Oceanographic and Pollution Monitoring Campaigns.
The current development model establishing the uncontrolled use of non-renewable sources generates strong pressures on the ecosystem, creating social inequalities and influences on the political stability of many countries. In order to react to these changes it is necessary to develop a new less expensive production and consumption energy systems, able to reduce environmental impact and waste generation.

The need for a transition based on the use of renewables and low environmental impact technologies is particularly important in rural areas where the deterioration of environmental resources is an important issue; in such contexts the potentiality for improvements are very important, considering the existing low-productivity index especially in poorer areas.

This necessary transition can be achieved with better management of energy and natural resources, especially through the production of energy based on biomass and the residues of agricultural production. In fact, among the various sources of energy, the sustainable use of forestry origin biomass together with agriculture and animal waste are a very high energetic and technological potential resources. The benefits the use of bioenergy can provide cover not only the environment, but also the economic and social structure that benefits from a reduction in production costs and in waste disposal costs.

The research activities of the CNR-IIA bioenergies group are focused on the design and development of technologies with reduced environmental impact and on the transfer of knowledge to the rural world.

In detail, the group focuses its activities on:
Development of innovative prototypes for the energetic exploitation of the biomass
Development of innovative biogas purification systems
Environmental analysis of production of energy from biomass with Life Cycle Assessment methodology (LCA)
Analysis of of environmental impacts connected to energy production
Artificial Intelligence for environmental application
Majors considered:
Engineering
Mathematics
Some projects (www.isaac-project.it, www.biogame.it, www.essiccatoremobile.it, www.smartisland.it )
Industry: CNR IIA  (National Research Council, Institute on Atmospheric Pollution Research)

**Term is flexible, can be Fall 2019 or Spring 2020**

Job Description:
Network Resilience in the Age of Big Data
 
The modern built environment is penetrated by networks of increasing size and complexity. From infrastructure systems like electricity, roads and water to social and economic networks, the organized complexity of the city provides it a remarkable degree of resilience to damage. Except when it doesn't. Researchers have been struggling to understand why some disasters or attacks cause only minor repercussions, while others are catastrophic.
 
Until now, this has largely been determined through theoretical modeling or small case studies. However, in recent years new and detailed data streams have become available which permit close observation of failure and recovery processes in multiple networks simultaneously. This opens the door for a new era in resilience research, where the insights of network science can be combined with large scale observations in order to understand, and ultimately improve the resilience of our society.
 
We are looking for talented and motivated students who are interested in collecting, analyzing and modeling data on failures and recovery in infrastructure and social systems including power grids, transportation networks, medical data and more, all with the aim of gaining a deeper understanding of what makes our society resilient, and how it can be made better.

Co-op Job Title: Program Correctness and Game Development Co-op
Job Description:
The goal of this project is to turn proving program correctness into a compelling game that computer science majors (and the general public) want to play. This is an emerging area of research with the potential to be a game-changing approach to dealing with the challenge of software verification. Society is crucially dependent on software, which is used to control critical infrastructure, medical devices, power plants, trains, automobiles, planes, stock markets and sensitive data such as medical and financial records. Bugs in software have lead to deaths, the loss of massive amounts of money and numerous security vulnerabilities. Traditionally software verification requires highly trained formal methods experts and our goal is to develop engaging games that allow non-experts to reason about software.

The current state of the art only allows players to come up with program invariants for very simple programs; we want players to come up with invariants for more complex programs. More generally, we want to develop a game that provides counterexamples, allows multiple players to work together, and allows players more specialized roles and has support for hierarchy and decomposing problems into smaller, more manageable components.

One major assumption that most existing games have made in that code should be hidden from players. Recent work from our group has questioned this assumption, and we developed a game, IDG, that does show players code. Our experimental evaluation shows that players of IDG discover higher quality invariants that prove more programs correct than players of previous games. Our game supports richer human-computer interactions, leading to effective human-in-the-loop systems that are able to augment the ability of non-experts to find loop invariants. See below for a link to the paper.

For this project, we want to explore the following interesting question: how far we can get without showing code (for example, by showing execution traces and counterexamples), which may be a balanced approach that is both effective and engaging to players. Part of the motivation comes from our experience with IDG; while the game is a significant improvement over previous approaches, the attrition rate in the population that played it was higher than trace-based games. So, a natural question is whether we can take the lessons learned and the technology we developed to design a more engaging game.

We are using ACL2s (covered in CS2800) and JavaScript to develop a web game. We expect that working on the project will involve work on web game development, systems programming in ACL2s/Lisp, Linux server development and databases, running experiments, analyzing data, and writing a report for publication.

You can try the game here: http://invgame.atwalter.com/.

You can read the paper comparing the code and no-code versions of the game here: Gamification of Loop-Invariant Discovery from Code.

Summarization, which is to find a small subset of most informaive points from a large dataset, has many applications in computer vision, natural language processing, and health, among others. Learning from human and incorporating user feedback into summarization allows to bring high-level reasoning into tasks. In this project, we develop and test structured summarization algoerithms from viusal data with the goal of learning from human feedback and preferences. The applicants must be familiar with machine learning and have a solid background in programming in python. Knowledge of deep learning and ability to work with pytorch and/or tensorflow would be a plus.

Co-op Job Title: (Khoury) Improving Privacy for Internet of Things (IoT) Devices
Job Description:
Have you ever wondered if your phone or smart speaker is listening to you when it shouldn't? Or whether while you are watching TV, your TV is watching you? We are conducting a wide range of privacy-related investigations in a "living lab" of IoT devices housed in the Mon(IoT)r lab in ISEC, which is set up like a studio apartment complete with large numbers of IoT devices, including TVs, fridges, washer/dryer, smart speakers, and smart thermostats. The goal of our project is to investigate IoT privacy leaks from devices in our lab and ultimately: (i) make users aware of what personal information is shared by their IoT devices, and (ii) give them control over which personal information can be shared and to whom. For example, if a user's Internet-connected camera does not use an encrypted connection to exchange credentials, the user should be warned that the credentials have been leaked and that anyone with an Internet connection can potentially get access to them.

The Research Assistant (RA) will work closely with Prof. Choffnes, his postdoc, and his Ph.D. students to build measurement- and traffic-modifying tools that detect and block privacy leaks from IoT devices in the Mon(IoT)r lab. The RA will have access to more than 100 devices not only in our lab in Boston, but also in our partner labs in London and Torino. This position is in a unique research environment, where the RA will work on new and interesting problems and advance the state of the art. Unlike many positions in industry, we publicize the results of our research and make our software products freely available publicly along with source code. Recent co-ops have produced results that led to vulnerability disclosures, bug bounties, publications in research conferences (along with paid trips to attend and present their work), and international press coverage.

Job Description:
Notarize is the first on-demand notary platform, allowing anyone to notarize a document online and empowering businesses to send, track and collect notarizations. We're helping people execute the most important transactions of their lives and streamlining operations for countless industries.

We're looking for talented Software Engineering Interns to join our growing team in Back Bay, Boston. You'll be part of a multi-functional team, working with designers, front-end and back-end developers, product managers and our senior leadership team as you design, build and extend systems to support our consumer-facing products.

Our tech:

We currently use Rails 5, React.js, and GraphQL with Apollo, but we consider ourselves platform agnostic. A willingness to learn and experiment with new tech is much more important than hands-on experience with our current stack.

What you'll do as a Full-Stack Engineer:
Build, extend, and support a highly available and scalable infrastructure
Be involved in all phases of development, from ideation to release and tracking and analyzing the impact of shipped features
Thoroughly test your own code, from unit tests to automated end-to-end tests
Ship code in weekly sprints
Participate in daily stand-ups, software design sessions, code reviews, and sprint retrospectives

What you'll bring:
Hands-on experience building and shipping software and web applications
Curiosity about new technologies and a desire to always use the best tools for the job
Ability to contribute effectively on any part of the stack - from back-end services to data layers to web interfaces
Belief in thorough unit test coverage
Desire to create quality products and tools that people can actually use

Our Engineering Culture:
Learn it: Notarize has a strong focus on mentorship, with regular 1:1s, reviews, and check-ins to ensure that you are learning & growing as an engineer. Your manager will help you set personal goals, support your learning, and track your progress against those goals, to encourage you in the growth of your career, wherever it may take you. 
Communicate it: You'll be part of a small, cross-functional team (no silos) with a highly collaborative process that values thoughtful communication, not just with other engineers but with all parts of the organization. 
Ship it: We have a very tight (almost continuous) deployment cycle. We ship code 1x/week with some nightly builds (both web & mobile), with a focus on small features & improvements (no monster merges). 
Fix it: We're a small startup with big plans, and there's so much to do. Whether it's an antiquated legal process, an edge-case user interaction, a quirky piece of code, or a desk that hasn't been put together yet, we show up every day with the goal of digging in and leaving something better than we found it.

Notarize is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation,

About Optimus Ride
Optimus Ride is a self-driving vehicle startup working to enable safe, sustainable, and equitable mobility solutions. Our mission is to transform cities and pave the way for a more sustainable future through the introduction of self-driving technologies.
 
Optimus Ride headquarters are located in the Boston Seaport District. Our team hails from a diverse set of backgrounds, and cumulatively has decades of experience building self-driving vehicles, electric vehicles, manufacturing robots, surgical robots, autonomous drones, underwater robots, and more. We aim for a highly collaborative, hands-on, and open environment where peers learn from each other while building technologies for real-world environments.
 
Transportation is for everyone, and we create a better product when our team reflects our users. We constantly strive for a culture where under-indexed groups are welcome and can flourish.
 
The Role
Optimus Ride software engineers create the software at the heart of our vehicles and systems. Our software needs to process complex dataflows and make decisions with real world consequences. We are looking for engineers who bring deep expertise in enabling vehicles and robots to move through and interact with the world around them. You will work with peers who cumulatively have decades of experience from places like Google X, SpaceX, iRobot, Rethink Robotics, Draper Laboratories, Zipcar, and have built self-driving vehicles, electric vehicles, manufacturing robots, surgical robots, autonomous drones, and more.
 
Our team is focused on a rapid path to market, in order to maximize the benefits of self-driving technologies for all. To do this, we need our engineers to be versatile, have leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic about tackling problems across the full range of our systems. Working at Optimus Ride you will innovate with engineers and designers who cumulatively have decades of experience in computer vision, machine learning, sensing and actuation, human-machine interface, and design. You will be creating new technologies through software development that integrates your areas of expertise to enable self-driving systems to be possible today.

 

Responsibilities
Build software for a fleet of self-driving vehicles
Develop planning, control, and estimation algorithms for the vehicles
Design and build embedded systems for real-time control of the vehicles
Test, debug, and maintain reliable, safe, and production quality code
Requirements
Working towards a MS or PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience
Deep expertise in planning algorithms and control theory
Experience with estimation and filtering
Excellent software development skills using C++
Excellent communication skills in written and verbal English
Interest and ability to learn additional skills and technologies as required

Domain expertise with one or more of the following

Real-time software and multithreaded systems
GPS and inertial systems
Embedded systems software

Computer graphics programming

Silicon Valley tells you that every startup is changing the world. Have you ever wanted to work on something that actually does?

We help people reverse and prevent lifestyle diseases like type 2 diabetes. This means if someone is living with type 2 ? we can actually reverse the effects of it. That means no more drugs, amputations, blindness, or dialysis. It changes the entire course of people's lives and that is no hyperbole.

OurPath is a digital lifestyle change programme aiming to tackle the growing lifestyle disease epidemic. Combining behavioural science, live mentor support, educational content, and health tech, the programme delivers a holistic approach to sustainably changing people's behaviours and improving their health long-term all via a mobile and web app!

What you'll be working on
Engineering at OurPath doesn't exist in a vacuum. In this role, you'll be working alongside a small team of crack engineers, designers and dieticians to build the best behavioural change programme in the world.

The features you craft will be delivered to users each day and you, along with the rest of the engineering team, will be tasked with making sure these features provide the best possible results and experience for our users!

Our core product is a React Native app and this is where the majority of our users interact with OurPath. We release multiple times a week through CodePush, so the ability to build features iteratively is really important to us.

The app is supported by a Node.js server and MongoDB server which you will be adding new endpoints to as well as enhancing the existing codebase. Our continuous integration setup means we deploy our web code every time a pull request is merged.

Our world class dietitians provide support and guidance through our mentor platform which is currently written in AngularJS but we are migrating this, along with our consumer website, to Next.js.

Skills & requirements
You'll be responsible for the main point of interaction OurPath users have with the programme and we'd expect you to use best practices. That responsibility comes with a highly flexible working environment and a mandate to design and build the best solution as you see fit.  The ideal candidate will thrive here!

We're also looking for someone who wants to stretch themselves professionally and who is engaged in the tech community. Like implementing solutions with the latest tech? Constantly tweaking your toolchain to optimise your own workflow? We want you!

We're not so concerned with your exact expertise. You can learn on the job, we get it.

CORE EXPERTISE
Javascript, our frontend and backend code is written in JS
Are familiar with React-Native, even if you haven't programmed in it
Experience with a popular Javascript framework (React, Angular, Vue)
Comfortable with Git - we're big on branching workflows, pull requests and code reviews
You have worked in a real agile environment
IDEALLY
You'll be product-focused, we write code to deliver impactful features to users
You'll love great design and appreciate good UX
You'll be comfortable in a fast-paced startup environment
You'll have a strategic approach to development (fast but sustainable)
You'll understand how to architect an API
Understand how Node.js works
Be familiar with AWS Services like EC2 & AutoScaling, Lambda, CloudFront, Route53

The Company
OurPath is a digital lifestyle change programme aiming to tackle the growing lifestyle disease epidemic. Combining behavioural science, live mentor support, educational content, and health tech, the programme delivers a holistic approach to sustainably changing people's behaviours and improving their health long-term all via a mobile and web app!

OurPath subscribers receive 3G scales and a wrist-worn activity tracker, as well as a nutritional handbook and recipe book. The tech syncs to the OurPath mobile or web app so users can track their progress and the programme takes them through both nutritional and exercise-related lifestyle changes also providing advice on sleep, stress management, thought patterns and behaviours. Users are guided by a professionally accredited dietitian, who checks in every day to keep them on track and accountable. They also have the support of a peer group that they can interact with via the app.

We are a team of ex-strategy consultants in our late 20s and are incredibly passionate about solving the type 2 diabetes epidemic. We believe OurPath is a fun place to work with an informal, non-bureaucratic, and agile working environment. You'll also have a nice amount of autonomy over your work-life balance. Finally, we will provide endless amounts of poor jokes and sub-standard humour. Just so you know.

Some of our national press:
http://www.wired.co.uk/article/ourpath-diabetes-app-roche-nhs-partnership
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/money/smallbusiness/article-4525902/NHS-start-prescribing-Diabetes-app.html
https://www.forbes.com/profile/ourpath/

What's in it for you:
You'll be able to provide direct input into how we should improve our product and the development of OurPath.
You'll get to work with amazing, friendly, smart colleagues all incredibly passionate about solving the type 2 diabetes epidemic.
You'll have autonomy and responsibility for your work direction; we also offer a flexible working environment where you can work from home when you need to.
We have regular company-sponsored socials (pub drinks, team dinners, board games and movie nights) that'll allow you to catch up and make friends outside of your team.
We all have a thirst for knowledge and have regular Lunch&Learn sessions to help us expand our knowledge base; the product team also get together and run quarterly Hackathons.

To Apply
This position is available to start immediately, so please send your CV and a short email why you'd like to work here to stella@ourpath.co.uk
We'll be interviewing on a rolling basis, so the quicker you can apply the better. 

p.s. we've already had 2 Huskies join us for a co-op in the past year and they LOVE it here!

Job Title: Signal Integrity/Power Engineer Co-op
Organization Name: Supply Chain Operations, Hardware Technology & Component Engineering
Location: Burlington, MA
 
Who is Oracle?
The Oracle Cloud offers complete SaaS application suites for ERP, HCM and CX, plus best-in-class database Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) from data centers throughout the Americas, Europe and Asia. For more information about Oracle (NYSE:ORCL), please visit us at oracle.com.
 
What's the role?
Our server hardware development team is looking for a highly motivated Electrical Engineering coop that will assist senior hardware engineers with signal integrity and timing analysis of DDR4 interfaces and high-speed serial interfaces (such as PCI-E) on Oracle Computer Hardware. The role may also contribute to power design activities related to the development and validation of Oracle's next generation server hardware targeted for cloud applications. The signal integrity and power design group is a small, focused team, distributed geographically spanning a few different internal hardware product design groups, focusing on the validation of signal integrity, design of power converters and power switches for all Oracle server hardware products optimized for performance, component cost, physical density, reliability, and manufacturability.
 
The selected candidate will be working primarily with senior hardware engineers at the Oracle Burlington MA Location but will be interfacing and collaborating with other senior team members and hardware design/operations groups spread across a couple US time zones. The ideal candidate is capable of working collaboratively, communicating effectively with a geographically distributed team setting but is also comfortable with functioning independently and reaching out for assistance when needed.
 
What will I do?
Signal Integrity Engineer: Gain knowledge and hand-on experience with simulation tools used for Signal & Power Integrity analysis and validation, including but not limited to: Synopsys HSPICE, SiSoft Quantum-SI, Ansoft HFSS/Q3D/SIWave, Mathworks MATLAB, and Cadence-Allegro/Sigrity PCB SI/PI tools such as PowerDC. Lab experience will be gained in the use of high speed test equipment for critical timing and correlative measurements/assessments.     
Assist senior SI Engineers with pre and post-layout PCB simulation and timing analysis of DDR4 memory interfaces on Oracle's Intel and AMD based system platforms;
Assist lab design verification for system platforms; Perform characterization, modeling and simulation of high speed serial interfaces (SERDES) such as QPI, SMI and PCI Express interfaces;
Carry out crosstalk analysis on multiple computer system platforms. Includes determining signal groups and their worst-case characteristics along with better design solutions;
Perform empirical memory interface characterization on multiple X86 platforms which includes evaluating the margins across all the supported DIMM vendors, DIMM types and at various speeds;
Assist with the evaluation of system power for all supported DIMM vendors, DIMM type at the supported speeds to help Oracle optimize its power budget by selecting the most efficient DIMMs;
Performance analysis of various different memory configurations, the bandwidth along with the DIMM power and cost of the DIMM enable an efficient selection of the memory DIMMs;
Assist with the development and verification of design constraints that will guarantee the operation of the design over temperature, voltage, and process.
Assist in software development to enable high speed memory operation and validate the BIOS across a number of memory configurations to check for proper speed and voltage operation.
What will I do?
Power Engineer:                           
Develop test equipment automation utilities to improve power validation and characterization capabilities and efficiency (interfacing with power supplies, electronic loads, oscilloscopes, DMMs, DAQs, etc)
Perform circuit board level power lab validation/characterization and document findings.
Assist senior engineers with power related issue debug at both the circuit and system level, interfacing with internal hardware/operations teams and external suppliers as needed.
Perform PCB power simulations to characterize new designs and validate alternate design proposals to address potential issues.
Help with schematic capture and PCB layout exercises for new and existing power designs.
Collaborate with senior engineers to participate in schematic and layout design reviews.
Participate in competitive teardowns with a focus on documenting and analyzing power components and design decisions.
Opportunity to assist other groups within organization associated with hardware design if interested (Signal Integrity, Component Engineering, Value Engineering, and PCBA Manufacturing).
What are we looking for in a candidate?
BS Electrical Engineering
GPA  3.2 or greater
Knowledge of simulation and modeling tools such as HSPICE/PSPICE, SiSoft Quantum- SI, Ansys HFSS/Q3D/SIWave, PI solvers e.g. Sigrity's PowerDC to develop signal and power integrity design recommendations
Understanding of Computer Hardware PCB and PCBA Technologies and Design processes.
Understanding of Perl, Python, Matlab, Visual Basic and any other programming is a plus.
Previous internship or experience in hardware design at hobby-level a strong plus
Exposure to schematic capture and PCB design tools.
Experience with lab test equipment (oscilloscopes, DMM, power supply, electronic load) and soldering/rework tools.
Experience with printed circuit board assembly (PCBA) construction, surface mount component soldering and related rework techniques preferred.
Academic background or experience in Power converter function or design.
No visa sponsorship is available for this position.
If you are interested in working at Oracle and you have more than 1 year of professional full-time work experience (excluding internships, research and/or teaching assistant roles, and/or military experience), please apply to Oracle's experienced job openings.  For information on currently open positions at Oracle, please visit http://oracle.com/goto/careers.
How do I apply?
In order to be considered, all candidates must apply on the Oracle website: 
Visit Oracle.com/Campus > Quick Apply > 1900138C
 
Getting to know you
Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.
 
As part of Oracle's standard employment process, candidates undergo a complete background check prior to an offer being extended. These background checks are conducted by a professional third party firm at no charge to you and include: prior employment verification, education verification, social security trace, criminal background check and motor vehicles records (where required for position).

About PayJoy
PayJoy's mission is to deliver access to credit to the next billion people in emerging markets worldwide.  Our unique mobile security technology creates collateral that enables customers to afford their first smartphone on credit and then allows them further access to credit to help weather life's unexpected financial surprises and climb the ladder of economic well-being.

Founded in 2015, today PayJoy has reached hundreds of thousands of customers in a dozen countries around the globe, from Mexico to Indonesia, India, Kenya, and Nigeria, and is on a strong growth path with support from major industry partners to bring credit to millions in 2019.

This Role
As a Software Engineering Co-op, you will build the technology to support millions of customers worldwide. Our unique locking technology combines our proprietary "secret sauce" (in firmware and Android O/S security) and the effective use of data to give users credit-based products in emerging markets. We're also focused on world-class app design, web frontend and backend, and partner API integrations. As a key part of PayJoy's global engineering team, you need to be up for any technical challenge and willing to learn new technologies. 

Responsibilities
Code software primarily in PHP, Javascript/AngularJS.
Query and manage MySQL databases.
Work with global engineering teams and partners to deliver great products into international markets.
Work in teams with product, design, data science, risk, and operations to design and build great products.
Independently able to build and/or take ownership of sets of features
Minimum Qualifications
Prior experience in PHP and/or Javascript or the ability to pick these up quickly.
Creative and fast problem solving capabilities.
Good verbal and written communication skills in English.
As part of PayJoy, you will have the opportunity to work on meaningful projects that immediately impact our customers, work alongside seasoned professionals and entrepreneurs, and contribute to a startup that is experiencing rapid growth.

Company Overview
Partner Therapeutics (PTx) is devoted to developing and commercializing cancer medicines and combination therapies that can make a meaningful difference in the lives of cancer patients.  We are united in our passion for improving the treatment of cancer and our desire to make a meaningful contribution to outcomes.  We believe that being a cancer company begins and ends with the patient.  We strive to support patients throughout their treatment journey and offer therapy options that are right for them and their loved ones.
 
PTx has worldwide rights to Leukine® (sargramostim).  As the only FDA approved GM-CSF available in the U.S., we believe Leukine® offers important and differentiated benefits to cancer patients and are excited by the opportunity to effectively re-introduce it to the hematology/oncology community with its current label and potential future expansion indications.  Leukine® is also the subject of significant scientific interest with multiple ongoing investigator sponsored trials.   
 
We seek a co-op student to work closely with a Northeastern (and co-op program) alumnus on delivering mission-critical projects. Working with us in our Lexington, MA headquarters will give you direct exposure to Director and VP-level mentorship. Your output will inform reports shared with C-Suite and Board of Directors. This position will provide experience in entrepreneurship, operations, biotechnology, data analytics, compliance, project management, and others.
 
Job Responsibilities
Support the commercial operations function with new product launch planning and execution
Maintaining and updating senior leadership commercial reporting and analytics
Perform ad-hoc data analyses (e.g., promotional response, sales team effectiveness, etc.) as requested by C-suite
Support the compliance function with projects related to aggregate spend reporting, the Federal Physician Payments Sunshine Act ('Sunshine Act'), state laws and restrictions, transparency and public disclosure
Note that this position does not involve lab work or traditional engineering design. We are looking for students that are interested in learning/getting involved in "the business side" of biotech. 
 
Qualifications
Advanced to Expert Excel skills
Experience with R is helpful, but not required
Strong communicator who can summarize key data and findings precisely and succinctly
Preferred majors include: Engineering [chemical, bio, industrial], Computer Science, Economics, and Finance

Co-op Description:
The Investment Office of Partners HealthCare, which manages one of the nation's largest health care investment portfolios, seeks a highly motivated student to become a Co-op member of the investment team. The Co-op is expected to be a fully-involved, contributing member of the team, providing the opportunity to gain a wealth of knowledge about institutional investing. The Co-op position is based in downtown Boston.

The Experience:
The successful candidate will work in a small-team environment alongside accomplished investment professionals. Through a series of projects that support the investment process, the Co-op will learn the nuances of research and portfolio management in the institutional investing world, while appreciating the benefits that strong returns bring to Partners HealthCare patients.
The Co-op will have the opportunity to meet with fund managers and evaluate investment strategies among all asset classes (e.g., hedge funds, private equity, real assets, etc.) and to research impactful trends and market movements.
Co-op students who immerse themselves in the experience will learn how an investment team works together to identify and research global investment opportunities, and get exposure to skills related to risk management, investment performance, financial analysis, and portfolio construction.

Qualifications:
Strong desire to learn about investing with institutional fund managers
Strong analytical and communication skills
Quantitative and technological skills, including adeptness with Excel
Willingness to work diligently and independently to complete projects
Excellent organizational skills
Unquestionable ethical standards
Teamwork orientation

About Our Organization:
The Investment Office of Partners HealthCare oversees a global investment portfolio for Partners HealthCare System, an integrated health care system in Boston. Formed in 1994 by Massachusetts General Hospital and Brigham and Women's Hospital, Partners and its affiliate hospitals are among the world's leading biomedical research organizations and are principal teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School.

Organization and Job ID

Job ID: 309730

Directorate: National Security

Division: Computing & Analytics
 

Job Description

PNNL is seeking undergraduate and graduate students for assignments within the National Security Internship Program (NSIP). The Computing and Analytics Division is looking for individuals who have a passion for solving critical national challenges using advanced computational, statistical, and mathematical techniques. The intern will be given an opportunity to be presented with complex problems in national security, energy, and science; apply cutting-edge research to make our nation safer and stronger; develop complex computer code; develop and participate in cyber competitions; design new visualization; work with big data and optimize solutions for energy.

Positions are available in Richland, WA and Seattle, WA, based on business need.

College and University Co-op positions will be up to a 6-month duration. Participants must be available to start January 2020.

Assignments for non-co-op positions will be a minimum of 10 weeks. Participants must be available to start January 2020.

Diverse Focus Areas: Your internship can be in one of six technical groups.
 

1. Applied Statistics & Computational Modeling: Employ powerful tools and techniques, such as mathematical modeling and computational statistics, graph and game theory, network science, and uncertainty quantification to solve complex problems in a variety of domains.

Disciplines: Applied Mathematics, Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations Research

Desired skills: R, Python, discrete event simulation (e.g., Arena), agent based modeling
 

2. Cyber Security: Deliver first-of-a-kind solutions ranging from network and software development to embedded systems to protect our nation's critical strategic assets.Develop cyber technologies and processes that have direct impact on our national security and scientific missions.

Disciplines: Cyber Security, Computer Science
 

3. Data Sciences & Analytics: Operate on the data-to-knowledge continuum distilling large, fast, distributed, and messy data into knowledge to support decision processes. Develop data pipelines, services, and data stores. Gain experience with modern NoSQL and distributed-SQL systems.

Disciplines: Applied Machine Learning, Data Architectures, Data Engineering, Data Science, Deep Learning

Desired skills: Python, Java, C#, C++, SQL, JSON
 

4. Operations & Analysis: Use a multitude of information sources to identify threats to critical networks and systems, creating tools that help us become more efficient at identifying those threats.

Disciplines: Cyber Security, Computer Science, Information Management
 

5. Software Engineering & Architectures: Develop and deliver well-architected software-centric systems and deploy sustainable software and hardware systems used in high-impact production environments.

Disciplines: Mobile Application Development, Software Engineering, Software Testing

Desired skills: Java, JavaScript, web design, software testing
 

6. Visual Analytics: Combine innovative interactive visualizations with advanced automated data analysis techniques to enable users to gain deeper insights from their data.Make complex data useful through skillful visual design, compelling human computer interaction, sound analytic methods, and solid engineering.

Disciplines: Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Information Visualization, User Experience, Virtual/Augmented Reality
 

To learn more:

https://workbasedlearning.pnnl.gov/default.aspx?topic=National_Security_Internship_Program_(NSIP)

https://www.pnnl.gov/computing-analytics

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mz2UPYcl_uI
 

*HOW TO APPLY*

Must complete all sections on the PNNL application portal.

When prompted to "Upload Resume" all documents listed below must be bundled into ONE-SINGLE PDF for upload:

1) Resume or CV

2) Current unofficial transcript with cumulative GPA listed

3) 300-word essay describing how your specific interests pertain to one of the focus areas listed above, such as personal projects, hobbies outside of class, or any other activity to help you gain extra experience in your field beyond textbook knowledge.

If any one of the 3 components are not included and/or not uploaded in ONE-SINGLE PDF file, application will be rejected and will no longer be considered.

Electronic applications accepted until 11:59:59 pm (PST) on the closing date indicated on the job posting.
 

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must be degree-seeking students enrolled at an accredited college or university.
Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.3 is required.
Some projects may require U.S. citizenship.


Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital or family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. All BMI staff must be able to demonstrate the legal right to work in the United States. BMI is an E-Verify employer. Learn more at jobs.pnnl.gov.

Panorama is on a mission to radically improve student outcomes by helping educators act on data. Today, more than 500 school systems serving over seven million students use Panorama to ensure that each child is getting the support they need, so that more students succeed in school, graduate, and go on to college. Panorama helps educators monitor how students are doing across academics, attendance, behavior, and college readiness, and then coordinate action to support each child. Panorama's platform also helps educators get data about non-academic factors that are key to each child's success in school and in life, such as social-emotional skills, safety, teacher-student relationships, and family engagement. Panorama has raised a $32mm led by Emerson Collective as well as Spark Capital, Owl Ventures, SoftTechVC, and the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative.

Our engineers are changing history way beyond "git rebase -i". The engineering team is involved in every step of the product cycle, working closely with many other teams (and our users!) to brainstorm and build solutions to education's toughest problems. Sure, we have strong technical chops, but we make sure to constantly challenge ourselves and grow. From lunchtime guest talks and weekly book clubs to hackathons and open-source projects (both in the office and outside it), we try to improve ourselves as we help schools around the world do the same. Check out our engineering blog to learn about the experiences of our first ever co-op cohort!


In this co-op, you will:
*Work on fascinating and challenging problems, like:
**Learning recommendation engines that correlate educator data with community-generated content.
**Optical mark recognition infrastructure capable of processing millions of sheets of paper per day.
**Novel data visualizations that uncover insights from school districts' dizzying variety of data sets.
*Design, write, test, review, debug, deploy, and occasionally be frustrated by code.
*Never put developer ease or convenience over making a difference to the millions of students we serve.

Our ideal candidate:
*Loves to learn and be challenged.
*Is a strong coder in any language (we primarily use Ruby and JavaScript, but it's okay if you haven't?see the previous bullet point).
*Is a middler or junior, excited to take part and have an impact in their second or third co-op experience.
*Has some experience in (or a lot of interest in) web app development and deployment?Unix and testing and uptime, oh my!
*Is a great communicator and collaborator. We're a close-knit team! Check out our blog: http://engineering.panoramaed.com/


Panorama Education is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive company because we serve students, educators and families from tremendously diverse backgrounds and identities across the country; we've seen how our product and impact are strengthened the more we reflect that diversity. In addition, we have found (and we believe the research) that diverse teams are higher-performing, and we embrace the varied perspectives that our team members share with each other. As such, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Background Info
            Pison is a high tech MIT startup creating the next generation of nerve-sensing and microgesture recognition for control of technology such as augmented reality and drones. The patented technology is being deployed at NASA, Samsung, the ALS Association, and the Department of Defense. The company was founded in 2016 with the mission of creating the most intuitive and universal human-computer interface to help people with ALS and other disabilities. The concept of nerve-sensing and microgesture input was inspired by the CEO's mother who had ALS. The goal of the company is to embed the patented electronics and algorithms into smart watches for mass market distribution in the disability, AR, VR, and military markets.
 
Job Overview
            As a Unity/UX Developer at Pison, you will be creating user experiences to demonstrate the capabilities of the Pison tech. Using the Unity Engine and our SDK, you will be focusing on rapidly prototyping and developing different experiences that shows how our tech can be implemented into different use cases to amplify the experience. You will be developing for multiple platforms, such as Windows, Android, Hololens etc. to implement our device as an alternative input solution/controller. You will be with working with AR/VR technology such as the Hololens, Magic Leap, ARCore.
 
Responsibilities
Design and develop experiences to showcase tech capabilities
Work with other team members to spec out and manage projects
Meet deadlines for project due dates
 
Skills
Experience with the Unity Engine and familiarity with it's features
C# development experience
Experience with game/UX development
Experience with well-performing and maintainable code
Experience with UI design
Experience with rapid prototype development
Organized and able to self-manage
Knowledge of source control tools (Git, GitHub) for issue tracking and project management
Able to work on and manage multiple projects at once.

Who We Are

The Cloud Foundry engineering team is looking for co-ops to join us in building an open source platform that transforms how the world deploys and scales software.

You

You love shipping features, but know that well factored code is what lets you keep shipping features in the long run.  Maybe you get antsy writing code without tests, or perhaps you have system operations experience and are interested in leveling-up your coding skills.

Either way, you judge your success by the success of your team; you are interested in learning about distributed systems; and you are excited to work on open source.

Us

At Pivotal Cloud Foundry we are opinionated about how software should be built. We pair program, all-day every-day, because we know it delivers remarkable results. We work in small teams, and rotate between them frequently. We believe in working at a sustainable pace. You'll typically pair for 8 hours each day, but then you're off work to relax, recharge, and refocus.

Where

Cloud Foundry engineering is located in New York at 636 Avenue of the Americas.  To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

We're seeking more amazing developers to add to our team. Apply by sending us a resume and optionally a cover letter.

Ability to work within a polyglot codebase and contribute while learning
Experience and/or interest in Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies
Experience as an operator or adminstrator of UNIX/Linux. (You know what a daemon is and how to restart one. When the daemon won't start because some other process is listening on the port it needs, you can find and kill the errant process.)
Candidate for a BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics or a related field.

Coordinator Note: (CS-OOR), (CS-STRTUP)

Company:
Plexim - a Swiss company with an office in Porter Square, Cambridge - provides solutions for designing and testing of power electronic systems. PLECS is a simulation software tool for developing such systems, and the RT Box is a Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) platform for controller testing. Plexim's customers include industry-leading engineering companies, as well as top academic and research labs worldwide. Plexim's tools are used in renewable energy, transportation, aerospace, industrial, automation, medical, and consumer electronics applications.

The PLECS Coder allows Plexim's users to generate C code for microcontrollers (e.g. the Texas Instruments C2000 family) directly from a schematic window in PLECS. This saves manual programming effort and is made possible with target support packages which are tailored for each controller type to accurately represent the model's blocks as code. Here is a video highlighting a target support package for the Arduino Uno: https://youtu.be/FHe4mjR0ixs.

Available tasks (choose one or more):
- Develop target support packages for microcontrollers used in the power electronics industry
- Create electrical circuit simulation models in PLECS for various applications
- Be involved in other aspects of developing and testing of Plexim's products
 
You:
- Have a basic understanding of power electronics, motor drives, and/or embedded controls
- Want to learn and expand your technical skills
- Enjoy having a diverse range of challenges every day
- Are detail-oriented with excellent written and verbal communications skills
- Are excited about working in a dynamic, small-team environment
- Are reliable and willing to work both with others and independently
 
Bonus Points:
- Prior PLECS, PSpice or MATLAB/Simulink modeling experience
- Power electronics knowledge/experience from coursework or previous co-ops
- Knowledge of embedded systems, feedback, or motor control
- Experienced with C/C++ or Python for firmware and tools development
- Can share examples of projects you've done
- Can request a PLECS trial from our website and send us a circuit model you've created with your comments/description

About Prime Buchholz:
Prime Buchholz LLC was established in 1988 and has grown to become a leading, completely independent investment consulting firm advising more than 260 institutional clients. Headquartered in Portsmouth, NH with offices in Boston and Atlanta. Prime Buchholz was one of the first investment consulting firms to develop in-depth expertise in alternative investments such as hedge funds, private equity, and real assets.

Our clients include educational endowments, private and public foundations, cultural and religious organizations, health care and insurance organizations, pension plans, and high net worth families. We work closely with our clients to create, implement, and monitor investment policies and asset allocation strategies to meet their unique investment goals.

Long-term client partnerships are a cornerstone at Prime Buchholz. The firm is employee-owned, and clients can expect personal service from a deeply experienced team that puts client needs first.

Our Mission
At Prime Buchholz, we're driven every day by our mission and passion to help our clients build the financial strength necessary to turn their visions into reality.
 
While You're Part of Our Team
Your Investment Consulting Research Co-op program is designed to provide you the opportunity to gain work experience as you play a key role on our Research Team.  During your time here, we will work with you toward achieving the goal of providing valuable, timely, and accurate data retrieval and input, document retention, and financial statement review services.  We will provide you with exposure to and help you build skills using industry-specific software in support of our team of analysts.  This means you will be a valuable part of our team from Day 1; our goal is for you to take with you the skills and experience required to provide added value to the overall client experience and investment programs.

Experience and Skills You Will Gain At Prime Buchholz
The majority of tasks you will perform as an Investment Consulting Research Co-op at Prime Buchholz will consist of investment manager due diligence and research-related activities.  You can expect to build industry knowledge and on-the-job skills as you do the following:
Collect manager documentation to back-load our document management database with selected materials (e.g., financial statements, offering memorandums, etc.)
Assist the Data and Research Teams in updating data on flexible capital managers by inputting information from financial statements into specified templates for expense, tax and other calculations
Assist the Data and Research Teams in gathering and updating historical assets under management, strategy allocations, and performance attribution from flex cap managers
Complete our in-house manager due diligence questionnaires with information furnished by the managers
Organize and build out our due diligence files
Screen industry periodicals for manager specific-information (e.g., new funds, closed funds, etc.)
Compile quarterly reports and work to establish broad access to quarterly manager information
Attend and take notes at  investment manager meetings and calls and internal committee meetings
Update and create performance reports using software programs such as Factset
Analyze manager data, create Excel charts, and assist in creating manager recommendation reports
In addition to the above, the Prime Buchholz Research Co-op may be asked to perform other tasks as departmental needs change.
 
Getting off to a Strong Start
The ideal candidate for the Investment Consulting Research Co-op role will bring with him/her a foundation of skills and knowledge that include the following:
Intermediate to advanced experience with Microsoft Office products; proficient in Excel
Knowledge of Quickbase, FactSet, Tableau will be helpful but is not required
General investment knowledge and interest
Demonstrated commitment, dependability, and respect for other employees with regular attendance, punctuality, and adherence to agreed-upon schedule of availability
Excellent attention to detail, with strong communication and organizational skills
A team-player mentality, with effective time-management skills and the ability to multi-task

Program Facts
You will work in a professional, fast-paced office environment.
Please be prepared to work in a stationary, cubicle-based environment.  This work occasionally may be intermixed with other related tasks, including lifting/pushing/pulling of up to 20 pounds.
Please expect to work a standard, 40-hour week (8:30 a.m. - 5 p.m.) with overtime as required.
The co-op program pays $17.00 per hour.

What's In It for You
You can't beat the chance to roll up your sleeves and get to work directly alongside the experts when it comes to professional development.  Here, you'll get to do that, but you'll also enjoy the following perks which we think are pretty great:
Meaningful work and mission: You already know we help bring our clients' dreams to fruition; what sets us apart is that we do it with a rare independence that allows us to put clients first always.  We're pretty proud of the clients we serve, too, many of which are educational, nonprofit, medical, and community organizations working to better the world around them.
Direct access to firm principals: Our size allows for firm wide collaboration and regular exposure to our leaders.
Respect for (and flexibility that allows for) work/life balance 
And while you're at the office a genial, collaborative office culture
Opportunities for growth, both personal and professional. We encourage professional development and internal advancement.  We also actively support our employees' community volunteerism, as well as mental and physical health activities.
Location: We're right in the heart of historic, bustling Boston, home to some of the world's best sports teams, arts and entertainment venues, restaurants, and more not to mention a world of professional possibilities. 
Fun! There's no taking away from how seriously we take our mission, but we also enjoy a relaxed atmosphere. We even have a Fun Committee. Think catered lunches, firm outings and activities, lunchtime fitness classes, and more.

Prime Buchholz is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law.

About Prime Buchholz
Prime Buchholz LLC was established in 1988 and has grown to become a leading, completely independent investment consulting firm advising more than 260 institutional clients. Headquartered in Portsmouth, NH with offices in Boston and Atlanta. Prime Buchholz was one of the first investment consulting firms to develop in-depth expertise in alternative investments such as hedge funds, private equity, and real assets.

Our clients include educational endowments, private and public foundations, cultural and religious organizations, health care and insurance organizations, pension plans, and high net worth families. We work closely with our clients to create, implement, and monitor investment policies and asset allocation strategies to meet their unique investment goals.

Long-term client partnerships are a cornerstone at Prime Buchholz. The firm is employee-owned, and clients can expect personal service from a deeply experienced team that puts client needs first.

Our Mission
At Prime Buchholz, we're driven every day by our mission and passion to help our clients build the financial strength necessary to turn their visions into reality.

While You're Part of Our Team
Your Investment Consulting Performance Analyst Co-op program is designed to provide you the opportunity to gain work experience as you play a key role in the daily performance measurement, monitoring, and reporting services we provide to our clients.  In this role, you will become a valuable part of our team from Day 1.  During your time with us, we will work with you to achieve the goal of providing efficient and accurate calculation and reconciliation of investment performance.  The Performance Analyst Co-op has the potential to directly add value to the overall client experience and investment programs. 

Experience and Skills You Will Gain at Prime Buchholz
As an Investment Consulting Performance Analyst Co-op, you can expect to build industry knowledge and on-the-job skills as you do the following:
Apply investment knowledge and sound judgment to select appropriate benchmarks and peer universe comparisons for all investments and plans
Utilize various custodian bank downloads and data files for proprietary performance measurement system input
Utilize proprietary database of client statements on a monthly basis to complete performance measurement calculations for all client investments
Maintain monthly cash flows for assigned client accounts by calculating and reconciling monthly investment valuations, transactions, fees, and investment returns for marketable and nonmarketable investments
Calculate portfolio characteristics for client reports that include but are not limited to:  equity, fixed income, hedge funds, and real assets
Analyze client meeting reports in a timely manner and ensure all job-specific action items are handled through completion
Deliver accurate and timely monthly executive summaries and quarterly reports for client relationships
Ensure data input accuracy
Interact professionally with custodial banks, mutual fund companies, and investment managers?in writing and verbally
Work in a team environment with analysts and senior investment professionals who may be located in other areas of the country
Interact with clients regarding performance-related issues
Use our contact management database to deliver client performance reports electronically to client contacts
Assist in creating new templates onto proprietary performance measurement system
Prepare ad hoc reports, custom slides, and presentations for clients and principals of the Firm
Getting off to a Strong Start
The ideal candidate for the Investment Consulting Performance Analyst Co-op role will bring with him/her a foundation of skills and knowledge that include the following:
Progression towards a Bachelor's degree in Finance or business-related field
Interest in the CIPM/CFA/CAIA program (s) desired
General investment knowledge helpful
Excellent attention to detail, strict adherence to deadlines, and advanced problem-solving skills on a consistent basis
Demonstrated commitment, dependability, and respect for other employees with regular attendance, punctuality and adherence to agreed-upon schedule of availability
A team-player mentality
Effective time management skills, including prioritization of tasks and overall organization
Strong verbal and written communication skills with internal and external contacts
Intermediate to advanced experience with Microsoft Office products, specifically with respect to financial functions and chart generation
Program Facts
You will work in a professional, fast-paced office environment.
Please be prepared to work in a stationary, cubicle-based environment.  This work occasionally may be intermixed with other related tasks, including lifting/pushing/pulling of up to 20 pounds.
Please expect to work a standard, 40-hour week (8:30 a.m. - 5 p.m.) with overtime as required.
The co-op program pays $17.00 per hour.

What's In It for You
You can't beat the chance to roll up your sleeves and get to work directly alongside the experts when it comes to professional development.  Here, you'll get to do that, but you'll also enjoy the following perks which we think are pretty great:
Meaningful work and mission: You already know we help bring our clients' dreams to fruition; what sets us apart is that we do it with a rare independence that allows us to put clients first always.  We're pretty proud of the clients we serve, too, many of which are educational, nonprofit, medical, and community organizations working to better the world around them.
Direct access to firm principals: Our size allows for firm wide collaboration and regular exposure to our leaders.
Respect for (and flexibility that allows for) work/life balance 
And while you're at the office a genial, collaborative office culture
Opportunities for growth, both personal and professional: We encourage professional development and internal advancement.  We also actively support our employees' community volunteerism, as well as mental and physical health activities.
Location: We're right in the heart of the historic, bustling, small city of Portsmouth, home to nationally known arts and entertainment venues, restaurants, outdoor activities, and more.  
Fun! There's no taking away from how seriously we take our mission, but we also enjoy a relaxed atmosphere. We even have a Fun Committee. Think catered lunches, firm outings and activities, lunchtime fitness classes, and more.

Prime Buchholz is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law.

It's not just about pushing code. It's about pushing high-quality code that sets the product apart and defines the ethos of the experience of the product. No problem shouldn't be considered and your teammates enjoy working through them with you. It's not personal, it's all about creating the very best product possible.

If this is you, come join the team at ProfitWell as an Engineer Co-op where you'll have a chance to get your hands dirty and learn from others who share your passion for building amazing products. For the past seven years, ProfitWell has been helping companies make more money and learn more about their customers through pricing and value monitoring. We do that by collecting, analyzing, and communicating not just data, but actionable insights. We believe that taking a bunch of data and translating it into a bunch of graphs doesn't really solve the problem. We also believe that focus on one industry helps us win in helping customers and growing our business. We want to solve for these failings of the Business Intelligence industry, empowering everyone to get the most out of the subscription model.

Our engineering team is small but deadly, and we are excited to add a few highly talented individuals to the group. This is a chance to help set the direction of technology, engineering culture, and the type & quality of future hires.

At ProfitWell, you'll learn more than you ever thought imaginable amongst a team that's incredibly focused on their mission to help subscription companies grow through pricing, analytics, and retention tools.

Promoboxx is the only retail marketing platform powered by brands 
We enable national manufacturing brands to connect, manage, and market through their entire retail channel.  We are proud to partner with leading brands -- including Chevrolet, GE Appliances, New Balance, and The North Face -- and with over 3 million retailer campaigns shared.  Promoboxx is transforming the way retailers and brands market together at the local level. We are rapidly expanding and we are looking for the next great backend engineering interns to join our team! 

Job Description
We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern who will contribute towards our efforts building, scaling and evolving our constantly growing product and infrastructure. You will work closely with our backend engineers to deliver new features as a part of the full software development lifecycle. This includes: working with the product team to turn requirements into design, coding, testing, and ultimately deploying fully functional, bug-free features.

You will experience our DevOps team culture and learn how to own your code across environments in our AWS cloud platform.  Using an agile methodology and with the guidance of our senior engineers, you will develop features alongside the frontend members of the team to ensure end-to-end performance for our users.  As a teammate, you will seek ways to improve the team's delivery and quality on a daily basis.

What you'll do:
Work with other backend engineers on the team to design, develop and deploy backend services with a focus on high availability, low latency, and scalability
Build and operate infrastructure, toolset, and deployment pipelines
Collaborate closely with other engineers and become a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional team
Work in an environment that supports your individual growth

Who you are:
You are an aspiring professional software engineer with experience building software as part of a development lifecycle
You are excited for a technically challenging opportunity that will allow you to grow while also providing the opportunity to deliver real business value.
You have experienced with one or more of these languages and environments: Ruby, Go, Java, Python, SQL
You understand the importance of including tests in code that you write and do not consider untested code to be complete

You have an interest in learning some, if not all of the following aspects of backend development work:
API development, including REST conventions
SQL Database and Stored Procedure development -  how they work, writing performant database code, and optimizing database calls
How to maintain a continuous delivery environment and automated testing
Data structures and algorithms and how they can apply to pragmatic solutions
Microservice architecture, development, and tooling
Networking principles: DNS lookup, HTTP/S and TCP/IP protocols, virtual hosting
Other operating system principles relevant to backend development - storage layout, concurrency, multiprocessing/multithreading, parallelism

Tools we use / Bonus points for experience with:
AWS
Docker
Terraform
Ruby / Rails
Go
Postgres
Mysql
Git
CircleCI
Datadog
Facebook Graph API
Postman

What Promoboxx Can Offer You:
An open, collaborative work environment with an amazing team and experienced leadership to help you succeed 
Mentorship focused around your personal growth
Technically challenging opportunity with a variety of technologies and types of tasks to get experience with the full software development lifecycle

This role will be part of PVH Corp.'s Co-Op Program. Students will work for a 4-month duration for 40 hours per week, beginning on January 7, 2020 and ending on May 20, 2020. The program includes real hands-on work within an assigned department, formal training classes focusing on skills to include professional presence, networking opportunities, community service, and much more!

The Business Process Management (BPM) organization contributes to PVH's transformation through global adoption of new and enduring business capabilities. Our mission is to lead, listen and partner to create extraordinary value for our brands through process excellence. BPM optimize business processes to deliver consistent, core capabilities balanced with flexibility to support value add brand/regional differences.

The Business Process Analyst Coop role will support in the data analysis and documentation of data standardization and data governance across multiple data domains across the PVH Enterprise. This role will help create and maintain data standardization documentation such as business data glossary and metadata information that support data standards. This role will support the development of process workflows and standard operating procedures documentation relating to data standardization and governance activities. This role will collaborate with IT partners and work with the business to refine tools utilized by the data governance team to provide visibility of data flow throughout our system landscape. This role will support various ad hoc data analysis as data challenges/issue arise. This role will support the development of data governance organizations as we build out to support PVH data domains.

Demonstration of a strong analytical mindset to perform root cause and other related technical analyses.
Practical experience designing and documenting business processes and sub-processes. Proficient in use of MS Excel, Power Point.
SQL a plus.
Strong organizational skills

Co-op Job Description:
This role will be part of PVH Corp.'s Co-Op Program. Students will work for a 6-month duration for 40 hours per week, beginning on July 9, 2019 and ending on December 13, 2019. The program includes real hands-on work within an assigned department, formal training classes focusing on skills to include professional presence, networking opportunities, community service, and much more!

The Business Process Management (BPM) organization contributes to PVH's transformation through global adoption of new and enduring business capabilities.  Our mission is to lead, listen and partner to create extraordinary value for our brands through process excellence.  BPM optimize business processes to deliver consistent, core capabilities balanced with flexibility to support value add brand/regional differences.

The BPM Planning Team operates as internal consultants across PVH, leading the design and implementation of planning leading practices and transformation programs. The planning team serves as subject matter experts, guiding and supporting business units on integrated planning strategies/roadmaps, business process design, development of capabilities and systems, performance metrics, training, adoption, and continuous improvement.

The BPM Planning Team actively partners with business and IT in the rollout of the PVH Performs transformation program. The planning team guides and governs the integrated demand & supply planning processes & capabilities ensuring alignment with business strategies/requirements, leads development and delivery of training, facilitates user acceptance testing and implementation, and enables business transformation and end user adoption.

The BPM (Business Process Management) Planning Co-op will have two sets of responsibilities.

The primary objective of the role will be to support the BPM Planning team in executing the PVH Performs program working cross functionally in Demand, Inventory, Supply, and IBP (Integrated Business Planning). Responsibilities include the following:
- Process & Training Documentation: The co-op will support the BPM team in the development/maintenance of process and training documentation templates and content. 
- Facilitation Support: Meetings with the business users often target key decision making or alignment on action items. The co-op will be responsible for defining a template and using it to record attendees, notes, key decision, and tasks.
- Administration of the PVH Performs business calendar: The co-op will coordinate business user availability with the BPM Team, and scheduling sessions via the PVH Performs Calendar.

The second will be to own the planning and execution of one or two small projects. Options for such projects include:
- BPM Archive: Develop and implement a content warehousing strategy leveraging SharePoint. The BPM team generates a significant amount of content, that often times is lost buried in folders. The objective is to create a location and process for storing and cataloging content for easy retrieval and sharing. Next, the strategy will be implemented by working across teams to train them on the process and to migrate content to the new location.
- KPI Insights: Develop KPI (Key Performance Indicator ) insights from data across business units. With the new planning processes and capabilities being implemented via PVH Performs, come a rich source of data. The objective is to enhance KPI adoption by mining the data in search of patterns and exceptions not normally seen in day to day business management. These insights will then need to be packaged and shared with the business.
- BPM Social Network: The creating and implementing a PR strategy to publicize BPM across PVH social channels such as PVH Insider. The BPM team is a newly created entity within the PVH organization. Awareness of the team has grown organically to date, but there is an opportunity to boost awareness by participating in PVH's various communication channels. Examples of content to share can include Supply Chain Educational posts, and announcement of milestone achievements.

Requirements/Skills Needed of Student:
- Demonstration of a strong analytical mindset, either through school projects or previous job/internships.
- Ability to handle multiple cross functional topics, and strong organizational skills.
- Effective communication and documentation skills.
- Proficiency in MS Office suite.
- Supply Chain or Business Majors preferred.
- SQL knowledge is a plus.
