Radial Analytics is a software technology startup that develops decision science solutions for healthcare. Our flagship product, Smart Placement, provides real-time optimization of discharge decision making, identifying which patients could and should safely go home with home health services after a hospital stay. 
 
What We Do
With our nation moving rapidly to implement fee-for-value (health care reform), our solutions help hospitals and health systems deliver care more efficiently while simultaneously improving patient outcomes -- delivering data-driven insights that help clinical care teams make better decisions for patients in real time. We capture huge volumes of data - including actual patient outcomes, real time patient data collected in the hospital, and provider quality metrics - and process this data to help doctors, nurses, and physical therapists make better decisions on a patient-individualized basis.
 
Who We Are
At Radial Analytics, innovation is "in the water" and ideas trump egos.
We are a small team (~10 employees) that pushes the envelope on new ideas and approaches. We think differently to develop creative solutions to problems. We distill complex ideas and data into simple, easily digestible, highly usable forms. We are fast to deploy, fast to test, and fast to fail. We value action over inaction. We believe that the best ideas and solutions are developed through open collaboration. We evaluate ideas for their inherent worth, making no distinction as to their origin. By working together we challenge each other and make each other better. We value the highest integrity in our relationships, our data processing, and our software design.
 
Our tech stack includes a Python / Django backend, ReactJS frontend, PostgreSQL databases, AWS cloud infrastructure, and modern Python-based data science toolsets: including Pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, NLTK, etc. We practice agile software development with two-week sprints.
 
Who YOU Are
You have a passion for developing products that positively impact lives.
You have a technical foundation in computer science, data science, design, and/or analytics.
You like big data and you cannot lie.
You've had some exposure to Python or ReactJS, and maybe you've played with Pandas (a big bonus!).
You are smart, thoughtful, and curious; you are a lifelong learner who is highly motivated to solve big problems.
You understand that when it comes to writing code, the best solutions are simple and elegant.
Healthcare knowledge is a plus.
You love puzzles (love of Legos is an added bonus!)
What You'll Do
As a co-op you will be a full-fledged member of our R&D team. Because we're a small team with plenty of work to do, you'll have the unique opportunity to contribute in a wide variety of ways throughout your co-op based on your skills and interests. Previous co-ops over the past two years have written production code in Python and/or ReactJS, implemented new product features, developed new data analysis algorithms and visualizations, built new data pipelines, performed custom deep-dive data analysis for our customers, redesigned our company website, improved the product user interface, and developed new devops infrastructure. You'll be stretched and will learn a lot, and will be given the mentorship and support you need to succeed.
 
Other Important Stuff
Our office is located at 50 Beharrell Street in Concord, MA, a short walk from the MBTA West Concord commuter rail stop (https://www.mbta.com/schedules/CR-Fitchburg/line). We'll cover 50% of your monthly commuter rail pass.
Our morning standup starts at 9:35am every day.
We're a laid-back group with a casual dress code and a modern, open-concept office.
We're a Mac shop.
We play with Legos.
For our last team outing we picked peaches at a local orchard.
Our Recruitment Pipeline
Apply to this job post - we'd love to (virtually) meet you!
Select candidates will be invited to fill out an online questionnaire followed by an analytics-based coding exercise
Semifinalists will be invited to a phone interview
Finalists will be invited to interview at the Radial office in Concord, MA

Co-op Job Title: (GLOBAL) Intern Engineer - Radio Integration and Optimisation Group
Job Description:
Location: England, UK

Students interested in applying to COE global positions must contact Sally Conant (s.conant@northeastern.edu). Once you have spoken with her about the position, your resume will be sent to global employers.

Pay/stipend will be in line with the cost of living in the UK to be discussed if students are selected for interview. All levels- UG/G/PhD hired so this may fluctuate.

Job Overview
This role would be ideal for an under graduate in electronics, maths, physics or computer engineering.
 
The Radio Integration and Optimisation Group's primary function is bring up, evaluation and optimization of new silicon with a emphasis on RF performance of Bluetooth radios.

The group consists of multi-disciplined (RF, analogue, software and digital) engineers who, working closely with specialist design and systems engineers, use their broad knowledge to provide optimal tuning and solutions for radio operation. The role is predominantly lab-based working at a circuit, cell, subsystem or system level.
 
The individual will be assigned to a project and will work closely with an experienced engineer. They will interface directly with analogue and digital designers, systems engineers and radio control firmware engineers to provide a complete radio system for validation and characterization over the devices operating voltage range, temperature and process skews.
 
Daily Tasks Include
Python code generation to control instrument and data acquisition.
Writing embedded code to exercise the chip functionality.
Maintaining test scripts and developing new features to optimise the RF performance of Bluetooth radios.
RF bench measurements.
Data reviews with the project team.
Minimum Qualifications 
Broad experience of hardware; analogue and digital circuits, wireless communications, RF techniques.
Competent in Python or other scripting languages.
Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of radio architectures at a cell, subsystem and system level.
Knowledge of PLL, mixer, ADC/DAC, LNA and PA circuit operation.
Interests in Bluetooth standards and methods for testing radios.
Familiarity with embedded C code or Verilog.
Keywords
RF, Bluetooth, Radio, Python

Educational Requirements
Successful completion of a 1st or 2nd years study towards a Bachelor's degree in Electronics, Computer Engineering, Maths, Physics or related field.

Radix is an early stage startup building an optimizing compiler that takes biotech procedures and compiles them to instructions that can be executed in a physical biology lab. Well plates are our "memory" and our move instruction is telling a lab worker or pipetting robot to move a substance or physical object from one location to another. We build fundamental abstractions over biology labs including work-flow specification, optimized program compilation to varied back-end targets (real labs) and put it behind great UX. The current industry status quo has talented PhD Biologists spend 5 hours a day on hard to reproduce, unoptimized minutia that isn't innovative. We hope to accelerate biotech innovation like early compilers did for computing by enabling lab protocols to seamlessly operate and be optimized across physical labs. We have funding from some pretty cool people (YCombinator, Firstminute Capital, MIT's The Engine, and Nikesh Arora) and have multiple pilots in academic research labs and commercial biotech corporations, and this number is growing. 
 
We're looking for pragmatic individuals who are able to appreciate well done code but are also willing to "just get things done" when that makes sense. The co-op will do a lot of deep work in our runtime system. If you enjoy playing with expensive robots, this is a great fit for you! We're 100% a Scala shop. While we don't require that you already know Scala, you will need to become proficient in it quickly. It is a dual paradigm object oriented and functional programming language. If you have experience with Scala, Ocaml, Haskell, and/or Java, we're especially enthusiastic to hear from you. We don't hire people who don't enjoy learning and teaching. You can expect to learn from and teach some world class engineers.
 
Key skills:
Experience working with physical hardware (especially mechatronics and robotics)
Experience with object oriented and functional programming (Scala, Ocaml, Haskell, Erlang, Elixer, Java, Python, and/or C++) or a strong desire and at least somewhat demonstrated capacity to learn (say by reading Essential Scala from underscore.io)
Strong critical thinking and causal reasoning skills
Experience tracking down annoying software bugs
Experience with functionally testing software
Experience with GNU/Linux (we do most our work in Linux) and Git for version control
Keen to learn
 
Nice to have:
Have done some things in a bio lab or think this sounds cool
Interested in or have experience with compiler and run-time systems
Experience with the Java virtual machine (JVM), Amazon Web Services (AWS), Raspberry Pis, Apache Kafka, type systems, optimization, data analysis, traveling salesman problems, run time optimization, implementing complex math in code
Human factors, user centered, or general design exposure
 
Radix is a exciting work environment. We care about each other. We're also LGBTQ+, polyamoroy, kink, gender, minority, and most other things supporting.

At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

The Red Hat OpenShift team is looking for a summer engineering co-op to join us in Boston. In this role, you will contribute to the OpenShift Container Platform, built on Linux containers and the Kubernetes cluster management system. Being part of the OpenShift team is about passion for technology and development. We are building a system that is changing how development is done. You'll need to be able to work in a fast-paced and sometimes chaotic environment, with the goal of contributing to one of the most cutting-edge cloud computing projects.

Job Responsibilities:

* Work with the following technologies on a day-to-day basis; don't be discouraged if you aren't familiar with some of the tools and technology included in the list below, as we can help you learn as long as you have the flexibility to apply your knowledge and experience to these new tools:
* Docker
* Kubernetes
* Linux and UNIX operating systems
* Develop code with the following tools:
* Go
* JavaScript
* Bash scripts
* Other OpenShift-supported languages
* Communicate with community members through IRC, forums, and email
* Participate in upstream projects

Required Skills:
* Practical experience with web or system programming, or equivalent university coursework
* Knowledge of the UNIX and Linux operating system (any distribution)
* Ability to communicate at an intermediate level in English as part of a global team
* Previous code contributions to open source projects or code samples on GitHub is preferred

The Role: You will be an integral member of our company's Business Development & Sales teams - assisting with tactical market research, new client prospecting, and sales related analytics. In addition to an hourly wage, you will be paid commissions/bonus (uncapped) based on the work you do that directly impacts our sales process!
What you'll do:
Prospecting Accounts - looking at target company's employees to find relevant Information Security professionals we can pitch the product to
Salesforce Database Maintenance - making sure all entries are correct and updating contact information when needed
Territory Mapping - locating relevant accounts within a specific BDR/SE's territory
Ad-hoc Management Requests - usually cleaning up large spreadsheets in order to portray more accurate information for the sales team to reference
Data Analytics - finding out which companies have the most information security professionals and linking that number to expected ARR through current customers
You'll learn:
From co-workers with decades of experience working in a wide variety of fields - everything from globally recognized tech-entrepreneurs, to ex-Intelligence Agency vets, to PhD's in advanced sciences
About the field of cybersecurity, specifically the sector known as threat intelligence
About the field of Machine Learning and how we utilized massive sets of data to power our product
How to operate efficiently within a full lifecycle business development & sales process, inside a fast-paced tech start-up within in emerging industry
How to navigate and operate Salesforce, the most widely used Customer Relations Management (CRM) product
What you'll bring:
Competitive attitude
Organized nature
Analytical skills
Curious mindset
Resilience
Collaborative, team spirit
 
Why should you join Recorded Future?
There's a reason why over 90% of Fortune 100 Companies rely on us for their threat intelligence needs: our patented web intelligence engine has the ability to unlock insights that radically improve cyber threat visibility for our clients. Our dedication to empowering clients with intelligence to reduce risk has earned us a 4.7-star user rating from Gartner.
If you're full of passion, ambition, and dedication you may be well on your way to becoming a Futurist. From over 35 nationalities, our Futurists are the perfect recipe of humility, accountability, and collaborative attitudes to put our team at the front line of securing the internet. If you want to be a part of this awesome team, apply today!

Looking for an exciting way to step into the digital marketing world? Of course you are. Why else would you be here?

Well, Rightpoint is looking for some help - from smart, young, energetic developers just like you. Are you interested? 

Well, you need to make sure that you're a detail-oriented person who's confident handling multiple activities - all while smiling, not whining.

This is a great (and we mean great) opportunity to gain hands-on experience in marketing with a leader in the digital marketing space. Our co-ops work directly with our full-time professionals - not down in some boiler room removed from the important stuff. As mentors, we offer an invaluable opportunity to gain exposure to all facets of our business - we work hard and we play hard. And we'll expect you to do both. Well.
 
We are looking for someone who can pick up an idea and run with it. In the interest of full disclosure, some administrative tasks may be required. But you'll live.

Work will be dynamic and challenging. Bring your passion and energy and be rewarded by ours.

More about the role
The role we are seeking to fill with a co-op sits within our CMS practice at Rightpoint. The CMS practice is responsible for mostly back-end development of enterprise-scale CMS (content management system) solutions. We primarily work with Sitecore and Episerver CMS platforms. Our work involves integrating HTML/CSS/JavaScript (most often developed by another practice within Rightpoint) into CMS platforms using APIs via C# and MVC. The CMS team works closely with other practices, most often our UI development team (HTML/CSS), QA team, and Project Management group. We are on the verge of shifting towards a more full-stack team as a whole, with more of our work being based on JavaScript APIs for CMS integration. Experience with front-end JavaScript frameworks such as React.js, Angular, or Vue is a big plus.

Responsibilities Include
- Creating quality source code - mostly writen in C# and MVC
- Maintaining quality revisions and change control - we use Git source control, most often following Gitflow as a branching strategy
- Verifying solutions meet requirements
- Interacting closely with project managers and other development team members (tech leads and other developers)
- Understanding timelines, analyzing dependencies, and raising red flags as necessary 
- Contributing to shared source code repositories
 
Candidate Qualifications
- Ability to thrive in a deadline-driven, fast-paced, team environment
- Self-starter with strong capability of multi-tasking
- Strong development skills, preferably with web-based technologies
- Experience with Object-Oriented Programming
- ASP.NET MVC experience a plus
- CSS experience a plus
- JavaScript experience a plus
- Experience with content management systems a plus
- Course work or job experience with the following web technologies: 
              -- an OOP language (e.g. Java, C#), with a strong preference of C#
              -- HTML
              -- SQL


Company Overview

Intrapreneurship is defined as creating from within, starting something from nothing. And it is at the heart of the people at Rightpoint. We are a values-led intrapreneurial organization. We're driven by innovation, rooted in technology and relentlessly curious. We love the creativity involved in taking a blank screen and blinking cursor and making it something amazing. With intrapreneurship in our DNA, we're able to move quickly to build unique, innovative customer experiences that evolve the way our clients do business. .
 
Are you someone who wants to create change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with inspired and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we're searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.
Rightpoint is the largest independent customer experience agency with technology at our core, and 350 employees across 8 U.S. offices. We create seamless digital experiences driven by insight, strategy, technology and design. Rightpoint serves more than 250 Fortune 1,000 companies with strategy, site design and development, content, CRM, commerce, BI and cloud infrastructure.

Why Rightpoint?

We love what we do. And working together. We're united in our mission to make great work every day, and we believe in taking care of our own. That's why we offer a supportive environment with plenty of opportunities to work on interesting projects, grow your career and have fun while doing it.

Come be a part of the team today!

Ronik is looking for Web Developers who are eager to challenge themselves in a small creative agency environment, working on a variety of web-focused projects.

Who are you?

You should have strong organization and communication skills and be comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment. Co-ops at Ronik are treated like full members of the team and have the same responsibilities. We actively mentor Co-ops, so you'll never be on your own, but will be held to a high standard.

You are outgoing and enterprising. You're interested in rolling up your sleeves and working on big projects with a small but mighty team. You're ready to take on real responsibilities and take ownership of your creations. You're excited to work on challenging problems that don't have clear answers. You're willing to ask for guidance when you need it, but you're also a self-starter and independent thinker.

You want to build your portfolio and work with amazing client teams to help transform our partners' ideas into successful, innovative digital products. You're willing to learn new processes and technologies, and to go the extra mile when the team or the project requires it.

You're interested in teaching us something and sharing your experiences. Ronik's strength lies in the diversity of our collective backgrounds and passions, and we look to continually enlighten and inspire each other.

Have a minimum 2.0 GPA.

You should be very familiar with:

Software Engineering Principles, Web Development best practices, JavaScript, HTML, CSS and Node.js

Some of the technologies in our current dev stack include:

- HTML
- Sass / CSS
- Node.js
- webpack
- TakeShape
- ElasticSearch
- Contentful
- Gatsby.js
- Netlify
- React.js
- Vue.js
- PlayCanvas / A-Frame

Every project is an opportunity to update and refine our engineering practices.

You should want to learn more about:

All of the above! And fill us in on what other technologies you're interested in and want to dive more deeply into. We believe that life-long learning is an essential quality, both professionally and personally. Many of Ronik's internal projects have stemmed from the passions and ideas of our Co-ops.


Co-ops at Ronik

- We typically hire two Co-ops, one from CAMD and one from CCIS. This cycle we will consider increasing the size of the cohort by one, depending on the applications we receive
- Co-ops are actively mentored, with monthly goal meetings
- Co-ops participate in Ronik Demo Days, casual show-and-tell presentations where you'll be asked to share/teach something you're pursuing either at or outside of work or school


Who are we?

Ronik is a multidisciplinary creative studio. We lead design and technology strategy for some of the biggest brands in media, entertainment, technology, and the nonprofit sector. We are passionate about building smart, beautiful experiences for audiences on the web, in VR, and in the public space.

We work hard to foster an environment where everyone feels comfortable, included, and free to share their ideas so they can be at their happiest and most creative.

We're a close-knit group who enjoy lunches together and sharing experiences in our lively neighborhood of DUMBO, Brooklyn. We like to have fun outside the office as well, with regular Roniktivities where we enjoy various outings together, chosen and planned as a group.

If Ronik sounds like the place for you, we encourage you to apply.

Overview:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Specialist co-op student to join the Development Sciences (DevSci) Informatics team at Genentech in South San Francisco, California. 

Development Sciences (DevSci) is a translational science organization that plays a critical role in Genentech Research and Early Development (gRED) as well as late stage development of our products at Roche. DevSci supports drug discovery and development projects across all therapeutic areas from discovery to launch and beyond. We are poised at a unique time when large volumes of complex and varied internal and external data for DevSci areas such as Biomarker, PK/PD, Diagnostics, Safety Assessment and Bio-analytical need to be readily accessible to ensure that swift interpretation and decision making can occur. These data impact decisions in ongoing preclinical and clinical programs, and provide key knowledge to inform new target discovery. 

The DevSci Informatics department is accountable for leading the strategy and execution around data lifecycle management, data standards, analytics infrastructure, ongoing data operations, and informatics systems for the DevSci organization. The co-op position will contribute to data management efforts that enable the critically-important scientific and development work in DevSci.


The Position:
Under the guidance of the mentor(s), the incumbent will:
Perform data management tasks to support biomarker discovery and companion diagnostic development efforts in DevSci. These tasks may include data inventory, storage, cataloging, curation, standardization, and vendor onboarding
Communicate extensively with scientists, research associates, operations managers, clinical data managers, analysts, and vendor representatives to gather and clarify requirements
Create and maintain content for internal knowledge sharing and documentation
Contribute to process and workflow improvement projects for the data management team

Required Skills and Experience:
Must be a student in a program related to bioinformatics, biostatistics, statistics, or life sciences
Proficient in R/Python programming 
Working knowledge of Linux
Quick learner and biology knowledge a plus
Familiarity with biomarker or genomics data a plus

The following is a co-op/internship position for an undergraduate that has completed their sophomore or junior year. 
 
Rogers Sciences Inc. (RSI) is an early stage medical device company located in the financial district of downtown Boston.  RSI is the developer of a new form of Photodynamic Therapy (PDT) and has developed wearable medical devices to enhance photosensitizer drugs and photoactive cellular pathways to improve therapeutic outcomes in cancer care and advanced wound care.  Currently, RSI's first product, a drug-device therapy, is in a Phase III pivotal trial for the treatment of skin metastases of breast cancer.
 
Current R&D within RSI is focused on new active-therapeutic-systems for cancer care, wound care, surgical care, and prosthetic devices.  The internship position is to undertake R&D in the development of new electro-optic sensor arrays, micro-image-camera systems, and software applications focused on machine learning algorithms.  R&D will involve the intern to work in teams or on individual projects that start in the design phase and continue with the intern testing out their prototype designs/concepts in the lab.  Interns will potentially get the chance to see some of their work translated into clinical trial deployment.
 
This role is integral in working with the company's CTO and engineering team on product engineering and planning.  He/She will collaborate and coordinate with a range of internal stakeholders to develop action plans on a wide range of strategic engineering issues, regulatory processes, and device testing.
 
Some local New England travel (domestic) is required to meet with vendors and partnership companies.
 
Key Activities
Ability to think strategically and provide concise engineering recommendations
Superior analytical and problem solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual rigor
Ability to structure, manage, and coordinate complex cross-enterprise projects, analyses and processes with multiple work streams and multiple stakeholders at both senior and junior levels
Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills
Eagerness to work intensively, independently, and in joint teams
Strong written and oral communication skills
Pragmatic and results-oriented
Demonstrated experience working in a fast paced setting
Qualifications
Candidate should have 1 or more years of work experience in an engineering or bio-tech position or in a scientific field relevant to material science, biotech and medical device development.
 
Education
Undergraduate or graduate in material science, bio/medical engineering, computer engineering/science, chemical engineering, mechanical engineering, biology, optical engineering, physics, electrical engineering, or mathematics.

This position is part of the Boston Community Impact Co-ops (BCIC) (formerly Community Service Learning Program), which are explained below.  It requires a 1-2 page essay (cover letter) addressing the following: Why do you want this position?  What do you bring to this position?  What do you hope to gain from this position? (don't forget to put your name on the essay). 

Activities Coordinator/Direct Service
 
PROGRAM OVERVIEW
Rosie's Place mission is to support and empower poor and homeless women. The co-op student works with several departments to organize and carry out creative and fun activities for our guests. They also provide services directly to our guests in several different areas including the Dining Room, Food Pantry and Outreach Program and assist with administrative duties as needed.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
Activities Coordinator - The co-op creates and carries out regularly scheduled recreational activities each week in our sitting room or dining room. They are responsible for planning and carrying out the activities as well as working with any volunteers who may be recruited to assist with them. Activities may include weekly bingo, playing song requests with our guests in the sitting room, doing games and arts and crafts with guests in other shelters and leading guest walking groups. 
Direct Service  Working in many different departments, the co-op gains valuable experience working directly with poor and homeless women. They may escort shoppers in the food pantry, help prepare and serve lunch, answer questions at the front desk and work in other areas as needed. 
Outreach - This program reaches out to poor women in the community in their homes, housing projects, public schools and on the streets. For example, co-op students meet weekly with a woman in the community to converse or do an activity together. They assist program directors with administrative tasks and research or special events. 
REQUIREMENTS
Strong communication and organizational skills, an outgoing personality, creativity, flexibility and prior volunteer experience are preferred. 

HOURS: Monday - Friday; 9am to 5pm 
A Criminal Record check is required for employment. 

This position has a $10,000  stipend for the 6 month period (this is about $11/hour)
 
 ***If you would like to read a student?s Reflection project  on working here, click the link and (scroll down to the company name)
 

 THIS POSITION IS A PART OF THE BCIC - BCIC MISSION STATEMENT
 
The Northeastern University BCIC (Boston Community Impact Co-ops) draws upon the strength of Northeastern as a large urban university and as a national and international center for the practice of a form of experiential learning called cooperative education. In establishing a deliberate link between service learning and career development, the BCIC compliments volunteer programs and curricula on campus in order to promote civic responsibility through career choice.
 
The BCIC was initiated by the Student Government Association and is funded through the University. For close to almost two decades, Northeastern University has generously supported the Boston Community Impact Co-ops as a way of expanding cooperative education opportunities, utilizing concurrent group reflection meetings and visits as well as supporting a connection between Northeastern and Boston-based community human service agencies and non-profit organizations.
 
The students in the BCIC work at 4 employers (AIDS Action Committee, Food Project, BMC - Pediatric Grow Clinic/Children?s Health Watch, and Rosie?s Place).  The program has three key components:
 
The employment of quality students to work as full-time staff members in targeted community-based agencies with the goals of meeting educational, public safety, environmental, and human needs of Boston neighborhoods and citizens.
 Provide students with quality supervision and work environments, which maximize student, professional, civic and personal development.
 Participation in monthly reflection seminars that are integrated into the 40-hour work week for both unstructured personal reflection and group discussions.
 
Concurrent Reflection is an integral part of the BCIC. Students who apply for the program hould understand that in addition to their assignment in a community-based agency, they are expected to participate in monthly reflection seminars.

NOTE - APPLICANTS NEED TO UPLOAD AN UNOFFICIAL COPY OF THEIR TRANSCRIPT TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE

This posting is for our Denver, CO office (preferred) but there is also an option to work at our Boston office instead. Please apply for each Job ID# in the city you would work.

Seeking experience in consulting? Do you have a strong interest in the healthcare, medical technology, business and innovation?

S2N Health is a small Boston-based consulting firm specializing in market & business strategy for innovative medical technology companies. We work with clients at all stages of the product lifecycle, providing full-service strategic marketing support from the highly analytical to the tactical including: corporate strategy, business development strategy and support, business unit growth strategy, market assessment and pipeline prioritization, go-to-market/commercialization strategy, pricing and market access strategy, and health economics and outcomes research. Since its founding in 2011, S2N Health has worked with over 90 innovative medical device, diagnostics, and drug delivery companies who have raised more than $500M.

Co-Op Description

The Healthcare Data Analyst Co-Op will assist the S2N team with research and data analytics in support of client engagements and special projects. Examples of Healthcare Data Analyst activities include:
Identifying and gathering relevant healthcare and financial data from a variety of sources including government databases, clinical publications, and company financials
Using Python or other coding languages to query healthcare databases and analyze results
Assisting with building financial and market models to size and prioritize commercial opportunities for innovative healthcare technologies in the US and other global markets
Interpreting data /analytics and creating data visualizations to communicate relevant information for client decision-making
Developing PowerPoint presentations summarizing findings of data analysis
Qualifications

We are looking for individuals pursuing an undergraduate degree in computer science and/or another rigorous quantitative discipline such as applied math, finance, or economics, and with a strong interest in the healthcare field, medical technology, business, and innovation.

In addition, we are seeking:
Demonstrated experience with Python, Pandas & other science tools
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
Intellectual curiosity and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English)
Detail orientation and professionalism
Ability and desire to work in teams
****Cover Letter Recommended****

Working At S2N Health:

We offer a fun, collaborative work environment with a high degree of variety in terms of projects, clients, technologies, clinical areas and business challenges. Our team works closely together, providing ample opportunity for mentoring and growth and direct exposure to clients.  Because we are a small company working in intensive collaboration with our client-innovators, co-ops can have a big impact on both the S2N culture as well as our project teams.

Testimonial from S2N Co-ops/interns:

"I am included in all aspects of client projects, allowing me to make a real contribution to incredibly interesting business questions and client challenges. I have seen my skills and knowledge grow and enjoy coming to work with them every day."

"The S2N team is very good at what they do, so they attract a variety of exciting projects and top-notch clients. Additionally, the S2N partners are wonderful mentors and team members who are patient and fun while expecting a high level of performance from themselves and the team."

ADDITIONAL INFO: 
Keywords: start up, start-up, entrepreneurship, innovation, consulting, health care, healthcare, med tech, problem solving, PowerPoint, self-starter, Python, Pandas, data analytics

This position is posted on behalf of our partner, Meetio, in Malmö, Sweden. The candidate will have a mentor on site and the Swedish-American Chambers of Commerce will assist in finding housing, insurance and other important matters. 

Compensation: 30000-35000 SEK/month (approx USD 3000-3500/month)

About the host company
Meetio is a software company dedicated to making the workplace as smart as the people in it. We develop software to help companies and their employees to better utilize the workspace and increase personal productivity.
We're currently a team of 22 people located at our offices in Malmö (HQ), Stockholm and Portland, OR, but our customers can be found all over the world. We've helped companies of all shapes and sizes, from cutting-edge tech companies in Silicon Valley to Dutch Universities and Asian National Banks. We take pride in doing everything ourselves, from development to sales, marketing and support.

Meetio's core values are Smart, Simple, and Reliable. This goes for our culture as well as our products. Be smart, don't overcomplicate things and work together as a team. We promise you'll have a great time doing it!

Job Description
You will be joining a fast-paced team and dive into code from day one. You'll get to know all parts of the code base and be an important part in everything from brainstorming and wire-framing to implementing and maintaining.

On a daily basis you will be:
 Brainstorming and discussing new ideas
 Designing and implementing new features
 Writing tests, improving existing code and fixing the occasional bug
 Work with great people building great products!

You will primarily be working with Android development using Java and Kotlin. We have a broad tech stack and product eco system, so depending on your preferences you will also have the opportunity to work with iOS, web applications and a variety of APIs and micro services.

Some relevant buzzwords that you'll come across include Android, iOS, MS Graph, PHP, mySQL, vue.js, AWS, TeamCity, socketIO and Docker.

Required Skills
We hope that you are willing to roll up your sleeves and dig into a little bit of everything. Whether it's developing new features, fixing bugs or tweaking the build process, you like getting things done. You're pragmatic and just love creating things with code. You may or may not have worked in a small team before, however it's something you feel excited about doing. We take great pride in working closely together and helping each other out, and you do too.

Although we believe that motivation and mindset will take you very far, it would be a bonus if you had experience working with one or more of the following areas:
Java technologies such as Java 8, Spring Framework or Dagger
The Android framework including Android NDK or Gradle
Microsoft technologies such as Microsoft Graph, EWS, Office365/Exchange, Azure, Active Directory
Software testing, GIT, Continuous Integration, API or micro service architecture

DevOps Engineer
We are Rue Technology, the team responsible for all the technology behind ruelala.com and gilt.com. Powering an online retail operation of this magnitude takes substantial systems and some serious engineering.
  
If a high-pace, rapid-growth technology organization that is well supported by a proven, expanding and innovative business sounds interesting to you then read on and see if you'd like to join our team and play an active role in taking our platform to the next level.

We are looking for young technologists who:
-Would love to build technology solutions in the cloud for high-scale e-commerce
-Have some cloud knowledge, scripting, maybe monitoring work, coding (terraform), and an understanding of distributed systems
-Are driven, humble, collaborative and hard working
-Eager to learn, build their technical depth and hone their Devops chops
-Would love to be mentored by senior technologists in a small Agile team setting
-Are passionate about making a difference

The Opportunity
Come and join our incredibly talented and highly productive Infrastructure team. Work with seasoned infrastructure professionals to learn all aspects of how to improve system resiliency, reliability, and performance.

Here's what we can promise:
-You will work with a group of highly skilled software, systems, and devops engineers in securing our next generation infrastructure.
-Your solutions will directly impact the security of our internal and production systems; protecting the data of millions of users.
-You will work on meaningful, large scale problems for one of the most successful customer businesses in Boston that can jumpstart your career in information security. 
 
Our Mission:
We have a collaborative, devops philosophy throughout our engineering team. We're scaling our site 10x to support daily peaks and working to deliver software faster and more repeatable by taking advantage of modern automation tools and treating our infrastructure as code.
 
About Rue Gilt Groupe:
Rue Gilt Groupe is the premier off-price e-commerce portfolio company, connecting more than 30 million members with coveted designers at an exceptional value. Two complementary brands, Rue La La and Gilt, utilize world-class merchandising, technology and marketing to strategically support our brand partners and inspire members daily. Our approach to retail brings excitement to online shopping and the best-in-class experience that today's customers demand.

Job Description:
Location: Aachen, Germany

Students interested in applying to COE global positions must set up an appointment through myNortheastern with Sally Conant (s.conant@northeastern.edu) . Once you have met, your resume will be sent to global employers.

Company Name:
RWTH Aachen University, Chemical Engineering Department, Process Systems Engineering Group
 
Company Description:
We are the process systems engineering group of Prof. Mitsos at RWTH Aachen. Most of our employees are PhD students (currently over 25 PhD students) who conduct research, teach, and work on industry projects. The Chair of Process Systems Engineering (SVT) was founded in 2012 and is directed by Prof. Alexander Mitsos who moved to RWTH from MIT. We work closely with our students, industry, and researchers all over the world. For you, this means a variety of ways to advance. In our team, it is not only your performance but also your personality that matter to us!
In our research, we work on a diverse set of methods and applications. Our main research activities include process optimization, machine learning in chemical engineering, process control & operation, conceptual process design, and model-based experimental analysis. We also have a strong focus on the development and implementation of optimization algorithms.
 
Industry:  Academic position at a university within the field of chemical engineering, computer science, and mathematics.
 
Company Website:
http://www.avt.rwth-aachen.de/cms/AVT/Forschung/Forschungsschwerpunkte-der-AVT/~ioaf/Systemverfahrenstechnik/lidx/1/
 
Co-op Job Title: Internship as a research assistant in process systems engineering
 
Co-op Job Description:
Most importantly, we will give you responsibility from day one in a fruitful work environment and "on-the-job" training. This implies that your will organize a collaborative research project on your own. With respect to topics, we will offer you a variety of possible project ideas within the field of process systems engineering. These projects may have a theoretical or practical focus and may be adapted according to your preferences. Recent interns from Northeastern for instance worked on machine learning applications in chemical engineering process design. To find a suitable topic for you, we would like to invite you to submit a short cover letter with your application where you state your personal field of interest.
 
What We Expect:
On a personal level, you convince through your communication skills.
You have a strong background in mathematics, modeling, data science, and/or programming.
Skills Gained by the End of Co-op/Internship:
The freedom with respect to the project requires self-motivation, discipline, and time management. This is not easy and is thus one of the main skills you will further develop during your stay. In addition, the collaboration requires (and will further develop) strong communication stills. As you responsibly manage your own project, you are also the advocate of it and thus, you need to ask for help, feedback, remind people of deadlines, etc. This is particularly relevant in international teams as people from different backgrounds communicate differently. During the internship, you will also get involved in our teaching activities. The goal of the internship is to write a scientific article about the project (that may get published in a scientific journal). Also, you will get a firsthand impression in the work as a PhD student.
 
Hours per week: 35-40 hr/week, about 10 paid vacation days for 6 month
Salary/ Stipend: about 600 EUR (around 650 USD) per month (additional scholarships possible).
Majors considered: Chemical Engineering, Computer Engineering/Computer Science, Mathematics or another related field
Language Requirements: You are able to work and communicate in English. Other languages (in particular German) are an asset but not required.

Mobile Developer

We are a top #10 mobile retailer. Our apps are used by hundreds of thousands of avid shoppers and deliver over $150M in revenue annually. Rue Gilt Groupe combines world-class merchandising, technology and marketing to create the most engaging and satisfying online shopping experience available. This position is posted on behalf of our partner, Axis Communications, in Lund, Sweden. The candidate will have a mentor on site and the Swedish-American Chambers of Commerce will assist in finding housing, insurance, and other important matters.

Compensation: Salary based on experience and education

About the Company

Axis is the global industry leader in network video. Founded in Lund, Sweden, we invented the worlds' first digital network camera in 1996. We offer solutions and services for video surveillance and analytics, access control, audio systems and device management. Axis has more than 3,000 employees in over 50 countries, 2,000 of them in Lund. We are a very proud and innovative product development company investing significant resources into our R&D. Our culture is characterized of an open and innovative spirit. We are growing heavily and are continuously looking to recruit talented software developers.

More about Lund, Sweden
Founded in 990 AD, Lund is a dynamic city and home to one of the oldest and largest universities in Scandinavia, housing 40,000 students. Located in the very south of Sweden, it's a 20-minute commute to Malmö, Sweden's' third largest city, and another 25 minutes to Copenhagen, the capital of Denmark. Lund is just as close to the continent (Rome, Italy is a 2.5-hour flight away) as it is to the arctic, with the northern most part of Sweden being north of the arctic circle. In total, roughly 3.8 million people live in the region, 100,000 of them in Lund, 320,000 in Malmö and 1 million in Copenhagen.

Job Description
We are growing and would like to see you becoming on of our many talented software engineers with the mission to develop cloud services extending the opportunities of current and future ranges of Axis products by connecting them to the cloud and offer a cybersecure environment. You will work in close collaboration with other teams at Axis creating the best solutions for our customers. We build on different cloud technologies and programming languages although we increasingly start to use GO as our preferred language. You will be expected to develop code that runs in the Cloud but also on-edge in our cameras and other devices.

We believe that autonomous DevOps team where all individuals are heard is a good way to be organized. We believe that all team members should take ownership from defining user stories, to continuously developing and deploying code to production. To us, continuous deployment brings great opportunities for learning and at the same time great responsibilities towards our customers. The teams can innovate at high speed and make at the same time sure that the system quality and security is not jeopardized.

This is a very exciting environment to work in with tremendous opportunities for personal growth!

Please check this video https://youtu.be/Oo406m7oxR0 for more insights of the daily work as a SW engineer.

Required Skills
We believe that you are an open person who is ready to help your team members when needed, and open with the challenges you have, and are committed to your team's succeed. You feel comfortable in an environment where the status quo is challenged in a respectful manner with the objective to improve existing solutions. We believe that when you are in doubt, you stay curious and experiment to learn.

You have an education in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or Physics. However most importantly you have a keen interest in technology and programming. If you have experience in Agile WoW, continuous integration, and DevOps, you might be the perfect candidate!

Examples of programming languages and tools we normally use are:
Go, .Net, Python and C#
GitLab, DockerHub
Amazon Web Services, Azure, Google Cloud Platform

The world of retail is changing, and Salsify is riding on the edge of a tidal wave as online product content becomes the key differentiator in customer purchasing decisions. Our platform helps companies like L'Oreal and Fruit of the Loom curate transform and distribute product information to retailers like Amazon, Target, Walmart and Home Depot. We are a prominent Boston software engineering organization with a team of local technology leaders and startup veterans including many Northeastern University graduates.

Engineering co-ops at Salsify benefit from the experience and mentorship of some of Boston's most experienced engineers while working on both the back and front end of our production web software platform. As a Front-End Engineering Co-op, you will participate in the design and implementation of cutting-edge, highly interactive JavaScript applications, and will work closely with, and contribute to, scalable, performant services in Ruby. 

During your co-op at Salsify, you will:
Participate in cross-team guilds where you can learn engineering best practices from subject matter experts. We have guilds for Production Engineering, Client Engineering, and more!
Work on a multidisciplinary team with user experience designers, product managers, frontend and backend engineering combined.
Help solve complex business and scalability problems and experience the process of software creation from ideation to implementation and deployment.

Coding experience as demonstrated through class work and personal projects
Solid knowledge of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms)

Experience with REST APIs and microservices using any language and platform
Computer science major with at least a 3.0 GPA and completion of Fundamentals of Computer Science I and II as well as Object-Oriented Design
Full-time availability to work in Boston, MA starting in January 2020 through June 2020

Engineering time, hackathons and tech talks
Ability to attend local conferences paid for by Salsify as arranged with your manager
Great mentors and a rocket ship company on your resume

2020 Spring Co-Ops: Sanofi Biologics
Co-Op Location: Allston & Framingham, Massachusetts
Co-Op Duration: January to June 2020

Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions.

With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.

Sanofi, Empowering Life

Discover your future with Sanofi?
Sanofi Biologic's university opportunities offer exposure to a fast-paced and collaborative environment. Students work side-by-side with biopharmaceutical professionals providing an opportunity to make an impact in the lives of patients around the globe. This Co-Op may lead to a full-time opportunity upon graduation based on successful performance reviews and final interview process. One of the goals of this program is to feed a leadership pipeline of top talent for our Sanofi Biologics full-time opportunities. Sanofi Biologics Early Career Talent Program launches your career to the next level through a targeted approach.

Spring Co-Ops are available in Automation Engineering, Engineering, Manufacturing, Quality Systems, Quality Control Chemistry, the Health Safety and Environmental group, and Manufacturing Science.

Basic Qualifications:
Pursuing a bachelor's degree with plans to graduate by spring 2021
3.0/4.0 GPA is a minimum requirement
Must have permanent US work authorization

Preferred Qualifications:
Strong attention to detail and analytical skills
Demonstrated leadership skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Desire to work within a team environment
Strong interest in working with computers

Sanergy is an award-winning social venture that builds healthy, prosperous communities by making hygienic sanitation accessible and affordable in Africa's urban informal settlements. Our systems-based approach to solving the sanitation crisis involves five key steps: we build a dense network of franchised micro-entrepreneurs, who operate low-cost, high-quality waterless sanitation facilities called Fresh Life Toilets.

We provide critical support services such as access to finance, business analytics, training, and marketing. We collect the waste regularly and safely remove it from the community. We convert the waste into valuable end products, such as organic fertilizer, insect-based animal feed, and renewable energy. Finally, we sell the end products to Kenyan farms under the brand name Farm Star.
 
Since November 2011, we have launched over 750 Fresh Life Toilets to a network of more than 350 Fresh Life Operators. We have collected and converted over 9,000 tons of waste. At the same time, we have built a team of over 250 people. For our work, we have been recognized by Fast Company as one of the 10 Most Innovative Companies in the World Doing Social Good and one of the 10 Most Innovative Companies in Africa.
 
Job Purpose Statement
We are an increasingly sophisticated, highly intricate organization with many moving parts. The Sanergy Fellows Program seeks accomplished, driven individuals who will make substantive contributions to the organization. 

Sanergy Fellows work in one of the following departments:

* Operations- Supply Chain Services, Logistics, Quality and Safety, Laboratory Fresh Life Toilet Sales
* Information Technology
* Marketing and Branding
* Finance
* Product Design
* Research and Design for Byproduct Technologies
* Business Development: Partnerships & Fundraising
* Communications
* Government Relations
* Talent 
* Engineering- Electrical, Chemical, Civil, Mechanical
* Legal

More qualitatively, we are looking for people who have the desire to take on a new challenge in a pioneering context.  We believe that we are on the cusp of transformative change and we seek people who believe their knowledge and skills will bring about that change. 

Job Requirements
* Undergraduate Degree or working towards
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Strong problem solving skills
* Strong time management, organizational, and prioritization skills
* Excellent communication skills on all levels
* Relentless desire to improve yourself, your team, and your organization;
* A collaborative mentality

As Sanergy expands, many new projects are on the horizon. While the Sanergy Fellows are not provided monetary compensation, the experience gleaned from their time at Sanergy will benefit them for many years to come. We are looking for fellows with the desire, determination and energy to spend at least 3-6 months in East Africa pushing the frontiers of innovation. Join us!

Firm Overview:
The Schonfeld group of companies includes Schonfeld Strategic Advisors LLC, an SEC-registered investment adviser, and Schonfeld Strategic Techworx LLC, a dedicated data and technology services company.  Schonfeld is a multi-manager platform that invests its capital with both internal and external / partner portfolio managers, primarily on a long-term, exclusive basis, across statistical arbitrage and other quantitatively-driven strategies, fundamental equity strategies, and tactical trading strategies.  Schonfeld has created a unique structure to provide global portfolio managers with autonomy, flexibility and significant support to best enable them to maximize the value of their businesses. Over the last 30 years, Schonfeld and its predecessors have successfully invested in and supported hundreds of portfolio managers.  Schonfeld develops and invests heavily in proprietary technology, infrastructure, and risk analytics. Schonfeld's portfolio exposure has expanded across the Americas, Europe and Asia, as well as among multiple asset classes and products.
We have created a culture that encourages people to share their ideas and perspectives. Team members come together in a highly collaborative environment where we emphasize hands on problem solving, not status meetings. Engineers are expected to self-organize the best way to solve problem and are collectively responsible for the entire team's delivery. At Schonfeld, we value individuals with a growth mindset, who can work across many different skill-sets and add value in many ways. We look for talent who raise others' skills through teaching and broaden their own skill sets through learning.

Job Overview:
This position is for a co-op C++ developer to work with the lead developer of an "Algo Container" (called AlgoFrame) used for automated equity trading.
 
AlgoFrame is a mission critical component in Schonfeld's systems. It uses many open source C++ and Python frameworks as well as custom code and runs in a Linux environment.
 
A successful candidate will gain exposure to equity trading systems, modern C++ development and many other important technologies used in the equity space.
 
Candidates for this position must have some experience (via employment, course work, or open-source projects) to:

C++
Multi-threaded programming
Unix
One or more courses in User Interface/ User Experience (or equivalent project work)
 
It would be a plus if candidate had experience in any of:
Boost libraries (ASIO, date, inter-process)
Python
Apache Kafka
Familiarity with Equites
 
The successful candidate will be given responsibility for delivering a  new developing a new component of the system that will be used in production. The scope of the project will be determined based on the candidate's experience.

Job Description

SeLux is developing a rapid phenotypic antibiotic susceptibility testing (AST) platform that promises to revolutionize infectious disease patient care and combat the current antibiotic resistance. SeLux's rapid AST platform uniquely breaks the current trade-offs between speed, cost, accuracy, and antibiotic menu breadth that plague the current generations of AST devices. The 30-person company is well-funded and on track to obtain FDA clearance for its first-generation platform in 2020.

We are looking for a hard-working, self-motivated, dedicated co-op student who has a strong desire to make an impact on the current antibiotic resistance epidemic. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-paced, interdisciplinary team that has deep experience working with and training Northeastern co-ops.

Duties and Responsibilities

The candidate will join the Software team and will be responsible for developing desktop and/or web-based components as part of the distributed software architecture that will be deployed at SeLux customer sites to manage and analyze data from the SeLux assay platform.  The candidate will be exposed to test-driven development, unit and integration testing, verification and validation processes, all of which are key to the success of any FDA-regulated product.
The ideal candidate will have/be:
Student with a GPA ?3.5 pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer, Electrical or Systems Engineering
Proven ability to write quality code in C#
Experience with Microsoft desktop application development (e.g. WPF, WCF, WinForms)
Experience with Microsoft ASP.NET and web development (HTML5 and REST web services)
Experience with collaborative software development using configuration management tools (Subversion or related)
Experience with relational database queries (SQL) and systems (Microsoft SQL Server)
An independent thinker and problem-solver who is enthusiastic and collaborative
Excellent written and oral communication skills and proven ability to work well in a team environment
Passion about working at an early-stage start-up that aims to change industry and how healthcare is delivered!

Job Description

SeLux is developing a rapid phenotypic antibiotic susceptibility testing (AST) platform that promises to revolutionize infectious disease patient care and combat the current antibiotic resistance. SeLux's rapid AST platform uniquely breaks the current trade-offs between speed, cost, accuracy, and antibiotic menu breadth that plague the current generations of AST devices. The 30-person company is well-funded and on track to obtain FDA clearance for its first-generation platform in 2020.

We are looking for a hard-working, self-motivated, dedicated co-op student who has a strong desire to make an impact on the current antibiotic resistance epidemic. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-paced, interdisciplinary team that has deep experience working with and training Northeastern co-ops.

Duties and Responsibilities

The candidate will join the Software team and will be responsible for developing methods and tools for software verification of the SeLux web-based AST platform.  The candidate will:
Embed with the Software team and participate in test-driven development
Develop unit and integration tests using Microsoft development tools
Create reusable suites of automated tests using tools such as Selenium
Write custom software to test software components within the SeLux architecture
Apply test tools such as Postman and Fiddler to verify network and web service functionality
Participate in and document verification and validation processes
The ideal candidate will have/be:
Student with a GPA ?3.5 pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer, Electrical or Systems Engineering
Proven ability to write quality code in C#
Experience with Microsoft ASP.NET and web development (HTML5 and REST web services)
Experience with collaborative software development using configuration management tools (Subversion or related)
Experience with relational database queries (SQL) and systems (Microsoft SQL Server)
An independent thinker and problem-solver who is enthusiastic and collaborative
Excellent written and oral communication skills and proven ability to work well in a team environment
Passion about working at an early-stage start-up that aims to change industry and how healthcare is delivered!

Co-Op Job Opportunity
Company Overview
SeLux, a 4-year old start-up company in Boston, is building a diagnostic platform to revolutionize Infectious Disease patient care and combat the current antibiotic resistance epidemic. SeLux's first product, a rapid antibiotic susceptibility test (AST) platform, uniquely breaks the current trade-offs between speed, cost, accuracy, and antibiotic menu breadth that plague the current generations of devices. The 30-person company closed its $25M Series B financing in March '18 and is on track to obtain FDA clearance by Q4-2019.
 
SeLux was recently awarded a milestone-based government contract from the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA) worth up to $45M to build its second-generation direct-from-sterile sample identification and AST platform. By eliminating most standard microbiological culturing, this platform will enable Infectious Disease clinicians to deliver same-day personalized antibiotic therapies to septic patients and those with urinary tract infections.
 
We are a diverse team of scientists and engineers with broad experience from early research through product development with savvy technology leadership. The successful co-op will join a fun, fast-paced, interdisciplinary team that has experience working with and training Northeastern co-ops.
 
This co-op position offers a future entrepreneur the opportunity to see firsthand how a startup company functions. The position also offers valuable exposure to multidisciplinary medical product development and the transformation of design prototypes into an FDA-approvable product.

Duties and Responsibilities
The focus of this position will be help finalize testing of SeLux's AST platform for FDA submission. This platform consists of complex subsystems including two lab automation robots featuring optics, software, and electro-mechanical integrations. This co-op position has the following specific duties:
Operate and execute tests on complex laboratory automation machines and other platform components such as software, consumables, and accessories.
Refine and execute test procedures to assess the platform's performance including integration of the machines and platform software.
Troubleshoot equipment and software problems and perform root-cause failure analysis when anomalous behavior or test results occur.
Perform statistical analysis of test results and data and communicate those to a technical team of scientists and engineers.
Writing, editing, and maintaining technical documentation including defect reports and failure investigations.
Perform experiments for determining early operating parameters of our next-generation product platform.
Qualifications
We are seeking someone with a GPA ?3.2 pursuing an Engineering degree with an interest in integration of biochemical/electromechanical/software systems and medical device product development. The successful candidate will be a member of our Engineering team, reporting to our Principal Engineer. The candidate must have:
Experience with electro-mechanical systems, software, and biochemistry.
The ability to work safely and comfortably in a wet lab environment with chemicals and microorganisms. Appropriate training and PPE will be provided.
Be an independent thinker and problem-solver who is enthusiastic and collaborative.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and proven ability to work well in a team environment.
Diligent, organized, and detail-oriented. Must be able to follow detailed instructions carefully and accurately and carefully document test results.
Passion about working at an early-stage start-up that aims to change industry and how healthcare is delivered!

Description

Founded in 2013 and located in Central Square backed by top-tier venture investors. This is a great opportunity to work with a team of experienced entrepreneurs creating technology that will really make a difference in the world. We are looking for someone energetic, curious, and eager to take on new challenges to join our Customer Support team.  We offer a career path opportunity that allows you to work with other departments on dedicated days of the week for additional learning in the field of your choice. 

Responsibilities

The Sharkninja Robots group is a fast paced, high energy environment seeking engineering coops passionate about robots.  As a coop within the robot embedded hardware group you will play an instrumental role in assisting the engineering team with all aspects of product development.  Expect to be involved in a wide range of activities such as prototyping advanced systems concepts for future products or deep testing and analysis of production ready designs.  For these activities you could expect to work with Arduino style prototyping platforms, oscilloscopes, multimeters, power supplies, Python, MS Excel, schematic capture, and PCB layout just to name a few.  
 
Required Qualifications

Basic AC and DC circuit comprehension
Experience troubleshooting, assembling and testing prototypes and breadboard circuits
Comfortable working with your hands
Experience with engineering test tools such as oscilloscopes and multimeters
Experience with some level of software development, i.e C, C++, Java, Python, Matlab is a plus
Natural curiosity and relentlessly driven to find better solutions to everyday problems.
Demonstrate integrity and courage in the way you work, breaking the mold isn?t easy.
A thorough understanding of basic physical principles.
Creativity and technical knowledge are crucial in this position.
Great communication skills
Self-starter, energetic, keen to learn
 
Essential Functions
Design, build and test novel advanced prototype concepts and technologies using Arduinos and Raspberry Pi platforms
Assist with system and component level electrical and firmware testing
Gathering and analyzing detailed electrical and system data to provide meaningful insights for design improvement
Develop python software scripts for gathering, visualizing, and analyzing device data
Cooperating with cross discipline engineers from software to electro-mechanical
Inject energy, enthusiasm and creativity into everything you touch.
Identify new ideas, products and/or features that improve customer satisfaction, reduce costs and keep our product line at the forefront of our industry.

###Job Title:

Financial Engineering Co-op

###Position and Company Overview

Smartleaf was founded to improve the way money is managed for the majority of people.

Everyone wants their money to be managed well but the quality of financial advice available today can be inconsistent and attention from a financial advisor is directly proportional to the amount of money an investor already has.

Smartleaf is about bringing consistency and scale to the investment process so that good advice can be delivered to everyone. Our software enables financial advisors to serve smaller investment accounts with the same level of sophisticated analytics, tax management and customization that was previously available only to investors with millions of dollars. 

We work with wealth management firms of all types, from multi-billion dollar national banks to startup "robo advisors" whose apps can be downloaded by anyone with a smartphone. 

As a financial engineering co-op at Smartleaf, you will have a chance to work on an investment management system that provides customized automated rebalancing and workflow automation to help financial advisors scale up without sacrificing quality. 

 ###What You'll Gain

You'll have the opportunity to contribute hands-on development work on a complex financial application.

You'll gain experience working in a cross-functional team. We handle front- and back- end development, integrations, API implementations, database work and customer service. 
Members of the team engage in several aspects of the development lifecycle: technical design, implementation, and support.

Depending on your interests you will have a chance to identify and implement a self-directed project towards the end of your co-op. 
 
###Perks

Casual dress code
Fully stocked kitchen
7 paid days off
 
###Responsibilities

You will participate in all the daily activities of a development team:
Implementing features and bugfixes
Code and design reviews
Writing tests
Internal tooling
 
This role is an excellent fit if you:
Have prior experience with a programming language such as Python, C++, or R
Can pick up concepts and skills quickly
Are curious, ask questions and enjoy diving into the codebase
 
###Things to know before applying

Our code bases are written in C++, Python, R with a little bit of SQL injected.
Prior knowledge of finance or investment is welcome but not required. 
 
###How to Apply

Please send a cover letter and resume to future@smartleaf.com in plain text or PDF.  Questions are welcome. We look forward to hearing from you!
Smartleaf is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to building a culturally diverse team.

Location: Tanzania

Open to Electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science majors

Students interested in applying to COE global positions must contact Sally Conant (s.conant@northeastern.edu). Once you have spoken with her about the position, your resume will be sent to global employers.

http://www.sikubora.com/

Seeking students interested in social enterprise in a developing country. Work will include all aspects of start-up duties- engineering and computer students may conduct business related work or coding for example, so you should be interested in the nature of start- ups and small companies where everyone participates and is flexible with the work needing to get done.

Prior Co-op Experiences/Blogs:

* http://www.coe.neu.edu/blog/life-changing-co-op tanzania#_ga=2.111051971.77063522.1547131341-1629124291.1537361702
* https://news.northeastern.edu/2018/08/06/she-got-over-her-culture-shock-and-helped-bring-solar-power-to-tanzania/
* http://www.coe.neu.edu/blog/east-african-solar-energy-co-op

Mission:

Sikubora is a small solar energy company located near Arusha, Tanzania. Sikubora was founded by a Northeastern Alumni in 2013 and has installed solar home systems for hundreds off grid Tanzanians in a country where over 40 million people lack access to electricity. Sikubora also installs large customized solar energy systems for schools, hospitals, lodges and other businesses. Installations can include solar panels, wiring, lighting, tv's,  phone chargers, and water pumping and heating systems. Sikubora employs around 20 people, most of whom are locals from Arusha.

Co-op Job Description:

Sikubora is a small company so students will have the opportunity to contribute to many aspects of the business. Co-ops will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects at Sikubora such as:
 
ERP and Website Development:
Co-ops will have the opportunity to develop the enterprise resource planning system (ERP). The ERP is used by employees to store customer information, manage ongoing projects, and to track revenue and expenses. There are also opportunities to develop the customer facing website. Co-ops will learn skills in database and website design using SQL, PHP, HTML and JavaScript.
 
System Design:
Co-ops will have the opportunity to assist in the design, cost analysis and installation of solar projects. Sikubora deploys systems consisting of solar panels, charge controllers, lighting, inverters, water pumping/heaters and electric appliances.
 
Financial Model Development:
There will be opportunities to develop a financial model for the company. We need a reliable way to predict and measure the cost and revenue from each project as well as for the company as a whole.
 
Co-ops will also have the opportunity to become immersed in Tanzanian culture. Students will have up to 3 weeks time off to explore everything that the country has to offer. Past co-ops have used this time to climb Mt. Kilimanjaro, go on safari in the Serengeti, and travel to nearby African countries.
 
Skills Gained by the End of Co-op/Internship:
SQL, PHP, HTML, JavaScript, System Design, Power Analysis.

Benefits:
You will be paid $300 per month (exchange rates fluctuate based on current market but this number is represented in approximate USD). This will cover most if not all of your living expenses and is the rate that full-time newly graduated engineers are paid in Tanzania.
 
Co-ops will also have the opportunity to become immersed in Tanzanian culture. Students will have up to 3 weeks time off to explore everything that the country has to offer. Past co-ops have used this time to climb Mt. Kilimanjaro, go on safari in the Serengeti, and travel to nearby African countries.

If you have a phone with an unlockable sim card, bring it. Phones don't work on plans like most do in the USA, but rather on a pay-as-you-go system for texting, calling, and data. You can likely find living arrangements, especially with a roommate, for around $200/month per person. You should also be prepared to purchase a tourist visa upon your arrival and then a work permit. If you have a computer, please bring it, as we offer wifi at work.

Sikubora is located in northern Tanzania just outside of Arusha. Arusha is one of Tanzania's largest cities and is very popular with tourist traveling to Mount Kilimanjaro and the national parks for safaris. The national language of Tanzania is Swahili, but English speakers are not uncommon, and English is spoken in the office. Tanzania has a very peaceful culture with a low cost of living. For public transportation, a bus ride from town to the office is under 25 cents.

Former co-op says:
"This opportunity at Sikubora gave me a lot of responsibility. Although it is a small company, it is a big thing to be given the tasks and duties such as talking to investors, remote monitoring..etc. Also being involved in some of the meetings with the technicians was nice. Those meetings and the opportunities to go on installation helped me understand the company and the climate Sikubora was acting in. The projects were interesting and versatile. I really enjoyed the array of knowledge I received from completing projects in finance, computer science and business."

Around Arusha there are many delicious food options, including a variety of locally grown fruits and vegetables. At the market, you can buy produce and goods for an entire week at a very reasonable price. In general, items bought frequently cost less in Tanzania than in the United States, with the exception of quality electronics and some other specially manufactured goods. There are also plenty of good restaurants and bars around Arusha. A lunch at the restaurant near Sikubora's office might cost between $1 and $3, while local beer is sold at around $2 per half-liter bottle.

Getting around town is also inexpensive. Most people use the "daladala", which is a van with seats for 15 people, though more will squeeze in and stand. The daladala goes almost everywhere around town (including to Sikubora in Kisongo) and generally costs around 20 cents per ride. Cars are also used to some degree, and motorcycles excessively. In and around town, there are plenty of activities. You can go shopping in the markets, play sports with local groups, and enjoy a variety of traditions. There are scores of natural and cultural wonders near and outside town, such as waterfalls, reservations, and tribal villages.

At the office, there are many Tanzanians who can help you adapt to life in Arusha. Overall, this part of East Africa is safe, will receive you with open arms, and offers a life-changing experience.

MIT Solve seeks 2 co-ops to be placed on Solve's Community team, which works within 4 core Solve pillars: Health, Sustainability, Learning, & Economic Prosperity.

Solve:
MIT Solve advances lasting solutions from tech entrepreneurs to address the world's most pressing problems. Solve is a marketplace for social impact: we find tech entrepreneurs from around the world and broker partnerships across our community to scale their innovative work - driving lasting, transformational change.

Solve Co-ops:
A co-op with Solve is designed to provide the opportunity to work on a growing team at MIT with a strong impact mission and deepen understanding about the social impact sphere and actors, master the basics of community management, and gain knowledge of CRM tools in the process.

Increase the base of prospective members for the Solve community, among corporations, foundations, & non-profit organizations

Participate in the preparation and on-site execution of Solve's flagship convening, Solve at MIT, on the MIT campus in May
