Are enthusiastic about learning new technologies 
Are proactive when working on projects that are not fully scoped; know when to ask questions
Have the project/task management capabilities to prioritize responsibilities 
Applicants should be 18+ and be legally able to work in the US. Interns are paid $15/hour, must commit to 32 hours/week of work at the office, and be able to start promptly on Monday, January 6th. To apply, send a resume and cover letter (not more than 1 page, indicating 1. your Solve pillar interest and 2. whether you are applying to the Community Co-op or Data Co-op) to intern@solve.mit.edu by October 6th at 11:59PM EST.

WHO WE ARE
Square Robot's mission is to make oil and gas infrastructure inspection safer, faster, and more reliable through automation. We're a Boston-based growth-stage startup founded in 2016 by marine robotics industry veterans, and we're looking for new driven and self-directing team members who share our passion for autonomous systems operating in unique and challenging environments.
JOB DESCRIPTION
As a Robotics Software Engineering co-op at Square Robot Inc., you will be part of a talented team working on our autonomous mobile robotic solutions for Oil and Gas infrastructure inspections. In this role, you will be exposed to the software, mechanical, and electrical engineering concepts that make up the core systems of our autonomous robots. You'll contribute as an independent team member while developing professional experience through exposure to the robotics development process. This role includes working closely with members of our interdisciplinary engineering and management team.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with the interdisciplinary engineering team to assist with the development process and enable an innovative engineering culture
Identifying and developing solutions to problems faced by the business
Perform tasks such as software development, system testing and field trials as business needs demand
Design, implement, document, and test systems that integrate with other hardware and software
Participate in code reviews
Build tools for internal analysis
Investigate and explore the use of existing software as solutions for our uses
Additionally, travel to customer testing facilities throughout the continental US may be required pending the system development timeline.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
Strong C++ and Python proficiencies.
Actively enrolled in full-time STEM undergraduate degree program
Excellent visual and verbal communication skills
Authorized to work in the U.S.
BONUS QUALIFICATIONS

About the Systems Integration and Validation Team:

The Systems Integration and Validation team plays a critical role in the development of our technology. SIV Engineers provide four main functions:

HW component characterization and verification: SIV engineers collaborate with the RF, HW and SW teams during development to test the component blocks that comprise our systems.
SW build verification and regression testing: SIV engineers develop automated regression tests and run them against each major release of our system software.
Full system validation: SIV engineers develop automated tests to validate system functionality during the prototype and manufacturing stages.
Investigation of system-level behaviors and issues: Leveraging all of the skills described above, SIV engineers are uniquely qualified to drill down into the entire system in order to find the source of (and often solution to) challenging problems.

Co-op Job Title: Project engineer (also known as fire breather)
Job Description:
Takachar is an MIT spinout company whose vision is to expand the amount of biomass (crop and forest residues) economically converted into useful products. Our impacts include income and job creation in rural areas, as well as mitigation of CO2 emission and air pollution associated with conventional open-air biomass residue burning.

In the first half of 2020, we will be building and testing a demonstration-scale prototype. We are seeking a project engineer to coordinate this effort. Initially, the engineer will assist in design, fabrication, and assembly of the prototype by working alongside our manufacturing subcontractors. Then, the engineer will assist in testing the prototype, first in a laboratory setting, and then in the field (at a logging site in a forest). In the latter stage of the project, you should be prepared to work in a rural environment (in California) under resource-constrained settings.

Prior experience with SolidWorks, design for manufacturing, control systems, and reactor testing will be helpful. A project website (if you have one) will help us gauge your experience.

Resume and cover letter required.In your cover letter, please explain your long-term career goals and how this position may help them towards these goals.

STR is a privately-owned, rapidly growing business focused on research and development (R&D) for the defense and intelligence communities. STR has approximately 250 employees at sites in Woburn, MA, Dayton, OH and Arlington, VA. We are a nationally recognized leader in research areas including data analytics, sensors and signal processing, electronic warfare, cyber, video and image understanding, command and control, and precision navigation. Several programs have transitioned advanced technology to military and intelligence users. While our primary focus is on serving US Government customers, we are pursuing commercial applications as well.

Job Description:
Students will work as part of project teams with mentorship from experienced staff
Collaborate with technical experts to solve problems related to signal processing, image/video processing, machine learning, computer vision, statistical estimation, object tracking, optimization, control systems, data analytics, cyber defense, sensor hardware development, and social media processing
Support all phases of projects ?
Problem design
Solution discovery
Development of prototype algorithms and systems in software and/or hardware
Experimentation and data analysis
System implementation/integration for test and fielded systems
US citizenship is required
 Qualifications:
Enrollment in a BS, MS or PhD degree program in electrical engineering, computer science, physics, mathematics or related technical discipline
Strong academic record and interest in research
Background/experience in one of the following areas: signal processing, image/video processing, machine learning, computer vision, computational hardware, RF hardware, software development, "big data" processing, scientific computing skills (MATLAB, python)
US citizenship is required

College of Science and College of Computer Science

Please apply by Wednesday September 18th. A first round of interviews will take place between September 19th and 24th.
Please include your GPA on your resume, as well as the year you started at NU and your expected graduation year. HR requires this to determine pay rates.
 
Position Description:
 
Working closely with their supervisor, the co-op will be instructed in Computational Chemistry to support Medicinal Chemistry programs. While learning about the role of computational chemistry in drug discovery, the co-op will work in two main areas.               
Extension and integration of computational software: The co-op student will have the opportunity to learn how to use state-of-the-art computational chemistry and molecular modeling software. By developing extensions to these programs via programming to provide additional functionality to discovery chemists, the co-op can contribute directly to the drug discovery process.
Development of web services: The co-op student will learn to capture important parts of the drug discovery process and encode it for deployment via web services. Python is used to develop the web services. There are also opportunities to apply data science techniques to drug discovery by developing programs which leverage Takeda's vast, internal databases.

The co-op will gain valuable experience with Python and SQL. In addition, the co-op will be exposed to a variety of computational techniques and will have the opportunity for hands-on training with state-of-the-art drug discovery software.  For co-ops interested in both chemistry and computers, this is a novel opportunity to develop unique skills. Throughout the co-op's tenure with Takeda, he/she will interact with and learn from experienced scientists while contributing to the drug discovery process. He/she will also attend several department-wide presentations, and will have the opportunity to present his/her work to the Chemistry department at a closing poster session.
 
In addition, there are many opportunities to tour labs on Takeda's Cambridge campus to learn about all aspects of the drug discovery process from target identification to animal studies and formulation. The proximity of so many experienced scientists with a broad range of backgrounds provides a unique opportunity to learn about drug discovery.
 
Candidate profile:

1- Chemistry and computer science  classes (requirement)
2- Knowledge of Python programming is preferred
3- Flexible and willing to learn (requirement)
4- Good oral and written communication skills

Company Description:

Takeda is a research-based global pharmaceutical company. As the largest
pharmaceutical company in Japan Takeda is committed to striving towards better health for patients worldwide through leading innovation in medicine.

Takeda Oncology based in Cambridge Mass. is comprised of a global team of scientists wholly dedicated to the study of cancer. It combines the innovative science of a leading American biopharmaceutical company with the global assets of Japan's largest pharmaceutical company. At Takeda Oncology, "We Aspire to Cure Cancer". Our mission is to deliver extraordinary medicines to patients with cancer worldwide through our science, innovation, and passion. We have cancer products on the market, Velcade, a medicine for the treatment of multiple myeloma (a cancer of the blood) and Adcetris, an antibody drug conjugate used for the treatment of Hodgkins lymphoma.

There are about 1,500 employees at the Takeda Oncology Cambridge site (previously known as Millennium Pharmaceticals).

Millennium Pharmaceuticals, Inc., was established in 1993 in Cambridge, Massachusetts as a genomics company applying world-class recombinant technology to the discovery and development of innovative new therapies in a broad spectrum of diseases. In May, 2008, Millennium was acquired by Takeda Pharmaceutical Company Limited and continued to operate as the Oncology R&D function for Takeda.
 
Transportation:

-By Bus: Take the bus CT1 or bus 1, going towards Central square in Cambridge and get off at the "University Park" stop. Landsdowne street is accorss the street
-By T: Take the red line towards Alewife, get off at the "Central" stop. Walk on Mass Ave. towards Boston until you get to Landsdowne Street on the right.

At TableCheck, we are transforming the dining experience at Japan and Asia's top restaurants and hotels via innovative reservation management and booking apps built using the latest technologies. Our company has over 3,500 restaurant clients and 100 full-time staff, with over 100 million diners seated via our apps.

As an IT Engineering Intern, you will join us in Tokyo, Japan where you will be mentored by senior IT engineers and work closely with our experienced team to build the next-generation of restaurant apps. You will gain exposure to a broad range of IT topics and see first-hand how robust, reliable, and scalable applications are built in the real world. Our interns work on real projects and features that are shipped to production as part of our continuous delivery process, and for this reason we only consider applicants who have some previous experience.

Our minimum length of internship is 6 months. Longer placements are also possible.

Desired Skills

At least one open-source project which we can review
Experience coding in at least one of: Go, Elixir, Ruby, Scala, or Javascript
Experience with RDBMS (PostgreSQL, MariaDB, MySQL)
Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis, ElasticSearch)
Ability to use a version control system (Git preferred)
Test-driven development
Software security

 

Bonus Skills

Infrastructure (Linux, Terraform, Ansible, Kubernetes, Docker)
Experience with frontend technologies (JavaScript, React, Ember.js)
UI/UX design skills

 

Language Skills

Fluent English
Knowledge of Japanese, Chinese or Korean are a plus

 

Evaluation Criteria

Applicants will be evaluated on the basis of their portfolio of prior work, skillset, philosophy, and cultural fit.

 

Restrictions

Applicants must be available to come to Tokyo, Japan for a minimum of 6 consecutive months.
Applicants without previous coding experience should not apply.
Applicants without at least one open source or publicly visible project should not apply.

About us

Companies embracing big data find themselves inundated with hundreds to thousands of data sources that they struggle to organize into one consistent view. Tamr provides a unique solution leveraging human-guided machine learning to intelligently unify your data.

Join our core engineering team in the heart of Harvard Square in Boston! We are a close knit team of around 25 people who are always willing to teach and eager to learn. We work hard but we also have fun together. Above all we have each other's backs. With such a small team we believe that every member needs to be contributing in a meaningful, business-impacting way. So when you join, we work with you to find the team and the project you want to work on. We want to connect you with a project that you're excited to finish and that we're excited to have.

Job Responsibilities:
As a co-op you'll be joining a sub-team of 4 or 5 people. You will basically be treated like a regular employee. You'll have a manager who will mentor you in your professional development as well as a sprint master who will facilitate the scheduling of tasks. You will design, break down and own stories for every sprint. Your code will be held to the same standard expected of every engineer.

As a full stack engineer, you'll be working with our designers to create beautiful and responsive user experiences in the front end as well as working on API design, algorithms and data movement in the backend.

Required Skills:   
We have no problem teaching you technologies you've never used before. All we ask for is creativity and tenacity in solving the problems that we're tackling together. That being said here's some information about our software stack:
Front end: HTML5, CSS3, React, Redux and, of course, JavaScript.
Back end: Java but often interface with REST APIs, Postgres, SparkSQL or Spark RDDs. Common data formats include CSV, JSON and Avro.

Seeking candidates with a strong background in electrical engineering first principles and an interest in hardware development. Tasks will encompass all aspects of the hardware design process including requirements derivations, circuit analysis & simulations, bread-boarding, printed circuit board design & debug, as well as documentation of results. Typical applications involve low noise amplifier design, analog to digital and digital to analog converters, filters, and power supply design. Additionally, candidates will be responsible for testing in an ESD-controlled environment using a wide variety of test equipment including oscilloscopes, dynamic signal analyzers, power amplifiers, and electro-dynamic shakers. Strong written and verbal communications skills are required as well as the ability to present results to peers and management in formal and informal settings.
 

Applicant Qualifications

Must be a US citizen and enrolled in an accredited Engineering curriculum.
Fast, self-directed learner with outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
An exceptional academic record and demonstrated laboratory competence in signal processing, analog electronics design, analysis, simulation, test and debug.
Hands on technical skills such as soldering and bread-boarding are highly desirable
The ideal candidate has coursework and lab experience in the following areas: 
Hands on experience in circuit design and test
Schematic Capture and PCB layout for mixed-signal circuits
Analysis and synthesis of closed-loop control systems
Circuit simulation using SPICE and its variants
Modeling and analysis using MATLAB/Simulink
Organization: The Charles Stark Draper Laboratory Inc

Job Description:
Location: Tokyo, Japan

Students interested in applying to COE global positions must contact Sally Conant (s.conant@northeastern.edu). Once you have spoken with her about the position, your resume will be sent to global employers.

Required: native level of English and entry level of Japanese language skill and/or strong will to improve it.

Established: 2012
Paid-in capital: 20 million yen
Number of employees: 17
Industry: Information Technology
Company site: www.techshare.co.jp
Related Division website: www.physical-computing.jp

TechShare has three core business such as Single Board Computer, Robotics and Software simulation.

Single Board Computer (SBC)
We are authorized distributor of major single board computers such as Arduino, Raspberry Pi, BeagleBone, Tinker board and LattePanda. We also provide SBC customization and development services for local industry users. We also deal with a lot of electric components including sensors and accessories to use with those SBCs. Our SBC business contribute to a lot of customers developing new IoT gadgets in new fields.

Robotics
We deal with robots including robot car and robot arm such as Zumo, DOBOT Magician etc. to use in education, consumer market and industries. We contribute to advanced educations such as University and technical college and providing new solutions in factory automation (Industry 4.0).

Software Simulation
We provide software distribution, training courses and consulting service for Model base development using MATLAB/Simulink, multi-body dynamics simulation and virtual training simulators. This division focus on the industries such as Automotive, construction, ports, defense and robotics.

Co-op Job Title: Assistant Engineer (in robotics and SBC)

Job Description
Robotics engineer is responsible for the following tasks and projects.
Daily technical support for Robotics product including DOBOT Magician (robot arm) and single board computer related products such as Raspberry Pi, Tinker Board, LattePanda, camera module and sensing devices.
2) Develop the demos and video contents to promote the robotics products, robot arm and vision system.
3) Sales supports to develop sales tools and web contents such as brochure, web page and video to promote the robotics products.
4) Asist senor engineers to develop new vision system for robot arms, IoT gadgets and AI applications.
5) Marketing support in promotion events
6) Teaching Assistant in STEM education class
Skills Gained by the End Co-op
We expect Co-op can have a lot of opportunities to see and participate in actual projects that Japanese industry customers is trying to improve their factory operations using small size robot arms, vision system and latest IoT technologies using SBCs. The Co-op will get actual experience and skill to develop a part of the solutions through real work experiences in Japan.

Salary/Stipend and Benefits
Hourly pay: 1,000-1,250JPY/hour
Housing allowance: 20,000JPY/ month (during 6 month internship)
Please note for housing allowance:

Job Description:
International internship programs for NU co-op students

The Intern Group is an NU approved provider that offers a fee-based package to Northeastern University students from all majors seeking a global co-op. The package includes guaranteeing a co-op, housing, cultural events and excursions, visa assistance, a professional development workshop, a career coach, and other services. 

The Intern Group provides internships across all career fields in Europe, Asia, Australia, North America and Latin America. They provide a fully inclusive program, so alongside an internship in your field, they also find your housing, provide social and cultural events, professional development tools and a personalized career coaching session once you finish your internship. They also help with the logistical aspects like providing visa assistance. 

Discounts:
They'll also give you a discount because you're a Northeastern student. Make sure to mention this when you apply and interview.
24 Week Programs = 15% discount
Anything from 16-23 Weeks = 12% discount
Anything 15 weeks or less = 10% discount
CO-OP & Non-CO-OP students get same discount
 
Qualified individuals gain valuable professional experience at leading companies and organizations in their chosen industry sectors, while exploring an exciting destination and developing extensive international networks. There are full-time local teams in each of their program destinations, who are equipped and ready to set you up with the experience of your dreams. Their programs include much more than a professional internship in your desired destination and industry sector. All aspects of the program are designed to enhance your professional and personal development, and to allow you to experience a new culture, people, and place. Their programs are regularly featured in the world's top news media, including Time, Forbes, and CNN.    

Examples of fees:

Medellin, Colombia program for 4 months - $5,850 U.S. dollars
All other programs fees here: https://www.theinterngroup.com/program-fees/

Fee includes:
Accommodation (private bedroom in pre-vetted neighborhood)
Guaranteed internship placement
Professional development workshop, training & tools (communication, teamwork and interpersonal skills)
Excursions and side trips
Airport pick-up and drop-off (private car to take you to your accommodation on arrival and to the airport at the end of your internship)
24/7 emergency assistance from local staff
Welcome package including transportation card, city maps, and orientaion guide
Visa assistance (where required)

Co-op Job Title: Software Development Engineer in Test Co-op (January 2020 - June 2020)
Job Description:
The MITRE Corporation is seeking a student to work from January 2020 to June 2020 who is interested in being a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) as part of our collaborative DevOps team to deliver better enterprise applications faster to end users.  Automated functional tests are a critical piece of our continuous delivery pipeline, and this position offers an exciting and challenging opportunity for a motivated technical candidate looking to improve software development skills, learn more about testing, and get experience working with a team that develops and deploys enterprise applications.
 
Key functions include:
Automated functional testing of various web and mobile technology stacks for DevOps and CD pipelines
Use of automated testing tools such as Selenium WebDriver and SoapUI
Develop code for tests using programming languages such as Python or Java and unit testing frameworks
Leveraging agile/scrum development practices

Other learning opportunities may include:
Performance testing (load and stress testing) using tools such as LoadRunner and JMeter
Use of Docker containers and other virtual technology
Data analytics and log analysis


Required Qualifications:
Ideal candidates are undergraduate students pursuing a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or other relevant technical disciplines.
 
Preferred Qualifications
Programming experience in Python, Java or JavaScript
Web or software development
Familiarity with web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, HTTP, Cookies, etc)
Software testing or exposure to unit testing frameworks (JUnit, TestNG, unittest, pytest, etc)
Use of tools such as Git, Maven, Ant, PipProgramming languages
Relevant courses:
Software engineering
Software design
Software testing
Systems engineering
Statistics and data analysis
Additional Information:
 
* 70% of MITRE's full-time jobs require US government security clearances; therefore, many internships and full time positions require that the candidates be clearable. MITRE does not provide sponsorship for those that need it currently or in the future.
 
** Many of our jobs welcome those students who have an interdisciplinary approach to problem solving.
** Please apply directly on our website for this position.

The Tandana Foundation is seeking an intern to teach computer classes in mountain villages in the Otavalo canton of Ecuador, to serve as IT specialist for our local network and Electronic Medical Records system, and to assist with other IT-related projects.  Located in a region that is rich in natural beauty and cultural diversity, this internship is available year-round, and the minimum time commitment is 3 months.

Position Description:
In this internship, you will teach computer classes for Tandana's scholarship students at the computer lab in Tandana's office, as well as for students at a local elementary school. You will work alongside Tandana staff, local teachers and community members, teaching basic computer skills to both elementary and secondary students. During Tandana's Health Care Volunteer Vacations, you will set up our portable router and server at each location, help troubleshoot issues with the network or EMR system, and help volunteers learn to use the system. Because Tandana facilitates many volunteer programs and community projects throughout the year, you may also help coordinate service- and cultural learning experiences for groups of U.S. students that are visiting your community as well as assist with other Tandana projects as the need arises. You may also provide individual support to Tandana scholarship students in using computers and the internet for homework assignments. If you have video production skills, you will also have an opportunity to create videos for use by Tandana volunteers as well as to spread the word about Tandana's projects. Finally, you will serve as a cultural ambassador and a positive representative of The Tandana Foundation. In return, you will be placed with a host family, which will allow countless opportunities to explore the indigenous cultures and subsistence lifestyles of highland Ecuador as well as the natural environment around you. You will also be given all the support you need to succeed in your work and be encouraged to accomplish your personal internship goals.

Requirements:
Conversational Spanish
Experience living in cross-cultural situations, preferably in Latin America
Ability to work cooperatively with a diverse array of people, to solve problems creatively, and to promote a positive experience for all involved
Self-motivation, responsibility, and an ability to work independently
Basic networking knowledge and the ability to explain the use of web browsers and Office applications.
Minimum age is 19
Minimum time commitment is 3 months
Responsibilities:
Teach basic computer classes and/or tutor in computer skills 4-5 days a week
Serve as IT specialist during Tandana's Health Care Volunteer Vacations
Optional: create videos for Tandana's external and internal use
Help coordinate the activities of visiting volunteer groups and other Tandana projects and ensure that volunteers and community members alike have positive experiences.
Represent Tandana in a positive manner to all community members and volunteers and help to build good relationships
Benefits:
The opportunity to participate in unique cultural activities and be a part of a dynamic, multi-cultural team
Detailed orientation and ongoing support from Tandana's Ecuador Program Manager as well as a mentor
Room and board with a local family (homestay)
Work expenses including local transportation, cell phone, and consular fees. (Interns pay their own airfare to Ecuador)
How to apply:
Interested parties should send a resume and a cover letter addressing each of the following questions to Aaron DiMartino, Operations Director, at aaron@tandanafoundation.org. Please write "IT Internship" in the subject line of the email.
Please describe any experience you have living in Ecuador or in another cross-cultural situation.
What are your strengths and weaknesses as a leader?
Describe an experience that was very challenging for you. How did you deal with the difficulties, and what did you learn from the experience?
What are you passionate about, and how do you express that passion?
What do you think will be most exciting about this internship?
What do you think will be most difficult about this internship?
What are your personal and professional goals for this internship and how can we help you accomplish them?
Travel Advisory:
Please note, this co-op opportunity is located in a high-risk destination as defined by the university's Policy on International Travel

Co-op Advisor Note:  CS-STRTUP

The Tandana Foundation is seeking a fellow to help prepare, lead, and follow up after our group volunteer programs in the Otavalo canton of highland Ecuador, a region that is rich in natural beauty and cultural diversity.  The minimum time commitment for this fellowship is one year, beginning either in January, May, or September.  We will also consider a 9-month option for exceptional candidates.
 
Position Description:
In this fellowship, your main responsibilities will involve working with communities to prepare for the visits of volunteer groups, coordinating the stays of the volunteer groups, and following up afterward to ensure that projects are completed, and volunteers are informed of the results of their efforts. You will serve as an Assistant Coordinator or Community Coordinator for all scheduled programs during your time in Ecuador, gaining experience with a variety of volunteer groups and work projects. During group programs, the schedule is intense, and you will need to be prepared to work hard, focusing on the tasks at hand. In between programs, you will make arrangements with community partners and service providers, meet with community leaders for evaluation, and do other preparatory and follow up work, and you may also take on additional projects based on your interests. Finally, you will serve as a cultural ambassador and a positive representative of The Tandana Foundation. You will be given all the support you need to succeed in your work and be encouraged to accomplish your personal fellowship goals, which will provide you with valuable skills and experience in volunteer program leadership. And by living with a host family, you will have countless opportunities to explore the indigenous cultures and subsistence lifestyles of highland Ecuador as well as the natural environment around you.
 
Requirements:
Fluent Spanish
Experience working with North Americans and Latin Americans
Experience living in cross-cultural situations, preferably in Latin America
Ability to work cooperatively with a diverse array of people, to solve problems creatively, and to promote a positive experience for all involved
Self-motivation, responsibility, and an ability to work independently
Minimum age is 22
Minimum time commitment is 1 year (or 9 months by special arrangement)
WFA or greater first aid certification and CPR certification
Responsibilities:
Work with community leaders and other local contacts to arrange volunteer work and cultural activities
Help lead the group programs on a daily basis and facilitate all aspects of the groups' stays in Ecuador
Help coordinate logistics of the programs, handle money, keep accurate records
Solve problems and handle emergency situations in a professional manner
Set an upbeat tone for volunteer groups
Coordinate the experience of visiting groups and ensure that they are a positive experience for the volunteers as well as the community
Meet with community leaders after each program to evaluate and improve
Follow up with communities on any projects that are still in progress after programs
Communicate with the groups about progress and outcomes of the projects they worked on
Follow up with patients from our health care programs to assist them in accessing the care they need
Engage in additional community projects as need and interests dictate
Serve as a leader for Tandana interns
Represent Tandana in a positive manner to all community members and volunteers and help to build good relationships
Benefits:
The opportunity to participate in unique cultural activities and be a part of a dynamic, multi-cultural team
The opportunity to learn about planning and leading high-quality, cross-cultural volunteer programs, practice the necessary skills, and gain experience in the field
Detailed orientation and ongoing support from Tandana's Ecuador Program Manager as well as a mentor
Room and board with a local family (homestay)
Work expenses including local transportation, cell phone, and consular fees.
Round-trip transportation to Ecuador from the United States
Stipend of $100 per month, with the possibility of additional stipends when filling official roles in group program leadership
Two weeks of vacation
How to apply:
Interested parties should send a resume and a cover letter addressing each of the following questions to Aaron DiMartino, Operations Director, at aaron@tandanafoundation.org. Please write "Program Leadership Fellowship" in the subject line of the email.
Please describe any experience you have living in Ecuador or in another cross-cultural situation.
What are your strengths and weaknesses as a leader?
Describe an experience that was very challenging for you. How did you deal with the difficulties, and what did you learn from the experience?
What are you passionate about, and how do you express that passion?

We are excited to inform you that our recruiting season for Disney Professional Internships is underway. We encourage you to visit our website disneyinterns.com, and apply for internships in which you are interested today.

Each of these unique areas of our global company offers students the ability to apply classroom learnings while networking with Disney professionals, gaining valuable experience from a Fortune 100 Company and having fun!

Programs range between three to six months and can be extended up to a year
Hourly Rate of pay varies, depending on the position  - all positions are full time/paid
Work perks include complimentary theme park admission, merchandise and dining discounts, personal
life and wellness resources, and so much more!
Applicants must be taking classes at an accredited college or university or graduated within the past six months
Candidates must have reliable transportation

Ready to make your impact on the way technology enables our retail business and our bottom line? Then you're ready to Discover Different. During this co-op you'll learn about retail from the inside out, and build a thorough understanding of how technology is key to driving results across every area of our business. 

IT Business Analyst Basics: Delivering Better Solutions?On A Global Scale.
We collaborate and provide the technology expertise and support to all aspects of our business including, Home Office, Stores, Distribution Centers and Buying Offices. Our mission is to continuously explore, identify, and deliver competitive advantaged solutions through our people, partners, processes, and technology to enable the successful execution of our off-price retail model.  
Our team works with legacy and emerging technologies while partnering and collaborating with a global team of experienced technology professionals and leaders. Our IT team encourages new ideas and applications of technology in support of our business, while also focusing and fostering career development through a variety of projects, experiences and opportunities throughout our Global IT organization.  

The Opportunity: Support Our Global IT Initiatives?And Our Business Model.
Global IT at TJX is offering co-op opportunities at our Marlborough or Framingham, MA offices to students seeking to learn, grow, and contribute in a fast-paced, dynamic global IT organization. You will gain industry experience in retail technology and have opportunities to work in an Agile environment and contribute to strategic projects that will enable the development of innovation solutions to make our platforms even better.  

Multiple January to June 2020 opportunities are available as an IT Business Analyst Co-op within a variety of areas within the TJX Global IT organization such as: 
/ Solution Delivery
/ IT Security & Compliance
/ Infrastructure & Operations

These co-ops roles will provide business and project analytical support for critical global IT initiatives, enabling the TJX retail business operating model. Every day, you'll discover what makes working at TJX so different?working on projects that contribute to the IT transformation strategy, as well as assisting with daily activities within the IT functions. You will collaborate with experienced technical experts and strategists, to ensure we are managing and executing assigned projects and deliverables in a timely, effective, and efficient manner. 

Responsibilities may include: 
/ Supporting the execution of key deliverables on IT roadmpa
/ Tool evaluation and recommendations through proof of concepts
/ Supporting of resourcing planning and budget
/ Reviewing and evolving current processes (e.g. Visio process flows)
/ Effective project communication and updates
/ Team meeting support
/ Technical documentation

Each IT Business Analyst Co-op will receive targeted supervision and guidance, hands-on training to facilitate learning, while given a high degree of creativity and autonomy?providing the tools for success in a global Fortune 100 retail technology environment.

Who We Are Looking For: It Just Might Be You.
We are looking for students who are highly motivated self-starters and who possess the ability to prioritize effectively, be proactive and flexible, and demonstrate a strong bias for action in a fast-paced, professional environment. Additional skills include:
/ A genuine interest in technology solutions and innovation
/ Experience working with numbers
/ Problem solvers who can think creatively
/ Excellent communicator
/ Students with proven leadership abilities and strong work ethic
/ Those who can think in "Agile Mindset"?flexible, change adept, willingness to learn
/ Knowledge, understanding, and experience with: MS Visio, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Word
/ Knowledge of Tableau and/or Power BI software
 
Key Qualifications:
/ A well-founded academic background ? GPA of 3.0 or above
/ Students eligible for an intermediate or advanced internship
/ Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or related major (other majors may be considered)
 
Post Co-op: We've Got Big Plans For You.
High performing co-ops may be offered one of multiple opportunities upon successful completion of their co-op experience:
/ Return for a second Corporate IT co-op opportunity
 / Return for a summer internship Corporate IT opportunity
 / Join us in a full-time Corporate IT role after graduation

(CS-BGNR)

Overview
Ready to make an impact on the Data Science team and learn how data enables our retail business and our bottom line? During this co-op you'll learn about retail from the inside out, and build a thorough understanding of how data is key to driving decisions and results across TJX Digital.
 
The Team:
Every day we are busy mining data, performing ad hoc analyses, recommending product, analyzing profitability, and building dashboards.  Our team works closely with many areas of the business including Finance, Marketing, Digital Experience, Store Operations, and IT.  We need a talented individual to support us as we move to the next level in all aspects of the Data Science realm including programming, quantitative expertise and business expertise.
 
The Opportunity:
TJX Digital is looking for an intelligent and motivated Co-op to join our growing Data Science team.  We are offering an opportunity to learn, grow and contribute in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You will gain industry experience and learn how Data Science is used within a corporate retail setting.  You will support on strategic projects and ad-hoc analysis to drive real time business decisions and long-term strategies.
 
Projects and analysis could involve creating dashboards, data manipulation, regression models, personalization recommendations, building business cases, and predictive analytics ? with the broader goal of driving profitable sales.  You will work with our business partners, ensuring their questions are answered accurately with the best data driven answers we can provide.
 
Each Co-op will receive targeted supervision and guidance, hands-on training to facilitate learning, while given a high degree of creativity and autonomy - providing the tools for success in a global Fortune 100 retail environment. 
 
Who We Are Looking For:
We are looking for current students who are highly motivated self-starters, with the ability to prioritize effectively, be proactive and flexible, and demonstrate a strong bias for action in a fast-paced professional environment. Additional skills include:
Problem solvers who can think creatively
Excellent communicators, who are able to concisely and effectively deliver results
Students with proven leadership abilities and strong work ethic
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Ability to adjust direction under constantly-changing business conditions and needs
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (i.e. pivot tables, charts, v-look up, etc.)
SQL Experience, preferably with SQL Server
Experience with R/Python or another programming language
Experience with well-known quantitative techniques such as regression, significance testing, multivariate analysis
 Key Qualifications:
 GPA of 3.0 or above
Students eligible for an intermediate or advanced co-op
Data Science majors preferred (consideration may also be given to Computer Science, Mathematics, or other related major)
 (CS-DASCI)

WDP&R Technology ? IoT Engineer Intern

At Disney, we are storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.
 
The Walt Disney Parks & Resort (WDP&R) Technology team combines custom technology solutions with creativity to produce robust applications that enhance all aspects of the guest experience. From one of the most sophisticated hotel reservation systems in the world to Disney Cruise Line shipboard systems, Disney Vacation Club member services, FastPass ticketing, PhotoPass, and even inventory applications to ensure we have the right number of cast costumes. WDP&R Technology seeks forward-thinking team members who are passionate about delivering a quality product and enjoy working closely with business partners on both strategic and tactical challenges.
 
With The Walt Disney Parks & Resorts Technology group, this intern will be integrated into a hardware IoT technology delivery team focused on building Cast-facing applications that support our Resorts and Park Operations. The individual for this position should have a passion for analysis, design and development of technology solutions. The IoT Engineer Intern will have exposure to a variety of technologies including but not limited to IoT sensors, rf communications, field and lab testing of IoT solutions. He or she should have or be in the process of learning and applying related development technologies.
 
Be a part of a transformative team and culture participating on team projects while learning and experiencing new technologies.
WDPR Technology seeks forward-thinking team members who are passionate about delivering a quality product and enjoy working closely with business partners on both strategic and tactical challenges.  Candidate should have good verbal and written communication skills, and be able to work independently as a self-starter, utilize good time management skills, and function well within a diverse team.   
 
Qualifications:
Experience with electronics & sensor lab and field testing, validation and installation
Strongly considered experience with IoT Hackathons
Experience with various sensors based on microcontroller or modules
Coursework in RF principles or exposure to RF equipment, testing, measurements
Familiarity with cloud technologies and platforms, mobile development, AWS a plus
Experience with embedded languages like assembly, C, C++, C#
Experience with electronics, engineering and hardware/software
Ability to follow existing programming and style guidelines to maintain consistent quality of code
Maintains documentation, procedures and working instructions for the operations team
Shows initiative in constantly reassessing business needs and makes suggestions that meet those needs proactive
Amazon Web Services experience a plus.
 
Required Education:
Junior, Senior, Graduate Level student or recent graduate (within 6 months of graduating) pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Business, Communications (technology mindset a plus).

Trifacta is looking for talented and dedicated interns to join our world-class team and build the software that is changing the way our users work with data. We're growing our team, but we are dedicated to maintaining our flat organization where every engineer has the chance to contribute ideas, influence our direction, and build significant pieces of our codebase and product. We are pioneering data transformation technology and approach engineering with a philosophy that is execution-oriented and iterative, yet also experimental. We're committed to producing high-quality software that our users love and meets the high standards of running within enterprise environments. We release and deploy that software frequently in enterprise and cloud environments. We're built on an open stack top to bottom, and contribute to various open source projects.

Why Trifacta?
- Work on real projects! You'll have the opportunity to directly contribute to the next release of Trifacta
- Opportunities to be hired full time after your internship
- See the impact you'll be making. You'll be receiving career development opportunities with an ambitious startup backed by top tier investors
- You'll get to work with some of the brightest people in systems and UI development, with access to leaders and innovators across the company
- Excellent perks including a stocked kitchen, catered meals, team events, flexible work hours, guest speakers from the industry, and more!

Responsibilities:
Contribute to our quality projects by extending automation infrastructure and authoring automated test cases
Work closely with product management, development, and operations within an agile process to qualify and automate new features as they're being developed
Creatively test the product with the intent to "break the feature or the product"
Create clear and articulate bug reports
Advocate for testability during the design process, enabling reliable and efficient automation
Collaborate closely with other engineers and become a valued member of our larger QA team between San Francisco and Berlin
Contribute to positive experience and success of our customers

You'd ideally have:
Pursuing BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science (or equivalent) or a related field
Prior experience in programming using Object Oriented Design and Analysis skills
Passion for excellent software quality
English language fluency, excellent communication skills, including writing clear and concise bug reports, test plans, and test cases
Excellent team player

Toast Overview:

We are a rapidly growing company that's revolutionizing the way the restaurant industry does business by pairing technology with an unrivaled commitment to customer success. We help restaurants streamline operations, increase revenue, and deliver amazing guest experiences through our platform that combines restaurant point of sale, guest-facing technology, and award-winning customer support. As a Toaster, you will be challenged to take on meaningful projects that will help shape the future of the company. Join us as we empower the restaurant community to delight guests, do what they love, and thrive.

Job Overview:

Toast is looking for self-motivated individuals who love building great software and want to have fun while doing it. We work extensively with Android, iOS, and web front ends, where we work hard to provide a well-designed user interface for our customers. Our infrastructure runs in Amazon Web Services where we run Java microservices in Docker containers; our customers rely on us to keep this infrastructure fast and stable so that their point-of-sale system "just works", despite being a complex distributed system.  We need talented engineers to build and maintain the highest quality product as our vision moves forward.

What you will do:

Work on a small team of 3-6 engineers, responsible for entire modules of the Toast product
Build, and maintain high performance, flexible, and highly scalable web and mobile applications
Participate in designing, estimating effort, implementing, testing, debugging, configuring, integrating and documenting database, middle-tier and front-end code
Diagnose performance bottlenecks and implement optimizations
Think in terms of the end-user and design accordingly
Actively contribute to product design and feature selection discussions
Participate in code reviews to ensure technical implementations meet functional requirements
Do you have the right ingredients?
Deep Java development experience
Mobile software development experience, preferably with Android
Well-versed in tiered web application architecture and databases
Proficient in the web front-end basics - HTML, CSS and JavaScript

Our Tech Stack

Toast's products run on a stack that ranges from guest and restaurant-facing Android tablets to backend services in Java to internal, guest-facing and restaurant-facing web apps. The main Toast POS application is an Android application written in Java and Kotlin. Our backend services follow a microservice architecture written using Java and DropWizard; we use AWS extensively, ranging from S3 to RDS to Lambda. We have our own platform for dealing with user management, service elevations and robust load balancing. Toast stores data in a set of sharded Postgres databases and utilizes Apache Spark for large scale data workloads including query and batch processing. The front-end is  moving towards React and ES6. For data between tablets and our cloud platform we operate RabbitMQ clusters as well as direct tablet communication to the back end.

True Fit is the universal platform for discovering and purchasing apparel & footwear with confidence; True Fit shows consumers what's True to them across millions of styles from the world's best brands.  True Fit is a big data company managing a growing database of the world's top apparel, footwear and consumer fit data to help consumers, brands and retailers unlock the online footwear and apparel market. By deploying a concert of proven algorithms, True Fit translates how shoes and clothing fit shoppers viewing them on screen by instantly providing each consumer with a personal fit rating and size recommendation for every style. Removing the "will it fit?" barrier restores consumer confidence, allowing leading retailers and brands to grow their digital business. True Fit also provides rich insights to partnering retailers and brands, which leverage these insights to accelerate personalization and growth.  True Fit is winner of 3 MITX Innovation Awards; Best Consumer Tech that Makes Life Easier, Best Analytics / Business Intelligence, and Best UX; and was selected Best of Web by InStyle Magazine.

As a Software Engineer Co-op at True Fit, you will work with experienced software engineers to build, deploy, test, and maintain our SaaS-based machine learning software product. Specific duties will vary by experience and interest.

Examples duties could include:
- Designing and building web applications in Scala and AngularJS
- Building automation tools on Linux to support our platform operations team
- Writing, running, and recording test cases
- Coding, testing, and debugging automation tests in Scala, HTML, and JavaScript
- Writing SQL Queries to analyze large amounts of data
- Creating procedures and tools to load structured data into our environment

Qualifications:
- Some experience programming using Java, C , Ruby, or Scala.  Racket preferred. 
- Experience with (or interest in) HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
- Interest in understanding business requirements and how to translate them into software product prototypes and user interfaces
- Progress toward an undergraduate degree in a quantitative field (Math, Physics, Economics, Engineering, or Computer Science) is preferred
- Strong listening and communications skills

Overview

The Data Science Team at Two Six Labs is looking for a Data Visualization Co-op to join us for January to June 2020. You will work with us designing and developing the next generation of visualizations and user interfaces for data analysis.

The Data Science Team applies expertise in data visualization, machine learning, large-scale computational architectures, and simulation to solve research challenges in high impact areas including cybersecurity, biological systems, and distributed sensor platforms. We've built visual malware analysis systems, access control policy diffing tools, a prototype to visualize graphs with millions of nodes, and visualizations to monitor city-scale sensor networks. Our team values creativity, initiative, collaboration, and diversity. We strive for a fun and collegial atmosphere that encourages knowledge sharing and professional growth. In short, we're passionate about empowering our customer's missions and enjoy working together at the leading edge of technology.

Responsibilities

As a Co-op, you will learn data visualization and human-computer interaction best practices and apply them to challenging, real-world problems. You will build interactive tools for expert users to visually analyze data. You will work on multidisciplinary project teams, which include experts from machine learning, cybersecurity, embedded systems, computing infrastructure, and physics. You will also be paired with a mentor who will encourage and support your technical growth. You will present an end-of-co-op project, and will be encouraged to publish relevant research results in blogs or conferences.

Qualifications

* Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Data Science, or a related technical field.
* Familiarity with JavaScript, Python, Java, or a comparable language.
* Knowledge of data visualization and/or human-computer interaction.
* Ability to work collaboratively and communicate results to team members.

Nice to Have:

* Familiarity with software development tools and platforms (e.g. tools like Git or webpack).

* Familiarity with web technologies (e.g. tech like HTML, CSS, WebGL, jQuery, or React).

[CS-DASCI]

True Fit is the universal platform for discovering and purchasing apparel & footwear with confidence; True Fit shows consumers what's True to them across millions of styles from the world's best brands.  True Fit is a big data company managing a growing database of the world's top apparel, footwear and consumer fit data to help consumers, brands and retailers unlock the online footwear and apparel market. By deploying a concert of proven algorithms, True Fit translates how shoes and clothing fit shoppers viewing them on screen by instantly providing each consumer with a personal fit rating and size recommendation for every style. Removing the "will it fit?" barrier restores consumer confidence, allowing leading retailers and brands to grow their digital business. True Fit also provides rich insights to partnering retailers and brands, which leverage these insights to accelerate personalization and growth.  True Fit is winner of 3 MITX Innovation Awards; Best Consumer Tech that Makes Life Easier, Best Analytics / Business Intelligence, and Best UX; and was selected Best of Web by InStyle Magazine.

As a DevOps/Operations Co-op at True Fit, you will work with experienced DevOps engineers to build, deploy, test, automate, and maintain our global-scale, SaaS-based machine learning software platform. Specific duties will vary by experience and interest.

Examples duties could include:
- Build and administer Linux servers in the public cloud (currently GCP)
- Automate the world. If it needs doing more than twice, it needs to be automated. Build, deployment, monitoring, testing, and infrastructure are all within our automation sphere.
- Analyze and troubleshoot system, network, and infrastructure issues. True Fit's environment demands a sharp mind and thorough analytical skills.

Qualifications:
- Linux experience
- Working knowledge of application development or system technologies such as Python, Java, or JavaScript.
- Experience or interest in configuration management / desired state frameworks (Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, Chef)
- Familiarity with a cloud computing service (GCP, AWS, etc.) a plus
- Progress toward an undergraduate degree in a quantitative field (Math, Physics, Economics, Engineering, or Computer Science) is preferred
- Strong listening and communications skills

Who We Are
At True Fit, we believe when it comes to fashion, it's all about the details.

True Fit's personalization platform is strategically leveraged by 250 global retail sites, representing 17,000 brands and 100 million registered users. Since 2005, we have built the world's largest data collective connecting consumers with apparel and footwear they will love and keep.

As our data collective continues to grow, so does our team! Let's disrupt this $2 trillion industry together.
What we do
This position is part of the Analytics group in the Science department. The Analytics group works closely with customer-success, engineering, and other groups at True Fit providing custom and complex analytics solutions for internal and external use. For example:
Building new validation methods based on econometric and other methods
Development of software tools to analyze complex data quality issues (e.g. deviation from expected statistical distribution, detection of low-data anomalies, finding unexplained data format changes)
Creation of new reporting metrics
Supporting the development of new products
Ad-hoc analytics (customer analytics, internal reporting etc.)
Working with internal technical and non-technical groups to ensure account success
What you will do
Create test software to analyze how True Fit is implemented on retailers' websites. The goal is to develop software that tests for correct A/B test implementation, though the ideas and software structure can be extended to other areas of interest.

We have a number of tests we want to run:
Detect the presence or absence of an A/B test on a website.
If the True Fit widget is not present on products/categories that it should be.
If an A/B test does not split traffic in the ratio it's supposed to (e.g. 5%-5%).
If an A/B test allocates returning users to different branches.
If the page takes a long time to load or the widget takes a long time to load. 
Required Experience/Skills
Strong Python. The candidate should be able to demonstrate he or she has written larger pieces of software in Python. They should be able to demonstrate an understanding of the language beyond the basics.
A good grasp of object orientation and the need for design in larger systems. 
Basic grasp of standard Python modules like Pandas and NumPy.
A basic grasp of internet technologies like:
HTML, JavaScript, CSS
IP addressing
HTTP technology like redirects and headers.
Project will use Selenium and WebDriver
Basic grasp of statistics (e.g. standard deviation).
Good spoken and written communication skills in English.
The ability to work with non-technical people
Why True Fit?
One size does not fit all in what you wear or your True Fit career. Everyone at True Fit has the opportunity to push their professional boundaries, while balancing personal ambitions.

Together we've built a tight-knit culture that's reflected in our Glassdoor reviews; "Great people, cool product ? refreshing place to work ?  everyone actually works together like a team, employees are all pro-active and genuinely take pride in their work? growth potential plus culture ?  management is approachable, mindful of their people ? opportunity to learn/work on new technology ? you are an integral part of the success of the company? the work you are doing everyday really matters and makes a difference? managers provide autonomy and trust you ? really innovative company, open to share ideas to make a better product?  great culture with the right vision."

We believe that how we dress is an expression of who we are and the confidence we feel. As an EEO employer, we work to help all team members experience an inclusive, diverse and accepting work environment, so you can be True To You.

Located in Concord, MA at the New England District of the US Army Corps of Engineers, the Risk and Decision Science Team of the Engineer Research and Development Center's Environmental Laboratory provides hands-on experience through paid internships applying techniques from risk & decision science to topic areas in civil, environmental, and water resources engineering, management, planning, and restoration, as well as projects in emerging materials, military support, and homeland security. Our team provides unique opportunities to participate in high impact basic research on cutting edge issues and mission critical applied research addressing national challenges. Check out our web page for topics and project examples!

Recent projects that past interns have had the opportunity to work on include:
Developing methods and metrics to assess infrastructure system resilience
Adaptive management for restoration of watersheds including the Florida Everglades
Developing strategic frameworks for humanitarian assistance and disaster response
Optimizing dredging operations, fish surveys, and infrastructure investments
Stakeholder engagement and characterizing uncertainty for environmental management
Life Cycle Assessments of emerging materials, alternative fuels, and sediment management
Spatial analyses of environmental, humanitarian, and homeland security concern,
Developing software for net zero energy, dredging, and bioaccumulation risk modeling
Our work on these projects typically entails basic and applied research in the following areas:
Risk assessment and decision analysis
Uncertainty analysis in complex systems
Optimization & cognitive science
Water resources & environmental science
Value of information & other meta analyses
Life-cycle assessment & economic principles
Emerging technologies (e.g., nanomaterials, synthetic biology)
Value engineering, scenario analysis, and network science
We are looking for undergraduate and graduate students with backgrounds and interest in engineering, environmental science, mathematics, physics, computer science, and similar fields to
join our team. Experience with complex problem framing, optimization, statistics, decision analysis, programming, systems analysis, operations research, computational modeling and/or past research is preferred. Must be a team player, able to multi-task, and have strong written and oral communication skills. U.S. Citizenship is required.
Organization: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) - Engineer Research and Development Center (ERDC)

Job Description:
The International Relations Office at Universidad de los Andes is the unit in charge of the Internationalization of the University. We are in charge of Student and Faculty mobility, international strategy, partnerships, and international programs.
 
We are looking for a Student Coordinator to help our rapidly growing department with the coordination of incoming and outgoing study abroad programs. This includes but is not limited to basic office tasks, database management, technology support, and also run the University's International Club (ICLUB), which is comprised of local Chilean students as well as long term, full semester exchange students.

Responsibilities include:

-  Act as the first point of contact for exchange students, available to help with questions or concerns regarding life in Santiago or within the university itself.
-  Develop and match members of the buddy system, which links exchange students with a Chilean students based on major and interests, in order to give incoming students an immediate local connection.
-  Organize and coordinate ICLUB events, including on-campus barbecues, ski trips, soccer matches, off-campus hiking excursions etc.
-  Oversee and manage ICLUB social media accounts, particularly on Instagram @iclubuandes
-  Assist the Incoming Mobility Coordinator with development of materials and calendars.
-  Administrative assistance for Outgoing/Incoming students which includes processing applications and transcripts.
-  Research and investigate potential partnerships with foreign universities to both send and receive long term and short term exchange student programs
-  Promote and foster cross cultural connections between both local Chilean students and foreign exchange students by encouraging participation in ICLUB activities.
Organization: Universidad de los Andes-International Relations Office
Division: Universidad de los Andes-International Relations Office

Job Description:
Pratt & Whitney Control & Diagnostic Systems (CDS) is a dynamic engineering organization focused on the development and certification of military, commercial and industrial gas turbine engine control and diagnostic systems. CDS is responsible for all aspects of Pratt & Whitney engine control and diagnostic system development including requirements analysis & definition, system & software architecture, algorithm design, and product software design, verification & validation. CDS is looking for engineering co-ops supporting the various product development activities within the organization. The engineering work in this group offers an excellent opportunity to provide leadership and technical work in a very dynamic and challenging environment. Job responsibilities will involve working closely with engineering staff in the design and development of control and diagnostic system hardware and/or software. The candidate selected for this opportunity will be responsible for performing one or more of the following activities: hardware/software design studies, requirements analysis, simulation analysis to develop control logic designs, documenting the designs, and testing the final software in a bench environment.

Job Function
Engineering

Job Discipline
Engineering: Software Engrg

Experience/Qualifications
Project work or an interest in analytical assignments and a good working knowledge of typical computer hardware and/or software applications.

Education
Student enrolled in a Bachelor degree program in Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace, Computer or Software Engineering with class work in control systems, embedded systems & software or gas turbines.

10%

Yes

EEO/AAP Statement
United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

The Role
Upstatement is seeking interested applicants for our Engineering Apprenticeship program! Being an apprentice at Upstatement means there's less coffee-fetching and more git fetching. This is a paid position where you will gain valuable experience in the fast-paced world of digital consulting, paired with a mastery of team communication and charged-up engineering skills.

We're committed to writing modern, performant, maintainable code. This means staying abreast of best practices and reviewing each other's PR's. The bulk of our code tends to be PHP and JavaScript, but we're not married to those languages or any associated tooling. Technologies we've deployed into production in the past year include WordPress, Craft CMS, Contentful, Prismic, Magento, React, Vue, Gatsby, and Elasticsearch.

Now for some bullets:
- We work with high-profile clients, tech startups and experimental projects
- We play at least as hard as we work
- We are excited about new ideas and love to share

Do I qualify?
As a true member of the Upstatement team during your Apprenticeship tenure, some experience in what we do (and how we do it) is necessary. If you are a student in a multi-year CS or digital media program, or if you have similar apprenticeships under your belt already, we'd love to chat.

This is about more than code. Join us to see what kinds of opportunities await you.
