Job Description 
Seeking an individual who is self-motivated and can work individually or as part of a
small team to assist in the development of new and existing software, as well as maintaining existing IT infrastructure.  A candidate must be comfortable in a fluid environment with constantly changing requirements. Have a passion for technology and an interest in working with the latest technologies.  
If you are looking towards fulltime employment upon graduation we encourage you to apply.  SourceOne is looking for talented, ambitious, intelligent computer science majors to work with us as we develop and expand our energy web portal (EMSYS).  We have listed the skills that we would like to see a candidate have but if you are willing to learn and work hard, we are willing to teach and mentor you to expand your skill set.  If you want to work with a great team and learn about the energy business we are the company for you. 
 
Company Information
SourceOne is a national energy consulting firm focusing on Energy, Carbon Management, Energy Efficiency, and Engineering. As a division of Veolia Energy North America, SourceOne has 60 highly qualified engineers based in NY and Boston in order to provide energy solutions customized for each client to make their energy more sustainable, more cost effective, or more reliable. SourceOne Manages 900 MW of electricity and 3 Bcf of natural gas for leading national industrial and commercial customers in addition to managing Energy Efficiency programs for hundreds of buildings representing millions of square feet.
 
SourceOne is a wholly owned and independent consulting firm of Veolia Energy. Founded in 1997 and purchased by Veolia Energy in 2007, SourceOne currently provides premier service offerings for energy planning, procurement, monitoring, and management.
Specific utility related service lines provided by SourceOne are:
Energy Management and Monitoring
Energy Efficiency and Carbon Management
Site commissioning & Testing
Infrastructure Development and Engineering
SourceOne and Veolia Energy are subsidiaries of Veolia Environment, the world's leading environmental services company. Veolia Energy's core business focuses on controlling energy costs and reducing carbon footprints through energy-efficient, custom solutions.
Veolia Energy serves customers throughout the Continental USA, with a national reach and capability, and owns and operates the largest portfolio of district energy (heating and cooling) networks in the United States.

SourceOne, Inc. is a national energy management company providing services and support to commercial, industrial and public sector organizations. SourceOne serves all vertical markets including commercial real estate, healthcare, higher education, government, data centers, biotech, financial institutions, industrial/manufacturing and power generation companies. For these entities SourceOne provides energy related due diligence, power master planning, and infrastructure development services including energy project evaluation, planning and project management. Working with industry leading clients, SourceOne, Inc. has completed many successful co-generation, central plant and renewable energy projects.
 
Veolia's Hubgrade provides energy data analytics to various commercial and industrial clients. SourceOne's team of analysts and engineers develop applications and dashboards to analyze customer's energy data performance.
 
SourceOne, Inc.is actively seeking an energetic and self-motivated professional to join our Hubgrade team in the Boston office. This position is located at 53 State Street, Boston, MA.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze building performance data
Develop predictive analytics models relating to energy performance
Build and be responsible for applications related to engineering calculations
Automate manual functions
Coordinate with Business Solutions team developers on  best practices
Observe and analyze building energy trends
Assist in streamlining existing processes
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS
Currently studying for a BS or a MS in Data Analytics, Engineering or Computer Science.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong oral and written communication skills
Self-motivated and ability to drive projects
Knowledge of Python, R, KNIME or Tableau a plus
Strong interest in data science, energy and buildings

Co-op Job Title: Innovation Center Marketing and Community Outreach - District Hall + Roxbury Innovation Center
Job Description:
Innovation Center Marketing and Community Outreach Co-op for Venture Café New England located at District Hall and Roxbury Innovation Center

District Hall + Roxbury Innovation Center, programs of Venture Café New England, are Boston's home for innovation. We operate a public workspace, rentable event space, and provide accessible public programming designed to support Boston's innovation community. 

We're excited to be adding an Innovation Center Marketing and Community Outreach Co-op our team! This is a fast-paced and integral role in our growing not-for-profit organization. The Marketing and Community Outreach co-op will support two very unique spaces: highly visible and active gathering places specifically designed for the innovation community to meet and connect. This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity to learn the ins and outs of running both an event and programming space and also a mission-driven not-for-profit as part of a small, effective team.
The Innovation Center Marketing and Community Outreach Co-op will have the following responsibilities:

Marketing:

Support marketing-related responsibilities including drafting and posting regular content for social media (Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram), weekly newsletter creation, website updates (Word-Press), and other marketing communications as needed
Content creation: Maintain and update District Hall's digital assets (photographs and b-roll) create basic digital and print design collateral


Community Outreach:

Assist in running District Hall's + Roxbury Innovation Center's internal programming and resources including Café Nights, Pitch Nights, Entrepreneur One on Ones, Office Hours, Community Coffees, Innovation Mixers, Workshops, and other programs as needed
Capture stories and data about the impact of our spaces  through qualitative interviews, quantitative surveys, and other creative methods of impact measurement and evaluation
Represent District Hall + Roxbury Innovation Center at events throughout Boston's innovation community (occasional night time and weekends required)
Conduct market research and outreach to explore local partnership and collaboration opportunities
Coordinate District Hall's weekly tour program, including corresponding with attendees, leading weekly community tours of District Hall, and collecting and organizing tour data
Staff information table in District Hall's public lounge to engage visitors, share information about the space and promote District Hall's programming and resources

Operations:

Assist with daily building and program operations, including managing incoming phone calls and general inquiries, website maintenance, assisting with event client's A/V needs, and other tasks as needed


The best candidates will have the following skills:  

People person - excitement about connecting with individuals one on one and with interacting with large groups 
Outstanding written and oral communication skills. 
Excellent organizational, project, and task management skills. Attention to detail is a must.
Familiarity with managing multiple social media channels (Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram) and the ability to leverage them 
Graphic design skills, familiarity with Wordpress, and comfort with Google products a plus


Most importantly, we're looking for the following traits:

Flexibility ? this is a fast-paced, constantly changing workplace, and you won't be at a desk all day, every day. We are a small, high-functioning team, and rely heavily on each other. A willingness and positive attitude about jumping in and helping out with a variety of tasks is key. 
Genuine excitement about being a critical part of the success of a unique, fast-paced, and impactful space 

 
District Hall + Roxbury Innovation Center is run by Venture Café New Englans, a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization focused on entrepreneurship and innovation-based economic development, with a mission to educate and connect anyone with an idea to the resources and relationships they need in order to successfully launch and grow businesses. In addition to District Hall + Roxbury Innovation Center, Venture Café Foundation runs a number of other innovation and startup-focused programs and spaces in the Boston area and around the world: Venture Café Thursdays in Cambridge our digital presence in Starthub, as well as new programs in St. Louis, Rotterdam, Winston-Salem, Miami, Philadelphia, Tokyo, and Sydney. 

Find out more information at venturecafefoundation.org

Location: Costa Rica

Students interested in applying to COE global positions, please set up an online appointment through myNEU with Sally Conant (s.conant@northeastern.edu). Students attend this informational meeting to learn more about COE global co-op, and following your resume can be forwarded to COE global employers.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

Are you interested in real-world solutions to pressing global issues such as climate change, food security, and environmental justice? Do you crave experiences outside the norm that push you to think differently? Are you ready to become a part of something bigger? If so, join us at VerdEnergia Pacifica, a multicultural permaculture community and agroforestry project in the heart of the Costa Rican rainforest, on your next co-op! This co-op position takes students out of the theoretics of the classroom and puts them into hands-on learning scenarios that incorporate principles of permaculture, agroforestry, and regenerative economics. Together, we are envisioning a brighter, greener future, and we invite you to be a part of it.

VerdEnergia was founded in 2006 by a small group of initial investors with the intention of building a cooperative farm in order to secure a healthy future for ourselves and our families.  A green oasis situated in one of the most heavily deforested parts of Costa Rica, the Verde team has worked hard over the years to reforest while simultaneously developing the land into a food forest that could sustain our community. Since then, we have transformed into an education center where people from all over the globe can come to exchange ideas, experience living in an intentional community, and learn about agroforestry and permaculture in a place that is creating a community-based, regenerative economic model with permaculture principles acting as our guide and unifying tool. We combine theory with applied practice, enabling ourselves and others to find right livelihood through practicing permaculture. Our humble project has since expanded into the founding of another business focused on reforesting our watershed, Blacksheep Regenerative Resource Management (https://www.weareblacksheep.org/). Our co-op offers the opportunity for students to work with this budding international business, with the potential for further education, internships, and even employment opportunities. 

This co-op is for those interested in experiencing theory in action, living in a community, and engaging with sustainability projects in a hands-on and dynamic environment. Students will work closely throughout the program with our on-site permaculture experts and support staff on projects ranging from natural building and construction to planting, harvesting, reforestation, hospitality and more. In addition to daily chores expected of every intern, co-op students in the Content Journalism Program have a concentration on documenting daily life of farm staff and interns, the surrounding jungle and its wildlife, agroforestry initiatives, and more through their writing and other modes of creation. These students will be expected to create written content for the VerdEnergia blog, with the potential to work on other projects that require writing and editing expertise. These students will have the opportunity to work with a professional writing staff. Other opportunities may include social media marketing, content editing, or business and legal writing. This experience can be shaped by the interests of the student, but with prompts, guidance, feedback and quotas given by farm marketing staff. Journalism, Marketing, or Writing students can learn about content creation and apply it to an active business model, gain professional writing experience, and are expected to put together a portfolio of their work at the end of their stay. This is a unique position that is truly crafted and flavored by each individual student. Because of this, the ideal candidate for this opportunity is self-motivated, interested, open-minded, creative and responsible.

Not only do students participate in experiential learning opportunities throughout the course of their co-op by working with Steve, they will also be formally trained in permaculture design while studying under other permaculture and agroforestry experts through the permaculture design course. The permaculture design course, or PDC, is a 21-day intensive immersion course exploring the theories outlined in Bill Mollison's Permaculture: A Designer's Manual in both hands-on and classroom settings. The curriculum covers regenerative practices as well as design theory and the basics of design consultation on a professional level. Our well-rounded permaculture courses cover the many facets of permaculture and focus on practical solutions in agriculture, building and design, economics, social sciences and politics. Additionally, students will engage with other participants and community members from all over the globe, and will have the opportunity to learn about other projects going on both in Costa Rica, the United States, and beyond.

For a co-op intern, daily life at VerdEnergia is dynamic and dependent on the season. Please keep in mind that experiences vary due to season and length of stay.

Our co-op program is 6 months long total, with 5 months onsite and 1 month of remote work you can do anywhere with an internet connection.

SPRING SEMESTER
Jan 6 - June 25th, 2020 (total program - remote and onsite)
Jan 14 - June 2, 2020 (onsite portion of program)
During the Spring semester, seasons shift from dry season to growing season. Students will get to participate in VerdEnergia's shift of focus from hospitality, harvesting and construction to planting, pruning and field maintenance.

SUMMER/FALL SEMESTER
July 1 - December 23, 2020 (total program - remote and onsite)
July 14 - December 1, 2020 (onsite portion of program)
The Summer/Fall semester is a time of quiet abundance. Seasons shift from veranito ("Little summer") to full-on rainy season in September and October. Expect peaceful rain, tree planting, garden nurturing, field maintenance and pruning, construction, and harvesting our year's work.

Of course, there is some crossover of work between the seasons; these descriptions give a general idea to help you plan your visit. Food processing, hospitality, and maintenance are a part of community living at VerdEnergia.  Please be prepared to engage in wherever the community needs help.

During time off you can go for a swim in our river, pool, or waterfall, walk jungle trails, enjoy the views from one of our beautiful vistas, do yoga or dance in our studio, make art, play music, check out a local soccer game, or simply relax in a hammock with a good book from our community library.

Communal living is integral to our daily operations. Participants should be comfortable living and working together as well as contributing to farm upkeep. As a community, we wake up together, eat meals together, take turns cooking and cleaning up, and share in the responsibilities of keeping daily operations running smoothly. Each member of farm staff has a different job and responsibilities, but we all do our best to work together as a cohesive group.

While on co-op at VerdEnergia, students will be living on the farm full-time and thus do not need to search for housing or transportation for the duration of the program. As students live, eat, and work on the farm, we ask them to pay for their cost of living.The price is $5600 per semester. This money goes towards the students' certification in permaculture course, food, housing, water and electricity bills, facilities maintenance, and to pay our staff that help make this opportunity possible. We are happy to discuss any questions regarding our pricing model.

If interested in this opportunity, please read more about our project on our website, https://www.verdenergia.org/. Apply to this position by uploading your resume on NUcareers and we will reach out to you for an interview. We hope to see you soon! Pura vida!
Job Function: Experiential Education - Shaped by individual student needs

Job Description:
Co-Op, Disaster Recovery
 
The Vertex Summer Internship Program offers students the opportunity to learn about the pharmaceutical industry from a hands-on perspective. You will be working closely with and learning from some of the brightest people in the industry. When you join our internship program you should not be surprised to see that our environment is one that is innovative and team oriented, where collaboration is not just a word, and "we are fearless" is in everything we do. Students can expect to be challenged by their summer project plan, connect with other interns, and feel valued by the Vertex community. Not only will interns learn about their day-to-day tasks through their specific work assignments, but they will interact and have exposure to our organizational leaders and their teams through a series of Professional Development Workshops.
 
Be FEARLESS... Join us and help kick start the path to your career!
 
Co-op Program: 6 Month Commitment (January - June 2020), Full Time, 40 Hours/Week
 
Job Description:
The GIS Disaster Recovery Coop will be part of the GIS Information Security team at Vertex Pharmaceuticals, primarily engaged in disaster recovery planning activities. As an individual contributor, the coop will work closely with the GIS Disaster Recovery Manager, GIS application support teams, and other teams involved in disaster recovery planning.   

Note:  This is not an Information Security Engineer position
 
Key Responsibilities:
Support the GIS Disaster Recovery Manager to configure and implement disaster recovery management function using the Fusion Risk Management Disaster Recovery Tool
Work with GIS application teams to create and maintain their system disaster recovery plans
Plan and execute Disaster Recovery tabletop exercises
Support Fusion 3rd Party Management Assessment functionality
Convert current GIS Vendor Assessment questionnaire to Fusion Questionnaire
Migrate current GIS Vendor Assessments to Fusion
Train Vertex staff to use automated system to request and manage vendor assessments
Create/maintain reports and dashboards to monitor GIS Vendor Assessment program
Create reports and dashboards to support the oversight of the Vertex DR program
Performs other duties as assigned
 
Minimum Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in an MBA or a Computer Science related Graduate Degree Program with a strong academic track record
Prior internship or Co-op experience in Information Technology
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong interest in information technology
Interest in Business Continuity Management
Outstanding analytical capabilities and problem solving skills
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Can simultaneously manage multiple competing priorities and meet expected deadlines
Excellent MS Office skills including Excel and PowerPoint expertise

NOTE: Students accepted for an interview will have an on-site test.

Company Overview
 
At Vicarious Surgical, we are building the next-generation surgical robot. We combine Virtual Reality and human-like robotics to enhance the abilities of surgeons. Through our innovative technology, we have achieved what has been the goal of surgical robotics since the field's inception; to shrink the surgeon and put them inside the patient.
 
Team Focus
 
The Software team handles everything between our custom circuit boards and the user. We develop the backend software that is responsible for converting human motion to robot motion, as well as the VR user interface that surgeons use to drive our robot. We also cover ancillary needs of the company as a whole, such as data logging and test / calibration tools.
 
Project Work
 
We are looking to hire talented software developers to work on our small engineering team to build the software that runs our robot. You will work closely with the embedded team to interface cleanly with our custom hardware, as well as the integration team to get your code running smoothly on our system. There are many options available, depending on your interest and skill set:
Developing robotics algorithms in C
Tackling our vision system and data pipeline end-to-end
Writing our factory calibration and test suite in Python and JS
Implementing low-level real time code on embedded systems
Improving our infrastructure, including build & release, deployment, and overall development workflow
 
What you'll get from us
 
You'll be a contributing member of our team working on the core code base, not an isolated project. You'll learn how to build software collaboratively on a team. Sometimes you'll have to dive in to electrical or mechanical problems, ultimately, you'll get to see your software controlling real hardware.

Location: Costa Rica

Students interested in applying to COE global positions must contact Sally Conant (s.conant@northeastern.edu). Once you have spoken with her about the position, your resume will be sent to global employers.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: 

Are you interested in real-world solutions to pressing global issues such as climate change, food security, and environmental justice? Do you crave experiences outside the norm that push you to think differently? Are you ready to become a part of something bigger? If so, join us at VerdEnergia Pacifica, a multicultural permaculture community and agroforestry project in the Costa Rican rainforest, on your next co-op! This co-op position takes students out of the theoretics of the classroom and puts them into hands-on learning scenarios that incorporate principles of permaculture, agroforestry, and regenerative economics. Together, we are envisioning a brighter, greener future, and we invite you to be a part of it. 

VerdEnergia was founded in 2006 by a small group of initial investors with the intention of building a cooperative farm in order to secure a healthy future for ourselves and our families.

A green oasis situated in one of the most heavily deforested parts of Costa Rica, the Verde team has worked hard over the years to reforest while simultaneously developing the land into a food forest that could sustain our community. Since then, we have transformed into an education center where people from all over the globe can come to exchange ideas, experience living in an intentional community, and learn about agroforestry and permaculture in a place that is creating a community-based, regenerative economic model with permaculture principles acting as our guide and unifying tool. We combine theory with applied practice, enabling ourselves and others to find right livelihood through practicing permaculture. Verde now acts as the community hub and living quarters for several agroforestry projects nearby, and we are excited to share the experiential benefit of working for a regenerative agroforestry business with Northeastern students and others worldwide. 

This co-op is for those interested in experiencing theory in action, living in a community, and engaging with sustainability projects in a hands-on and dynamic environment. Students will work closely throughout the program with our on-site permaculture experts and support staff on projects ranging from natural building and construction to planting, harvesting, reforestation, hospitality and more. In addition to general co-op activities, students of a range of majors and focuses can bring their talents and passions to this position. In the past, engineering students have collected data for our future micro-hydro project; Biology and Environmental Studies students have assisted in long-term soil studies; Policy and law students gain insight into alternative ways of tackling contemporary issues; Students with marketing skills have helped build our social media presence; Students of a business background will receive insight into the back-of-house inner workings of a developing international business. This is a unique position that is truly crafted and flavored by each individual student. Because of this, the ideal candidate for this opportunity is self-motivated, interested, open-minded, and responsible.

Not only do students participate in experiential learning opportunities throughout the course of their co-op, they will also be formally trained and certified in permaculture design while studying under other permaculture and agroforestry experts through the permaculture design course. Scheduled at the beginning of the internship semester, the permaculture design course, or PDC, is a 21-day intensive immersion course exploring the theories outlined in Bill Mollison's Permaculture: A Designer's Manual in both hands-on and classroom settings. The curriculum covers regenerative practices as well as design theory and the basics of design consultation on a professional level. Our well-rounded permaculture courses cover the many facets of permaculture and focus on scientific, practical solutions in agriculture, building and design, economics, social sciences, and politics. Additionally, students will engage with other participants and community members from all over the globe and will have the opportunity to learn about other projects going on both in Costa Rica, the United States, and beyond. 

Our co-op program is 6 months long total, with 5 months onsite and 1 month of remote work you can do anywhere with an internet connection.

For a co-op intern, daily life at VerdEnergia is dynamic and dependent on the season. Please keep in mind that experiences vary due to season and length of stay. 

SPRING SEMESTER
Jan 6 - June 25th, 2020 (total program - remote and onsite)
Jan 14 - June 2, 2020 (onsite portion of program)
During the Spring semester, seasons shift from dry season to growing season. Students will get to participate in VerdEnergia's shift of focus from hospitality, harvesting and construction to planting, pruning and field maintenance. 

SUMMER/FALL SEMESTER
July 1 - December 23, 2020 (total program - remote and onsite)
July 14 - December 1, 2020 (onsite portion of program)
The Summer/Fall semester is a time of quiet abundance. Seasons shift from veranito ("Little summer") to full-on rainy season in September and October. Expect peaceful rain, tree planting, garden nurturing, field maintenance and pruning, construction, and harvesting our year's work. 

Of course, there is some crossover of work between the seasons; these descriptions give a general idea to help you plan your visit. Both of our internship semesters begin with the Permaculture Design Course and then expand into a practical application period. Food processing, hospitality, and maintenance are a part of community living at VerdEnergia. Please be prepared to engage in wherever the community needs help. 

During time off you can go for a swim in our river, pool, or waterfall, walk jungle trails, enjoy the views from one of our beautiful vistas, do yoga or dance in our studio, make art, play music, check out a local soccer game, or simply relax in a hammock with a good book from our community library.
Communal living is integral to our daily operations. Therefore, personal accountability and good roommate skills are a must. Participants should be comfortable living and working together as well as contributing to farm upkeep. As a community, we wake up together, eat meals together, take turns cooking and cleaning up, and share in the responsibilities of keeping daily operations running smoothly. Each member of farm staff has a different job and responsibilities, but we all do our best to work together as a cohesive group. 
While on co-op at VerdEnergia, students will be living on the farm full-time and thus do not need to search for housing or transportation for the duration of the program. As students live, eat, and work on the farm, we ask them to pay for their cost of living. The price is $5600 per semester. This money goes towards the students' certification in permaculture, their food and housing, water and electricity bills, facilities maintenance, and to pay our staff that help make this opportunity possible. We are happy to discuss any questions regarding our pricing model. 

If interested in this opportunity, please read more about our project on our website, https://www.verdenergia.org/. Apply to this position through NUcareers and we schedule an interview. We hope to see you soon! Pura vida!
Job Function: Experiential Education - Shaped by individual student needs

Job Description:
NOTE: Students accepted for an interview will have an on-site test.

Company overview
 
At Vicarious Surgical, our mission is to give doctors the tools to provide the highest quality of care to patients around the globe.  Our technology combines immersive virtual reality and proprietary human-like robotics, exponentially improving a surgeons visibility and accuracy.  We are a passionate and innovative team looking for motivated self-starters who want to make an impact.
 
Team Focus
 
The Integration team sits in the middle of the action. As new subsystems are designed and built, it is their job to incorporate them into the system as a whole. Playing with, breaking, and debugging robots are a daily occurrence for this team, and they work closely with engineers from every part of the company to design solutions for short-term and long-term fixes.
 
Project Work
 
You will work with our Integration team to create a system for logging robot usage data. Both low-level and high-level robot data is valuable to debug current systems and inform future design choices. You will work to develop a system for collecting this data, storing it, and presenting it in a meaningful way. This will require considerable collaboration with the software team and a strong knowledge of C and Python.
Understand the robot system, usage, and data collection needs
Work within the software architecture constraints to collect relevant robot data
Create software tools for internal use to analyze this data
Link analysis to high-level metrics for evaluating and comparing robots
Develop system of reporting findings and usage for specific robots
Having taken CS4500 - Software Development is a plus
 
What you'll get from us
 
We're a dog friendly, ping-pong playing, ice cream eating office who enjoy working on innovative technology. You will work on the cutting edge of surgical robotics and inform design decisions that will shape the future of surgery. At the end of the term, you will have the opportunity to present your work to the Leadership Team and to members of the Board.

The Role
Voltus is hiring a whip-smart, entrepreneurial, proud energy nerd with an unparalleled desire to learn about energy markets and demand side management. The energy markets team is responsible for helping our customers profit from their involvement in energy markets. If you are bright, gritty, good, and intellectually curious, and if your brain marries creativity and engineering diligence, you're a great fit.
 
We will work with you to help grow your knowledge base of the energy industry, while improving on your process improvement, operational, and analytical skillset.

Key Responsibilities
Support optimization and automation of customer demand response performance calculations to deliver on the Voltus Value Proposition.
Support internal demand response market operations and activities, including customer registration, customer analysis, and data organization in our software systems.
Develop and follow processes for requesting data from our utility partners
Contribute to maintaining our sales collateral to reach our ambitious financial targets
Qualifications
Independent and willing to work remotely
Voltus does not have an office, though there is the possibility of working in a shared work space
You will have frequent communication with your supervisor and team, but you must be self-motivated and able to work on your own
Technically capable with knowledge of at least one coding language
We work in Python but are willing to teach you if you have experience with matlab or R (or another language)
Experience with SQL is a bonus
Knowledge of data model structures preferred
Energy industry experience not required but interest in the energy industry is strongly preferred

About Voltus, Inc.
We build virtual power plants that reduce carbon emissions and energy prices.
We chose the name Voltus because it represents the "potential of us" to better manage energy through simple, no-cost, no-risk energy management products that align collective interests. Our industrial and commercial customers generate cash by allowing us to be their energy expert, delivering innovative demand response, energy purchasing, and energy efficiency solutions to them. It's this simple: a customer signs up with Voltus and we deliver cash based on performance. Voltus makes money when our customer makes money by sharing the cash generated from working together. What's more, there are significant community benefits that accompany working with Voltus - a cleaner, more reliable energy future, and dollars invested back into your business instead of being wasted on a bigger energy bill. You could say that we're energy pragmatists in the sense that we believe that "simple, no-cost, no-risk" solves huge, global energy problems.

The typical responsibilities of this position will include performing network or application penetration testing alongside VSR security consultants, conducting security code reviews, and assisting in security tool development. Candidates should have a strong passion for conducting security research, and a working knowledge of how a variety of web, application, and Internet protocols function. Candidates should be able to enumerate and identify application threats, and devise working proofs of concept or exploits for identified vulnerabilities.

Requirements:

Currently pursuing Bachelor's or higher degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science or related field
Familiarity with the following programming languages: Java, C#, C, C++, SQL and at least one of the following scripting languages: Python, Perl, or Ruby
Strong understanding of application security concepts for Internet technology, architecture and protocols
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

"Nice to Have"s:

OWASP and CWE concepts
Experience with security tools, such as: Burp Suite (or equivilant attack proxy), Nessus (or equivalent vulnerability scanner), Metasploit Framework, Static Analysis tools
Extensive experience with Super Smash Bros. 
Public examples of security research (such as blog posts, bug bounty reports, or open-sourced security tools)

--
VSR (an NCC Group Company) background:

VSR, founded in 2004, acquired by NCC Group in 2016, is a boutique information security consulting firm focused on providing quality information, network and application security consulting services. We work with clients in nearly every industry vertical and at multiple stages of maturity, from start-ups to large multi-national enterprises. We understand that security is not a one size fits all and that security activities should be customized to fit our clients businesses, and not based solely on a compliance checklist or framework. As part of NCC Group, VSR benefits from being part of a globally recognized information security consulting firm with dedicated research capabilities and specialy practices including crypto, transport security, and hardware security.

Our current clients include: enterprise and consumer hardware and software products, financial services, insurance, communications service providers, retail, and the health care sector.

Our services include: web, application, mobile and product penetration testing, network penetration assessments, social engineering and incident response testing, and security advisory services.

Candidates may be placed in a role across three different teams depending on business needs, experience, and fit. These teams include:
 
Business Intelligence (BI)
Wayfair is an organization obsessed with data, and Business Intelligence (BI)  is the department responsible for making well-governed data accessible and actionable across the company. BI partners with departments throughout Wayfair to create data solutions and empower data-driven decision making. Every team across Wayfair utilizes data continuously in their work- each week, we observe over 1 million data queries across the company!
 
Competitive Intelligence (CI)
Competitive Intelligence focuses on optimizing Wayfair's strategic positioning within the rapidly evolving competitive e-commerce landscape. This cross-functional and entrepreneurial team uses Big Data and cutting edge advanced analytics capabilities to build analytical products and identify insights that impact every major business function at the company; the unique, external market perspective brought by this team complements our robust internal data asset to guide Wayfair in making more informed decisions.
 
Analytics Center for Enablement (ACE)
The ACE team is on a mission to develop a large, passionate, and enabled community that builds momentum and fosters engagement in Analytics. This team has a focus on professional development, hands-on training for both our technical analysts and our business stakeholders, as well as cross-functional communication, documentation, and alignment.

Priority Application Deadline, Oct 4

Our engineering team is building the future of home and looking for dynamic, hardworking and talented students to join us in January for a 6 month co-op.  As a Software Engineering co-op you will dive into a number of complex technical projects and gain a better understanding of our business. You will have the opportunity to work within one of the following groups:
Storefront Web Engineering: Develops the features, web services, and data architecture that provide a world-class shopping engine for our millions of unique daily customers. The group works in small, cross-functional teams to rapidly develop, release, and iterate on new experiences built on a foundation of highly-scalable technologies and supporting tens of millions of products.
Storefront Mobile App Engineering: Builds and maintains 7 different mobile applications, both iOS and Android, which are released to millions of customers every week. This team is responsible for all app related experiences including app-exclusive features such as 3D View In Room and push notifications.
Supply Chain Engineering: Develops the complex, ground-breaking logistics system to help move the products Wayfair sells from suppliers to warehouses to customers. Supply Chain is responsible for the transportation, warehouse management, Castlegate, and customer delivery network and making it all possible.
Ad Tech Systems and Customer Intelligence Engineering: Builds world class advertising & customer outreach technology to drive growth in a multi-billion dollar business using real-time tracking, personalization, and product recommendations to engage millions of new and returning customers.
Enterprise Engineering: Builds and improves the software that directly impacts customers, customer service, sales, finance, talent management and external vendors. This team is responsible for all the tools and processes to support business critical operations at Wayfair, along with supporting the continued enhancement and scaling capabilities of these systems. 
Infrastructure and Platform Engineering: Responsible for the entire Wayfair website and all backend components that fuels and powers production. You can be an embedded engineer or a platform engineer. Embedded engineers work directly with engineering verticals to build and consult in building new initiatives. Platform engineers are subject matter experts and drive several initiatives. 
Catalog Systems Engineering: Wayfair sells millions of products and this team owns all the data, tools, and systems that create and manage the content on the site related to each product. We build tools for our thousands of suppliers to send us content we need to be able to sell their products on site. This team makes sure the customer has the information she needs to be confident when purchasing for her home. Within Catalog, there are also teams such as pricing & competitive intelligence engineering, merchandising & media engineering, and virtual media.

At its core, the Pricing & Profitability team is focused on steering growth strategy and billion-dollar P&L management across Wayfair's product verticals, by leveraging highly quantitative business analytics and cutting-edge data science techniques. This team directly controls Wayfair's dynamic pricing and product sorting capabilities to manage the delicate tradeoff between short and long term profitability, while working cross-functionally to affect selection, merchandising, operations, and site traffic initiatives. Co-ops leverage unique, proprietary, and massive datasets coupled with a constant flow of experimentation on consumer response to answer thorny strategic questions that guide go-to-market strategy. Wayfair Analytics is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. We move fast, iterating quickly on big business problems. We work smart, applying technology to unlock insights and provide outsized value to our customers. We swing big, knowing our customers won't benefit from micro optimizations. Leveraging the largest data set for products sold in the Home space, this team treats data as an asset and determines how to maximize its business value and extend our competitive advantage.

At their core, Data Analytics Co-ops at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy coding but also want to balance that with their interest in business. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new team members to emerge as leaders, taking on additional projects and responsibilities with strong performance. 

Each Data Analytics Co-op is aligned with a line of business either focused on Marketing, Merchandising, Operations, Finance, Sales + Service or our core website. Whether you're analyzing customer behavior and trends, developing new recommendations, or constructing SQL queries, you will be working with cutting edge technology and multi-terabyte datasets. 

What You'll Do: 
Collaborate with leaders of functional areas (e.g., Marketing, Operations, Storefront web, Finance, Sales + Service) to identify the most impactful ways for data and analytics to drive decision making and accelerate profitable growth. 
Comprehend, extract, and massage information from multi-terabyte data sources including sales, clickstream, logistics, product, and customer databases to deliver business insights and recommendations. 
Design and build solutions to empower stakeholders across Wayfair to self-serve analytical needs. 
Become the subject matter expert for data, analytics, and testing within a business unit to ensure accurate and proper interpretation of core business metrics and consumer behavior. 
Perform deep-dive analysis, including the application of advanced analytical techniques, to solve some of the more critical and complex business problems including website funnel progression, customer segmentation and targeting, and supply chain optimization. 
Develop data visualizations, including reports, dashboards, and analyses in Tableau to distribute data insights in an easily digestible manner to over 7000 global employees. 
What You'll Need: 
Hands-on experience conducting quantitative analyses on large data sets. 
Coursework or experience with SQL or other structured programming language(s) (e.g. Python, Java, C); Experience with Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.) and Tableau a plus. 
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems. 
Strong written and verbal communication. 
Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, Management or other quantitative discipline field with strong academic record. 
Ideal Candidate: An aspiring Analytics Co-op with a quantitative background who has a strong desire to make an impact on business decisions with data. You appreciate the power of a data-driven environment and predictive analytics!

Wayfair's Data Science and Machine Learning teams build the algorithmic systems that drive our business. Specifically, the Computer Vision team aims to get the customer what they want without needing words. Take for example determining how to implement AR technology to improve the shopping experience. The projects that this team works on are driven from the ground up, so we look for entrepreneurial individuals that want to take ownership over their own agenda and thrive in a collaborative team environment. In addition, they work closely with stakeholders across the business to ensure that our data driven insights do not collect dust. Computer Vision (Non-distributed Computing) - Machine Learning Enginee

Develop a robust, sustainable plan for future iterations of models, including projecting data collection requirements and partnering with engineering on improvements to the data collection, transcription, and annotation process.
Effectively collaborate with colleagues from design, science, engineering and business backgrounds.
Empathetically brainstorm with engineers to support models and explain results in production.

Deep appreciation of pragmatic application and distillation of cutting-edge techniques in Computer Vision, Deep Learning & Computer Graphics literature.

Machine Learning experience (such supervised/semi-supervised & unsupervised learning, deep learning, recommendations systems) and proven track record of application of these algorithms that drives measurable value.

Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast paced environment with a high degree of ambiguity and cross-functional project teams.
Experience with Python and Tensorflow is a must
Experience with OpenCV, Keras, 3Ds Max, Blender, Unity/Unreal, C++ is a plus

Ensure high quality data through collection and processing.

Experience with various machine learning techniques
Experience in building speech recognition and natural language processing systems (e.g. commercial speech products or government speech projects)
Solid Machine Learning background and familiar with standard speech and machine learning techniques.

Great written and spoken communication skills

Co-op Job Title: Data Science - Generalist & Machine Learning Engineer
Job Description:
Data Science - Generalist & Machine Learning Engineer - Co-op Opportunities
Final Deadline: The final application deadline is November 1 for consideration during the Fall 2019 recruiting season.
 
Wayfair's Data Science team builds the algorithmic systems that drive our business.
With 8 expansive workstreams (Pricing, Personalization & Recommendations, Merchandising, Marketing, Measurement, B2B, Computer Vision, and Operations), and more than 20 specialized subteams, our projects span from enormously broad to minutely specific. The projects that our teams work on are driven from the ground up ? we look for entrepreneurial individuals that want to take ownership over their own agenda and thrive in a collaborative team environment. Take for example (1) determining how to implement AR technology to improve the shopping experience 
versus (2) optimizing diversity in the sales we highlight in a customer's email. There is very little at Wayfair that our Data Science team does not touch. They work closely with stakeholders across the business to ensure that our data driven insights do not collect dust. With an in-house A/B testing platform and rolling code deployments, our team can quickly and clearly see the impact that its work has on the company at large.
 
Data Science Generalist
What You'll Do
Own the full Data Science life-cycle from conception to prototyping, testing, deploying, and measuring its overall business value
Develop quantitative models, leveraging machine learning and advanced data analysis techniques to create novel solutions to complex business problems
Integrate your algorithmic solutions into our technical platforms to run at scale and directly change the experiences of customers on our site
Drive measurable business value collaborating with business teams to change the course of Wayfair
Uncover deep insights hidden in our vast repository of raw data, and provide tactical guidance on how to act on findings
Use data to improve the decision-making of our employees, and ultimately, to enhance the experience of our customers and our suppliers
Work with a team of friendly and motivated scientists working together to build novel solutions to business problems
 
What You'll Need
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate, Master's, or PhD degree program at a top-tier institution with a strong academic track record.
Currently obtaining a Degree focused within either Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other major with a heavy quantitative concentration. Please include related coursework on your resume.
An affinity for data along with experience leveraging statistics and regression analysis is a plus.
Experience with or an interest and ability to quickly learn SQL and Hadoop.
Experience with or interest and ability to quickly pick-up programming skills relevant to data science such as Python and R.
Quick learner with an analytical approach to solving problems as part of a team who has good communication skills.
Must be a hard worker who enjoys solving challenging problems in a fast-paced environment.
 
Machine Learning Engineer
The projects that our teams work on directly impact our customers on a massive scale.  We look for driven experts who are passionate about machine learning and applying it to solve real business problems at scale as part of a collaborative team environment.  Working on projects such as:
 
Developing novel machine learning models to identify latent customer tastes so that the best products can be highlighted in real-time to our customers.
Build a pipeline to scale algorithms to determine the causal impact of different steps in a customer's journey across our millions of customers so we can determine what drives incremental value and iterate across the business
Create machine learning solutions to detect product duplicates across the millions of products in our catalog and scaling the solution to handle real-time uploading of new products by partners.
 
There is very little at Wayfair that our machine learning engineers do not touch. They work closely with data science teams across the business to build and scale novel solutions to business problems via machine learning. With an in-house A/B testing platform and rolling code deployments, our team can quickly and clearly see the impact that its work has on the company at large and the algorithms you create will directly impact the customer's experience.
 
What You'll Do
Develop and scale state-of-the-art machine learning methods to address core business problems
Architect and support technical platforms for our algorithmic engines to run at scale
Build end-to-end ML solutions and pipelines to run in real-time, scaling algorithmic insights to impact millions of Wayfair customers
Own the full machine learning life-cycle from conception to prototyping, testing, deploying, and measuring overall business value driven by your work as part of a dynamic team
Leverage your expertise in scalable system design, working with the devops team,  as part of a culture of engineering practices
Pilot projects using new open source tools and packages to enable novel machine learning techniques across the company
Collaborate with data scientists to create maintainable, scalable and debuggable code by bringing strong software development practices
Work with a team of friendly and motivated scientists and engineers to build and scale novel solutions to business problems
 
What You'll Need
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate, Master's, or PhD degree program at a top-tier institution with a strong academic track record.
Currently obtaining a Degree focused within either Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other major with a heavy quantitative concentration (e.g. mathematics, economics, computer science, engineering, physics, neuroscience, operations research, etc.). Please include related coursework on your resume.
Intuitive sense of how quantitative and technical work aligns closely with business priorities and business value
Ability to effectively work with technical leads: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize conclusions for non-experts and desire to influence technical decisions
Comfortable with data structures, algorithms, and programming in a team environment, e.g. languages such as Python, C++, perl, C, Scala, Java, bash, etc. and a tools such as Docker, kafka, Jenkins, github, Kubernetes, MSSQL, AWS / GCP, etc.
High level understanding of machine learning (such as supervised/unsupervised learning, recommendation systems, reinforcement learning, deep learning, etc.)
Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment where there can be degrees of ambiguity
Bonus points for being hands on, while providing technical leadership and driving strategic initiatives for your team
 
No matter the position that you choose, you will have the opportunity to play a critical role in a growing company while also operating with a high level of executive visibility. The team is focused on creating strategic solutions that steer customer behavior, influence key decision making and quantify our impact within the e-commerce space. Our diverse and fun employees enjoy an environment of strong ownership and quick feedback from building, experimenting and iterating on high-impact work.

This is a unique role for a highly motivated individual that is interested in joining a high growth company and making an immediate impact.

Build key supplier relationships to enable successful negotiations and drive towards best-in-class customer experiences
Create cross-functional partnerships to advance your category through merchandising, promotions, marketing, on-trend product selection, effective pricing and profitability strategy, and operational excellence
Leverage big data to analyze the competitive environment and develop business cases for strategic initiatives

LOCATION: San Francisco
NOTE: Yon need to apply with your resume and a response to the writing prompt noted in the description below.

Wefunder is like "Kickstarter for investing". We've helped fund over 160 startups and small businesses, including flying cars, space rockets, breweries, hollywood studios, and potential Ebola cures. Every company we've funded is full of amazing stories.

We're larger than all of our competitors, are growing like crazy, and need to add reinforcements to our team! It's not all rainbows and bunnies, but hard work and fast paced. However, we'll keep it fun, creative and engaging to keep you on your toes.

Some things you could be doing:
Scouting out cool businesses we can help fund
Planning events where investors fund companies
Inviting cool founders and investors to our weekly dinners
Helping our customers (investors and founders) through email support
Telling the story of business owners
Communicate user feedback on our product and ways it can be improved
Handling our Twitter account
Creating Facebook ads
Testing the web site for bugs
Helping prepare government filings
Booking a kick-ass mansion for our weekend retreats
Understanding the ins-and-outs of security sales and explaining them to others
Or if you have a better idea of what you could be doing, let us know!

Skills & Experience
We're more concerned with your drive and hunger than your experience. We invest in potential. If you are a quick learner and super-motivated, we'll help teach you.

Here are some skills we think are important:
Organization and attention to detail. It's important that no balls get dropped when dealing with multiple projects and stakeholders

Strong people skills. You should have a talent for making people feel instantly comfortable, heard, and understood.
Independent problem solver. We want someone who's able to tackle difficult problems on their own and proactively looks for new ways to improve Wefunder. In other words, you can just figure it out.

Prioritize efficiently. You'll be juggling a thousand things at once. Be able to recognize which tasks are most important and get those done.

Learn quickly. There are tons of details to learn; securities regulations are quite complex and things change fast around here. You must be able to absorb and retain a lot of facts quickly; we don't like answering the same question three times and it's up to you to seek out information if you need it.

Responsible & accountable. If you say you will do it, you do it.

Bonus points if you have design and/ or writing chops.

Compensation
We'll start out at $20/hr. We're also happy to teach and mentor. Give us your best, and we'll give you our best.

To Apply
Please send your resume and instead of uploading a cover letter, send us a few sentences with why you'd like to work for us. Brownie points: include a survival skill you'd offer the team in a post-apocalyptic world.

About Wefunder
On May 16, 2016, it became legal for regular people to invest as little as $100 in startups and small businesses. Since then, we have become the largest equity crowdfunding platform. We've helped 190+ startups and small businesses ? including flying cars, space rockets, breweries, Hollywood studios, and potential Ebola cures ? raise $70 million.

We're a Public Benefit Corporation and a B Corp with a mission to revitalize capitalism and keep the American dream alive. GDP growth is slowing. Wealth inequality is increasing. Entrepreneurship is dying across America; falling from 10.6% to 3.6% among those under 30 since 1989. We're reversing these trends by funding more deserving businesses across all of America, not solely tech startups in Silicon Valley.

Want to help? Join us! We're a team of founder types: enjoy autonomy, responsibility, the opportunity to learn, and no red tape. Just make it happen.

Co-op Job Title: Investment Science: Global Risk & Analytics Co-op
Job Description:
On-Campus Presentation: Monday, September 16, 2019 in 458 Richards at 6 pm
 
Open House Networking Event:  September 26, 2019 6-8 pm
Wellington is hosting an Open House Networking Event at their downtown offices and network with over 40 hiring managers and current co-ops. This is an invitation only event.  To apply to attend, click the link HERE: https://forms.gle/VKoCwW1CqLbhuEYw6
Deadline to request an invitation to the Open House: September 24, 2019
Job Application Deadline:  October 1
Office Interviews:  Week of October 7th
Students must apply NUCareers AND complete the application link HERE: https://forms.gle/6GQ6xjF1TMCsYF2s9  
Students may apply for up to (but no more) than 4 positions.

 
The Company
Tracing our roots to 1928, Wellington Management Company, LLP is one of the world's largest independent investment management firms. With US$1 trillion in assets under management as of 30 June 2018, we serve as a trusted adviser to institutional clients and mutual fund sponsors in over 60 countries. Our innovative investment solutions are built on the strength of proprietary, independent research and span nearly all segments of the global capital markets, including equity, fixed income, multi-asset, and alternative strategies. As a private partnership whose sole business is investment management, our long-term views and interests are aligned with those of our clients. We are committed to attracting a talented and diverse workforce, and to fostering an open, collaborative culture of inclusivity because we believe multiple perspectives lead to more informed investment and business decisions. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we welcome people with diverse life experiences, fresh ideas, and specialized subject-matter expertise.
 
The Position
The Co-op will support the Global Risk & Analytics (GR&A) team within Investment Science, providing much-needed assistance with running analyses and interpreting data. In addition, The Co-op will handle many of the daily tasks of the GR&A team.
 
The position will provide the Co-op with an opportunity to develop/expand their knowledge of portfolio risk management, develop relationships within Wellington's Investment Science department, and strengthen technical skills.
 
Responsibilities
The Co-op will work closely with risk analysts and managers in producing packages of risk analytics for review. The individual will also work with Information Technology team to automate reports and analysis. The role of the Co-op will include, but is not limited to, the following:
 
Business Processes:
Work closely with GR&A team on specific projects
Build reports and analysis for internal clients (using Excel, Tableau, etc.)
Monitor data quality for risk platform
 
Product Integrity
Attend discussions with risk analysts and managers to learn about risk analytics
Identify risk measures that need to be flagged to risk analysts and managers
 
The role of an Undergraduate Co-op on the GR&A team requires demonstrated analytical skills, attention to detail and a strong interest in both investing and process expertise.
 
 
Qualifications
We seek individuals who possess the analytical skills and ability to organize and interpret data to reach conclusions, effective verbal and written communication skills, and an interest in business processes. A positive, collegial attitude and high level of professionalism are essential, as is initiative and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment with tight deadlines. Given the unique demands of risk analytics, we also seek an individual with a good sense of humor and willingness to assist in any way.
 
Further, the ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:
 
A successful candidate will be pursuing a degree in a relevant quantitative field, such as computer science, computational finance, statistics, operations research, engineering, mathematics, and/or econometrics.
Strong analytical mindset
Strong programming abilities and experience with any of common programming languages, e.g., R, MATLAB, C++, Java or Python, and/or familiarity with SQL or database programming
Strong organizational and communication skills, with an emphasis on accuracy, timeliness, and clarity

WTG enables our clients to innovate and transform their business by realizing the benefits of hyperconverged, software defined, and hybrid cloud infrastructure frameworks. WTG serves the IT needs of clients ranging from medium sized organizations to Fortune 100 companies that operate in a variety of industries including finance, healthcare, education, manufacturing, technology, legal, and more.
 
Job Description
The Business Development Representative (BDR) will work under the direction of the Manager of Inside Sales to create new prospects and customers for our growing sales team which includes the Director of Sales, Regional Sales Manager, Manager of Inside Sales, Account Executives and Inside Sales Representatives.
 
Responsibilities
Gain knowledge on the product offerings of WTG and our strategic vendor partners (Dell Technologies, Nutanix, VMware, Arctic Wolf Networks, Fortinet and Amazon Web Services)
Work with a local team that sells the most innovative and cutting-edge products in the Information Technology industry, like Dell Technologies Enterprise Solutions, Dell End Point Solutions, VMWare Server Virtualization Software, and Dell Technologies and Nutanix Hyper-Converged Infrastructure
Communicate with all different levels of the customer end user organization including CIO, Director of Information Technology, Storage Infrastructure Manager, and Network Administrator at some of the most sophisticated IT organizations in the Country
Report Sales Activities and outcomes and maintain and update key sales documents (i.e. reference lists and sales team account lists)
Work on leads provided by our strategic vendor partners to schedule initial meetings and onsite assessments for prospective customers with our sales and engineering teams
Help organize, communicate and fill attendance for upcoming customer education and sales generation events to our customers such as: Seminars, Webinars, Lunch-and-learn meetings and Technical User Groups.
Learn the use of our Customer Relationship Management system (Microsoft Dynamics) and Sales Demand Generation system (DiscoverOrg) to:
Research companies to determine if they are viable prospects for WTG products/solutions
Develop a prospecting plan for each prospect to determine if they are a "fit" for WTG
Conduct outgoing sales phone calls, emails, and direct mailing campaigns
Qualifications & Skills
Customer focused with an outgoing personality
Must be reliable and detail oriented with strong follow-up skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills (i.e. email and telephone communication abilities)
Coachable, team-player looking to learn and grow in a fast-paced, sales-oriented environment
Proficient in Microsoft Office, Excel and Outlook
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics CRM desired but not required

40 hour per week position. The hours are 8:00AM-5:00PM with a one-hour lunch break.

Location: 349 5th Ave, 5th Floor, New York CIty, NY 10016

Who We Are:
Wise Systems is transforming the way that companies deliver goods and services, empowering today's fleets to be more efficient and customer-driven. Our cloud-based autonomous dispatch and routing system dynamically manages all aspects of delivery operations with intuitive yet powerful user experiences for drivers, dispatchers and delivery recipients, and increasing levels of automation to support large fleets. At the core of our platform is a powerful optimization engine that uses machine learning to continuously improve operations and adapt to the realities delivery drivers face on the road each day.
 
Wise Systems came out of MIT inspired by the goal of using data to make cities smarter. We fell in love with the unique scale and complexity of the challenges faced by the logistics industry and the real-world impact smart technology could make. 

Based in Cambridge, MA, The Wise Systems team values initiative and expects everyone to take on responsibility and to grow in their roles. Our diverse team is made up of individuals with a wide range of backgrounds, experience, and skills. We share curiosity and a passion for producing quality technology.

Your Position
As an Engineering Co-op you will be responsible for implementing solutions to directly support our customers. 

We have one engineering team that works on customer-facing applications and another that works on the data underlying our platform. You will work with one of these teams to deploy new features that will be used directly by customers. 

You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of problems and interact with many different parts of our product. You will also get to work alongside many different members of the Wise Systems team, from our product and engineering teams to our sales and customer experience teams. You will get the opportunity to creatively solve problems, design features, and independently manage your projects. 
This position is for engineers that want to work either on full-stack, frontend, or backend and projects will be tailored to your skills and interests.

Your Day-to-Day  
?Designing and deploying new features
?Leading API integrations of our platform with other systems
?Assessing and solving bugs or functionality issues
?Implementing designs created by the team
?Collaborating with other engineers
?Contributing to documentation and engineering processes.
?Participating in code reviews

Wolters Kluwer Health's Clinical Effectiveness (CE) organization is a fast-growing and innovation-driven healthcare
information technology (HIT) provider working on the front lines of clinical care. Our talented team of physician
and pharmacist editors, technologists, and product visionaries collaborate to provide advanced clinical decision
support solutions that measurably improve clinical effectiveness by helping healthcare professionals provide
optimal care for their patients.

The Referential Product Engineering team is seeking a co-op to help implement a variety of functionality within the UpToDate core web application. The co-op will be fully integrated within the team attending all project related meetings including daily scrums, code reviews, retrospectives, and reviews. The co-op will first spend time learning the application environment and processes of the team. They will begin working on smaller items and then transition to helping the team complete major projects. Example work includes UI modifications, enhancing search in your own language, add 508 compliance, enhancing our continuing medical education functionality, and technology research and upgrades.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Understand existing application architecture and technologies.
Learn and improve the capabilities of the application through various work items.
Help the team complete major initiatives with high quality through code reviews and unit testing.
Collaborate with product management, QA, and development engineers to ensure requirements are properly implemented.
Plan and execute tasks within an agile environment.
Job Qualifications
Current matriculated student in Computer Science or relevant field of study.
Hands on experience with Java, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML
Experience with the Java programming language required.
Experience with a Java development environment such as Eclipse or IntelliJ a plus.
Experience with the Git version control system a plus.
Experience with SQL a plus.
Experience with AngularJS 1.X, or another modern web framework, a plus
Demonstrate problem analysis, resolution, decision making and judgment.
Demonstrate collaboration skills.
Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications
Understanding of object oriented programming concepts and general software engineering concepts.
Understanding of agile methodologies and the software development lifecycle.
Creative problem solver and pays careful attention to detail.
Honest, humble, friendly and collegial with a great sense of humor.

Wolters Kluwer N.V. (AEX: WKL) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.
Wolters Kluwer reported 2016 annual revenues of ?4.3 billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the
Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people
worldwide.

Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices. Wolters Kluwer has a sponsored Level 1 American Depositary Receipt program. The ADRs are traded on the over-the-counter market in the U.S. (WTKWY).

For more information about our solutions and organization, visit www.wolterskluwer.com, follow us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube.

The Development Operations Team is seeking a co-op to help implement an automation tool to aid the rapid release process and work with a team that is evolving our application platform. The co-op will first spend time learning the capabilities of our selected monitoring tool and our Next Generation Platform architecture. This project directly supports a Technology organization's goal to decouple critical components and fully automate the release process. It is also a necessary operational element of the Platform DevOps Transformation efforts on-going and the candidate will learn and practice critical skills for any evolving development group.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Understand existing software components that comprise our pre-production and production software architecture.
 Learn and improve the capabilities of our Continuous Integration tools including Jenkins, maven & groovy.
 Determine appropriate workflows and tools to accomplish our Continuous Delivery goals.
 Create dashboards which appropriately share status and documentation so the work can be carried on   following the co-op.
 Analyze approaches to a DevOps problem ? document and discuss your thinking with the team toward having  your analysis accepted.
Collaborate to incorporate automated unit, integration, functional, and performance testing into the continuous integration process across multiple projects.
Plan and execute tasks within an agile environment.

Current matriculated student in Computer Science or relevant field of study.
Hands on experience with Python, shell scripting, Groovy, etc
Experience with the Python programming language required.
Experience with a Java development environment such as Eclipse or IntelliJ helpful.
Experience with the Git version control system and Jenkins helpful.
Cloud hosting concepts understood at introductory level and some hands on experience.

Hi there. We're Zipcar, the world's leading car-sharing network, driven to make cities better places to live.

Since 2000, we've worked hard to turn a brilliant and disruptive idea into a movement that serves more than a million members worldwide. We're keeping the pedal to the metal and growing every day. That's why we need talented, passionate people with great ideas to join the Zipcar family.

Want to work for a company that is shaping the future of urban mobility? Ready to join a dynamic, playful, diverse, and respectful company that's seriously changing the world? Then apply!

Summary:

We are looking for a highly analytical Marketing Analytics Co-op to join our Marketing Analytics team. This team member will play a key role in enabling Zipcar's Marketing and Sales organization to make better strategic decisions and help drive the transformation of Sales and Marketing to a fully data-driven organization.

In this role, you will work closely with all Sales and Marketing functions and will serve as a central resource that will assist in a wide variety of data-centric needs - from designing and delivering reporting to campaign analytics to advanced analytics ? all driving the marketing and sales businesses forward. In this role you will also work closely with our internal data science, data engineering, and finance team, providing your counterparts with advanced analytics requirements for technical analytical projects.

Responsibilities:
Proactively identify how analysis could inform business decisions. Translate business questions into a well-structured analysis
Understand the financials of the business and apply this lens to the evaluation of strategic marketing decisions
Consistently guide and deliver structured, analytical and actionable problem-solving: setting the measurement and data collection plans upfront, structuring the analysis with the output and decisions that need to be made in mind, executing the analysis with high level of accuracy, surfacing the insight, visualizing the data and telling the story
Delivering a broad range of analytical output ? dashboards and reporting, forecasting, campaign measurement strategy and analysis, NPS reporting, survey analysis, segmentation, digital media attribution, and many ad-hoc analyses exploring and informing important business decisions
Apply Data Science products (e.g. LTV, churn, member segmentation) to sales and marketing workflows
Partnering with product engineering on best practices for data capture to support meaningful analytics downstream
Qualifications:
Candidate for a Bachelor or Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Industrial Engineering, Data Science, Data Analytics, Operations Research)
Basic SQL and Excel skills; Knowledge/experience in R and/or Python preferred
Experience with a data visualization / BI tool (i.e. Looker, Tableau)
Basic knowledge in statistical methods; Experience with statistical modeling and machine learning preferred
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, problem-solving, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills
Ability to develop analytical frameworks, metrics to measure ongoing business performance and understand key performance drivers
Ability to translate business needs and key questions into inputs for data analysis
Ability to communicate effectively at all levels (including executive team) and articulate ideas, analysis results, and recommendations
Strong attention to detail and time management skills to ensure accuracy while meeting rigid deadlines
 
Recruitment Timeline and Process
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. The job posting will be removed once the position is filled.
Interview process: 1) Phone screen 2) In-person interview at headquarter in the seaport district 
About Us:
Today, Zipcar provides hundreds of thousands of people with a viable alternative to traditional car ownership, saving them money, time and headaches. Around the world?from coast to coast, across Canada, the UK, and college campuses in between?people are making the decision to live car-free and enjoying the convenience and environmental benefits of having "wheels when you want them".
 
As we continue to grow our operations, we are looking for talented, passionate people with great ideas to join the Zipcar family. We aim to create an environment that is supportive, diverse, and as fun as our brand. If you're results-oriented, dedicated, and ready to contribute to an unparalleled member experience for our community of Zipsters, we encourage you to apply.
 
To learn more about Zipcar, what we do, and how we do it, visit https://www.zipcar.com/carsharing.
 
As a member of the Zipcar Team you will receive:
Competitive Compensation
Free Membership
Discounts on services, products and much more
While we appreciate every applicant's interest, only those under consideration will be contacted. We regret that phone calls will not be accepted.
